hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The room is big enough, the location is on the edge of Central Park, very good scenery from the room. It’s also really pleasant for morning jogging. Very professional and friendly front desk. There are many restaurants around the hotel and there is a huge food supermarket. The hotel facilities are a bit old, but still doable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park really knows how to make guests feel welcome! Upon checking in, we were asked what our plans were and I mentioned it was my daughters birthday and we were planning to see Hamilton. Later that afternoon, we were brought a plate of chocolates and a card wishing my daughter a happy birthday. The following night, upon returning to the hotel after seeing Hamilton, we were surprised with a Hamilton book and another personalized card for my daughter. She was absolutely over the moon!Hotel room was clean, modern, and had a nice view of the park. We had consistent housekeeping, turn down service and water service. Definitely a top rate hotel! We have stayed at this ritz several times and will be back many more times!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The bar and restaurant surrounding the courtyard were beautiful at night, such a pleasant place to eat and drink. Great menu, excellent service with friendly attitude. Loved it here. Felt like coming home. Liked the atmosphere of restaurants better than St. Regis

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at this property several times over the years, and are pleased that it remains excellent. You can't beat the location and park views. The staff are very professional and helpful. My only complaint would be that our room service breakfast was fairly lackluster.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel was nice, the room was clean and spacious for NYC, with a great view of Central Park. We were there for Valentine's Day night and wanted to celebrate our engagement there, plus our first date out away from our newborn baby. We loved the room and enjoyed the (way overpriced) drinks at Contour. We were surprised that, for a category 8 with a known name, their in-room dining food was so basic and dull and there were limited options for t.v. (especially no pay per view), so it wasn't very thrilling. But the worst part was our experience with check-out. The night before, I called the front desk for the opportunity for a later check-out and he gave me 2pm and I agreed. So my hubby and I planned our day accordingly to that time to leave. The next morning, I got called twice from the front desk wondering if we were extending our stay, to which I told them about our agreed 2pm check-out. Later, they called me and told me I had to check out in 30min, so we rushed out completely unprepared. If I had known there was no true availability for a later check-out, that would've been fine. The short notice that we needed to be out felt like I was another sheep in a herd that needed to shove out.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Upon checking in our room had a slight scent of cigarettes. By day two the odor was so overwhelming when we complained all the did was bring in a air purifier that did nothing to filter out the odor. On day three we requested to be moved to another room and were told that would not be a possibility for another day or two. My boyfriend and I could barely sleep and I had a horrible headache. When they finally were able to move us we were moved to a much smaller room and just overall big disappointment. Managment was rather rude as well because the room was booked under my boyfriends name and kept saying we will speak to him about any requests despite my name being on the room. He was there for meetings and was upset they were treating me that way when I was trying to resolve the problem for both of us.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The ritz Carlton does it again. The service was absolutely incredible and the location of this hotel made exploring the city easy!safe somewhat quiet and very relaxing!!!! Will stay again and highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The best hotel in NY for sure. All the amenities and service exceeded our expectations and were above any other parameter. The rooms are bright, clean and extremely comfortable with the best views of Central Park. Loved it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter has always dreamed of seeing the macys thanksgiving day parade. Staying the Ritz Carlton for thanksgiving was the best decision.The location was absolutely perfect and we were able to have front row seats of the parade right outside the hotel.Having a hotel room directly over central park was the icing on the cake!
user_name:
gswannabe
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned home from our stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park. Everything was wonderful from the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left. Everyone was out going and helpful. Club Lounge ladies and gentlemen were so helpful. I can’t name them all but just a few: Levar, Celso, Kelly, Charles and even more, couldn’t have done more for my husband and me. Only regret is that financially it will be awhile before we can return but return we will due to the impeccable service always given with a smile.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I booked my room with points and an upgrade. The room blew expectations away! The room was HUGE....gorgeous and the views blew my mind! Unfortunately it was very foggy so my pictures don’t do it justice, but honestly this view alone is worth double what I paid...extraordinary!!! Thank you Ritz for a dream worthy experience!!!! I got up early and strolled across the street to Central Park for a morning stroll...dreamy...came back asked the concierge about breakfast places. He suggested Sarabeth’s a few doors down. I had always wanted to brunch there. He called down and put us on the list. We went down and they were true to their 15 min wait although there were dozens of people waiting. thank you thank you thank you for such an extraordinary experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Thank you so much to Thomas, who was so accommodating and made us feel so welcome upon our check in. Best hotel to stay when in New York City! Clean good-size modern room, great location (very close to subway station and nice area) and most of all, friendly staff!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just love this place, Club Lounge is my favourite amazing food, opulent, Lazar makes this place in my opinion, just a good all round New Yorker who makes such an effort with everyone making it a fun experience. Gym is great, door man who’s name escapes me knows everything about this City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our favorite feature of New York City is Central Park - and it doesn't get any better than staying at the Ritz-Carlton right across the street! Beautiful property, well-appointed - with gorgeous rooms and amenities. The concierge staff is experienced - and brilliant, as they arranged an unusually flexible car service for a special event attended by my wife. The restaurant and room service were prompt and first rate - with a great children's menu. Loved everything about this hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed over new years at the Ritz. Had an amazing time, and the staff was amazing, warm and friendly. As a platinum member, I was upgraded to a magnificent 1BR Suite. Best location in NYC, would highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was not a huge fan of the Ritz brand, thinking it was too stuffy and formal. However, we decided to give it a try - I LOVED this hotel. It was not stuffy-formal but rather elegant and relaxed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The gym was terrific with plenty of equipment, water, earphones, etc. The bed was perfect with Frette linens, and the bathroom also had great products, a full bath, and plenty of places to store/hang items. It was altogether a wonderful and memorable experience. We stayed on points (a lot of them) so for us, the value was great. It was also lovely to be across the street from Central Park. I am definitely a converted fan of the Ritz brand.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park is first class all the way. Exceptional rooms, views and amenities. The staff are attentive, professional and detail oriented. I highly recommend you pay extra for a view of Central Park as well as the Club Room. The club is well worth the price. Tasty bites and excellent drinks are available all day. Kudos to the management team for an excellent job establishing and maintaining high standards. We will definitely be back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: No words can describe how horrible my experience was at this Ritz. It was so horrible that I had a reservation at the Ritz in Washington DC to spend New Years Eve that I cancelled because I did not want to take the risk of having the same treatment. My family comes to NYC every Christmas for the past 15 years. We spend it at The New York Palace where we have amazing relationships and a wonderful time. Including with Becky Hubbard who is the GM at the Palace and used to work at this Ritz. I received as one of my Christmas gifts to spend two nights at this hotel because I wanted to venture out a little from my comfort zone and try something new. We had reserved two rooms with club lounge access. The day before our arrival we went to the hotel just to meet the wonderful Kamal and Kylam for the first time. They were so nice to us. They told us to come around 10 am because our rooms were ready the next day. We arrived around noon and only one room was ready and the other room was going to be ready around 3pm. And that’s when our issues started. We had to store all of our family’s luggage in my room to wait for the other room. Around 3:30pm the room was ready. We went to the room and it had a horrible smell and the layout of the room was completely different than mine. My mom is highly allergic and immediately felt she could not stay in that room. We went downstairs to charge the room and Ella told us that they did not have a single room in e whole building that was similar layout and she only had one room that would be available around 7pm. Yes 7pm!!!!!! Also she began to tell me that we did not even have that category of rooms and we were giving an update.. we never asked for upgrades it was giving to us because the people from the Palace recommended us to the Ritz since we are VIP guests over there. We had until 5pm to decide if we were going to stay or not in the rooms so my mom went back to the Palace and of course even though “there were no room available” they were able to get us our rooms at the Towers. It’s all about relationships and amazing customer service at the Palace. So I tell Ella around 4:30 that we are going back to the Palace since we were not willing to wait until 7pm to see the other room. She proceeded to tell me in front of the concierge desk in front of Celso and Daniel and Suzanna that she was going to charge me for the room she gave me earlier. I was shocked !! We never used the room!!! I took pictures and video of the untouched room. So I called her manager Justin who obviously has no clue about customer service and he told me the same thing. That I had to pay for the room I never used!! Then he said he will give 50% off the rate. If money was an issue I wouldn’t have reserved two rooms for over$ 4,000 !! It’s how I was treated he wasn’t even apologetic !! The Ritz should have paid me for the day I spent there waiting for the rooms to be ready since it was said they were going to be ready at 10am!! Celso and Daniel and Suzanna were horrified and so apologetic!! I am so glad they watched the whole thing happening!! I cried out of anger and disappointment .. I am so glad I went back to the Palace!! I am waiting for the GM to call me. Let’s see if he will deliver the Ritz service that I mostly deserve. I also contacted the Marriott headquarters to bring this issue to them. I was never so mistreated in a hotel. I am so glad the concierge was a witness of this horrible experience .This situation caused me to cancel my trip to the Ritz in Washington. If you like to be well treated do not go to this property ever!! Incompetent staff far away from a Ritz way of treating guests who are spending over 1,500 dollars a night. Stay at the Towers in the New York Palace.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I booked for a quick getaway. We didn't end up getting the room upgrade that we were told was likely (long story, but fact is this wasn't the fault of hotel staff). Everyone at the hotel, especially Ella (the Front Office Manager), more than made up for things. Ella was extremely professional, empathic, and helpful. We ended up having a shorter stay at the hotel, but had a great time -- thanks Ella!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Outstanding service and amenities at the Ritz during trip to see 'To Kill A Mockingbird' on broadway. The room was clean and comfortable. Room service was timely. Spa treatment was exceptional (Jana) and Maria with the concierge was phenomenal. The staff made a birthday celebration remarkable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My room was an upper floor room facing Central Park. It was small, and did not contain a desk. The bathroom had a single sink and, whilst there was a walk-in shower stall, the water pressure was very poor. The lounge-restaurant-bar (all in one) was always crowded and breakfast was served, from a limited menu, mostly at low coffee tables for one or two people. It was certainly not a proper restaurant with tables and chairs. The dining selection for any meal was generally very poor. The service was patchy, at best.The tariff of a room was certainly not poor. It was exorbitant to say the least. Not good value for money

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the hotel this year, as a part of our annual Christmas in NYC pilgrimage.Other places we have stayed in the City include the Parker Meridian a couple of times and the Essex House (Marriott property).The facility itself is very nice. The room was clean and updated. The bathroom was definitely Ritz style.We ended up with an interior room, despite the fact that we had made the reservation about 6 months ago. We did use points - so I guess that's the rub. The hotel was full, so they were not able to upgrade me.Aside from the interior room with no view, which was still do-able, I thought the hotel was pretty noisy. We heard doors slamming at midnight on Saturday night, as well as people running up and down the halls Sunday morning.The nicest part of the hotel was the front door staff, who were very helpful getting cabs, and the hot chocolate in the early evenings is a nice touch.All in all, not my idea of a "spectacular Ritz Carlton experience"...a Sheraton maybe, but not a Ritz or Four Season's. To be honest, I think these guys are living on their reputation and location.Won't be in a hurry to come back to this property. We'll probably be back at the Essex House next year.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I’m not one to write reviews but was compelled to start an account to brag on the Ritz. We’ve travelled to NYC many times but this was the first holiday we’ve spent there. I researched a lot to find the best Thanksgiving experience for my family and the Ritz delivered all the way around. We think we’ve found our new annual tradition. I read a review that the parade view rooms were too high up - the balloons were flying low this year and we still had a perfect view from the 10th floor. Service was attentive without being intrusive. Staff were all super nice but not that unauthentic over-the-top deferential attitude I sense at certain high end hotels that can grate. Genuine and kind from the doormen to housekeeping. This hotel made our Thanksgiving and will be our go to in NYC holiday or not.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I could have written many great things about this amazing place to describe the experience and attention received, but all had been said before. I highly recommend everyone considering to stay here, especially the clubroom and its offers. Since checked out, I had already booked and looking forward to the next experience. Well done and well recognized. Thank you for making our life experience richer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Spent a night at this fantastic property this weekend as part of a quick family trip to NYC. Loved everything about it - the room, the view, the Club, the attention to detail. As upscale as it is, the vibe is family friendly and casual. Pets are even allowed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After many stays over a number of years, they have always delivered the highest level of service making me feel welcome upon each return. I never have heard a single noise and you feel completely pampered from the second you step onto the sidewalk under the awning.They care and make you feel missed and remembered each and every time you come back. Amenities are top notch. Views of Central Park are breathtaking. Great location!Worth every penny!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved staying here for 6 days, the room is spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. The bed is super comfy, staff friendly, delicious food (although expensive). Location on Central Park is ideal for visiting the sights. Looking forward to returning!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We booked a room with a view, Central Park directly in front of us, with a binocular.We had 2 windows, one clean and able to look out, the other almost opaque ! Why ?The room 608 was across from the elevator but we did not hear any noise.The room and bathroom were spacious, and it had 3 closets, enough space to store away the luggage. The service from the reception and concierge as well as the porter were good. At breakfast time the service was slow and not very attentive at all, there is room to improve. The location is sensationell, in walking distance to the shopping, park and all major tourist spots. But is does have its price, attention.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After many years my wife and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton again. It turned out to be a very good decision. The location is really nice, but the real asset of this hotel is the staff. We were treated nicely from the moment we stepped out of our taxi ( with a terrible driver - but that's another story) to the moment we stepped into the taxi after checking out. The lobby bar is really nice with a good staff, the room service staff is efficient and friendly and the same can be said for the housekeeping staff.The only one detail I did not really like is that they leave the housekeepers' carts in the hallways. That is not becoming of a hotel of this level (and price). Still, I feel comfortable recommending this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is always an excellent stay. My only frustration is that because it is a limited Marriott partner, it does not honor Marriotts’ most loyal customers with complementary upgrades, lounge access, and other amenities throughout the majority of the system. The rooms are comfortable and service top rate.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I ran the NYC Marathon this year so I decided to treat myself to a night at The Ritz before the run. Simply put, the service from the employees at The Ritz was absolutely perfect. I had previously emailed with some questions about the marathon. Upon checking in, the front desk staff engaged in conversation about the race I was even given an upgraded room due to Bonvoy status. Didn't even have to ask! They also said that they would like to leave a gift for me. I was pleasantly surprised to find a wonderful "recovery bag" in my room upon returning from dinner. I also needed an early breakfast which was delivered promptly to the room at the time I requested. I desparately wanted to be at ease before my race and the staff at the Ritz did everything within their power to make it so. For that, I thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is an old favourite but we hadn’t been there for 3 years. We were very disappointed by the recent refurbishment of the rooms. Previously they were warm and cosy with a sensible desk for writing/laptops etc. That has now gone to replaced by a giant and utterly pointless floor to ceiling mirror that precludes access to the power points on that wall. It’s really destroyed the atmosphere of the room. Presumably it’s there to reflect the sensational view of Central Park, but why not just look it the right way round out of the windows?

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am a regular Ritz Carlton guest and have stayed in their San Francisco, Chicago and LA locations and this experience is nowhere near what it should be for a $1000/night hotel. The basic rooms are small, and our room, like many if not most others, has a view of a brick wall and other guest windows on all sides and in close proximity. Walls seem thin. Nothing stands out as remarkable. They don’t honor upgrade requests for Marriott Platinum Elite members. We were told somewhat haughtily that this is the one Ritz Carlton location that does not. Also just tried to find out how to get coffee. There is no Nespresso, tea bags or otherwise in the room and they take away lobby coffee at 10am. We were told they have a nespresso set up available for a $39 charge.... unreal when you spend $1000 for a room. These are provided in other Ritz Carlton’s and much humbler hotels routinely without cost. I would recommend looking for better options — there are many in midtown Manhattan. We stayed last at the St Regis and it was much superior. It’s a shame when a brand relies on its name and address alone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Probably the nicest place I've ever visited; just wonderful. The staff greet me like an old friend and it is an absolute pleasure to go there, whether to dine, drink or stay. I genuinely can't say enough good things about this place. Everyone there defines what service should be. If more people were like them the world would be a wonderful place. So kind, so decent and so thoughtful. Simply the best!
user_name:
Scenic794331
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here 3 years ago we are not disappointed on our return visit. We were on the 20th floor overlooking Central Park..beautiful with the autumn colours. The room was pleasant although we missed the opportunity to have tea/coffee making facilities available in the room.We particularly like the bar area opposite concierge and enjoyed breakfasts. The dining room has been redecorated and is now part of the extended bar area which provides gastro type food. We tended to eat out at night due to my food issues and the restricted menu. We enjoyed the food when we ate there on arrival.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton is a beautiful hotel. We visited NYC in October and stayed here as a special treat. It was extraordinarily busy in New York due to the United Nations Assembly so security was massive but it didn’t put us off. We arrived at lunchtime and our room wasn’t ready so we waited in the lounge area. No one offered us a drink and I do get the feeling that if you aren’t clad in designer clothes you are a bit ignored. When we got to our room it was gorgeous- huge bed, massive bathroom with gorgeous Asprey toiletries - everything was top quality. There were no coffee making facilities in the room but you can get coffee from reception every morning. Housekeeping was very good with nice chocolates and pillow spray each evening. Overall I can’t complain but when I return I will stay downtown which is less commercial and crowded and a bit less snobby. On a plus side if you are in New York go and see Billy Joel at The Garden - he is amazing, also there is a fantastic bar and restaurant called a The View which we loved.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Pretty close to perfect. It's just beautiful, quiet and serene. When you're at the Ritz, you have absolutely no idea that you're in Midtown Manhattan until you step outside! The views of the park were stunning from my room, which was comfortable and quiet. I have also never stayed at a hotel that had such delicious food on the room service menu. You're directly across the street from Central Park and close to many restaurants. I travel to NYC a lot and the Ritz is at the top of my list when it comes to hotels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Booked a grand view park room with CLUB LOUNGE ACCESS. Four days before I arrived, I was downgraded to a room without club access which became "unavailable". Didn't like that at all as one of my main reasons to try this hotel was to experience and work in the lounge. So, I cancelled my reservation and booked the Four Seasons, which I am thoroughly enjoying. Bye Ritz Carlton!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I actually live in the New York area but NYC is so big and amazing that I've done a couple of stay-cations, and typically I go for the Ritz as a Marriott Bonvoy elite member. The last occasion was actually for our wedding ceremony. Every time the customer service reaches out and checks for the occasion and to accommodate the stay to the best they can, and I have to say they have been outstanding every time! If you get a room that is facing Central Park you will not be disappointed, the Ritz has an uninterrupted view over the entire park and it's such a beautiful picture to wake up to in the morning. Right next to the Ritz is an amazing place for breakfast and brunch, Sarah Beth's - make sure to get a reservation there if you stay in the Ritz! The rooms are clean and I think for NYC offer great space, plus each bathroom comes with a bathtub and shower separately. If you are looking for a close-to-the-action stay with great service or just a stay-cation, then I can highly recommend the Ritz. As a Marriott Elite member you can also redeem nights here with a very fair redemption value!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife surprised me for my birthday. From the fantastic free upgrade to a park view on the 20th floor, to the personalized birthday card with cookies. The room was tastely decorated and clean. The bathroom was wonderful and the amenities was above standards. I would suggest this hotel and hope to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On August 21 we stayed at the Carlyle and it was wonderful. The next day we spent at the Ritz. Their website suggested we join Le Club which would make us eligible for a room upgrade upon arrival. I did that but was told that we had a beautiful room fully prepared. The view from one window was a brick wall from one window and the other widow view was that of a large watershed. I am a 100% disabled veteran and asked for a room close to the elevator. I do not think we deserved to be "punished" as we were for that request. Though I appreciate the free breakfast the view was not worth anywhere close to $1,000 we spent to stay there. Usually hotels ask for a review and I did not receive one from likely because they were fully aware of what you did to us.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Absolutely the least impressive $1000 per night hotel room you can imagine. I was given a base level room at the back of the building, right next to a service door that slammed constantly all day and into the night. With a broken air conditioner that rattled and wheezed like something straight out of Motel Six. And a cordless phone circa 1994 that barely worked. Suffice it to say my room looked nothing like the pretty pictures so helpfully posted here by the property.On the plus side, the towels are top quality, the bed extremely comfortable, and the staff unfailingly courteous. But there are so many truly excellent Manhattan hotels in this price range, I cannot imagine ever returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a fabulous weekend at the Ritz! The entire Club level staff was amazing. Felix was able to find a tailor to alter a dress over the holiday weekend, other staff worked miracles in dining reservations, and the breakfasts were amazing. Far better than other Ritz and Four Seasons Club level options across the country. We will return!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I’m giving this hotel a well deserved low rating. Our previously three stays were very good experiences. We are currently staying in room #616 through this Saturday (unless I check-out and go to another hotel). Being a loyal Titanium Elite member with over 800 nights spent in 5 star hotels with Marriott & partners, this was by far one of the most offensive experiences I can remember. Here are the reasons I believe this hotel and staff fall below the standards of Ritz Carlton. 1. I was offended that the front desk informed me if I wanted to use the Executive lounge that it would be an extra $250. per night. I informed him that as a Titanium Elite, I have never been requested to pay an up-charge for lounge access at a Ritz Carlton & St. Regis, ever. He informed “we normally charge $500-$750 up-charge per night night in peak season.” I guess August 27th is not peak season…  2. I was eligible for an upgrade with suite night rewards, but was informed by the same gentleman that they did not have availability. I understand, however, I can look on the reservations portal and there are rooms available for sale in every category… 3. I took a cold shower for the 4 minutes until the water was finally warming but he time I was finishing. I understand, it's an old building but we are paying prime money for prime real estate. I do not think a Ritz Carlton should subject their guest to such a discomfort!We have stayed at this property several times over times over the past few years and have always been upgraded without even using my Bonvoy Suite night rewards. To be given a room in the back of the hotel on the lowest floor (which my app preferences always request a high floor) is just not taking the customers preferences into account or even looking at the customer reservations. This is very far below the Ritz Carlton standard or really any 5 star in a conceptive market like NYC. I did not raise an issue with the customer service, but feel the front desk decisions will most likely cause me to take my 14 nights stay per year in NYC away from this hotel to a competitor in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were looking for a weekend getaway treat and the Ritz was perfect. We decided on an Avenue room with partial view and it was great -- from the bed, the view was of the Park. Check-in, concierge, and room service were all very kind. We had told the Ritz in advance that it was our first night out of town from our six-month-old baby and they left a precious stuffed animal in our room for her with a kind card. I was so touched by the thoughtfulness. The bed was luxurious as was the bathroom. The room was a bit smaller but plenty of room for a night and the view was so restful and pleasing. We had one snafu in that the restaurant recommended by the concierge, Benoit, was a dud. It must have gone downhill since the Ritz recommended -- we were served $21 champagne cocktails in a plastic glasses (and the cocktail wasn't mixed, in ice, very strange), with sub-par, cold, and flavorless food. However, when we shared our experience on our return, the concierge bought us drinks and desserts in the Ritz bar, and the drinks (and awesome bartender!) more than made up for the experience. Also Benoit sent pastries in apology (a little strange to get burnt croissants at 10 pm but again with the great service!).We were made to feel like valued guests by all of the staff there. Combined with the room and view, it was amazing. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I would give this property 10 stars on a 5 star scale! We took my mom to NYC to celebrate her 96th birthday. The property was gorgeous; so much quieter than being in Times Square. The staff made us feel like we were royalty! I simply cannot say enough about the rooms, the food, and the staff. The remodel of the hotel is spectacular and this will be our go to location from now on when we visit New York. It is truly a magical hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a great time at the hotel. celebrating a birthday. staff treated us like royalty. club lounge was awesome. i would recommend selecting this when making a reservation. had a great view of central park. what more could you aks for.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is not my usual place to stay in Manhattan due to costs, but want to stay at a special place with my wife on this visit and be relatively close to the Upper East Side where a friend lives. The hotel had a great location for what we wanted to do this past weekend and I had sufficient Bonvoy points to stay free for two nights. The upgraded room was beautiful as was the view of Central Park. All the standard Ritz amenities and service. No complaints as all. You know what you get at a Ritz, you just have to be willing to spend a bit more. Without points and the desire to be on the park, I would have stayed at my favorite, The Sofitel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing Services,On My Experience this hotel is a best one in my life.18:30 ミュージカルに行くためにベルボーイにタクシーを依頼しただけで、そのミュージカルの記念品が部屋に置かれていた。しかも商品を変えて2日連続。もちろん高層階のセントラル・パークの景観もラウンジアクセスの内容も文句の付けようが無い。リッツ・カールトンは主としてアジア圏、香港、東京、大阪、シンガポールでも各地でそれなりのサービスを受けてきたが、此処NYで受けたサービスは全くレベルの違う当にAmazing Serves だった。これでは今後NYでは此処以外に泊まれなくなる。そう思わせるサービスだった。マイベストだった他地域のホテルに比べ3分の1から4分の1のコストでコスパを加味するとマイベストかも知れない。

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am terribly upset at this establishment. It was a complete waste of 90,000 points and $500.The TV would constantly restart every 45 seconds, our water was brown (I HAVE VIDEO PROOF) and the room service made my pregnant wife throw up all day!We even had hallway noise all day and our room didn't have proper blinds, we had people looking into our room the entire stay. Last but not least the lobby staff would give me these looks like I do not belong in such a hotel. I would rate ZERO stars if possible.I stay plenty at Marriot hotels, this is a bad representation of their quality.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here one night in August for my cousin's wedding which was a quick 2 block walk over at The Pierre. It was perfect! I had a room facing 6th Avenue and could see Central Park. So pretty. The bathtub was also excellent, perfect depth for relaxing with a book to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I took my parents in for a drink on the club level since I have Titanium Platinum what do I even do with these points status and it was lovely. Great view of the park and the staff made us feel right at home. I even had my dog and they made him feel welcome too. We had a blast walking around Central Park. I hope to get a chance to stay here again someday, just loved it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our family has stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park multiple times . We usually book a room that has Club Lounge access. The location is lovely , the service is top notch and the lounge is worth everything it may cost to get . Walk to Central Prk , great shopping, even to Broadway shows . Love this place !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My 16 year old daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Ritz near Central Park in late June. The hotel was beautiful and the location was spectacular. We enjoyed the spa and all of the employees were lovely and professional. I did not give the hotel a higher rating because on 2 occasions the cleaning staff opened all of the draperies and then significantly lowered the AC in our room, so we returned from all day activities to a very hot room. I called the front desk twice and by the 3rd day, the problem was fixed. Other than the AC issue, we were thrilled with the hotel and will return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was just in the city for a "last hurrah" trip with one of my sons before he heads to college and we stayed at the RITZ. Our stay was really perfect - the hotel is pretty, clean and well-located. But more than that the service was outstanding - at check in we were reminded of all of our benefits (from AMEX) - which I often forget about so the reminder was good. Then we were escorted to our room by a lady named MICHELLE who was very nice and asked the reason for our visit - we explained that among other things we'd be seeing a Broadway show. When we returned to our room early that evening the CD from the show was left for us as a gift! The hotel also contacted me by email prior to my visit to see if they could do anything for me in anticipation of my stay. I was truly impressed and felt that the staff at the RITZ went above and beyond to make sure we were happy & comfortable - very professional people make the beautiful property even better!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first time at the Ritz-Carlton New York and we were not disappointed. From the moment we got out of our car we were greeted by smiling staff members. Upon check-in we got a room right away and an upgrade to Club Level. (Not sure if it was due to Marriott Gold Elite or our Honeymoon). Yoniedy showed us around the property and took us to our room. The room was beautiful minus the inside facing view, but we would stay again in a heartbeat. The smell of this hotel was amazing, not sure if it was the fresh flowers or a great room spray. Either way, we will stay there on our next NYC trip.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: One of the best hotels we’ve ever visited with great location and excellent service. We had an unforgettable stay thanks to the polite and professional staff. Our room was large, clean and with a breathtaking view to Central Park.
user_name:
denicav2019
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful Hotel, great staff, great location. There is nothing I didn’t like about this hotel. I love the decor, I love the room, I love the views. Everyone was friendly and helpful. I definitely would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am always impressed by how welcomed, and how comfortable, the Ritz Carltons make me feel. It’s like walking through the doors to your own home after work and letting out a *sigh* because all of a sudden, the stresses of the day are washed away. That’s a pretty great product.We only stayed 1 night in June 2019 at the Central Park location, but from that stay, the room was great. It’s as quiet and solid as a bank vault. By NYC standards, ours was a very large room (and we had the smallest sq ft room category) and impeccably clean. All the usual accolades of a luxury property: well appointed, fantastic mattress and pillows, thoughtful amenities.And of course, you’re right on Central Park South, so the location is fantastic.My only observation on a short-coming: the lobby is devoid of anything interesting, or even anything useful. There’s no character (or utility) to the lobby: Only 2 lonely, awkwardly-placed chairs in the entire lobby to sit for a second. The front desk has 3 stations, and 3 people were being helped and 2 waiting in front of us. 6-7 minutes later, there were still 2 people waiting in front of us. And nowhere to sit. We could have walked into the adjoining restaurant/lounge space, but the tables are reserved for dinners. And even that space is pretty unremarkable.Ok, yeah...minor gripes about a premier hotel in one of the best locations in one of the greatest cities on the planet. But if I had a magic wand, that’s what I would change.
user_name:
KTnDC
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent 6 nights here to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary. We loved it! The club lounge was by far my best lounge experience ever. While we went out to eat and got room service, ot was completely unnecessary for those that would prefer to eat 3 meals a day in the lounge. Anyone that says you have to go outside of the US to experience an exceptional club lounge in a hotel needs to try this one. The staff was incredible, especially Lazar in the club lounge. I'd like to go into a bit more detail in this post, starting with the dining (focusing on the club lounge cuisine), moving on to the location, room, and price.The food:There was plenty of variety offered as well as some things that remained consistent where we were glad to see them on a daily basis. It was easy to get small portions, which allowed for more variety within a single meal than if the servings were bigger. They had caviar the first night in the lounge. They had rotating things once during our stay like short ribs, large shrimp, fish, etc. They often had a wide selection of cold meats, raw vegetables, raw fruit, dried fruit, nuts, crackers, and cheeses. They probably had fresh fruit, cookies, and scones on a daily basis while we were there. The dessert spread they had available every night was incredible, with some consistent items that were great like chocolate fondue with strawberries and some excellent chocolate that we saw at least a few times and lots of variety as well. They had a selection of wine and you could ask a waiter for additional options that were not visible. They had a nice tea selection as well as plenty of options for coffee lovers. While they didn't have sparkling cider, Lazar even ordered some just for me from outside the hotel, treatment that I have never gotten at any lounge.Everything that never or virtually never left: at least 9 varieties of candy, red and green apples, oranges, teas, wines, coffee variants, sodas, bottled water, and cookies.I only went to breakfast once (we did more room service for breakfast, which was great), but when I went on a Friday options included the following (the only meal I am going to go in detail on):Small muffins with either nutella, apple, or raspberry preserves (excellent).There was chocolate and plain croissants, sliced bread, and 4 kinds of bagels as well as a few kinds of cream cheese.There were 6 kinds of cereal, oatmeal and options to include with oatmeal like golden raisins and brown sugar. There was skim milk, whole milk, grapefruit juice and orange juice. There was a selection of cheeses and dried fruits. There was salmon and a few toppings to add to it. One egg option included a baked blend of eggs, ham, and green onions. The other was zucchini, peppers, cheddar, and egg whites. There were boiled eggs with shells removed, There were blackberries, blueberries, and raspberries. There was sliced cantaloupe, honey dew, and pineapple. There was a yogurt parfait and excellent muesli. There was cold roast beef, ham, olive tapenade, and pickles. As always there were apples, bottled water, wine, sodas, teas, and various coffee derived options.Lunch was varieties of sandwiches, soup, salad, and other things as well to compliment those like veggies, tapenade, apples, cookies, and chips. Among sandwiches my favorite was probably the hot cheddar and pastrami. Snacks included things like chips, nuts, and scones. Of course snacks were lighter than during breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The scones were fantastic and they might have had them every day and you could add options like devonshire cream, apple butter, or apricot jam.Dinner was differing main courses (i.e. short ribs, lasagna, etc. none of which we ever had twice in 6 days as far as I can remember) in addition to cold meats, crackers, cheeses, salad, dried fruits. Large shrimp cocktails were a nice side one night.Dessert presentation and taste were incredible every night. Even if you are going out to eat while staying there a lot, at least come back for the dessert. There was lots of variety within a night and from one night to the next. Lemon blueberry tart, fine chocolate, chocolate panna cotta, strawberry banana parfait, chocolate coconut mousse, lemon tart, excellent macaroons (especially their raspberry macaroons), and strawberry champagne mousse were just some of what we saw. Location:Being able to walk out of the hotel and enter Central Park was incredible. My wife and I loved walks there during our stay. There was a lot to do within a short distance, so whether taking Uber or walking, it was easy to get to where we wanted to be. Uber for us made a lot more sense than renting a car with the high cost of parking in NYC.Room:It was clean, it was comfortable, it was beautiful, and was wonderful for our stay. The view on our side was poor (maybe 20 ft from another building with what may have been an alley underneath), although if there had been a view, noise was a concern since we were in NYC. You can always spend more at the Ritz if you really want a view. We had a free upgrade option via my Gold status to a better view but we opted for the lesser view due to other factors about the room we liked better in the room we stayed in.In NYC rooms tend to be small, and while we were in a basic room there, it was never too small for us. Square footage was clearly advertised in booking and for those that want more room, there are upgraded room possibilities that are much bigger there.Price:For the kind of experience my wife and I had, from the outstanding service like Lazar in the lounge, to the fantastic room, to the ideal location, to the best lounge experience I have ever had, the price was absolutely worth it.Our stay was >95% on points (Marriott points for the room while it was still Category 7 before they came out with Category 8 that they converted it to) and Capital One purchase eraser for the spa, lounge access, room service, etc. The only exception was $ tips. I thought it was a solid use of Marriott points, especially because I got the 5th night free. Because of the points transfers now possible with Capital One, especially as they slowly roll out transfer promos, I probably wouldn't use purchase eraser again. Pictures included in this review are of the club lounge cuisine. The one exception is the chocolate covered strawberries sitting in a bed of dark chocolate with a marzipan label that said, "Happy 1st Anniversary" that greeted us as we got settled into our beautiful room.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was going to post my review a few days ago but I am happy I didn’t. I stayed using points and found a charge on my credit card a few days after leaving. I contacted the property and was charged for “2 beers” which my family did not consume. I am sure we will probably be credited and the property was very nice but there is nothing that I hate more than departing a hotel only to find random charges added to my bill after the fact. Nice property - great location but make sure to check your charges after you leave - how sad for a property of this level.
user_name:
Happytravelinfamily
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location is everything in New York and you can't beat the Ritz Carlton on this. Located right opposite the south entrance to Central Park, only one block away from 5th Ave with all the fancy stores and a short drive to Times Square. But it's not only location, the Ritz with it's classy style and very elegant appearance and nicely decorated rooms does the job. Only downside are the slightly exaggerated rates which are above the market even for New York standards and the staff is not always as friendly as you expect when you pay 1000$+ per night. But other than that a great place to stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent 6 days here and I am writing this review just before checking out. As a frequent traveler, I stay at many hotels and this is among the best I have stayed at - not just NY, but around the world. The staff are the hotel's greatest asset - friendly, helpful and always smiling. No request is refused and they do all they can to make one's stay memorable. Right from the cake and macaroons and happy birthday banner in my daughter's room, reservations at the best restaurants and even sending me a foam roller in my room for my stiff back - it was all thought of and done. Not to mention free complimentary water sippers that serve as a great memory. The location is the very best in NYC. The shopping is just round the corner and central park at the doorstep. The rooms are big and spacious and the bathrooms are huge. Can't ask for anything better in NY. Do not stay in any other hotel! My compliments to the management on such a well run and managed property.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I attended the FinTech conference in NYC last week. My wife joined me for the trip and we extended the stay for a couple extra days. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park South for five days, and the experience was excellent. The Club Lounge on the second floor is fantastic. The hotel staff is exceptionally professional. This long-standing NYC landmark hotel is still a top choice for business or tourist travelers.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We booked in again at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park South for a weekend trip. Using points and status we were entitled to a room upgrade but the room was not ready when we arrived. An interior courtyard room had been made up and as we put a premium on getting into the room and then getting on our way for our lunch reservation we selected the courtyard room. The room itself was newly refurbished and up to RC standards. However, the courtyard view was uninspiring to say the least. For a frame of reference for those who has seen the Alfred Hitchcock thriller "Rear Window", looking into the courtyard was like looking into the window of the apartment across the way in the movie where the murder was committed. Needless to say we kept the curtains closed during our entire stay. Having said this we willingly chose the room so this is really just an observation and not a critique of the Ritz property. We stayed on points so we could not use our club level certificate but looked into the club lounge and determined to use the club level certificate on our next visit as the lounge looked comfortable and well stocked.
user_name:
Bob S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After the nightmare we endured at the St. Regis we appreciated the fantastic hospitality we received at the Ritz Carlton.Alexander & Thomas at the front desk saved the day..... checked us into a beautiful large room that fit our family of 4 very well. Alexander gave my husband a pre Fathers Day gift. Our room was great, bathroom large and bed was comfortable. The gym was the best I’ve seen @ a hotel. What we loved most was that we were appreciated for being Titanium Elite and our family felt welcome. We’ll be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Definitely not and what a disappointment. When one stays at a luxury property, one presumes a certain level of hospitality. I arrived and while the doorman was helping another, he literally grabbed my bag without even a welcome. Enter hotel, no upgrade for Gold status. Okay and no problem. Enter door man who left bag by my side. No one offered to take my bag to the room. I was given lowest room category with a view of several brick walls, no morning light. I walk into the bathroom and WC was not checked before arrival!!! Disgusting, and that is all I will say about that. Offered another room, upgraded, (where was this at check in)??? but who wants to repack and unpack after a long day of travel? I go to bed and am awakened at 4 AM to an alarm that I did not set, lamenting the one chance I had to sleep in. Went to breakfast and had to get my own coffee in the restaurant, and was not asked for a refresher until I left 45 minutes later. The bill did not allow for the customer to tip freely; it was automatically added. Ostensibly, the server had to get an income and was not willing to help his only table in the restaurant. That said, the hotel update was enjoyable, the ambience appealing. I was offered a coupon to try this place again but why waste my time when the Big Apple has so much to offer? Oberoi Hotels, PLEASE open in NYC and teach the amateurs the true meaning of hospitality. This was merely a dressed up HOJO.
user_name:
Louise M
Indian River Shores, Florida

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We didn't stay here but the door men were of assistance to us the other day, now there's not many friendly employees in New York most look like theyre there just for money, HOWEVER the door men at the Ritz Charlton you can tell are professional, helpful and genuinely friendly people and thank you for your assistance. You are all very kind and I hope your work ethic and professionalism is appreciated :)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had an amazing stay at the Ritz. Everyone was incredibly nice and helpful, very welcoming and it was super comfortable. We usually stay down in the Soho/Greenwich Village area at more contemporary hotels and were a bit concerned that the Ritz would be stuffy/snobby. Though it was decorated in a more traditional (and lovely) fashion, it was homey in the best possible way. The room was much larger than a typical NYC room with a really nice bathroom. There are a great, spacious gym and a new workout space where they have virtual classes on a very large screen (hadn't seen that before). I was sad when it was time to leave and would absolutely go back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We can't say enough good things about this hotel. The overall atmosphere of serenity, the beautifully appointed public areas and the outstanding guest rooms have been mentioned by others. However, what stood out to us was the superb service provided by the obviously impeccably trained staff. In particular, Ender went out of his way to make us feel special We shall return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here for new year 2019 for 5 nights. While my review is a bit late, our stay is still fresh in our minds. The hotels location is one of the best in the city with Central Park on your doorstep and Times Square and Fifth Avenue only a short walk away. We stayed in a grand park view, high floor room and it was spectacular.I had organized with the hotel our engagement proposal through Cassidy, and on the day Yoneidy couldn’t have been more helpful. She stood outside with another member of staff in the freezing cold while we made our return to the room. She organized a large telescope in the room and held a huge sign from across the road which was ideal for us. They even sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne afterwards. From the reception staff to the cleaning staff, everyone was extremely friendly and it felt like a home from home. Staying here over new year we had an amazing view of the Central Park fireworks display which was one of our highlights.The rooms are very comfortable and all recently renovated. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in at any hotel. It has a large bathroom which has both a bathtub and powerful shower.The gym at the hotel is also well equipped with modern and well maintained equipment.Thank you so much to all of the front and back room staff for making our stay so memorable. You have ensured that we stay loyal to the Ritz-Carlton brand and we will definitely be back soon!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton New York Central Park on May 4th weekend 2019. From the moment we arrived, the service was beyond stellar!! The 5 star rating I have given this hotel is not just for the luxurious acommodations but because the service really was the best I've ever received at any hotel I've stayed at in the past. The concierge upon arrival brought up a lovely little gift bag of room spray and a candle after hearing me say how much I love the smell of this hotel! What a nice touch! The location can't be beat as well! Well done Ritz-Carlton! Your accommodations and staff were the best! I definitely will be back! Thank you!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a hotel in a great location with immediate access to Central park. The hotel reception area is small with only a couple of chairs available. The restaurant (newly reopened?) is rather small for such a hotel and their breakfast is both overpriced and mediocre. Fortunately the rooms are well appointed with an excellent bed and good amenities, some rooms have a beautiful view on the park while others face a narrow inner courtyard with no privacy if the shades are opened. Overall, I have seen better hotels and this one would never garner 5* in the middle east. But of course NY is special and where else could you get such a wonderful location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A luxury hotel. Even the most basic room is well equipped with a very comfy bed and bathroom with separate shower. The club lounge is well stocked and worth every penny. Rooms could be improved with their own coffee machines but hard to fault

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went for a list minute getaway just as a couple without the kids. The room was amazing (upgraded to a king bed & sitting room). The view of central park was amazing.The club lounge had a beautiful view & the service was also amazing. Everyone was so nice & proactive anticipating needs without being intrusive. We even got last minute reservations to amazing restaurants via the concierge. Felix (concierge) went out of his way to help us with anything we could possibly ask for. If you have a chance to go to the spa ->ask for Laura, who was an amazing massage therapist! Housekeeping was also amazing. We were in room 607. I slept in the first day until almost noon! My husband kept asking her to come back in an hour, when I got up & we went out, I apologized for keeping her waiting & she was so nice, saying you probably needed a good rest! Would definitely come again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park with our daughter over Easter weekend and had one of the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had (and we routinely stay at five star properties). We were celebrating our daughter’s birthday and from start to finish, the hotel and concierge staff made sure she felt celebrated and special. Even the spa department took part in celebrating her birthday. From the moment we checked in, the hotel staff knew our names and went out of their way to make sure every part of our stay was not only perfect but absolutely unparalleled. The location is superb, rooms large and spacious, complimentary car service to the broadway plays is an added bonus, and the spa is divine. Special thanks to Ender and Andrea for making our stay one we will remember and cherish forever. Can’t wait to come back soon... very soon!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is well located if you are interested in the opera, museums, theater, and shopping. It has been our first choice for six years.The concierge service is outstanding. They have recommended excellent restaurants that we had never thought of and scored some great theater tickets.The lounge level is very convenient for breakfast, lunch, a light dinner, and drinks.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a great hotel right off of Central Park. As you enter the doors, the lobby and bar/cafe give you a warm welcome. The rooms are classic contemporary with excellent temperature controls and sound proof windows. The decor is very tasteful. One problem that I had was with the bed. I had back pain after sleeping the first of 6 nights. The staff was accommodating to add another pillow top to the bed. However, this gave little relief. I must say that I seldom have any back discomfort on beds so this was unusual. Especially since this was my second visit to the Ritz in the last year. I had no issues the first visit at all.The only other issue was service in the bar. Unfortunately you have to flag staff down to get a drink and then later for your check. There were 3 servers and a host for approximately 12 tables of clients requesting drinks. Seems to be more than adequate staffing for cocktails and snacks but the service was very slow. Hopefully this will improve with some staff training and the addition of their soon to be renovated restaurant (it was closed at this time for renovation). Overall a good experience with a few glitches.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I came to NYC for my first mom/son trip. I failed at making it memorable with the plays, museums and park outings, since The Ritz Carlton is what stood out most for my 8 year old son . Alex, checked us in, engaged my son in conversation and was genuinely interested in our weekend plans. The front door staff brought him a football and remember our names every time we passed them- I mean they met us for 30 seconds and remembered our names! . The room service gentleman was so accommodating to our needs as was the Spa staff. We came home after a day out to a gorgeous plate of deserts, a chocolate made Into an Empire State Building and loads of cookies, my sons face lit up!. And then right before bed, a knock on our door with a delivery for my son- a kind note from Alex, remembering that we mentioned we were seeing King Kong on broadway- a gift of a King Kong mug, and a stuffed animal. My son was so grateful for this gesture he wrote him a thank you note. Aside from a gorgeous LARGE room, stunning bathroom, a restful quiet sleep, and beautiful location across from the park, the service at this hotel is in a league of its own. The ONLY negative is that no other hotel will ever compare. Thank you for making this such a memorable trip from my little man.xoxox

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On a recent business trip to NY, I decided to join a colleague at a NY Mets game...The staff at the Ritz Carlton (Central Park) always exceeds my expectations, but this was truly AMAZING!Thank you to the ladies and gentlemen of the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel facing Central Park is perfectly located as you’re between 5th and 6th Avenues and at walking distance of all Midtown famous restaurants from 59 to 55 Streets.The rooms are quite nice and decorated in a sober way. Unfortunately the hotel restaurant was not in service due to its current renovation.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Park view room on 20th floor was elegant. Larger than most NY hotel rooms. Huge picture windows with magnificent view of central park. Immaculate, recently renovated bathroom. Room service was prompt and everyone was courteous. Yes, it was expensive, but it was a much better value than nearby St. Regis (tiny rooms, arrogant pretentious service) or Pierre (ancient rooms, terrible service).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: While the restaurant is being renovated, bar staff must walk a long way to fill food and drink orders, They do this with great cheer and efficiency, none more wonderfully than Kabir.We spent a long evening enjoying champagne, wine, and bar food, all served by Kabir with plenty of great conversation and laughter, We could not have asked for a more enjoyable night, made doubly special by him. He's been with Ritz for 17 years, and remains an exemplar of efficient and congenial service. They are lucky to have him, and we were fortunate to spend an evening in his company and care. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I brought our two boys ages (8 & 11) to this hotel on their very first trip to NYC. We used Marriott points for a 5 night stay and it was amazing! I had messaged the hotel prior to our arrival to make sure we were in a 2 queen room and I let them know we would be celebrating both of our boys birthdays. The 2 queen room was much larger than I expected and the bathroom was huge!! The largest I have had in NYC by far!! The concierge had surprised the boys with balloons and cookies along with an Empire State Building chocolate (My oldest’s favorite part. He requested another on our last night at the Star Lounge as a dessert and of course, they delivered!) We didn’t require a lot of assistance but anytime I did need anything (bandaids for a kiddo scrape, or extra bath salts) they were extremely quick to respond! Everyone was so friendly and even staff members who we just exchanged hellos on the elevator, knew our name. They really are spectacular. The doormen were all so friendly. My kids especially enjoyed seeing Felix most days. He always made them feel special. We had a couple evenings in the Star Lounge for desserts and drinks and enjoyed the experience. The location is great! We loved being able to walk outside right into the park! The hotel also had a complimentary house car (a very nice Mercedes with an even nicer driver) that we used some evenings to take us to our midtown destination. Such a nice option to have! The Ritz Carlton Central Park gave us a phenomenal first family vacation! I hope we get to return one day!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have visited the lounge at the RC Central Park many times over the years. The service is outstanding and the seating is very comfortable. It has an old world charm and is very conveniently located directly across the street from Central Park.
user_name:
Hodgson9191
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Friendly staff and especially Jenny at the front desk made us feel very welcomed. Room was good-size, very clean and luckily got upgraded with central park view. We love this hotel and hope to stay here on our next visit. This made our stay all the more enjoyable!!! My girls were very sad to leave the hotel this morning. I guess they really felt at home. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel was Amazing. The staff greeted us right at the cab, and after we checked in, our bags and belongings were already in the room. the room was beautiful. Especially the bathroom. All Marble and elegant. We had a room with a telescope in it so we could see the Statue Of Liberty up close. one night we order room service and they give you the whole try with table on wheels and big portions. they have a spa and restaurant as well. The park is in walking distance. they were shooting a movie at the time, so movie stars were staying there as well. (50 Cent, Nicolas Cage) The subway is not far so you can get anywhere in a decent amount of time. It's totally worth the money.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: While staying in New York, no better place than the Ritz-Carlton. Sits at the edge of Central Park is just the beginning. The start is the beautiful room, then continues with with outstanding staff, Very knowledgeable and THERE to help you with your stay/visit. Would stay again in a heartbeat and HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz in mid February to celebrate my boyfriend’s graduation from the Police Academy. From booking the room to our departure the trip was fantastic all in part to the staff at the Ritz and their ability to make us feel extremely special. Upon booking we were contacted to see if we needed help booking any restaurants and/or shows. The staff was extremely helpful in suggesting great places to eat and explore. During our stay they made my boyfriend feel very special by surprising him with a little treat in the room to help celebrate his graduation. Our room on the 21st floor was amazing. We had a fabulous time and cannot wait to return!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Used points for one night sat stay. Checked in on website and Marriott Platinum upgraded us to partial park view, only problem was we arrived an hour early and wasn’t available so got high floor inside room instead. This wasn’t an issue to us since we were more interested in getting the room early versus having a view. TA reviews are correct this hotel is elegant and plush, the lobby was small and the service is very good. Reception had someone take us to our room, my wife said it was one of most beautiful rooms we have stayed in, they have nice turndown service, they replaced towels I left a note asking for extra ice they left 2 buckets (see pics)! Next morning they had free coffee and tea in lobby – they were out of tea bags and concierge quickly got me some. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From location to the service and the staff this is first class all the way. Nothing to add, nothing to improve, nothing to change.Our stay was perfect. Even though we had snow and winter temperatures every day.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I’ve stayed in different hotels in my visits to New York. There are some of the worlds best hotels in New York, but this Ritz-Carlton is truly one of the best I’ve been to. Just a small entrance, not a grand foyer and lobby, but location is great- right on the 58th street, cornering with 6th Avenue, at the beginning of Central Park. 5th Avenue, shopping, big Apple store, Central Park and everything you need in within walking distance. The staff was very professional and friendly from the first minute to the last. The concierges were good, knowledgeable. The room was large, clean, nicely appointed and very modern. The lobby bar is beautiful, has good drinks and service. The hotel Is luxurious, it is the place to stay in Manhattan whether on business or pleasure. I know where I would stay next time in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. It is very discreet and the doormen are amazing! Everything was lovely. We unfortunately did not have a view of central park but that didnt matter! Turn down service was a nice treat!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Simply elegant. Feels like you are coming home to a park ave / UES apartment. Luxurious but without the excessive opulence of neighboring hotels. Impressed that the doormen, housekeepers, and other staff members remembered our names, even the next day! The only hiccup was a delay in delivering our bags to the room, but we stepped out for lunch anyway so it wasn’t an inconvenience. The bed and sheets were one of, if not the best, of any 5 star hotel we have stayed in, have never slept better. Despite us being locals the concierge provided several personalized dining recommendations, didn’t feel off the shelf or tourist-trappy. So many little luxury details and conveniences in the room and throughout the property. Beautifully maintained blend of modern luxury and old world charm. A great use of (former Starwood) points. We normally stay at the Chatwal, loving the Art Deco theme, but the Ritz was so comfortable, charming, and relaxing - we will be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wonderful hotel. Beautiful rooms. Terrific location. Outstanding service and offerings at the Club. Each employee spends time to get to know you to provide personalized suggestions and recommendations based on personal experiences. (and caviar on Saturday evenings)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here on our annual visit to see the lights at Rockefeller Center and this property did not disappoint. I used points for the room and had a regular king room which was outstanding. Great spacious bathroom. This hotel was recently renovated and it is wonderful. Staff is the best. Property right across from Central Park. Highly recommend. It will not disappoint.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a good experience here. There were great amenities for our toddler. The room was new and very comfortable bed. The bar and restaurant had good service. The service at the concierge and door were not up to the standard I would expect. The concierge gave us incorrect information regarding the logistics of our departure. I would stay here again, but there are other hotels I would prefer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: For the fourth year I have celebrated my birthday at the Star Room at the Ritz Carlton. It is ordered in advance so everything is specially made for you. It is expensive so a treat, but it is one of the best teas in the city!
user_name:
Paula R
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Marriott taking over Ritz Carlton has been good for Marriott brands and not so great for the Ritz Carlton brand. Nothing proves this rule more than this property. I stayed here many years ago and now just stayed recently. Things have changed (to say the least). Gone is the elegance, grace, and "old world magic" of the pre-Marriott Ritz Carlton. This is a very nice hotel, but it feels like it is part of a big chain. We stayed in a "deluxe" one bedroom (couldn't tell what made it "deluxe"). The hotel is well built and the rooms are of good quality (but they are on the small side for a "five star" property). Our room was nice, but felt a little cramped (by "5-star" standards). The furnishings are of high quality but they are the pretty much the same as you will find at any Ritz these days (and the higher quality JW Marriott properties). Our room had a spectacular view of Central Park. The hotel has an enviable location and a decent gym (didn't see any pool). We had lounge access. Very good food but very Marriott. When I stayed here way back when, caviar and stone crab claws were served club level--not anymore--but still good. Also, there is supposedly still a dress code in the club but these days it is not enforced (I actually saw a guest in bare feet and not one of the many staff members said a word to him). The service at this property is solid, but not over the top. There were a couple of little flaws. They kept removing my daughter's rollaway when we asked them not to (and one night they made it up with dirty blankets). But, as soon as we brought the flaws to their attention, they fixed them immediately (and most things service-wise were fine). Again, nothing wrong with this hotel (actually quite good and amazing location). I do not give it 5 circles because I believe there are better brands in this price range (Auberge, Four Seasons, Relais properties, etc). However you could certainly do much worse (I have stayed at Mandarin Oriental in NYC and that was a horrible experience). This is a fine choice but not the magical, old world experience of Ritz Carlton past. Also, they DO NOT honor platinum Marriott status at Ritz Carltons. I have totally accepted this fact, but it seems like (from the other reviews) that many are bitter about this. Get over it people. You can use the Marriott points to book rooms, but you get NOOOOO special recognition. That's just the way it is.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love. the prairie and they have a nice spa. la prairie. the girl is from. Hungary and others from different countriesthe hotel is. across. central park so you. might get a nice hotel roomColumbus circle is. 1 block away and the. 5th avenue is. like 4 minutes. walk

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My hotel of choice in Manhattan for many years has been the St. Regis. I could not secure rooms for the dates I required and so I stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park South. I could not have had a better stay and look forward to returning soon. The staff was exquisitely attentive and went above and beyond to meet every need and supersede every request. While the St. Regis provides a personal butler to provide services such as bringing coffee in the morning and delivering newspapers and the like, I received commensurate service here at the RC. They knew that I was celebrating a birthday and had dessert delivered to my table while I was dining at Mastros with my cohorts. They literally went above and beyond in every respect. I was upgraded to a room overlooking Central Park and really enjoyed the view. The room was plush and comfortable, the staff was wonderful, the food was great and the location was perfect. Overall, the feeling at this RC is very intimate - you feel like you are staying in a luxury townhouse. I look forward to returning soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Well what can I say other than 5 stars is not enough!! This place is just absolutely incredible!! I've always wanted to visit new York and we couldn't have picked a more perfect place! I just wish we could have stayed longer!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing Concierges and Front desk and excellent t reservation staff, they were all very professional and kind. Our suite was small, and we didn t like the new decoration very much. Very noisy AC. There s no coffee/tea machine in the room.
