Amilcar, from room service was very nice and professional, but unfortunately the quality of the food was not good enough , fruits were impossible to eat, and juices were not fresh but from boxes. the Windows of low floors are very small, I remember windows were a lot taller and the decoration was really beautiful in the past. The club lounge is nothing to write home about. It is very expensive for what it has to offer that s why we give it a 4.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I will update review later as I am currently an in-house guest, but just want to pre-warn people who have an elite status with Marriott, about this property, hence you can consider booking a different hotel, in my experience the JW Marriott Essex House is on par with this hotel and from previous experience do honour elite status benefits. I currently have Platinum elite status, even though from availability the hotel is not busy, no upgrade was offered, additionally the hotel does have an executive lounge but if your reservation is done on points or even if you have paid for a standard room, but not paid for executive lounge access, you are not entitled to use the executive lounge (as part of elite status benefits), and a request for a 4 pm late check out also declined, so in my experience if you are choosing a hotel in NYC under the Marriott umbrella and have an elite status I personally wouldn't choose the Ritz-Carlton Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My spouse and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park for one night on a Saturday evening in mid-October 2018. We booked our stay online through the Marriott website, and we remitted Marriott rewards points for a complimentary stay. (This was perhaps our best use of points ever, since the room value was upwards of $800 per night!) A few weeks before we arrived, we received an email from guest services inquiring about our preferences and plans, and we mentioned that we were visiting to celebrate our joint milestone 50th birthdays. (We had already booked our restaurants and theatre tickets on our own, or they would have helped arrange those activities.)The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is located in a Beaux Arts building on the southern perimeter of the park on West 59th Street. (Although it occupies the site of the 1930 former St. Moritz Hotel, the building has since been owned by Harry Helmsley, Donald Trump, and Ian Schrager.) From the moment we stepped out of the taxi, staff greeted us by name. I thought that my spouse had provided our surname, and conversely, he thought that I had given it, but neither was true. Our guess is that the doorman/valet sneaked a peek at the luggage tag on our suitcase and then passed our name on to all other staff that we encountered. It was a lovely arrival experience!The property has an on-site restaurant (Auden Bistro and Bar), afternoon tea (in the Star Lounge), a La Prairie Spa, fitness center, and small sundry shop, in addition to club level accommodations that enjoy a separate private lounge. Many of the hotel’s nearly 260 rooms and suites afford either city or park views. (We were thrilled that the two windows in our standard room allowed us views of Sixth Avenue and a glimpse into Central Park!)Our standard room had a hallway (which was the most convenient place to open the luggage stand for our small suitcase) that led into the main room. We were blown away by the first thing that we saw: two huge silver Mylar helium balloons with the numbers 5 and 0 to mark our special occasion! The balloons were positioned between the comfy king-size bed (with a nightstand on each side) and the small sitting area (with its tiny sofa, chair, and coffee table [which held a plate of sweets plated to mark our special occasion]). The side of the room opposite the bed contained a built-in unit that included two smallish closets (neither was long enough to hang a calf-length coat) and a shelf that held the TV, with drawers beneath (one of which held a pull-out refrigerated drawer). The marble bathroom was large by Manhattan standards, with a vanity for dual sinks, ample shelving, complimentary toiletries (even men’s dress shirt collar stays were offered!), and a big glass shower. (Note that our room did not have a soaking bathtub; in retrospect, we may have been assigned a semi-handicapped room, since the shower seemed as if it could be rolled into.) Textiles incorporated muted and tasteful earth tones, with creative and memorable wallpaper that showcased clouds. We loved the personal business cards that we could give to acquaintances advertising that we were “In Residence” at the hotel!We loved our stay at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park! The service was excellent, and our accommodations were comfortable. In fact, we wished that we had booked two nights!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: An ok experience at The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park, which for a Ritz-Carlton is not acceptable.Check-in service was unfriendly and impersonal which was a surprise when you consider that I'm a Platinum Premier member with Ambassador Service, and that is meant to be the "Ritz-Carlton". Apparently, spending 125 nights a year in Marriott products doesn't mean much to them. No upgraded room available albeit the hotel was mostly empty. I was given a room with a view to other rooms ...The room was mostly ok except that getting the WiFi to work required a phone call and one of the black-out curtains didn't work at all. About the curtain, we only found out at 1 am when we tried to close it ...Cleaning carts were parked overnight in front of my room door, which made me feel I was "stored away" in the broom closet (see picture).At check-out, I requested the folio to be emailed to me, which they never did.I won't be back. I don't have a problem paying for something nice when I want it. It is inexcusable to pay for Ritz-Carlton to get service I could have gotten from the Sheraton.
user_name:
MR1966
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were beyond thrilled with our decision to stay at the Ritz to watch the Macy’s Thanksgiving parade from a parade view room. The staff at the property was wonderful, especially the concierge desk. The location is very close to Central Park so we were able to walk. Our kids loved it and can’t wait to go back next year.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went to NYC for a weekend getaway and decided to splurge. This was our second stay at a Ritz Carlton and it didn't disappoint. We thoroughly enjoyed the Ritz experience. The staff was attentive, engaged and completely focused on providing exceptional service. The room was expansive, well appointed and provided a to die for view of the Central Park, even in January. We met friends for drinks at the Star Lounge where the seating was comfy, the service great, and the setting was perfect for drinks and conversation. Breakfast the next morning delivered to the room just before our departure was delicious. Our budget doesn't permit this kind of indulgence all the time, but spending extra really did provide an exceptional experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Settling into the comfortable elegant bar lounge after serious art viewing is a treat. We shared a mezze that was ample for two and refreshing Brooklyn Pilsners. We always like to call in here at least once when in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Overall: 4.6/5Value: 5/5, weighted 30%Location: 5/5, weighted 30%Service: 4/5, weighted 30%Design: 4/5, weighted 10%The Ritz-Carlton New York is situated at the corner of 6th Avenue and 59th Street with picture perfect view of Central Park. Location wise it is very convenient with easy access most attractions in the city. Others will have their preference but for a new year day stay, the location is perfect as the fireworks take place in Central Park.I utilized my loyalty points for the stay and opted to supplement cash for an upgraded room for an additional $150 per night. The front desk was kind enough to reserve a room on the top floor with prime central park view for my upgraded room. It was very much appreciated. I consider this hotel one of the best use and value for my loyalty points.Service is pretty much impeccable. The front desk staff was one of the most professional and helpful I have ever had the pleasure of engaging. One minor mark is one of the bathrobe was removed and not replaced on the last night of our stay which was odd. The design of the room is well thought out with lightning and the furniture placed logically. One oddity is that the hotel does not have in room coffee maker or kettle. That said when I requested a coffee maker, one was delivered promptly to the room.A special shout out to JB at the Ritz-Carlton Residences Buckhead. He assisted us in making this reservation and arranged for a very nice surprise for us when we arrived. A true exemplar of the impeccable service provided by the Ladies and Gentlemen of Ritz-Carlton.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying here for just two nights. As platinum premiere member, requested nicely in advance for a room/suite upgrade since I have kids with me for our annual city trip. After waiting for 3 plus hours for the room, no upgrade whatsoever and ended up in a the smallest room possible with views of opposite rooms/walls. Emailed management but no response whatsoever. Checked availability and there were many suites available both nights! Very disappointed with how Ritz is treating platinum members and even worse is how hotel mgmt is ignoring unhappy customers!!
user_name:
swg999
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent 3 nights over Christmas at this perfectly located RC hotel on the south end of Central Park. We could not ask for a better stay over the holiday, we were fortunate to have a room with a view of Central Park which allows for some awesome people watching and we were extremely happy with the location as we could go anywhere in midtown within a few blocks. We wanted to thank Michelle with the desk staff for going out of her way to assist us with our check-in, it's the staff and attention to detail that makes us life long RC fans!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Myself, my husband, and our 6 year old little boy stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park for our annual Christmas trip to NYC. The service here is remarkable. From the moment our Lyft pulled up in front of the hotel and the awesome doormen got our bags, we were treated top-notch. Rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean. Our room wasn’t a park view, but it overlooked a beautiful courtyard. It was extremely quiet, despite being in the middle of the hustle & bustle. The location of this hotel is ideal! Beds were extremely comfortable and linens were high quality. Bathroom had high quality toiletries, along with q-tips, makeup remover pads, etc. Ronald sent up some Christmas treats for our little boy, which was such a nice touch. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning and it was delicious & well presented. The only complaint that we had was that we went down to the hotel bar one evening for coffee & Baileys and they were very pricey(nearly $20 each) and weren’t even hot. Next time we are in NYC, we will book this hotel again without hesitation!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I spent one night at the hotel as I was in NYC to celebrate my sons 8th birthday. We both had the most amazing 24 hours. Comfortable, quiet and well appointed room as you would expect. My son was treated so well, he was welcomed on check in for his birthday and given a toy and then their was a plate of the most delicious chocolate cookies, pretzels and a chocolate star in the room with lots of sprinkles and a happy birthday on it that we both loved. That touch made it so special!! For kids as in most RC hotels they had the treasure hunt and he loved that. His excitement and enthusiasm I will never forgot. Warm lovely memories that I hope I never forget. My son has 2 younger brothers and now I’m hoping I can do that for each of them for their 8th birthday. Concierge were so helpful in advance of our arrival and the check in desk was great. No complaints, wonderful experience. Thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I have stayed here before and yes the price is huge but the service and rooms are outstanding. We were upgraded to corner and park view suite and I wish we could have stayed a week. The concierge and staff and #1. The food and wine are perfect!!!!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I cannot tell you how spotless and lovely this hotel is. If you have followed my travels to NYC, you will see that I usually stay elsewhere. This hotel outdid itself in so many ways. Also, they knew about all my allergies (I always call before I go to make sure that I will be able to eat breakfast and have coffee. They were SOOOOO kind and brought a beautiful fruit basket and a bottle of wine upon our arrival. Also, the outstanding hostess at the restaurant was so sweet. They have fresh morning coffee in a beautiful set up at the bar in the morning. When I asked if they had almond milk, she immediately ran back, got it and brought it out in a beautiful creamer. The next morning when I came down, She remembered me and without my saying anything, the creamer was out before I could finish during my coffee..amazing. The bartender was just as fabulous. I told him I had food allergies and he took my simple burger and green bean request back to the chef, Came back out and explained what he requested and served me a beautiful quick lunch at the bar as if it was a fifty dollar steak. The rooms were so clean and beautiful. We will be back..very, very soon. Thanks so much

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Good place to stay in NYC. Great views. Great location. Staff is good but could be more personable especially to someone who stays at the various Marriott Group of hotels over 60 nights a year. Leading hotels is what we look for and this one is not the best you can find in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed on the 6th floor in a room with 2 large windows overlooking the park. The room was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. The room was a little noisy during the day due to sounds of the afternoon traffic, but was perfectly quiet at night for sleep! Staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't know there was free wifi until check out when they took off the charges. Wish I knew before hand. Check in with the car was BUSY out front but the Christmas week was horrible traffic. Waiting to pick up the car was 1 hour due to holiday traffic. We were delighted to be able to sit in the lounge/restaurant to wait. Otherwise check in and out was swift. Concierge helped us out with dinner reservations. We tried there recommendation and it was great-Bond 45! They also went the extra special mile to include a small birthday gift for us upon arrival-truly special!! Kudos to concierge! Best service was the men out front offered to take our luggage from storage directly to our car when it arrived-no waiting around with bags in the lounge etc! LOVED that! Also, when we waited for a cab for 1 minute, a driver offered to take us in the "hotel courtesy car". We were delighted to do this at a busy time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying at the Ritz is, (at least for my family and I), one of those rare things we get to do that when you do it, you want to do it for a special reason. My wife and I wanted to take out kids up to NYC to see the tree at Rockefeller Center and so when I went to book the room I knew we were going to give the Ritz a try. Since I'm a Platinum Premier with Marriott I decided to book a room on points (60,000) for a Saturday night and do it right. When you book a room on points all you are able to book is a standard room which was fine for my family and I. Normally I get upgraded at Marriotts but I was also well aware that Ritz's normally do not upgrade award stays so I was not expecting one. Upon arrival though I was able to at least upgrade our view and get a room facing 6th Ave with a partial view of Central Park. We were very happy with that! One thing you have to realize about hotels in NYC is that unless you are staying in a suite, standard rooms are not very large. The standard room size at the Ritz is roughly 450 square feet so it's fine for a family of four for a night but for a long stay you probably want to make sure where you book has larger rooms. As for the service I have to say the employees we encountered were all very nice and very helpful. I expected this at the Ritz and they delivered. For instance when the horse and carriage ride I booked with the Concierge Desk was 10 minutes late to pick my family and I up, one of the head Concierge's, Keoni, made sure to apologize and get my family some cups of hot chocolate to keep us warm on the ride. That was very nice and we appreciated it very much. I must also say Felix the doorman was wonderful and greeted us each and every time we went outside or came back in. He also was very apologetic to us when the valet took some time to retrieve our car and made sure to have our car loaded with our bags and with bottles of water in the console before we got in the car to drive back home. They have great people and Keoni and Felix are two great examples of that. Even while we were waiting for our car another employee brought my 4 year old son a large stuffed animal Lion to play with out of the blue! He did it just because he wanted to. These are the reasons why we will certainly return to the Ritz and stay again. Their people make the experience wonderful. Add to the fact they have one of the best locations in the city right on Central Park and you have the makings for a great trip to NYC. Stay at the Ritz, you won't regret it!
user_name:
Stan D
Springfield - Delaware County, Pennsylvania

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, top notch service, incredibly comfortable and well appointed rooms. You can walk right across the street for a stroll in Central Park. You are just a few short blocks from both east and west side. Plenty to do and see in the area. I had a corner suite overlooking Central Park that was perfect. Celebrity sightings occasionally add to the fun.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We decided to stay at the Ritz-Carlton instead of The Plaza for our annual Christmas trip to New York City. Unfortunately didn’t meet the standards that we expected. Our room #1803 was the worst view of ANY hotel we have ever stayed in our lives. Our view was brick wall of the other side of the hotel. It was also very noisy. Could hear elevator all day/night. Sounded like we were near a runway at the airport.I’m sure there are better rooms but we certainly had to have one of the worst rooms.Valet/doormen could not be better, very helpful and nice!When we checked out we were not asked how our stay was, therefore we never offered our experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wow! Likely my favorite hotel of all time, our stay at this Ritz-Carlton was fantastic.The view is a large part of the charm as it faces Central Park. We were fortunate to nab a park view and I loved waking up looking out over the trees every morning.The staff and level of accommodations you'd expect with the Ritz are all there - incredibly accommodating & attentive, beautifully decorated rooms, and all the little touches like a spy glass to watch what's going on across the street out your window.We are frequent Marriott travelers and visit many of their lounges. This one was top notch! The food was so good, it was hard to leave and go have a real dinner one night. The view is also the perfect spot to people watch the busy sidewalks below.After staying all over NYC this ranks as my favorite place when we're in the city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a suite on the 3rd floor. Beautiful two room - two bath. Completely renovated. Incredibly comfy King bed. Perfect in every way. Love the cocktail room off reception with overstuffed chairs and leather sofas. Great for a drink on a cold December’s night! Hotel is so Tastefully decorated for the holidays. Hotel staff impeccable. No children in lounge-bar area ++

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The room is very nice, a little bigger than typical NYC. Recently renovated, so aesthetics are great. The good: nice lounge area and great staff. Perfect for working in the morning with coffee. Great location. Not so good but not too bad: our room was up against the freight elevator shaft, so whenever it was going up and down, it sounded like a bunch of Harley’s were outside of the room. In addition, at 6:00 am, the construction across the street caused a constant drone of horrible noise.Bottom line: very nicely appointed, but nyc is noisy. How anyone lives here is beyond me. Turndown was missed tonight. Nice place but very expensive for what you get.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Comfortable rooms, great amenities, most of the needs of a business traveller available in the room. Cozy Bed, classy interiors. Location near central park which makes it an amazing experience. Definitely recommended for a business or leisure stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a client who has been staying at an array Ritz Carlton hotels now for almost a decade, being at Ritz Carlton Central Park for a recent overnight visit reminded us of why Ritz Carlton Central Park is regarded by many as a flagship hotel in the RC collection of hotels. Many of the staff provided excellent service; for example, Robinson Martinez at the Front Desk was superb in accommodating our requests, and was most congenial and friendly throughout. Also, Ashley Suhre, Executive Reservations Coordinator, was excellent with her ongoing assistance with our reservations before we arrived. Carmelinda Parker provided us with a helpful tour of the recently renovated Club Lounge, and Kelly (who works in the Club Lounge) introduced us to the array of wines offered at the Lounge, as well telling us about the subtle ways used to get guests to speak softly in the Lounge’s "quiet" zone. Most importantly some problems we had with the service at the recently renovated Club Lounge were very effectively addressed by Winfred Van Workum, the GM of the hotel. His prompt responses to our issues reinforced our loyalty to the Ritz-Carlton brand in general.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I’ve only good things to say about this hotel! I’m super pleased with their quick check-in process when we visited on 2 occasions, 3 days at the beginning of July and 4 days at the end of July. The staff was super helpful, and our requests were swiftly answered or brought to the room.Many thanks to the concierge team, Susanne, Bernard, Kerri and William for helping me print my music scores. Housekeeping was really efficient but just a bit peeved that they're slightly hesitant about giving extra amenities (is it because I didn't book a suite?). Also, thank you to the African-American lady (can't remember her name) at the breakfast room for being really welcoming! Generally, it's very elegant and it even has Baroque music turned on at the lobby. It's within walking distance to Columbus Circle, Lincoln Centre, Central Park, and the Metro station. Conveniently located near restaurants, small cafes, as well as supermarkets like Morton Williams and Wholefoods.You can also arrange for transportation with the Hotel (at extra cost). I would definitely come back here again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am not sure who decided on the new interior design of the rooms at the RC Central Park but they shouldn't have. Old work European glamour is replaced with bland, modern and cheap looking finishes that are more reminiscent of a mid-range Marriott or Sheraton than a flagship Ritz Carlton. The lobby and bar retain their wow factor but the staff let the side down with earpieces and behaviour perhaps more suited to an Atlanta airport hotel. Overall I had an average stay - it was okay - but I expect more from a Ritz. There are better options at this price point and indeed within the same hotel group. Not recommended.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Marriott Platinum MemberValue: 1/5Cleaniness: 5/5Decor: 2/5Service: 3/5Location: 4/5I'll go through things in chronological order. I'm a Marriott Platinum member, but as most Marriott Platinums already know, Ritz Carlton doesn't give much for benefits to Marriott elites, no suite upgrades, no lounge, or breakfast but that is besides the point.Upon arrival to the hotel, I realized there is no actual lobby/parking for exclusive hotel guest drop off. It's just a sidewalk entrance with minimal signage. The location is great next to central park but come on, a 5 star hotel upward of $800 a night for a lousy sidewalk entrance? Are you serious?If you choose to stop reading here, I don't blame you but there's worst time to come. Like I said I didn't expect much for an upgrade but Iiterally got nothing. Why do you treat Marriott elites this way? I could go next door to JW for half the price and could've gotten a suite almost guaranteed.It could've been the fact I booked with reward points, and thought long and hard about extending an extra night but ultimately decided not to. I'm glad I didn't.I got to the hotel pretty early and the staff said they will call me when my room is ready. Walked around central park and had to come back to ping the front desk for an update and he said "15 minutes" I knew the room was vacant as informed by the front desk earlier, it just needed housekeeping and they had 3 full hours to do it.Upon "checking in" they did not say ANYTHING about Marriott elite nor anything about the welcome gift. They gave me my card keys and told me where the elevator was.The elevators are TINY. It fits 6 people max. The decor of the hotel tries to be classical but it simply looks old and painted/veneered over. The room was decent sized but half of it was allocated to an excessively large bathroom - most of which is wasted space and could've been used more for the room. The doors in the bathroom didn't even close properly. You had to push super hard to get the door latch to clear the gap.The beds had these black Lutron switches taped to the post. They were hard to find and also once you found them, just plain unsightly. These switches simply show a lack of thought in the renovation. You can get these for $49.99 at Best Buy, probably less since Black Friday is coming up. Nobody wants to see these in one of the most expensive hotels in NYC. The view was other people's hotel rooms/apartments. It was just plain awkward looking outside so we kept the blinds down for majority of the stay.About service, it was fine except they threw away 2 tubes of fresh toothpaste the day after we opened them. Like I get it, rich people stay here, but even Jeff Bezos wouldn't throw away a tube of Colgate after using it for a day.I didn't bother dealing with front desk when I checked out, I just did it on the TV and left. This was my first stay in NYC and first stay at a Ritz Carlton property. Terrible first impressions. To all Marriott elites out there: STAY AWAY. Go to JW for less, hell I got a better experience in the first 30 seconds of checking in at Renaissance Midtown than this place. I honestly don't see why anyone would pay so much for this place. Maybe you need to see the club lounge to enjoy it. Maybe you need a suite.Some SEO tags so you guys can find this review: Marriott Platinum Premier, SPG Platinum, Gold, Silver. Please excuse any typos, typed with my thumbs while taking a "Ritz Carlton" on the toilet.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is beautifully appointed and its location was perfect for all mid-town activities. It is walking distance to Broadway and Lincoln center. The room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was comfortable. The concierge service was phenomenal. They were knowledgeable and very helpful! We were in a high floor and there was no noise issue. The only downside was that we asked for a rollaway bed and it was not provided.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have only been here for one day, but it has been elegant and a wonderful hotel so far. We were booked for the courtyard room but were upgraded due to Platinum status to an “Avenue view” which has a partial Central Park view...such a treat. Also, since we are here celebrating my birthday, we received complementary champagne upon checkin and a beautiful cake was delivered with a thoughtful card from the staff. The room is gorgeous and well planned out...more than adequate drawer space and storage. The bathroom is spacious and very well appointed. The location literally can’t be beat! Central Park is directly across the street. There are fabulous restaurants within walking distance including Sarabeth’s which is steps away (breakfast/lunch) and Quality Meats (amazing dinner).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very pricey, excellent hotel, with very attentive staff and great ambiance. Right on Central Park South, it couldn't be anymore in the heart of action. Rooms are excellent, well appointed, great temperature controls, soft beds and pillows. Bathrooms are very spacious and beautifully designed. Beware of the high price for anything in the mini bar or the hotel lounge.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I spent three days at The Ritz, with a mixed experience. First the good aspects of the hotel:It is in a great location, right on the park, and with easy access to the theater district and mid-town New York. I don't like big hotels, and The Ritz feels more like a boutique hotel. Check-in and service were excellent. The bed was big and comfy. Good charging capabilities throughout the room, including bedside USB chargers. Fast free internet for frequent stayers. The bathroom was big and well-equipped, and one of my favorite features... they had a really nice hand steamer in the room that was perfect for a wrinkled suit.The not-so-good. My king room, while in great condition, was on the small side and very dark, with an inside courtyard view of a brick wall. My smoke detector malfunctioned early in the morning and woke me up. Unlike other Ritz Carleton's I have stayed in - this room does not have a coffee or Nespresso maker (the Ritz should make that standard). I had stayed at the Ritz Denver two weeks earlier - and it was a much nicer room. It was a bit noisy. I was already up because of the smoke detector, but the hallway noise was loud.So while it is a nice room, and a lovely hotel, for the price it did not compare favorably to the Park Hyatt that is just a few blocks away. Rooms at The Park were much larger and better equipped. Still, it is a classic NY hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is very special Luxury Hotel and ia one of my favorite places to stay. I have stayed here 2 other times and I can't wait to return. Very conveniently located and very elegant in many ways. The rooms are very nice, a lot of marble in the bathrooms, great bedding, room service and the staff is very pleasant. Tell them Brady Bunte sent you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: we stayed here for the NYC Marathon. Service and rooms are five star. Hotel provided us with a "recovery box" and a lovely celebratory cake (it was also my birthday). Barkeep Manny served a great martini.You cannot go wrong here!
user_name:
parksloper511
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our room was beautiful, although the view was of the other side of the hotel, it provided a great barrier to noise! The staff was very friendly and helpful. Food in the lounge was great; fresh coffee every morning was divine. It's not cheap - New York prices on top of Ritz Carlton premium, but worth it for a quick weekend getaway. Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton across from Central Park is my “home away from home” when I visit New York. I have been staying at this Manhattan oasis for 15 years now. From the moment I arrive (when I am warmly welcomed by name by the affable doormen) to the end of my stay (when the front desk staff makes sure my stay was a smooth one), I am always made to feel that I am a valued guest. And I don’t think this is just because I am a longtime visitor. Rather, I’ve noticed that all the other guests are treated just the same as me, whether they be first-time visitors or returning regulars like me. The hotel recently underwent a top-to-bottom “refreshing”, and the new décor is elegantly stylish and sumptuous without being stuffy. And of course, the midtown location can’t be beat (directly across from Central Park and within steps from Fifth Avenue). The ladies and gentlemen of the Ritz are extraordinary – starting with those affable doormen I previously mentioned. The bellmen are prompt, helpful, and friendly; the front desk staff is totally professional and always anticipates my needs; the concierges are first-class; the Club Lounge personnel provide the utmost in service; the La Prairie spa front desk staff and providers are all outstanding; the in-room dining folks (and selections) exceed my experiences at all other hotels; the housekeeping staff is top-notch (twice daily); and the managers who are often circulating in the public areas are not only perceptive but also engaging. For me, what sets this hotel apart is the sincere and genuine personal attention that awaits when one enters its doors. Family members or friends often accompany me on my stays at the Ritz Central Park, and all of them have remarked how attentive the staff is to their guests. For example, I treated my niece and her friend to a summer trip recently to celebrate their college graduations and the friend’s birthday. Upon first entering their room after arrival, the young ladies discovered a “goodie plate” congratulating them on their accomplishments and the friend’s special day. Over the years I’ve experienced countless other examples of “above-and-beyond” hospitality, from stocking my quarters with my favorite Texas-based soft drink to leaving a Broadway show cast recording as a souvenir following an evening at the theatre. This level of attention, the hotel’s ambience, and the marvelous staff will keep me returning to the Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park for years to come.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is nice and pretty well located in front of the Park.The rooms are nice and well equiped.Beds are confortable.The Concierge staff is pretty nice and helpful but some at the reception were rude and unfriendly...is not so bad to smile sometimes...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am a frequent visitor to the City. I have my go-to hotels. This is my first time at The Ritz in NYC. I typically stay in Ritz hotels in other locations. I am a Platinum member and booked with points. When I booked my room I booked a park view room with club access. I enjoy the club at all of the Ritz hotels. They did not provide what I booked at check-in, so I came downstairs and they recognized that they had not given me the room I booked. Make sure you have your reservation handy to prove what you booked. I had to show it a couple of times. We were arriving from Paris and a long flight. It was already late when we were checking in, after 6:30 pm. I was mistaken about booking a club room. But since they did not have a park view room ready we had to wait so they escorted us to the club. It was not until 8:30 that our room was ready. Not sure why the room required over 2 hours at the time we checked in to get ready, but it did. The room was on the 18th floor and had a nice entryway, coat closet, small couch, nice wardrobes for your clothes, wonderful bed and..... That central park view. Yes, it was dark but oh the view. Our room was provided with a telescope. All of the lights surrounding the park. The lights in the park. We enjoyed going to sleep to the view, waking up to the view, & enjoying the view with room service. Our room was a nice size, separate tub & shower, 2 sinks, separate water closet.Yes, the water was brown when I started the tub but I ran it for 2 minutes and it was fine. Water pressure in the shower was nice.The club was wonderful. Usually, the Club is on a higher floor so no super cool views. But, the food offerings, wine, and staff were wonderful! We were able to get 1:00 checkout. I would have preferred past 2 but I didn't insist. Room service was very nice. They do take about 30 minutes to pick up your room service table so call as soon as your done as it takes quite a bit of space in the room. The hotel is quite pricey. The view is why. If you don't have the view or an exceptional room, I can't say the $1000+ a night is worth it. But, if you book the view. It's worth every penny.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love the Ritz-Carlton hotels, however; this one never seems to fire on all cylinders. We were coming in for a fall weekend, and booked the room a few months in advance. We specifically asked for a high floor park view. The reservation's desk said they couldn't guarantee, but given how far in advance we were making the reservation there shouldn't be a problem. When we checked in we were given a park view room on the third floor - lowest floor in the hotel. Clearly this isn't the end of the world, and we still had a nice stay. The rooms are beautiful and it is a great location, but how we ended up with a view of the street is beyond me. The rooms cost quite a bit, and for the price, our view was mediocre at best. There are other hotels in that location - maybe it's time to give them a try. See if we can get treated a little bit better - or at least get what we are paying for.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We finally had a chance to experience the world famous flagship Ritz-Carlton at Central Park, and it was a wonderful experience. The service and interaction with the staff was as expected—an excellent standard that shows only the best of the best Ritz staff are generally there. The location is great—right across the street from Central Park, easy walk to numerous nice restaurants and shops. The facilities were well-maintained, elegant, and beautifully ornate (some of the molding and fixtures were splendid). We didn’t get a room with a great view, but it was quiet and we thoroughly enjoyed the comfort/contrast—after walking around in the hustle and bustle of NY all day, especially Central Park the same day as a huge concert event, it felt like we were transported somewhere else when we were back in the room—quiet, calm. The only negatives was that there was not much space downstairs in the lobby area, there was no pool/hot tub/sauna area, and the perfume in the rooms was a little strong (especially the closet area—so if you have allergies to that it may be sensitive). But, once again, the staff were phenomenal, room service was great, cleanliness and facility upkeep was great, and you can’t beat the location. Definitely would recommend (with the caveat that we didn't pay full price--it's a very nice hotel, but doesn't contain the "wow" factor that the price indicates).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Always a pleasure for a short day trip for my meetings but what won me over was the simple touch of The gentleman who turn my seat warmer on as I was getting ready to head to the airport. It’s the little things that mean the most!!! Thank you James

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is one of the most expensive hotels in New York. So expectations are high accordingly. Like a previous review, I am a Platinum (Elite) and very little was done for me. I was "upgraded" to a room which has no closet, so I needed to "downgrade" back in my original low category facing another building (yuck... don't book a low category room in this hotel - nasty). The room itself is nice, marble bathrooms, nice furnishings but nothing surprising - it's similar and perhaps at a lower luxury level than other Ritz Carltons, especially comparing the non-US properties.Then there is the shower. The water pressure was literally a trickle. This is extremely basic and I was rather upset about this. Is the whole hotel like this or only my very subpar room. I was in room 415 - so be warned if you are assigned this room. But given that this is a solo business trip, having a nice relaxing shower is sort of a "must have". Given that I was so tired, I just dealt with it rather than asking to change rooms (or even change hotel, which came across my mind). All I can say is that shower was so unacceptable that it was possibly the worst shower I took in the past 5 years in my 300+ nights of hotels. Totally unaccepable for a Ritz Carlton.I will absolutely not return. There are so many choices in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I check in last Tuesday and were given most likely the worst room in the house. The window opened up to backs of other buildings and trash, when we asked for a room facing Central Park. The faucet water was brown. When I called down they told me to let the water run for a few minutes. Well, 15 minutes later it was still brown. So we checked the shower only to find all the hardware on the shower floor (faucets, knobs, screws etc.). Further, I am a lifetime Platinum member and was entitled to an upgraded room. When they figured that they had to move me because of an inoperable bathroom, the suddenly had these upgraded rooms to move me. We went to eat at the lobby restaurant only to find we had to wait 30 minutes before a waiter came by. Needless to say, we spent most of our time at the Plaza Hotel down the street.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment you step out of the scrum of Manhattan traffic, the doormen welcome you. The lobby is classic dark wood paneled with clubby furniture and tapestry. The staff are world class and take care of your every need, especially Brian and Celso at the concierge desk. These gentlemen can answer just about any questions you may have. The rooms are elegantly remodeled, but I wish the bathroom marble floors were heated and the commode seats were soft close, like at home. One minor disappointment was that they missed the time requested on a birthday champagne surprise, so we did without. All in all- Luxury and Serenity meets world class service here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I have stayed at numerous luxury level hotels, several of which have been Ritz-Carltons. The Ritz-Carlton, New York, Central Park definitely lives up to the brand's steller reputation. The unobtrusive front entrance, manned by two attentive doormen; the comfortable, subdued lobby; a concierge, staffed by people who had already managed to snag impossible restaurant reservations in advance of our arrival; and a check-in desk with a welcoming ambiance; all this made us realize we'd made the right choice in selecting this hotel. We weren't quite sure exactly how friendly was, "Pet Friendly", when we decided to travel with our 10lb. Pomeranian. As it turned out, very friendly indeed. The location, across from Central Park, was perfect - no in room accidents, a readily available bathroom across the street, and lots of sights and sounds to keep a little dog fascinated. I can't sing the praises of the very accommodating hotel staff loudly enough! And that includes room service. They are all outstanding. Our spacious room on the 22nd floor, overlooking the Park and beyond, was perfect. The king sized bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and attractive. Our five day stay felt a bit too short, so we probably will return to New York in the spring, and we'll definitely stay at this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There isn't much to say other than the Ritz was wonderful. It exceeded all our expectations. The room was large, clean, comfortable, and fully equipped with everything one could need. The AC was superb and a welcomed respite from hot days in the humidity and unseasonably warm October temperatures. Also, we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was. We could not tell we were on 6th ave. Aside from the obvious beauty and charm, the staff really made our stay here excellent. Brian at the concierge desk was the most helpful and kind. He went above and beyond to help us and he was extremely friendly. He was able to get us a reservation at a popular Italian restaurant and he found a very special and rare kind of whiskey we were looking for to celebrate a 60th birthday in our party. The doormen Felix and Al were superb as well - both extremely welcoming and gracious. We will stay here again for those three men alone. The lobby is beautiful and a great place for a night cap. The location obviously cannot be beat with 5th Ave so close and being directly across from the park. The congestion in front of the hotel did get very bad at times but what else can one expect being in NYC. And lastly, the nightly turn down service was beyond anything we've had before. We loved our stay and will be back for sure.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located across from Central Park. Long walks or picnics on the Green this is a nice location, with a Big City Flair! Within walking distance to Fine dining and Shopping. Great Getaway for family or couples. Min away from Awesome Attractions Museums & Theatre!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very good hotel, perfect location, very good rooms. Reception very efficient, kind and helpful. Lobby is amazing. However there is one very rude waiter, with the name suhel, arguing with guests when they do not like the table shown by him. Sometimes a small fly can waste the whole soup. Unfortunate. Otherwise highly recommendable hotel right next to central park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When surprising my wife with a trip to NYC for her 40th birthday, there were no shortage of options. I settled on the Ritz because I thought it would be a special experience to stay at a landmark hotel. The hotel did not disappoint. First, the door man was incredibly kind. He asked us a few questions and showed us in. Everyone we then encountered was sure to say "Happy Birthday" to my wife. It was both surprising and wonderfully pleasant. The lobby was impeccable. The staff at the check in desk was friendly. Our room wasn't ready (we were there very early) so they said they would deliver our bags to our room so that when we returned much later (after the Harry Potter play), we would be all set. Everything went off without a hitch. The room upgrade was spectacular and the extra lengths that Ronald went to ensure that the weekend stay was special for my wife were both unexpected and appreciated. Overall, I challenge you to find a better property in all of NY. I do not think it is exists. Thank you, Ronald and the rest of the Ritz staff.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the doorman to the concierge...lochain and Damian were outstanding. We are in the hospitality business, so we know what good service means. We were greeted literally by everyone we saw. It was sincere, we felt the team members at the Ritz truly wanted this to be our greatest stay in NYC! It was! Thank you Ritz! We will stay no where else! Period!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The room refresh was done very tastefully. We had a lovely suite (booked a deluxe room only) presumably due to recognition in the new Marriott/Starwood combined loyalty program. The staff were incredibly attentive, helpful and engaging. As always, there's no beating this location. The only constructive comments I would give are related to housekeeping; it's a bit sloppy (e.g. ice bucket left with melted water after two "visits" from housekeeping). But that's a minor detail and wouldn't deter me from returning. Truly a gem in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I previously wrote a review and my only “complaint” (which was hardly a complaint) was that the rooms need a refresh. We were there in December and were one of the first to stay in the renovated rooms and they are gorgeous! Between the staff that goes above and beyond from the moment you step foot to the new rooms, the Ritz Central Park surpasses all expectations!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am a frequent traveller and stay in all the best five star hotel around the world. In the summer I visited New York with my family for six nights, we stayed in the Ritz Calton, Central park. We were welcomed by the General Manager with many different drinks such as champagin, wine and juices for the children. We stayed in the interconnecting rooms and we had a great view of Central Park. I recommend rooms on the fifth floor. The concierge service was amazing they recommended so many lovely places for breakfast, lunch and dinner. They were all walking distance as well. I can certainly say the Ritz Calton Central Park was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed here in early Sept 2018. We have stayed at the The Ritz many times and it has always been very good but this year the service level seemed to be a bit more helpful and caring if that was possible. We were greeted by employees wherever and whenever and they went out of their way to make our stay relaxing, memorable and wonderful. Even when I went down to get some free coffee in the lounge, the attendant remembered my name and was very friendly. Our room on the 18th floor with a Park view was very comfortable too. The only disappointing thing was that the Club Floor was closed, but management made up for that too with a discount on food and beverage plus a nice bottle of wine. The doormen were also great and we were able to use the house car to take us to some very nice restaurants nearby. And even the Ritz's own restaurant is great, although a little pricey. I think this was our 8th vacation in NYC and seven times we have stayed at the Ritz. We feel like it is our home in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved this hotel! Staff was wonderful from the door men to servers to bartenders to front desk! Best service in NYC.Food and drinks were exceptional. Appreciated the gift that we received in the room. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Hotel is centrally located with breathtaking views of Central Park! The staff is extremely knowledgeable and makes every attempt to personalize your stay. LaPrairie spa re-opened after completing a beautiful remodel and has several services to choose from.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, beautiful rooms. The staff is as always polite and courteous. Easy walking distance to most major tourist areas. The views from the room are pretty awesome, getting to see the City high up in a nice room is quite the experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed a 4-night stay on 19th floor. Street noise was not a problem. The staff was very friendly including doormen, front desk, concierge, lobby bar and housekeeping. Central Park is across the street and very accessible for walking. Bath and bed were outstanding. Will definitely look to stay there again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed several times at the Ritz Carlton Central Park in the past two years. The location is fabulous, the rooms(we have stayed in both park view and suites sometimes club level as well) are lovely, beds are incredible, and the service is personal and stellar. We have enjoyed drinks at the lobby bar and have appreciated the help of the Concierge for dinner suggestions. Coming here is truly like finding a little slice of peace and understated luxury in the midst of a busy city. We hope to be back again sometime soon. We can't wait!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Love the team at this hotel. The conceriage teams always create the best itineraries and very accommodating for last minute changes. The location is excellent. The facilities are excellent. The bell men are so helpful and very sharp. All the staff can address us by name which really makes it feel like home. We have had a couple of occasions with delayed flights and needed last minute accommodations as we did not want to wait out at the airport. The Front desk team are were always there to help us check back in and find us a excellent place for last minute dinner. We used to stay more up town but one stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park and I couldn’t picture myself anywhere else in NYC. This last stay we received a newly renovated room. More techs stuff added to the rooms and it’s much brighter and cleaner looking. Every time the car door opens I truly appreciate hearing “welcome home Ms. T.” Something so simple but so meaningful.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Am a frequent visitor to this property and am generally treated very well.This evening was a major disappointment; I am a Platinum Premier Elite Guest with SPG and Lifetime Platinum with Marriot Rewards.Yet, they had no idea about my status at check-in and no availability for upgrades.Not even a higher floor room in my Category.I asked if I could use my Suite nights and they declined that as well.Overall a very disappointing (surprisingly) start of what was supposed to be a 6-night stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Outstanding location, fabulous service. Would highly recommend upgrading to a suite with a view of Central Park. Great dining in house. Fantastic lobby bar. Look forward to a return visit during a warmer week!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: By all acknowledgement, the Ritz-Carlton (especially - Central Park South) has been the bellwether of service and comfort of hoteliers in North America for decades. Our family's choice does not wane - we do from time-to-time search out those "boutique" experiences looking for that new thrill - only to know where we have to return for the refined, exceptional service that only the Ritz can offer. This weekend was no exception, a welcome reminder of the refinement that flows, freely, from this gentle giant. Our weekend was set to drop our daughter at Fordham, Lincoln Center, to begin her college career. A move that would be as emotionally charged as it would be beautiful. Coinciding with my 50ish birthday, the Ritz was on task. No moment of our weekend was overlooked. The welcome gifts, the "diet aware" treats, the service, all unparalleled in our experiences elsewhere. We visit the RC Central Park around once or twice a year and are always pleased. This trip however re-set the bar. The newly renovated rooms are exceptional, and a delight regardless of your budget (deluxe or super deluxe). The staff is unparalleled, the rooms terrific, and the restaurant delivers jaw dropping perfection on meal preparation. There is a lot of competition in NYC, its good to be the King!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We’ve stayed in Ritz Carlton hotels in other cities and experienced the always friendly great customer service. This one may have been the best!!! Every single staff person was exceptional and some were amazing! As an AMEX platinum card holder the room upgrade and benefits were fabulous. The dinner food wasn’t 100% great though some was. Everything else 100% fabulous! Thanks for making our visit exceptional!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First, let me begin by saying I’ve never felt the urge to write a TripAdvisor review until now, so this is a first for me. My wife and I recently stayed at the Ritz for our Anniversary trip. The concierge staff is the best we’ve experienced in any hotel we’ve ever stayed. They helped with dinner reservations, getting us into the hardest to get places in NYC. I casually mentioned it was our anniversary and received an email from Guest Services asking if I could send a couple pictures of my wife and me. When we arrived to our room, they had left us a bottle of champagne and framed pictures of the two of us from over the years. Everywhere we went in the hotel, we were acknowledged by name and wished a Happy Anniversary. Even at our Afternoon Tea, they brought us macaroons with Happy Anniversary written on the plate. One staffer asked if we needed help getting tickets to a show. I mentioned we had tickets to The Band’s Visit on Broadway. When we returned from the show to retrieve our luggage before heading to the airport, they gave us a small gift bag with a note and copy of the Musical’s soundtrack. This hotel has small touches down to a science. This is in addition to the beautifully renovated rooms that have to be some of the most spacious in NYC. The Ritz should be commended for all they do to make their guests feel so comfortable and welcomed. I cannot imagine a better place to stay than this hotel. Thanks to the entire Ritz Central Park team for making our anniversary trip so special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful two night getaway to the Ritz Carlton. From beginning to end the staff treated us like royalty, doing all sorts of really nice things for us from big to small, usually without being asked. When we mentioned this was sort of a second honeymoon, they surprised us with a bottle of champagne. When no upgraded rooms were available, they treated us to a great breakfast both days instead. Even aside from that, just the everyday interactions with all the hotel staff were unfailingly cheerful, helpful, and so very friendly. The hotel room itself was gorgeous and extremely convenient, right on Central Park South. All in all we couldn't have been happier with this hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is totally amazing from the rooms which have just been redone to the impeccable service , it is the very best. Whatever you ask for they will try to help. It is such a pretty place too. Make sure to visit this place.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In the interest of full disclosure, this stay was partially paid for by the hotel in order to compensate us for a poor experience last year. We stayed at this Ritz Carlton last September (2017) and it was obvious the rooms were in desperate need of being refurbished. Hotel management offered us a free three night stay in one of the newly refurbished rooms if we returned. We decided to take them up on their offer as we needed to be in NYC anyway. Our room was a newly re-done Deluxe Park View Suite on the 16th floor. In fact, we were only the 10th guests to stay in this room. The room was beautiful and HUGE. We had a wonderful view of Central Park. The room was clean and very well appointed. The public spaces have been updated and re-painted as well. It is obvious that the hotel has made a real effort to bring this magnificent property back to the high standards one would expect for a Ritz Carlton property. The staff were excellent. Very attentive and they anticipated our needs. When our travels bring us back to New York city, we will stay at this property again. A special thank you to the hotel management and Mr. van Workum who truly took ownership of a problem and showed real concern for us and offered real solutions.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything about this hotel was 5 Star - the location, the cleanliness, the staff. The staff couldn't have been more warm and kind to us. Everyone there was really helpful and welcoming even to our kids (14 and 11). Our room was fantastic and the noise level very very low for an NYC hotel. The location is perfect - convenient to Central Park, Times Square, Bloomingdales, 5th Avenue and more. It's a great home base for exploring all of NYC because the Big Bus tours start close by as well. We loved this hotel and couldn't speak more highly of the staff. They really made it exceptional.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was booked for a business trip for 3 nights. Hotel’s location is convenient, and room is big and clean.Unfortunately, we faced number of issues.1- I called up guest service and asked for a scale. The agent was speaking to me over the phone but I could barely hear her. I said “sorry I cannot hear you” and pushed the volume up button several times. She scolded at me saying “P.L.E.A.S.E DO NOT DO THAT ON THE PHONE WITH ME. IT BEEPS REALLY LOUDLY BUT I WILL SEND UP THE SCALE AT THIS TIME”. I apologized to her that I couldn’t hear her but what does she mean by “at this time”?2- A gentleman brought the scale up to the room and asked me if I needed anything else. I asked for a black coffee as there was no coffee station in the room. My coffee order was never delivered this day.3- 5 star hotel without a coffee station. I had to spend 26 dollars (with tips) for a pot of coffee the next day morning. It was delivered quick which was good.4- fridge in the room was not working. 5- “privacy” means nothing. Even if we had put DND sign on the door knob, housekeeping came 3 times knocking on the door and even opened the door with the master key! This happened 3 days out of 3 nights stay. 6- bad odor comes up from the carpet in the room, had to have strong AC on at all times. 7- you can hear the sound of metro passing by every single time, all day and all night. Our room was on the 10th floor and we were able to hear and feel it’s pass.8- there was “bellman gratuities of USD 22.25” charged to the room. I’ve never seen a hotel charging bellman service to bring the luggages up to the room after tipping the bellman directly. 9- internet was super slow.10- there was a package arrived to the hotel before our check out and no one notified us. We went back to the hotel and had to wait 20-30 minutes to collect a package from the Conciege as it seems they didn’t know where it was placed. Overall, it wasn’t a 5 star experience. Not at all.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We decided to take a quick 2 day trip to NYC and since we are only an hour and 1/2 drive away we got in our car and started our journey. While driving we went to our "go to" app to see if there was any availability at the Ritz Carlton Central Park...and there was. In less than 2 hours we were inside and engulfed in exemplary customer service, a cocoon of comfort and style.Of course, if you did venture out you are right across the street from Central Park and within blocks of fabulous dining.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I stayed in a suite over Thanksgiving. We had my children and their grandmother. It was a wonderful experience in the city. We were centrally located to see the parade. The staff provided consistent, high quality service. It was very expensive at this time of year (more than usual) but worth every dime. It was an amazing experience!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location and incredible concierge staff, but definitely not our best stay.. Parts of the stay were amazing and magical and some facets were just bad.. Let me start by saying my wife will only stay at Ritz properties if they are available, Ritz properties usually give her nothing to complain about, but unfortunately she complained quite a bit about this one. Biggest gripe was no espresso or coffee machine in the room and the small room size. I don't think we've ever stayed in a room that small or a room without a coffee machine, which upon waking up the first morning we discovered no nespresso or coffee machine which made for a very grumpy morning as we got the family ready for the first day of vacation. We need to wake up with coffee to function well.. so on the second morning we scheduled coffee to be delivered to the room at 8am with the front desk after we were told we couldn't get a coffee machine in the room. I set the alarm and woke up early and got dressed to receive coffee from room service at 8am.. And Nobody showed up from Room Service. So i waited and went out to get Starbucks at 8:45am with the family all still asleep.. by the time I got back my wife woke up and called and let them know the coffee was not delivered.. they did bring her the $27 coffee at 9:45 am just in time for us to leave the room for the day.. I think she took 2 sips of that delicious $27 coffee pot.. It did not get drunk at all.. She did rave about how great the coffee was later on at breakfast though.. The 3rd day I just went directly to starbucks and couldn't rely on the hotel at all for life's most essential requirement. The other bothersome issue we had was with getting a rollaway bed delivered to our room for our son.. We had to ask for it 3 times the first day.. We asked for a rollaway upon check-in.. Then as we were leaving for dinner the turn down service lady was coming in and we discussed the rollaway with her and she said she was there to take care of it and set it up and I tipped her and we went off to dinner.. When we got back to the room around 11pm with a sleeping child on my shoulder there was still no rollaway bed in the room.. We had to call and ask for a 3rd time.. just annoying and pathetic.. especially when you are paying an additional $75.00 a night for a rollaway bed and then tipping the turn down service lady $20 to set it up and she lies right to your face and does not set it up.. not a wonderful feelingOther than the very small room size and no coffee machine the room was perfect.. it was impeccable and so clean.. The rooms were just newly renovated and everything was so fresh and brand new.. not a blemish in the room.. The room was super tiny though, I guess thats probably customary and a given in New York, I'm not holding that against them.. just don't expect a very spacious room here. The Bathroom was plenty big enough though.. The bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom, but we got an interior room and I certainly would not make that mistake again. We could barely move in the room.The Concierge was always amazing in our interactions and sent us to many amazing restaurants.. I definitely recommend having the hotel set you up for a picnic in Central Park.. they provide an amazing experience with Blankets, awesome food and picnic baskets and was so much fun for the kids.. the picnic they provide is top notch in every aspectBest Part of the hotel is definitely the concierges and lobby lounge.. Lobby staff and food were so nice and a wonderful part of our trip.. Good and bad.. certainly not our favorite and certainly not terrible..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Is it crazy expensive? Yes. Is it worth it? YES! I've been staying at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South for a decade now. I sadly don't stay there EVERY time I'm in NYC (I'd be living in the poor house. . . IF I was lucky). But, the service, cleanliness of the rooms, location and staff make the money you spend worth it. My late husband and I stayed there while he was very sick and receiving treatment at Sloan Kettering. The staff took WONDERFUL care of us. They even sent flowers to my room during my first trip back after he passed away. The doormen are amazing. The concierges are the best in the world. The club level has amazing food and staff. During my last visit, I returned to my room and found a little bag from Saks Fifth Avenue! They gifted me a gift card for being a loyal client. If you have Marriott points or are looking to splurge and treat yourself. . .The Ritz Carlton Central Park is the place for you.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at this hotel during my business trip. Everything was super perfect. Location, staff even surprisingly room services were extremely fast compare to other 5 stars hotel I stayed before. Food more than perfect. I love how they serve my breakfast and especially their berries oatmeal, I would say the best I've ever tasted so far. Room was clean and lovely bathroom. Totally recommended for travelers visiting new york city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this hotel last year and it was simply perfection, the staff and interiors were what was expected. Whilst the rooms were a bit small for our usual standard we would love to return. The high tea was amazing served in the hotel foyer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location is perfect. The room had great Views to the park and perfect service. The room was spacious (for nyc standards) impeccable and with great amenities. The bathroom was very large and with enough privacy. The concierge was super helpful. I called a few days in advance to ask for help with a dining reservation in a place where the tables are hard to book. When we arrived it was all arranged for us.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel, which is very well located. Our room was a good size, bathroom lovely. The safe is small and upright so not easy to store belongings. We went to see Lion King and on our return the Cd was left in the room playing. Was surprised on our arrival that we were just processed and not offered an opportunity to upgrade. We were given the key to the room and pointed in the direction of the lift, however, no-one told us that you had to swipe you room key in the lift before pressing your floor number. Concierge was good and helpful. It was very good but something stopped us feeling part of it.
user_name:
Joanne T
St Helens, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our stay at the Ritz was delightful! We arrived on a cold and rainy afternoon but found ourselves warmly greeted by friendly and attentive staff. After a quick view of the room, which was spacious and inviting, my husband and I headed back down for a cup of a coffee and a light snack before our dinner at the Russian Tea Room. The parlor off the reception area was welcoming and the coffee exceptional, be prepared to indulge in more than one cup. To our surprise the light snack was anything but light, we only ordered one platter to share and we both left full and unsure how we were going to eat dinner in a few hours.The hotel is across the street from Central Park and my husband and I spent hours walking and discovering all the hidden treasures of the park. It was early spring, so the cherry blossoms were in bloom-simply breathe taking, to say the very least. The hotel was also centrally located to many other “must see” sights in NYC, and even though I grew up on Long Island, NY, I am still surprised at what I can discover in the big apple. My husband and I love to see the sights on foot and we were able to comfortably walk to the Russian Tea Room, Daniel’s, Saint Patrick’s Cathedral, and shopping. Even though you seem to be in the heart of the city, the hotel is extremely quiet.You will not want to miss out the breakfast served in the dining room. The menu has enough options that you can eat there all week, without eating the same thing twice, as you once again enjoy the unending servings of full bodied, rich and delicious coffee. This breakfast is a wonderful way to start your full day of exploring the city.If you stay at the Ritz, expect to always be greeted by all staff with a friendly smile, impeccable service, spacious and very clean rooms, large bathrooms, and amazing body lotion, hair and body products. I was very comfortable and enjoyed my stay tremendously!My husband has made reservations for the two of us at the Ritz in Paris, we are heading there next; I hope I will be equally pleased with my stay there!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Let me start by saying this: To call the employees at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park “staff” is akin to calling Michael Jordan a “basketball player.” These professionals in hospitality have no peer - and having traveled to over 30 countries I can assure you - they aren’t any.Case in Point: My wife and I travel to the New York to visit the set of our favorite TV show, Billions (Showtime). Absolutely one of the best shows in television history! And I inform Ender - who is in charge of guest relations - as to the reason for our visit a few days before we come out.Wait for it...wait for it.We walk into our hotel room - and there it stands: A frame - made out of chocolate - surrounding an edible picture of the TV show.Yes. You read that correctly (see pic).WHO DOES THAT???!!!And what’s more - Loic (the hotel manager) took it upon himself to source imported candies from France. Why is this a big deal? Because during a previous visit he learned of our upcoming trip to the South of France and prepared a four-page document on places to visit (he did this from scratch as he is from France). And later - when he found out we had to cancel the trip - he proceeded to get these French treats for us as a condolence. WHO DOES THAT?I’ll tell you who does these things and thinks at this level of detail - the “staff” at the Ritz-Carlton. Or, as I like to refer to them, my New York family.If you’re going to New York, the hospitality and elegance and care of this hotel and all who work there is simply without equal. I wouldn’t dream of staying elsewhere.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed her for 2 nights to celebrate an anniversary. We were had a gorgeous suite with a beautiful view of the park. The room is nicely stocked with towels, slippers, bathrobes, plenty of soaps-shampoo and the like. While the room does not have a coffee maker in it (they provide coffee in the mornings downstairs) I was able to request one and they brought it to me. We were also given a nice treat from the hotel for the anniversary. We found the hotel staff very helpful with reservations and directions. We were pleasantly greeted at the front desk-even offered water. We arrived a bit early so the staff brought our keys to us while we were dining in their restaurant. The restaurant has a nice menu with food that we were very pleased with-they also have some great drinks at the bar. We had not planned for the St Patrick's Day Parade street closures-someone from the hotel was kind enough to arrange for the bellman to help us get our luggage down to our car service since he was not able to drive up to the hotel. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a wonderful anniversary weekend at the Ritz-Carlton, Central Park with our five year old son and medium sized lab/retriever mix. We had an amazing experience from our arrival until our departure and cannot wait for our next visit! From the moment we were greeted, service was top shelf. Our five year old was delighted to see a wagon full of toys from which he could choose. This hotel, unlike many other luxury properties is extremely kid friendly. Everyone went out of the way to talk to our son and made him feel very special. Even our dog was spoiled to treats and her very own plush pet bed in our room. My husband mentioned it was our ten year wedding anniversary and the hotel provided us with a beautiful array of desserts ranging from delicious macaroons to chocolate covered strawberries in our room upon our arrival. The staff was very accommodating and answered all of your questions, helped us plan our outings and recommended restaurants. Dinner and brunch at the Auden Bistro at the hotel were wonderful, service was swift and very attentive. Our son was very at ease at the property as everyone acknowledged and chatted with him.The doormen were so kind and paid extra attention to our little one and went out of their way to quickly hail a cab for us and answer any questions about where to go and how to get there.The hotel is conveniently located. So many great restaurants and attractions are within walking distance. The Central Park Zoo was a five minute walk. We had a seamless adventure in NYC for our anniversary weekend and the Ritz-Carlton made our stay one to remember.A huge thank you to the staff for answering my endless questions and always greeting us with an umbrella and a smile last Saturday! We hope to stay with you again over the summer!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You are in the right place if you are looking for something special such as back stage tour of Broadway. Perfect location facing to Central Park. I woke up and exercise in Central park every morning. The concierge Lady is the most resourceful Lady that you will get solutions for whatever you need(legally of course).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is all about service or should I say anticipating the guest needs. The check in was quick and efficient. My room was clean from top to bottom. The room was adequate size and the amenities are abundant through out - from the honor bar to the bathroom amenities. Things you need that most hotels don’t provide at your finger tips. The service is unobtrusive - but if you need they are there. The door men always there & always cordial. The location is ideal for Central Park, museums and terrific restaurants within a few blocks. I’ll be staying here during my next visit to the BIG city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I recently celebrated our anniversary and we stayed at the Ritz Central Park. The staff was the best (helped with reservations, special attention to detail, etc.). I highly recommend. We will be back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First off this is a very nice hotel and my stay was fine, however there were a few disappointing points.
