I booked a standard Club Guest Room, and that's exactly what I was given, no consideration given toward my Ritz Carlton Platinum Elite status More on this in a bit.Service wise, the hotel is up to typical Ritz standards with professional and polite service Room was a fair size and resembles the "old school" Ritz style, i.e., very elegant Even though the hotel is an older building, the bathroom was pretty updated, offering a separate tub and shower and separate water closet and very nicely laid out. One note, though, the room did lack sufficient power outlets and no usb ports. I'm sure this will be resolved in the upcoming renovation. View wise, as advertised, it was an interior view which is mostly of the adjacent buildings' brick walsl. Unless you specifically reserve a view room, you'll most likely have a similar view. Club lounge was a bit disappointing, as some other reviewers have mentioned, and compared to other Ritz Carlton Club lounges, you can definitely notice some lacking items.  Wine selection was limited and unlike other Ritz's, where if the club doesn't have a certain wine or other cocktail, most other Ritz lounge staff would offer to get from the lobby bar, not happening here. The offerings here are on the limited side, which is especially disappointing being that this is to be considered the Flagship Ritz Carlton, and one of the more higher priced club lounges. Another missing aspect was not one single hot item was offered during the evening presentations. When I inquired, I was told they do not offer hot items due to the smell of food. That makes no sense to me. I've been to many many Ritz Club lounges throughout the USA and overseas and everyone I've been to has offered 2 or more hot items. Now on to the Elite benefits. As with a lot of Ritz Carltons, they just don't like to honor the Elite Benefits. As a platinum, one of the benefits is an upgrade, even to a suite, per the terms and conditions. Right before I checked in, I went on to the app to see what other room types were available. They were still selling better view rooms as well as a variety of different suites. At check in, I inquired about a suite upgrade and was told, all suites were sold out. While I know this wasn't true, I then proceed to ask if at the least, I could receive a nicer view room but received the same answer. I wasn't in the mood to argue or create an even further awkward situation, but I really dislike when the front desk agents are not honest, and use the sold out excuse. I checked again later that evening, and still, higher category rooms were available. I get the hotel does not like to give away upgrades for free, but this is a benefit of being platinum, and if it is available, it should be honored, even more so if it's requested. I've experienced the same situation at the San Francisco property. If they don't want to honor the benefits, I'd respect it more for the hotel to just not participate in the rewards program, than in comparison to being dishonest. I'd stay here again, and recommend to others, with just the caveat to elite members, of not expecting many of the promised benefits. Hopefully, after the renovation, the club will step up it's game, and by then, the newly merged rewards program will be in effect, and hopefully better honor the program benefits.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is not my first time at the hotel and most of the staff are great but this isn’t a Ritz Carlton that cares about its customers and it’s not about the money over the years I have spent plenty it’s just they believe they are the Ritz and they are on Central Park and so even if they treat you poorly consistently you will return as this is the Ritz and it’s on Central Park!I am have status with Ritz hotels but in several visits they have never got the booking correct, always try and over charge and never deliver what they are supposed to. I suppose you can say they simply have attitude and it’s New York but that doesn’t excuse it.And this is all a shame as they could have such a great hotel it’s location is perfect rooms clean and comfortable and will be up to standard but I don’t need to pay what they charge to be treated like they don’t care! Such a disappointment!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the property from March 12-15.Upon arrival on the 12 the at the night front desk employee name Jitka or Yitka ( one is right for sure) greeted us. Terrible experience, on every our question she said NO, and we thought she is the manager of the property! At the end of our check in, we were very disappointed with her customer service skills, and how she responded on our questions on some of them, she even didn't make any eye contact with us. Beutiful property, but first point of contact terrible!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You are greeted at the Ritz on Central Park by the most friendly and helpful door staff! The rooms are beautiful! The property is located in one of the very best areas in New York, great for shopping, museums, the park, wonderful restaurants, etc. I always feel pampered and welcomed at this hotel and look forward to return stays. This is my favorite in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I came to the Ritz Carlton to stay for two weeks during a procedure she was having. They were extremely accommodating. Several discussions on the phone helped to set up the room just right. We arrived to flowers and personal notes from the staff. They catered to our needs and we’re extremely gracious. An excellent hotel. You get what you pay for.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I go to NYC frequently. Usually we stay at the Marriott Marquis which I absolutely love. This time my wife wanted to stay out of Times Square and near Central Park. We chose the Ritz-Carlton and boy are we glad we did. From the time we booked it the hotel was in constant contact with us . Cassidy Davis was outstanding and guided us through everything , even making dinner reservations at a great Italian restaurant at the last moment. She answered every question I had and made the trip smooth. Once we arrived at hotel it was luxury at its finest. Champagne upon arrival. An escort to the room and just flat out great service all around. Even upgraded us to access to the club lounge for the weekend ( which if you stay here is a must) . We just reserved a basic Basic deluxe king room and it was outstanding. Clean , roomy and luxurious. The hotel knew we were seeing Billy Joel Friday and even left a Billy Joel CD in our room when we got back. I also must give a special shout out to Damien at the door and valet he was awesome. He was helpful extremely nice and went out of his way for us. He made sure we had house car to go to the concert and to restaurant before our broadway show on Saturday and he personally left a frozen CD in our room to remember our show. I cannot express how unreal this experience was. So much so we shall stay nowhere else when we head to NYC. It is pricey, but for the service and everything that comes with staying at the Ritz it was so worth every cent. Thanks to Cassidy, Damien and Everyone at the Ritz who made our first stay there a memorable one. And see ya in October when we are back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Attention to detail another level, yes very expensive but has a great deal of charm. Nothing is too much, service impeccable, a wonderful time. The club lounge is fantastic with great food and whatever you want to drink all there.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just stayed 3 nights here in a Deluxe King. Overall a very good stay with no issues. My room was fairly spacious for the lowest category in an NYC Hotel. It had a nice, well provisioned bathroom. I am a Lifetime Platinum member and didn't receive an upgrade, but that seems to be par for the course with RC. Very good AC in the room that stays set once you set it.As others have pointed out, the rooms are a little tired in some respects but that will it appears as though that will change shortly as they just started refurbishing all the rooms and that process is supposed to be complete by 9/1/18. Word of warning: I did notice some very loud drilling on one of the lower floors during the afternoon so if you are planning on sleeping during a weekday here it may not be the best fit until after 9/1.Here's what they said about the renovations in my pre-arrival email:"As part of our ongoing commitment to providing exceptional service and facilities, beginning April 2, 2018, we will embark on a full reawakening of our guest rooms and public spaces, including the guest hallways and lobby. In mid-May 2018, we will begin our re-imagination of our Club Lounge, La Prairie Spa, and lobby lounge. The exciting transformation is slated to be completed by September 1, 2018."Outside of the drilling noise in the afternoon I didn't notice the renovations, but it sounds like the Club Room will be closed and the lobby and spa will be under construction this summer so plan accordingly.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Accommodations were fantastic. Club level is a must and provides a great light breakfast and lunch. Service was wonderful. Location for walking the park, Madison Ave, and Theaters is great. Will keep coming back. Kids love it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I’m happy to pay a premium for a great hotel when I feel like I’m getting value, but in this case I felt the cost exceeded the value. The room we had was very nice indeed, well appointed and roomy with top-notch fittings. The staff were kind and helpful, the beds comfy. The hotel has limited amenities if you don’t get access to the club lounge and despite paying $925 for a king room, we didn’t get in. Also had to pay for WiFi access which is really poor in this day and age - it’s free in a coffee shop for the price of a coffee, so I expect it to be included in a premium room charge. The bar was nice and the lounge a nice place to while away some time. The Auden restaurant was ok, although the food was quite ordinary (I had the lamb loin which was tasty but really tough). The worst part was the flagpole mounted right outside our window which clattered and clanged all night in the wind, so avoid room 312. Overall we had a pleasant experience and nothing went wrong. I just felt my experience was only worth about $500-600 a night rather than the price I paid, so I would prefer to stay elsewhere next time I am in town.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was a special family trip and we wanted to stay someplace special and chose the Ritz. The service is very warm and the surroundings elegant. Only three complaints: small rooms, no pool, and no upgrades initially (that was rectified) when the website both advertised it and I am a platinum premier member and mostly get it. The Ritz is known for its service and its database on each and every customer and I would have liked to see more individual initiative taken to customize the experience (which is what the brand excels at) and less prodding for them to do the right thing. The Ritz is renowned for magical experiences and that should be woven into this facility’s fabric even if it is located in the hustle and bustle that is New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We came here for a friend's wedding. The venue was beautiful. The flowers and the decor were luxurious. The food was delicious, but I know the cost of the wedding was astronomical. It was a lovely evening.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Visited the Star Lounge after getting dinner with good friends in the area. Wine list was great, but service was awful. Had to flag down server for a drink, and soon after that another server approached us saying that there was "an accounting issue", that if we were "paying with cash we should pay right away...but that we could wait if we planned on using credit or debit cards". A bizarre occurrence at such a well renowned establishment. This gentleman soon brought us a check, and came by repeatedly to check for cash. We told him we would be paying with a card and he backed away for awhile. A few minutes later, our server came and asked if our card was in the black bifold. I couldn't believe it! There were several other tables in the room, and even in the tackiest of Applebee's, I have never been asked that question. Appalling. He came back again five minutes later to ask if we were ready. Our glasses were halfway full, we were still munching on the plates we ordered, so no. The time was 11:30pm and several tables remained. Another server paced in front of our table and picked up the bill. It was ridiculous. We paid before the bar closed and before other tables in the restaurant, yet we felt completely rushed. The bar is beautiful and the wine list is great but not worth the poor treatment. We expected so much more from a world-class establishment!We were coming from Bemelman's Bar and we learned our lesson. Skip the Ritz!
user_name:
gracefary
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We checked in today so this review is only based on our arrival. When we arrived to check in the girl at the front desk greeted us and begin our check in. When she was done she walked us to the elevator pointing out the lounges and restaurant. I then asked her about the club level and she quickly told me that our reservations doesn’t come with access. I politely told her that was what we booked and we had even received an email from them welcoming us. She said again that it didn’t show on our reservation and that we didn’t have access but we should go ahead and go to our room and she would check and IF (yes she even stressed the word IF) our reservation had access she would bring new keys. Well of course she had to bring us new keys because our room did have club access as we tried to politely tell her. Mistakes happen I get that but the way this young lady acted on her assumption that we didn’t have access as if we didn’t belong was awful and to insinuate that we would be lying was worse! Let’s hope my birthday weekend here at the Ritz gets better - we will be here until Sunday andI hope the rest of the employees are truly welcoming!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed here a few times for work related purposes. As always, the people who work here are friendly, patient, gracious and helpful. One nice touch- I dropped my car off at the front entrance and by the time I got through the front door just several seconds later, each of the staff greeted me by name and welcomed me back to the Ritz. Clearly, the person who took my car radioed in who I was, but it was a nice touch that really helped to make me feel welcomed. From there, staff helped at each step from getting through the check-in up to my room. For a few reasons, though, I give my overall stay four rather than five stars. First, this is a very expensive hotel and I'm just not sure my standard sized room was worth all of that money. Second, my room window looked to the back of the hotel and the view consisted only of the brownish brick walls of other buildings. Finally, when I got my car back upon leaving, the attendant had changed my radio settings. Still, given its location, service and splendor, and the fact that I was not paying, I will stay here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We ended up staying at the Ritz for three nights and it was the best hotel we have stayed at in NYC. Prior to arrival, Yoneidy from guest relations reached out to me and I mentioned that it was our anniversary and also our toddler will be traveling with us. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a park view room, which was fantastic. Also, Damien at the front door helped us get our luggage 2 blocks away from the hotel due to all the road closures that day. The location is perfect and right in front of Central Park. You'll end up going to the park multiple times due to the great location. The room itself was very spacious and luxurious. In addition ,the bathroom was fairly large and well appointed with high-end finishes. The bed was very comfortable and we slept really well!The hotel also sent up a gift for our son as we mentioned that he loves trains and trucks. He was so happy and we were very touched by this gesture. Things like this definitely make the Ritz different than the other hotels in NYC. This hotel will cost more than the average hotel in NYC, but it is worth it! Can't wait to come back.
user_name:
Dain K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Celebrated our 15th wedding aniversary here and we were not disappointed. The staff are the best in the city-no other hotel in NYC can compete with these amazing people. Such attention to detail! Stayed on the Club Level and the food and wines were great. Had a facial at the Spa and it was wonderful! Such a great place!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have no words that can really describe our 9 days at the Ritz. We arrived early cheek in with our dog Filippo. He was a total success!!!! Service was incredible and impeccable. We received the dogs dishes and the room was immaculate everyday. Room service wonderful. The bar (where had been many times) incredible, the atmosphere. We did miss the piano that was there before. A Must experience in NYC. Thank you RITZ!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If want to wake up and look at the Central Park, have great service and feel special, stay here!The classic hotel can get better, of course (a renovation never hurts anybody) but the service, the location and the view still worth the stay.The friendly staff makes all ease.
user_name:
Juliana G
São Paulo, São Paulo, Brazil

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and this has been our second visit to the same hotel. Missed Joe at the door. Great attention to detail service is excellent and very comfortable beds. Very central to all the shopping areas.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Fabulous location. Directly across from Central Park. Walking distance to the theatre district and many fine restaurants. Hotel car will take you anywhere within a mile. Turn down service with chocolate and fresh towels. Staff all friendly and helpful. Unlimited water bottles. Fabulous amenities. Shower gel , shampoo, conditioner, comb, nail file, q tips, cotton pads, shoe shine cloth, shower cap, sewing kit, collar stays, suit rack, lined robes, body lotion, soap, face soap, toothpaste. Great views of Central Park and the horse carriages.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great smaller hotel. What I like most is the large casual lounge area outside the resturant. It is perfect as a meeting place for business associates or gathering place for friends for drinks/meal or just relaxing. The gym has top equipment and well organized. Resturant service is very good with a good menu selection and wine list. My one suggestion would be that they offer more vegan options on the menu with protein. I try to always stay here when I travel to NY.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My first trip to NYC I enjoyed a wonderful stay in a gorgeous suite. Loved having my own bathroom, and the room was incredibly comfortable! The concierge recommended a fabulous place for a hair appointment, making the appointment for me. Couldn't have been more pleased with the service provided. Our stay was top notch and beyond from start to finish. So much nearby to see and do. It made my first trip to NYC extremely memorable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Found a great deal online for the hotel and decided to splurge for this special occasion. The staff were wonderful. We mentioned the purpose of the trip on check in and also talked about going to see a broadway show while we were there. The room was a good size and the bathroom was luxurious. After the broadway show, we returned to our room to find the soundtrack playing and a note saying they hoped we had enjoyed the show and the CD was a gift. The next night we returned to find a small chocolate birthday cake in the room. The staff were exceptional with w a terrific attention to detail that helped make this a truly memorable trip for my son and me.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Employees here are so paranoid and, for whatever reason, keep on thinking bugging individual customers to ensure they are real customers. Of course there should be a balance to this. But doing it at this paranoia/psychotic/obsessive level, you would likely lose real customers.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is perfectly located for broadway shows, shopping, Central Park visits and great restaurants. A bit dated but still delivers an excellent atmosphere and easy in and out. Staff is it 10/10 everyone is smiling and goes out of the way to make sure you are enjoying your stay. We booked a king room interior view and the hotel was willing to upgrade for a small additional fee to a two window king room facing the park. The room is big enough for large bags and has plenty of closet space. Single sink with separate shower. Quiet and dark at night but the bed is soft so be ready to suffer if that’s not your style. Club lounge service is very good. Staff is energetic and helpful. Understand the hotel will be going through some renovations, but by working a floor at a time should be no problem, in fact it will only make my favorite NYC hotel better. Didn’t use the gym or spa this visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Was happy to take the opportunity to experience a few days at the Ritz Carlton at the park. Found the location to be spot on, and enjoyed a few days at the club lounge. Found the staff to be somewhat motivated but not as engaged as I would have expected (eg: Asking for a computer screen/monitor to use for a few hours to get some solid work time in wasn't accommodated). Was told there wasn't any caviar tasting available at the lounge, however one did materialize - lucky me - and yet it wasn't announced as one would have expected. Overall it was an interesting experience, however I would be happier at RCBP again, even when considering waking up to a CP view.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: my daughters and I have celebrated many birthdays with Tea in the Plaza. But this year, we decided to try the Ritz Carlton at Central Park. We were delighted. The tea room is elegant, tranquil, welcoming and it lends itself to a comfortable, limitless conversation while having delicious tea , finger sandwiches and fantastic sweets. We were not rushed or disrupted by noise and felt that this would be, from now on our tea place. Service was impeccable and the ambiance classic and sophisticated.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton is a very expensive hotel, but the old saying "you get what you pay for" certainly applies. The rooms are nice, the beds are great, the location is hard to beat. But, the best part for us was the staff. Very helpful, friendly and courteous. They made our stay worth doing again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz and especially this one has exemplary service from the front desk to the service staff. I usually travel for business but this time i traveled with my wife for a special occasion. We got cakes and drinks as it was our anniversary and thehousekeeping team made excellent arrangements

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We absolutely LOVE this hotel! It is our home away from home anytime we are in New York City. The staff here is beyond welcoming. We have made so many wonderful memories at the recommendations of the staff - you can not go wrong with any place that they recommend to you! The rooms are so spacious, light and airy. If you are lucky enough to get a park view you are in for a real treat. To be able to see Central Park no matter the season is fabulous. We have been here in the summer, fall and winter and while the landscape changes with the season it is breath taking to look out over the massive park in the heart of the city. While looking out over the park you have the “concrete jungle” on either side. It truly reminds you of what an amazement Central Park really is. We have always had such a wonderful and restful stay here. I can not recommend this hotel enough!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In a hyper competitive NY, the Ritz competes and provides very professional service in a classy style right off of central park in a great location. Bumped into one of the hotel managers in the elevator who introduced himself, made a connection, accompanied me to my room, and gave some background on the hotel. Things that only took a little bit of time, but which are why I remember the stay as classy and professional. Room was very nice. Decorations in the main lobby were very well done. Breakfast was also notable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located at the south side of Central Park, this hotel is convenient to anywhere besides sightseeing and shopping. I booked and stayed one night to celebrate our 25th anniversary there with my wife. Watching the fabulous Central Park view from hotel room window while sipping a glass of champagne, we fully enjoyed all the romance and comfort it bring to us. It's definitely an unforgettable beautiful memory.
user_name:
C Z
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a truly amazing hotel! The lobby is small and quaint, so don't expect a big entrance. You're welcomed with champagne. The rooms are perfectly appointed. Awesome bathroom amenities by Asprey.Food is great, although restaurant could be nicer with better service. Service is typical Ritz - AMAZING.Great location to explore NYC.
user_name:
Lily30
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is in a great location. The staff is very helpful. The doorman go the extra mile trying to flag down cabs on a busy street. I have stayed here before and the rooms can vary in terms of quality. Some rooms are worn out and could use updating in the bedroom. Some rooms are great. The bathrooms are always very clean and have great tubs. The restaurant breakfast was not good. I am not sure why they could not make eggs with toast that tasted decent. There is a nice lounge that serves high tea which is very nice especially when it is chilly outside.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were looking for a nice hotel somewhere in the city center and founded a good deal for the ritz. It was worth it. Location is perfect the staff is friendly, and we went to broadway shows from there very convenient!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time staying at the Ritz in Central Park and my experience was amazing from the moment I arrived. The lobby is poshly cozy and welcoming. The room was beautiful and impeccable and the service was harmoniously in sync with all else. So much so, I was already in my transportation ready to depart and noticed I had forgotten a few things in the room. The bell captain personally walked me to registration and then to my room to pick up my things. From beginning to end my experience was superb. Looking forward to future stays.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice rooms and great location, but what made this Ritz stand out was the wonderful personal touches by Cassidy and crew to make a birthday celebration extra special. Would definitely return. Unlike other locations I've stayed at, there is no in-room coffee maker so you have to go down to the lobby to get your morning fix, and the doormen aren't super consistent, but other than that this is a high quality hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have traveled the world and stayed in some of the finest hotels. We’ve decided to stay here for my wife’s 50th bday celebration. The “deluxe” Central Park view room was nice, clean and there was lots of drawer/closet space; however, it was on the smallish size, no coffee machine, the TV flickers and some lamps that were outdated (eg. hard to even turn on). We did have a nice view of Central Park but too bad the windows were a bit on the dirty side and one of the blinds was broken - it didn’t open/close properly; we did not complain as we were only staying for one night. The shower stream was on the weaker side - who wants a shower saver head when we are staying in a hotel? There was only one (1) USB plug in the entire room (via a very outdated alarm clock which no one will use) and there’s NO outlets on the two nightstands - the hotel really needs to get with the times and update the electrical outlets to accommodate basic electronic devices. Thank goodness I always bring my own USB outlets with extra long USB cables to charge my devices. We were told by the stocking bar person (who came into the room soon after we checked in) that the Ritz Carlton small water bottles are free even though it’s listed for $2.50 - hope we don’t get charged for that. We had free wifi as I’m a Ritz Carlton member - unfortunately, you cannot download anything via Netflix as it’s extremely slow. Ritz Carlton emailed me a few days prior to my arrival on what they can do for my stay ... I emailed back that it would be nice to have something in the room to acknowledge my wife’s bday (chocolate or fruits - which I gladly would’ve paid for) but there was no acknowledgment in the room whatsoever (not great customer service for this type of hotel). Also, they don’t seem to have 24 hour doorman as we’ve had to open/close the main entrance door several times ourselves - we don’t mind doing that but that was unexpected for this hotel. We’ve been to smaller, boutique NYC hotels and they have 24 hr doorman (eg. all 24 hours). On the plus side, the location is right across from Central Park, the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and even said “Happy Birthday” to my wife - so I know they got the email :)
user_name:
PYLI19
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife is a hardworking mom and recently graduated at the top of her class. We decided to take a break from the kids for one night and celebrate her hard work in style. Since we only had a one night window to go out and recharge I was hoping for an experience that we will savor and enjoy for a long time. Boy were we blown away! For no real reason at all we were instantly upgraded from a deluxe king room to a beautiful sprawling suite. Complimentary WiFi was thrown in as well. Service was great and the beds were ridiculously comfortable. We were really impressed with the attention to detail and immaculate rooms. The gorgeous marble bathrooms feature a separate shower and deep soaking tub. The suite felt more like a luxury apartment than a commercial hotel room. The location is second to none. Right near Central park and within walking distance to many brand name stores. The suite was surprisingly quiet as well adding to our wonderful experience. We took full advantage of the what the hotel had to offer. My wife got her desperately needed break and I got a happy wife - so it was a win-win!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Absolutely loved everything about our stay Experience at this hotel!I visited here with my partner over the holidays, and had contacted the hotel in advance, as I was planning to propose to my partner on NYE while we were there.This hotel pulled out ALL of the stops to ensure that our special day went exceptionally well! They ended up decorating our entire room for us, putting a photo of us in the room, rose petals, and even had our song playing for us when we walked in. Incredible!!The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous as well, and the cleanliness of the rooms, corridors and public areas was immaculate. Each and every single staff member that we passed stopped whatever they were doing to ensure that we were happy, and that they thanked us for coming.Can’t thank the team at this hotel enough for making our engagement so special, and I will 100 percent recommend this hotel to friends, family and colleagues moving forward.Will definitely be back!! Exceptional stay Experience!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I only stayed the Ritz a short time, but this amazing hotel and made a big impression. It’s in a amazing location just a few steps from the park. The views from the rooms where fantastic and the staff could not do enough for you. I’m not normally sold on city hotels as can be soulless how this hotel has changed my opinion.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz the last week of December. Our first impression was that we came in a side door because the lobby is very underwhelming! However, the room was perfect luxury, overlooking Central Park. Very sound-proof too. Rachel, the restaurant host, was very sweet and helpful, as well as all the bar staff. While we were there it was freezing cold, so we spent an entire day in the room and the spa (very nice, although super expensive). We had 3 great dining experiences: Il Tinello (walking distance, friendly, authentic, elegant Italian); The Polo Bar (also walking distance, must make reservations a month in advance – so worth it!); and Bar SixtyFive (we took a pedicab to and from – on the 65th floor of 30 Rock - a great way to see views without going to the observation deck. I’m afraid of heights but this wasn’t scary. You can go just for a drink but the food was surprisingly good). We saw the fireworks above Central Park from our room at midnight on New Year’s Eve, and room service was kind enough to prepare our can of black eyed peas! We’ll be back but definitely not during the winter!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park - so sweet at the holidays. New York is great for the Holidays and the Ritz Carlton Central Park made it that much more enjoyable. What can I say its an exclusive Marriott property that offer s the best in class. Will enjoy the hotel again and Central Park in the spring.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect hotel on the Central Park. We got the room on a higher floor with a view of the Central Park. Great staff who catered to our needs. The concierge provided excellent recommendations to restaurants as well as things to do in the city. Only negative was the smell of the horse carriages (horse litter) across from the hotel outside Central Park. It did not bother inside the rooms but people like me with sensitive noses can smell it when you come out of the hotel.Overall an excellent place to stay with nice rooms and staff.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great room with view of Central Park. Made us feel as though we were the only guests at the hotel. Champagne and chocolates in room on arrival. White rose pedals trailing from the front door to the bedroom with a heart shaped of rose pedals on the bed. Housekeeping excellent. Room serviced in the am and pm.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: from the moment the doors opened we were greeted by friendly smiles of welcome! the outstanding concierge service was over the top! most accommodating check in and happy to upgrade platinum ritz member!!! we will definitely return to the ritz central park!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Since we stayed on a Christmas Eve, we were surprised by the toy presents given to our son and daughter.The staff were really accommodating and kindly helped us what we wanted. On Christmas, Santa Claus greeted our daughter.It was quit impressive night staying at the Ritz-Carlton NY Central Park.
user_name:
Roy11111
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz NY Central Park made our trip an “experience” vs a “visit” to New York. They turned each event into something spectacular and memorable based on the attention to detail upon our return to the hotel after every activity or show.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had tea at The Pierre a few weeks ago and it has head and shoulders above the Ritz-Carlton. When I wanted to try a second tea at the Ritz, they said they would have to charge me $10 more. When I asked for a second scone, they said they would have to check with the manager as they only bake one per reservation. At $90, we found this really nickel and diming us. The Pierre never questioned any request at tea. Go to The Pierre instead. Much nicer experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Denise Norris was the kindness and most attentive individual I have met in years. She met me upon my arrival and assisted me and my party with any desire needed. I will stay again at said property because of her wonderful personality. She is one of a kind. E. Allen Smith

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I traditionally spend a few days in New York just before Christmas, as the city is never more beautiful. For the past five years, we have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park and the staff has managed to make each stay even more special than the year before. The location of the hotel is perfect---overlooking Central Park and an easy walk to luxury shopping and the Theater District. It's truly a special holiday getaway!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed in the Ritz-Carlton in room 314 over looking Central Park. The view was great - even though it was only on the 3rd floor. Unfortunately there were a couple of problems with this room and I'd strongly advise you to ask for a room change if you get it. We did ask for a room change after our first night, but reception they said they were fully booked. Disappointing, but understandable.Problems with this particular room:* There's what sounds like an air compressor starting up every 25 minutes, lasting for 1 minute (this was not the aircon unit in the room). If you're a light sleeper or suffering from jetlag, it makes getting to sleep unbearable. The bed was fantastic though!* In and approaching the room, some of the decor is coming away from the walls.* The carpet had visible staining, especially around the TV area.* The shower head plate wasn't connected to the marble correctly.* The bath filler tap leaked, causing water to run onto the bathroom floor.* Plus other general "tattyness", such as large scuff/gouge marks over the wardrobe doors and other furniture, paint spilled onto the marble etc..Overall we had a great stay mostly because the location, but weren't in the room for too long - other than sleeping. It's unfortunate this was spoiled by the compressor running every 25 minutes.Would I stay here again? No, there are other Hotels in the same location and I wouldn't say the service was anything out of the ordinary.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton prides itself on wonderful personalized service. These are small things, but the warm cookies and the New York City chocolates that were waiting for us on our arrival were certainly appreciated. The Ritz Carlton is high-end. It's very special to be able to stay in a hotel like that. We enjoyed ourselves.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My mom and I come here every year to see NY right before Christmas. We have always been so impressed by the customer service and coziness of this hotel. We usually take a red eye from Los Angeles to NY and arrive very early in the morning. Almost every year the staff greets us warmly and has a room ready for us to shower and get some rest right away. In several other NY hotels, we have waited up to 6-7 hours to get a room after a long flight. Obviously, the Ritz has NO obligation to let us in that early, but the woman who checked us in (I think her name was Rose) was so gracious and kind about getting us into our room, saying “Merry Christmas!”
user_name:
Christina T
Lake Los Angeles, California

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nothing but great things to say about this hotel. For business I stay at hotels for over 50 nights per year. This particular trip was with my family and between the concierge, valet, front desk, etc. we had a phenomenal experience here and this hotel hit the mark on every level. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz at Central Park is the perfect location for Christmas or summer. Directly across from ice skating and 2 blocks from Bergdorfs and Columbus Circle Christmas markets. Great for pets and families.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I wanted a hotel near Central Park and my wife wanted one near the best shopping locations. We both got what we wanted. Central Park was across the street, Bergdorf Goodman around the block. Time Square was about a 20 minute walk. There is a CVS pharmacy behind the hotel. Great service and great rooms.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Pre booked afternoon tea ahead of our honeymoon to New York and it was the best one we’ve ever had.My wife and I have had some pretty good ones over the years but The Ritz was the best by a mile. We were treated like royalty as soon as we walked through the doors, even though were dressed up in winter gear!The room was stunning, decorated up for the holiday season.We were given a glass of champagne courtesy of The Ritz as it was our honeymoon and also an extra plate of chocolates turned up from the chef as well.It really was perfect and thank you for making it as wonderful as it was

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I traveled to Ritz Central Park for my 50th Birthday celebrations with my Mother and my Daughter.... we had this planned for approximately 9 months....Upon arrival we were very impressed with the hotel lobby. Whilst checking in I didn’t feel the usual Ritz welcome service I had experienced in other Ritz Hotels. We made our way up to a very pleasant room with a Cava chilling and selection of chocolates and a birthday card welcome which was a lovely touch to the start of our vacation. Our room was not quite ready as the put up bed had not been set up, our arrival was approximately 8pm so I would have thought this would have been done. We hit the shops ( Black Friday). On returning to the hotel all was done. We continued to enjoy our stay at the Ritz which an amazing setting in an ideal location. The doormen where very attentive as we were in and out and nothing was to much trouble for them.Getting ready to go out on Sunday evening I realised an item of jewellery was missing. Security initially could not do enough and we were given access to Club Lounge as we needed to hang around the hotel more than we wanted to to help with investing the incident. Not ideal when we only had a 5 day stay. However, after 24 hours and the item was never found I felt like we were under suspicion. We never heard anything from Security again. Police took statements. On arrival back to the UK we have had to contact Ritz to find out any outcome of their investigation and are still no further on. Overall staying at Ritz Hotels is amazing experience but this particular stay did not make me feel like a valued customer....

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Before I write this review I think it is important to point out in the last 6 years myself and my family have racked up a 300+ nights stay at Ritz Carlton's around the world and I have good friends who are residents in Ritz's around the world so I write this review with much sadness.On the 28th November I took my mother and Nan to New York for my mothers 50th from the UK - this was a 4 night break and my first non-working trip in 10 years. On the 3rd night we prepared to celebrate my mothers 50th and as always dressed and ready to go the last thing was to put our jewellery on. To much shock my mothers Rolex watch wasn't in the bedside table where it had been earlier in the day, turning the room upside down for several hours without any luck (and missing reservations for the bookings we had) we had no option to call security. Whilst we discussed the watch we suggested that before my mother had placed the watch into her bedside table she had laid out all of the items in her bedside table onto the bed to organise them (she had done this as with jet lag she woke up at 4am and without disturbing us just tidied her draw) therefore we come to the conclusion there was a possibility the watch was in the laundry as the cleaner would have just folded up the bedding and thrown it into the shoot, so the plan was to wait for the shoot to be checked the next day. This night was now gone so we took a short walk and went back to the hotel with too much drama we didn't feel like staying out. I might add that the safe in the hotel is so slim and the size of an A4 sheet of paper (but about 5cm thick) unless you have tall items its not hard to fill, we had been Black Friday shopping and completely filled it. The following day I was offered club room access, which I should have got anyway due to the fact I am a platinum member and stay no where in the world without club lounge access plus it was on the booking, so this was resolved. This is a conversation I had when I checked in but was unable to resolve. The following evening it was confirmed the watch was not found in the laundry- we were then asked to complete a report with the police, bearing in mind this was our last evening of a short 4 day trip! We agreed and waited for the police to arrive - again missing all the reservations we had made. The police arrived and we were asked to go to the police station. We were taken in the police car to the station this night was now completely ruined!! in fact the whole trip now was the biggest waste of money ever!!!The security guy I dealt with at the hotel had given me his number and email and was very nice to deal with but knowing we were departing the next day didn't respond to emails or we didn't see him again nor has he responded to date, I was advised Marriott claims would call me when I got home.Sure enough the hotels claim department called me to tell me they don't hold insurance liability for the watch, I explained I didn't want them to replace or pay for the watch, the watch was gone however I wanted to know what the outcome was. I said I could not believe how I was treated at the hotel and how my family and i were made to feel the criminals and left so upset and disappointed!! - I advised I was a valuable customer, to which I was told we do not offer good will gestures!! I again advised I wasnt after compensation or money I wanted to know what actions had been taken and how serious the situation was to me and my family... nothing.... not only was my £5,000+ holiday ruined, special memories lost, a watch stolen, what felt like being arrested and interviewed - but as a such loyal customer not even an email apology not even a response to my emails to the security manager. I am genuinely gobsmacked this is how a company wants to treat its customers, let alone how they are actually treated... I would not recommend this hotel other than its location based on my experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I travelled here for our anniversary, and the Ritz went out of there way to make it special for us. They even went so far as to ask for a wedding photo and have it framed on our bedside table. My wife cried with how splendid everything was. They made our trip incredibly special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Club lwvel room perfectly designed for good storage, comfortable beds, nice views and access to concierge club for beverages, carriage views, and breakdast, lunch, snacks and dessetts. Good wine and cocktails. Wellcworth the club fees.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It’s like going home!Have been staying here for longer than I can remember! Staff is excellent from the doormen to housekeeping. Right at Central Park & 6th. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. Club level is the key if you can get It.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The RC Central Park got me a room at the last minute when I decided to change hotels. The staff made it so easy. I was greeted by name when i arrived and was given a lovely room. The Club staff, especially Club Concierge, were amazing. They helped me with some complicated tasks all while wearing a smile on their faces. This is definitely my favorite hotel. Kudos to the management and staff of the RC Central Park!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Unimpressed with room but you're paying for the location. Staff could use a little training. Doorman was a joke. They were too distracted to actually open the heavy door. It seems I've had better experiences there in the past. They greeted me by name. They offered an upgrade. My room key worked. My tea was served hot. Looks like things changed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We really enjoyed this hotel and the location right along Central Park South. We could easily walk to Times Square and to each of our shows. The concierge helped us book a tour while we were there and provided excellent restaraunt suggestions.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our dinner at the Ritz was one the most memorable parts of our stay, besides the hotel staff and view from our beautiful room. Service was exceptional, the food we had was delicious and the desert’s presentation for my wife’s birthday was fantastic. We felt welcomed during our stay, and were greeted very warmly from our arrival to our departure. This hotel has a fantastic team, and truly made our stay a memorable one that we will continue to share with family, friends and colleagues.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Could not have asked for a more perfect experience. Went for an anniversary trip and was so impressed. Every person there made an effort to get to know us and bent over backwards to help. Even when they messed up a dinner reservation, they handled it with grace and fixed it immediately. Will definitely be back. Our room was perfect, cannot beat the location, and the service trumps all of the above!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great suite, I’ll try for Central Park view next time Had to work , but my family enjoyed club level and shopping After this experience I’ll take my family more often to New York while on business trips

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz Carlton is always known for their excellent afternoon tea and with the price you pay on this prime location, you would think that you will have a "wow" experience. But to our dismay, this experience which was supposed to be one of the highlights of our NYC trip was truly disappointing. Thankfully, we manage to find humor on whatever went with it and still enjoyed the company of good friends.First, there was a big hype on the "STAR LOUNGE" as the venue for the afternoon tea, but this place doesn't even have any view of the central park at all, nor does it exclusively cater for afternoon tea ceremony on pre designated time. The lounge is basically a small confined area of the hotel here guests can either have cocktails, or simply chill out in the area, read news paper or do office work. Literally, half of the customers were there with their laptop and not there for the afternoon tea ceremony.Considering it is The Ritz , you would expect to be welcomed warmly but to our dismay, no one was paying attention to our arrival or even leading us to our table. The waitress is not very keen to her attention to details and seem to be serving us haphazardly. Literally, when she served the tea, the hot water spilled in our table. We had to look for server to ask for honey, and replace our tea because it literally taste nothing, like water.. The sandwiches are too small, very cold, and taste like they have been prepared 2 days ago. Scones were dense, moist and we enjoyed the cream that went with it. The cookies are extremely tiny looked like a store bought cookie.Please do not call this HIGH TEA because high tea comes with hot meal and the small amount of serving they provide is definitely not worth the price you pay for.Also, Ritz should train their staffs to smile, and serve with finesse and sense of elegance. After all, it is Ritz Carlton so we pay for the premium of better service than this. Overall, would not recommend for the price we paid, but sub standard service we received.The tea were not very flavorful, literally taste like hot water, I had to asdk

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park continues to raise the bar on unparralelled service. With each visit, I am certain it cannot get any better and it does. The location may be the single best location in New York City. Quite simply, this the best city hotel in the United States bar none.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the staff to the amenities this hotel is a 5⭐️ The rooms are spacious and the hospitality is second to none! Also, a big plus is that the thanksgiving omg parade passes right in front and the hotel deserves an area for their guests! Also, they provide hot. Hot chocolate and cookies during the parade! All in all and excellent hotel and location!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Central Park provided everything that it promotes and more. The only drawback is the price,and for must of us does not provide price/performance.Close to Times Square, Bryant Park and Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ladies and Gentleman of The Ritz-Carlton Central Park provide world class service at a location like no other. From the moment you arrive you are swept away into a calm and inviting hotel where your satisfaction is their number one goal. If you every get the chance to visit be sure you make this your hotel of choice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Anyone that ever wants to experience the Macy’s Thanksgiving day parade needs to stay at this hotel! The staff is amazingly accommodating you feel like you stepped into your home you feel comfortable warm wanted like you are truly welcome ...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Central Park, New York was an excellent choice for my first ever live viewing of The Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. The staff was exceptional, the hotel is beautiful and the food is delicious!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent service. They go above and beyond to make you feel at home. Took great care of my friends and I on our visit to NYC. I will definitely stay at this Ritz. I have stayed at the Ritz in New York, Montreal, Grand Caymen, Dubai, and Singapore...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had "issues" like food trays in hallways for more than 24 hours, lamp socket in room dangling, stains on walls in room. Need a Ritz staffer to do sweeps of this. Why am I paying so much to stay there? Had better rooms and common areas at Westin and Hyatts. Also restaurant staff not really attentatitve

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent location. Very warm welcome. Door staff amazing as was concierge. Bar slow when busy. More staff needed there. Room very pleasant although mattress not the best. Excellent location and staff very helpful. Expensive but everything is in NYC. However still felt it was very expensive for the type of room we had.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary. Had a deluxe king room with city/partial park views. Upgraded due to platinum status. Also club lounge for a fee. The whole staff treated us great the whole time. From the bell service securing the curtesy car, to the club lounge making gluten free dishes for my wife. Charles in club is the best! Will be back for sure!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We love the Ritz Carlton Central Park. The staff is so friendly and location is perfect right across from Central Park. The view from our room was excellent. We could look right down on the NYMarathon. The rooms can use a little updating.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff turned a great weekend in to an unforgettable weekend... a TREMENDOUS experience. In particular the concierge, club level and front door staff were "over-the-top" and added to our time in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed in this hotel while I was on a business trip, it is one of the best hotels I have been to. A great location, very friendly staff and lovely facilities. I will go there again in on of my next trips

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is certainly a pricey hotel, but it's absolutely worth it! We've stayed at this Ritz many times over a number of years and we have yet to be disappointed. Without a doubt the Concierge level is worth the extra fee. There's always a light food service available most of the day / evening and it's a nice way to grab a snack or light meal.The staff is always willing to go beyond expectations and kind to guests. I've seen some guests who treat these folks very rudely or in a condescending manner but they simply smile and continue to help. I've learned that if you're nice to the Ritz team they are very kind and always willing to help. The Ritz Carlton has some of the best employees I've ever seen.The other two areas I've enjoyed are the lobby bar and spa. We've used the lobby bar when we are meeting folks for a drink and we really enjoy the seasonal menu of craft cocktails. The spa is perhaps one of the best I've experienced. Here again service is beyond compare and perhaps the hotel's best kept secret.Highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had an outstanding stay at the Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park. Many thanks go out to Robinson for our gold status upgrade and excellent service getting checked in. Our room was facing Central Park and was very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable with our requested feather pillows. The bathroom and shower was great with all the amenities. The lounge and restaurant was also excellent. Overall we had a great stay in New York City at an outstanding hotel. From the front desk to the concierge all were very helpful in all our request. Thanks to everyone who made our stay so pleasant.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best service money can buy, fully satisfied with my stay. Relaxing environment and great spaces to live in. Upon arrival the staff was very helpful and polite, the food fas amazing and the rooms and services even better.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South when in town for the NYC Marathon. The staff and property are exceptional! The location can't be beat and it feels like an oasis in the very busy city. Our room overlooked Central Park and was absolutely beautiful.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you are looking for a fantastic mid town hotel look no further than the Ritz on Central Park South. It is in a nice spot across from park, yet close enough to midtown for business or pleasure. Rooms are very nice and service is second to none. Bar tender is great!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed here many times, since it was the St. Moritz. Only have kind words for the Concierge and the Bell Staff. Had a family vacation with two rooms and was surprised at the continuous and persistent mishaps and mediocre service in many areas, specially the Club Lounge. In short, we had issues with service - staff at restaurant, Club Lounge and Bar seemed more interested in taking to each other than in their clients. Food served burned, breakfast dishes served cold, inattentive servers, etc. etc. Room service was very good, fast and food served hot and as ordered. Housekeeping in their own time, one night they would not do turndown, other nights yes, last night one room yes and other room no. Last night issue with the AC, didn't work well below 70, next day repaired men in the hallway. Elevators very slow, seemed at least one out of service, room keys didn't work in another elevator. Club Lounge was the biggest disappointment, for $150-$200 a night/ person it is really not worth it. Staff at the Lounge were always cold and impersonal, no greetings, no interest in service or offering drinks ( like other lounges ), minimal offer of wines and drinks, limited offer of breakfast, hors de oeuvre and others. The only thing good at the Lounge were the cookies and lots of candy, that is expensive candy. We were really disappointed at our current stay, would have though that this Ritz had a name to maintain, but it really felt like a downgraded hotel and that is a very expensive downgraded hotel in service, attention and food offer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was just great. Fantastic staff, and the location was just perfect. Easy walk to Columbus Circle, Rock Center, Times Square and right on the park. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is older but refurbished with large bathrooms and very nice amenities.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: great location, great people at the RitzCarlton to help you, receive you and who do appreciate you as a guest, AUDIN restaurant a very good place, very friendly staff starting with the doormen, great lounge/bar facility, business center needs improvement

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the NY Ritz for the NY Marathon. Could not be more convenient and service was absolutely fantastic. Entire weekend experience was geared towards runners. Best travel marathon experience I have ever had....thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed here for two years in a row for the NY marathon. The NY marathon happens to be our wedding anniversary as well. Both years, the Ritz staff have gone above and beyond to celebrate our anniversary and to prep us for the marathon. This year we had our 6 month old daughter and the Ritz went above and beyond for her. There were just too many positive things to list and all these great things involved various staff (bellman, housekeeping, room service, concierge, restaurant staff, spa, gym, etc.). Everyone seems truly happy to work for the Ritz and they constantly were anticipating our needs. We can't wait to come back! The only other hotel that's had this same level of service is The Brando.
user_name:
Corrie C
Manhattan Beach, California, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved the hotel and staff. The room was wonderful. The lobby comfortable and the location is hard to beat. We arrived about 7 on a Tuesday night and decided to catch supper there as we were tired. The food was expensive and not particularly tasty. Better off getting a hot dog from a street vendor. Breakfast was very good and service was excellent .Would we go back, absolutely !
user_name:
Ralph G
Sarasota, Florida, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you want a treat get one of the "city view" suites. Our room was immaculate with two full bathrooms, a living room, hall closets and a bedroom with an armoire. They sent up champagne for mt birthday and after the two shows we saw had placed cds of the musicals in our room. The room service "healthy" breakfast was enough to get us through until dinner. It is pricey though.They also sent a special cork up for the champagne so it would last through the weekend. Friendly staff, from the cleaners to the managers, who make you feel at home and as if they delight in being in the hospitality service. The restaurant is okay, but not my favorite place in the area to eat. But - if you want a quick meal it is handle and has several GF offerings. We stayed in 1501 and could see part of the NYC marathon. THe hotel even helped people get to a place they could pick up an uber or taxi as the road out front was closed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wow what a property! That was my favorite NYC hotel stay so far. Service is attentive, breakfast was good, and the location is just amazing, just across from Central Park.The room was large and the Park view is breathtaking. I strongly recommend this hotel, and I will certainly stay there again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend in NYC to see a show. Prior to arriving, Cassidy and Bernd from the concierge team were extremely helpful in making recommendations on things to do and places to eat. Charles in the club lounge was exceptional, ensuring our glasses were never half-empty. The hotel is impeccably clean, and service is top-notch. This mid-town location is perfect for exploring NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is the central standard to all other existing Ritz- Carlton properties! I have stayed on many occasions, attended dinners here, entertained here, and, the property, staff, maintenance, service, atmosphere, ammenities, are the top!Yes, there are other top places, but, this place is the standard bearer to all the others!When you want luxury, you can count on this place, every time!
user_name:
eventsbythirteen
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay in this landmark property. Although I booked the room using points, I was offered a room with Central Park views (with the caveat that there would not be a bathtub in the room). While some of the furniture was showing some wear, I really adored my stay, with the first-class spa and the amazing location on Central Park South. I felt very welcome and would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.
user_name:
Kristine_Archi
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed with family at this elegant hotel. Managed to get a lovely room overlooking Central Park, wow! Just an amazing view, especially in Autumn.The rooms just ooze refinement from the bed sheets to the bathroom amenities. They brought up a portable bed with no trouble and at no additional charge.Managed to get access to the Club Lounge. The service, food quality and ambience of the room was just wonderful. It also overlooked Central Park. I cannot underscore enough the serenity of this room and the team that work there. It’s first class. We had dinner in the restaurant. Pricing was reasonable and the food was delicious. The waiter, can’t recall his name, was was so personable. It felt like he had been born there. They stored my bags effortlessly and arranged transport whenever I needed. Walking out into the busy street just to hail a cab. The location near 5th Avenue is just brilliant to access all the well known brands.I will stay there in my next visit to New York. Let it be soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We love the Ritz Carlton, the staff is welcoming attentive and friendly! From the Doormen to the Vlets, to the front desk and the Concierge Desk, they stand above the rest!! When you depart it is almost like leaving home!! The weakness is the Optional Concierge Lounge at $300 per day! They serve some breakfast items some small lunch items, and tea + cold hor d ouvres at 5 and desserts in the evening. Dallas has a Concierge Lounge at $75 a day that puts this to shame!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing...simply amazing. The staff are friendly, helpful and seem to love working there. The food is wonderful and the rooms are cozy and inviting. They anticipated our needs and added a few wants without having to ask. Can't wait to come back

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is not a five star hotel or like any Ritz Carlton I have stayed in around the world. I am a Ritz Carlton gold member. I stayed at the hotel for two nights from 9/13-15 with my 84 year old Mother. Our room was dark and old. throughout the stay, there were several of the housekeeper carts in the hallway by my room 24 hours a day. On 9/14, we returned to the room and found that my Mom's special orthopedic pillow was gone. Pilar from housekeeping came to our room and told us that they couldn't find the pillow, and would keep looking. She also said that this wasn't up to Ritz standards. That was the last we heard about the pillow from anyone at the Ritz. We didn't get a follow up call the next day or ever despite frequent attempts. On 9/15, the rude front desk clerk informed that I had to check out at noon despite gold status and assurances of a 4 pm check out when I check in to the hotel. The New York Ritz is old and needs upkeep, but the reason I would definitely never stay at this hotel again is the poor customer service from a supposedly five star hotel especially with the $1000 per night room cost. surprised at the poor customer service at one of my favorite hotel brands.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first stay at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park in New York. The staff made my wife & I feel like we were the only people in the hotel. It was absolutely fabulous. I cannot wait until we return to stay again,

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our first time in New York. Ritz Carlton did an amazing job making our experience wonderful! Thank you Ritz Carlton! From the cleanliness of the room to the amazing hospitality. Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter and I visited the city for her 19th birthday. We were pleasantly surprised to find the room ready on our arrival (hours early!), which allowed us to freshen up after our long drive. We were even more surprised with the delivery of chocolate covered pretzels and cookies and a hand written birthday card later in the evening. Thanks to Jenny, who checked us in, for that small detail. We had to leave very early-before 5am on Monday morning to get back to work and school, and one of the doormen even got us fresh coffee while the car was being brought around. There is no better place to stay than the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best view on Central Park South. Luxurious and tasteful furnishings. Room and furnishings in top condition. Other luxury hotels on CPS and Columbus circle have views of the park, but rooms and furnishings are sometimes worn (Mandarin, Trump, Plaza, all in 2016-17). Great lounge and bar. Efficient, courteous service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: wonderful hotel, very clean, staff was super went out of there way to greet and accommodate us, great views of Central Park, one of the best fitness centers experienced in a hotel, the mattress could of been better, but other than that what a wonderful hotel

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In the middle of Manhattan, right across from Central Park, can't beat the location.The staff and amenities are first rate. Have a drink in the Star Lounge on the lobby floor even if you are not staying at the hotel, it is like an oasis.
user_name:
safpsy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton at Central Park is a special experience that I was so lucky to enjoy. The location on Central Park is beautiful, and ifyou can get a high floor with a Central Park View, you will never want to leave. The decor has a Regency/Federalist feel, which always makes me feel as if I am in classic luxury and living in a bit of history. I did not want to leave. Staff is excellent, the Restaurant, Auden, has wonderful food and generous portions, and the room service was fabulous. I can't wait to come back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located across the street from the park. Centrally located to get wherever you need to go in Manhattan. Super friendly Ritz staff is available 24/7 to take care of all your needs. This hotel will be at the top of my list for my next trip to NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Almost perfect! Service from all areas, cleanliness of hotel & room, majestic views, service, service, service. Ladies and Gentlemen serving Ladies and Gentlemen. An oasis in a park in the greatest city in the world. Service in most hotels is just a word, at the Ritz Central Park it's a promise.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Right across the street from Central Park in the heart of the city. Plenty to do whether walking the park or riding in a horse drawn carriage it is simply magical at night. The room was lovely but few with a view. Wifi worked well. The staff was great and focused on service. Cabs were easy access. Would love to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It just doesn't get any better. The facility is wonderful, the location perfect, and the always accommodating, friendly staff makes every moment comfortable and exemplary. they do more than provide great service - they anticipate your needs, and take the initiative to provide what you might not even realize you're missing. My favorite place to stay in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz for 3 night and 2rooms for our 21st wedding anniversary.Enjoyed everything from the room, the upgrade, the AMEX offer(stay for 3 pay for 2) along with breakfast included, you really need to find the right offer to stay here at $1100 a night! Our room was upgraded and the staff went out of there way prior to our arrival to show they valued us as a guest. candy of rah kids room, a picture of my wife and I when we were married framed in chocolate...welcoming gift, and so much more When you stay in nbc, all the rooms are expensive, staying at Central Park in itself is so much fun, and the hotel is in great shape.A few tips, the front door staff over the 3 days never really got their act together, and the breakfast staff was also not on their game, but that said, outstanding team overall.I stay in hotels around 100 nights a year, there were 3 night I can say I enjoyed!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is beyond your imagination! My stay was extra special because of the hotel's competent and caring staff. The location is across from Central Park and not far from attractions such as Carnegie Hall and Times Square.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent location, professional and gracious staff, beautiful room, quiet and secure. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a superior hotel in a prime NYC location. I can think of no deficiencies

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing hotel and staff from the front door men to the restaurant and the concierge service. One of the best experiences we have had anywhere in the world, and we travel about 80 nights a year. It was my wife's first time in a Ritz and now all she wants to do is stay in Ritz Carltons for now on.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent a week at the Central Park Ritz Carlton recently and what a week it was. from the moment we checked in to the moment we departed we were treated as very special guests. I am sure every one is treated the same but we really appreciated the level of service. It was a trip to celebrate a milestone birthday and also my retirement from work The hotel staff marked this with gifts of chocolates and special desserts in Audens bistro. We really appreciated these kind thought. It is surprising in a hotel of this size that the staff remember your name, I didn';t expect this!The room overlooking Central park was huge with everything you could possible need close to hand. Despite being in Midtown the room was very quiet at night, we slept well. Audens bistro is fabulous, possibly the most tender steak I have eaten in along time.Great hotel, great location and above all, great staff! Thank you.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I recently stayed at the Ritz CARLTON NYC. This Hotel is just simply the best. Everything about it is amazing, from the rooms to the stunning view of central park. Excellent world class service. Hopefully will be going back soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is simply outstanding. The views are magnificent and the staff outstanding. It is the best hotel I have stayed at in NY to date. It is a higher price than other hotels but service is excellent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My colleagues and I have visited the Ritz-Carlton for a business dinner. Service was professional and allowed us enough space to talk and select. Food on the other hand was nothing to write home about. I justify my 4 stars with two reasons.Reason #1 I ordered a chard squid so chard coal I got. My bad.Reason #2 B E S T D E S S E R T S E V E R ! ! !My gratitude for saving the day goes to amazing chef Mr. Baldwin for turning a disaster into a gastronomic spectacle. That gentleman is a true artist and should be paid in gold.Sincere greetings from Czech Republic.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz with my sisters and mother, it was a surprise event. Maria McDonald was an amazing concierge and she was able to get all her team members supporting our event. It was spectacular!
