hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Love the property! The location is perfect! Central Park is just across so we personally loved that convenience. The rooms, staff, service is amazing! The Club Lounge is also great!! A perfect NY experience...we would love to stay here soon whenever we visit NY next!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: President Trump was arriving... at his place,nearby,...wow...added excitement...Amex platinum booked...no upgrade,but room was high floor,overlooking park....checked in early,easy...room large,very comfortable and great view...hotel was quiet,bar area quiet and dining room small,almost empty. But great service and food...pretty limited choices...all doormen were extremely helpful...almost a boutique feel .Not as well known as some of its competitors,but rates 5 stars.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We celebrated our 50th Wedding Anniversary at this location and I don't believe we could have chosen a better location. Everything you expect in a Ritz you will find here. Great location, Great Staff, and awesome views of Central Park. This Hotel has everything in you love a New York experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Fantastic location; upgraded room overlooking Central Park, however, mattress wasn't all that comfortable and water bottles not replenished. I concierge was great; the other was rather rude. Rooms could use some upgrading; feeling like grandma's house.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: excellent in all categories of service and quality. Great bellmen and front desk and housekeeping. location is excellent and ease of access to park and subway is great. great restaurant next door. great coffee ibn the morning and great breakfast.
user_name:
M8928JLwilliame
silver spring maryland, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location steps to Central Park, shopping and restaurants. Very quiet rooms and I did not hear any traffic - outside noise. I think it is the quietest hotel in NYC, Hotel is in need of a refresh... Dated and lots of wear and tear needs to be renovated. They say it is slated for renovation but will not be happening in 2017. Room was not very clean mold in shower... Service was OK not in line with what I know and expect from the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel before and this time it was definitely not worth the money. The staff seemed distracted, the internet worked half the time, we did not get turn down service for 2 of the nights, etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very nice location, in front of Central Park, attention is nice, room size and amenities are ok but the hotel should need a renovation as many of the hotels nearby has been remodelated. Also the lobby is quite dark.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had a super stay at this perfectly located hotel. Professional and friendly with a boutique hotel feeling. When you book, try and get a Central Parc facing room - views are really world-class. The bar is Old School and Bourbon Sours proper!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park to celebrate an anniversary. The hotel is beautiful and the staff and service are the best in the city. It was a splurge but well worth every penny.
user_name:
arthurt459
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went into the city just for the night and to see a Broadway show. The hotel is beautiful. Everyone is so pleasant and helpful. We were only there for a day, but we were always greeted by name by all of the staff. The location is convenient to so many things, and being right across the street from Central Park is amazing.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is remarkable in every manner from its great iconic structure to the staff attentiveness....Its service in every manner is out if the way and provides a well deserved experience....Recommended to all..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I always getting unforgettable service at Ritz properties. That was especially true at the Ritz by Central Park South. NotThe staff of this hotel provide impeccable service and also this Ritz is located at the best spot in NYC. Madison and Fifth Avenues at our feet with amazing shopping as well as the unforgettable Central Park. My husband and I are planning to spend one more weekend there this fall. Lovely experience!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As yyou would expect, the service was superb. This location simplycan't be beat. Steps to the subway, the Plaza with its food hall, and the Park Lane. Central Park right across the street. The shopping on 5th Avenue right around the corner. We will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel staff and location was perfect. Everyone went out of their way to make things perfect. We had one problem with bed which the hotel resolved immediately by changing rooms. Upon doing so I left my hot iron in our first room. Housekeeping went out of their way to find it and return to my room. They also brought me a little gift as a token of apology so sweet but not necessary. Exercise room great and of course across the street to Central Park Spa bit pricey but hey it's NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is great, in my opinion if you're paying on average 300-700/night you should give people upgrades if there is not enough room for everyone. I'm rating it excellent due to the views and hotel it self. Not for accommodation or empathy

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed on Virtuoso booking (park view room) and I am also a Gold Elite member of Marriott/RC program.Check in was fast with and no upgrade to higher floors was given. The room on 9th floor itself strongly smelled of cleaning chemicals and my wife was immediately turned off. Then we started finding traces of garbage all around the room - q-tip and hair tie on a bathroom floor, small pieces of food scattered all around the floor, huge splash on the wall from spilled drink and sharp pin on the carpet next to bathroom entrance (possible liability issue). Housekeeping manager was called in, she took some pictures and offered us deep room cleaning and comped bottle of wine. We agreed and when we started to get ready to get out of the room and venture into the city, strong smell of cigarette smoke started coming out of our bathroom. We were finally fed up and demanded to move to another room. From this moment on the hotel staff mostly delivered the expected level of service. They put a nice camping tent in our room for a 3 year old, changed linens in the tent daily and she was enjoying it for the whole stay. There was no funky smell of cleaning supplies in the room.If you want better park view please book deluxe park view rooms. Floors 8-9 are on the level with treetops from the park. No guaranteed 4pm checkout for Gold Elite status, but they were happy to accommodate a later checkout time. Thank you for turning our experience into a positive one, but I am still worried about smoking policy enforcement and possibility of getting a room with strong odor of cleaning supplies.Location is perfect for everything.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent views and the club floor and room service are perfect. There were issues with bags not being delivered to the room and items requested prior to check in were not ready and required multiple calls and followup.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz is not as fancy as others I have stayed at. Some rooms are in need of a sprucing up. Other rooms are very nice. Interior rooms are great because they are super quiet. No street noise. Great location. Right across the street from Central Park. Subway stop a few doors down (it is somewhat hidden so ask concierge exactly where it is so you dont miss it). I wanted to like the breakfast but 3 tries and none were good. Sarabeth Kitchen a few doors down is better and cheaper alternative for breakfast.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton on Central Park is one of the finest hotels I've ever stayed at anywhere around the world. The staff was incredible and knew my name the second time I encountered someone. Their attention to detail was extraordinary. The were great with kids and after going to see Hamilton, when we got back to the hotel after dinner, there were CDs playing in each of our three rooms of the show's soundtrack. I've never experienced such intuitive consideration at any other hotel. I highly recommend it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Full disclaimer: I made the reservation through a friend of mine who knew an employee at the hotel. The treatment we received was far beyond anything I've ever experienced (or expected) and I'm sure some of it had to do with the fact that the room was booked by a friend. With that said, the Ritz-Carlton Central Park is a 5-star establishment in every sense of the rating, and I'm sure a place like this would make your stay very special regardless of whether you do or do not know the staff.--------------------------------------------------------------I was proposing to my girlfriend, and I had a full evening of events planned which included the following: the actual proposal at the Lincoln Center fountain, dinner at Marea, Tchaikovsky at the Metropolitan Opera, and a 1-night stay at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park.I arrived at the hotel around 3PM, and I was an absolute train-wreck. I had just gotten out of work, and I was going out of my mind trying to make sure that all the evening’s details were in order, and at the same time texting my girlfriend a cover story so that she would not find out what was going on. I was in desperate need of a both a shower and a shave. I was also loaded down with about 20lbs of overnight bags. I'm quite sure I looked like a vagabond.The moment I got within 10 feet of the Ritz’s door, a tall gentleman smiled at me and asked if I was checking-in to the hotel. I replied that "Yes indeed I am sir" and he immediately relieved me of my 20lbs of luggage and whisked me away to the front desk.I was then greeted by a cheerful young lady who smiled and said "Welcome to the Ritz-Carlton, sir! Are you here for any occasion in particular?" I said that I was proposing to my girlfriend, and upon that revelation another gentleman immediately stepped in and offered to keep the ring in their safe. I patted the right-side of my pants and replied that "The safe will be right here in my pocket!" and the entire front desk staff began cracking up (another thing about this place is the staff has an excellent sense of humor). When it came time to assign me a room, I asked if there was any way to get a room with a view of Central Park. She grimaced as she looked down at her computer screen and said that unfortunately none of the park-view rooms were currently available, but if I were to come back in a few hours she would surely have one ready. I told her that unfortunately I needed to clean myself up, and so I would just take what she has available at the moment. She then smiled and offered something that truly astounded me: "Why don't we check you into a room right now so you can wash up, then we will transfer your things to a park-view room and have it ready upon your return?" My jaw dropped. I have never heard of such an accommodating, hospitable offer in all my life. I replied that "sure, that would be just wonderful," and slipped her a few $20s as a thank you for her efforts.I was in a bit of a stupor at this point, and didn't fully remember where I was, and so one of their lovely, front-desk gentlemen personally escorted me up the elevator and into my room. Before he left, he asked if there was anything special that I would like to be done, and so I slipped him a $20 and told him to just surprise me. He smiled and said that he would "surprise me with his surprise" and left me to get ready.I looked around at this initial room and examined what I was dealing with. The furnishings were superb. Solid wood details, and all of my stuff had been neatly put away (and hung) in the appropriate closets. I then examined the bathroom. Boy, does the Ritz know how to do a bathroom! The entire thing was built of solid marble and was nearly the same size as the room itself. Needless to say, everything was spotless, and the room was immaculate. Ahh! I was finally beginning to relax! Since I was seeing Tchaikovsky that evening, I opened up my iPhone, put on The Nutcracker Suite, puffed a few spritzes of Green Irish Tweed into the air, popped a new blade into my double-edge razor, and began my shower/shave engagement-preparation ritual.When I was done, I dried myself off, slicked back my hair, put on a freshly-pressed suit, and carefully examined the results in the mirror. Boy, does a shower/shave at the Ritz make you feel like a million bucks! I left the room and walked into the hotel lobby a new man! I said my goodbyes to the lobby staff as they wished me good-luck, and just as I was about to leave the hotel, wouldn't you know it, that same wonderful lady from the front desk ran over, handed me a new room key, and said that she had managed to secure "one of the finest rooms this hotel has to offer." I said "thank you" and then decided I would visit this new room before I left.As I entered into the elevator I noticed that the room key was for the 22nd floor. As I pressed the button for "22" I noticed that "22" was the highest floor the elevator would go to. "Interesting," I thought to myself as the elevator arrived at its destination. I stepped out, and proceeded to the room’s door. I swiped my key, I heard the mechanics of the lock “click” and unwind, and as I opened up the door to this new room my heart lept out of my chest as I saw two magnificent, 10-foot windows overlooking classic Central Park. Boy, what a sight! A penthouse-suite overlooking the 39 million square feet of foliage that composes New York City’s grandiose Central Park! Now, I have lived off of Central Park West for nearly 13 years, and I have been in many multimillion dollar apartments… never in my life have I seen a view like this. Extraordinary! The Ritz had truly outdone itself!Regarding the proposal: I won’t bore you with all the details of my time spent away from the Ritz except to say that she said “yes,” and that the two of us are currently betrothed to spend the rest of our lives together.So after a wonderful evening of love, dinner, dance, and music, I suggested to my fiancee that we take a stroll down Central Park South. A little sidebar - if you are a couple and have never walked down Central Park South at night (in all its lamp-lit glory) - I would highly recommend it. It is one of the most romantic things you can do and will make you feel like you’ve been transported back to Gatsby-era New York. So like I said, we were walking down Central Park South. When we came upon the entrance to the Ritz, I suddenly stopped (I had managed to keep it a secret up to this point) and our conversation went something like this:“Oh, interesting, here’s the Ritz” - she gave me a funny look.“Oh, interesting, here’s a room key” - complete shock and awe as I revealed the rectangular, plastic card.“Oh, interesting, the penthouse floor” - nearly in tears as we travelled up the elevator.She was full-on speechless when I opened the door, but her vocal chords soon revved back to life with proclamations of joy as she walked around the room and examined its opulent accoutrements. Once again, the Ritz had truly outdone itself! They had decked the room out like a scene from Snow White! There was:-A rose petal pathway leading up to the bed, where there was a rose petal heart in the center-A room service cart with chocolate covered strawberries and an ice bucket with Taittinger champagne, compliments of the house-A bouquet of flowers neatly arranged on the ottoman by the bed-And to top it all off, they dimmed the lights and had “Swan Lake” playing (a fitting end to the evening since we had seen a collected works of Tchaikovsky at Lincoln Center)The hospitality of the Ritz extended well into the next day. They have a little thingy you can fill out and hang outside your door telling them what you want for breakfast the next day, and they will bring it right up to your room at the exact time you specify. So a large pot of coffee was brought up to our room at 9am sharp. Let me tell you, there is nothing quite like sipping coffee in morning with the woman you love, while looking out the window to a perfect view to God’s wondrous creation in New York City’s magnificent Central Park. Spectacular.We checked out around 12 noon, and asked if they would hold our bags while we walked around the Park. They held our bags for nearly 2 hrs (again - what lovely hospitality). When we came back to pick them up, we ran into the nice gentleman who decked out our room, and he asked us if we had taken the Swan Lake CD? I told him we didn’t because we thought it was property of the hotel, so he told us to wait one moment, and he ran up to the room and brought it down. He said we could have it as a keepsake. I slipped him another tip for his fine service and then said our final thank-you’s and goodbye’s to the lobby staff. So that was it for the Ritz!Needless to say, the entire ordeal was a massive success, thanks in no small part to the staff at the Ritz-Carlton. Bravo, Ritz-Carlton Central Park! Bravo! I would quite literally applaud you from my computer chair if I thought that you could hear it. What an introduction to the Ritz brand! My fiancee and I are now in love with the Ritz, and want to stay with them every chance we can get. We will probably stay at the Ritz for our honeymoon - we are thinking Kapalua or maybe perhaps the St. Thomas location. We also recently stayed at the South Beach location for a day, and it was also a great time. Well worth it. But I do have to say, staying at the South Beach location (which was an excellent time) did make me appreciate how truly special the staff at Central Park location is. Honestly, I don’t think there is another hotel staff anywhere in the world quite like them.Well beyond five stars. Once-in-a-lifetime class experience.
user_name:
JonK2036
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A great hotel in a great location. Service is immaculate incl. room service. The concierge was very helpful (thanks Daniel for the CD!)Take a room with park view. It is spectacular!Oh, and it is not for free ;-)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Brought my fiancée to the Ritz-Carlton for an amazing weekend. The staff were the very best, and they outdid themselves. Each of them were so nice, and they took care of everything for us. The hotel was super clean and well maintained. It was total luxury. We were on the 16th floor with Central Park views, and it was spectacular. The hotel was also extremely quiet. We hardly heard a car pass by on the street below. Thank you to the Ritz-Carlton and staff for making our trip a very special memory for a lifetime! We look forward to returning soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everyone at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South was friendly and considerate throughout our stay. The room is comfortable and had a lovely view of the Park. Guest services was very responsive to requests or questions. Hope to return very soon!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Super Location. Everything you can ask for in entertainment, dining, leisure, and sightseeing is all within walking distance. Hotel is modern and elegant and the concierge was helpful whenever we needed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park is our hotel of choice when visiting New York. Best location and outstanding service. We've stayed in other luxury hotels in New York, but the Ritz is amazing in all areas.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is beautiful, the location very nice, the rooms are just ok, the bathrooms in the rooms very nice. Had a zip tie in my chicken noodle soup my first evening in the Lounge. Breakfast the next day: took 25 minutes for a simple omelette ordered off the menu with the special request of very light cheese. We were literally the only people in the restaurant and there were just two of us in our party. Omelette came with FIVE slices of cheese wrapped around it. Hardly "light cheese". My friend had the turkey egg sandwich - turkey was grey. We left without eating our breakfast. Stopped on the way out to get tea in the to go cups. Hot water barely even warm, let alone hot.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Positives: Perfect location for sightseeing and all of the concierges were absolutely amazing and so helpful. They helped arrange our Central Park carriage ride and gave us local eating ideas. Doormen were also so nice and helpful. Quick response when I called for service from our room. Room was large and comfortable. Bed was great. Negatives: Front desk staff wasn't the best. I requested and paid for an upgraded room with a park view and requested a high floor. They said the highest room they could give us was 9th (out of 22). I had requested a roll away bed but it wasn't in the room (but once I called them they brought it quickly). There was a large group that had about 50+ giant suitcases all throughout the very small lobby, which was not a great experience. Food prices higher than even normal high end hotels.
user_name:
LoisGriffin75
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location with great views and access to Central Park. Direct access to horse and carriage rides (I recommend the night time tour). Hotel staff is extremely accommodating, helpful, friendly and professional. Everything was spot on! Delightful stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton at Central Park experience is consistently exceptional. We find the club level to be convenient and of value for in between meals, a place for family to connect or to have a glass of wine overlooking Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved the luxury of this hotel as well as its location across from Central Park. 5 stars all around. My only wish was that the food wasn't quite as expensive as it was for breakfast, $18 for a bowl of cereal. We're not used to those kind of prices.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After a morning tour of Central Park there is nothing better than a respite, and tea is the perfect remedy. High Tea at the Ritz was just as it should be. Comfortable seating, ambient atmosphere, excellent service, a choice of teas, along with a course of sandwiches, scones with clotted cream and desserts. The scone with currants was one of the best i have ever had. The salmon and shrimp sandwiches were excellent and the champagne option as a palate cleanser was ideal. Highly recommend, and will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay at many Ritzs and always are part of the club lounge. In addition we are black credit card holders. We have stayed at this hotel many times and each time we feel that the service and experience in the club lounge declines. We do get to know some of the folks since we do stay there a couple of times per year. Especially this time we felt that every time we asked for something we were inconveniencing one of the staff. We are typically a very easy guest and our requests are very simple standard requests. This is not something that we feel in any of your other club lounges. Typically they go above and beyond our expectations. I would be glad to site examples of this if in fact you chose to contact me. I am a big fan of the Ritz Carlton!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It is a well run hotel. The staff is very thoughtful and personable. My room was not available when I arrived but they immediately gave me some chilled water and asked to call me on my cell when it was available. The manager remembered my name and was kind enough to welcome me back with a nice card in my room and some wine. The valet was amazing and looked for my Uber ride diligently and kept checking for me. I LOVE this place!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our stay at the Ritz-Carlton was great. The location of the hotel is excellent for great restaurants and exploring the upper East side and west sides of Central Park. The concierge staff was extremely helpful with restaurant reservations and recommendations.
user_name:
Juan V
Hobe Sound, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had an excellent stay at The Ritz Central Park for my best friend's birthday. Our concierge, Cassidy, had a birthday cake and balloons in our room when we checked in. She continued to provide Birthday surprises throughout our stay. The room was quiet, despite the street noise and the Club Lounge food was excellent. Overall, a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love Central Park!I Love Broadway Musicals and Performances! I love events like the NYC Marathon!I Love NY City for 2-3 days at a time!!I hope to visit NYC at least once a year!The Ritz at Central Park was Awesome!Thanks so much!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staff are amazing, head concierge is one of the best around and gets you reservations in most places around NYC in short notice.The club lounge is great as it is quiet and chilled, offering a large selection of food at breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea and evenings. I recommend a park view room as the view is simply incredible. Can't rate my stay any higher. Very very pleased.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton's South Central Park setting is ideal, especially so if you have a high floor from which to view the iconic majesty of Central Park - also a perfect tonic when you need a break from the churn of the city. I came for a special occasion and the ever-courteous staff provided exceptional service throughout and made it a perfect stay, for which I was very grateful. Rooms were opulent but tasteful and the fitness suite was well appointed. When I return to NYC, the Ritz Carlton will be my first choice of hotel.
user_name:
RobLetts
Chalfont St. Giles, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed one night at the Ritz Carlton Hotel near Central Park, NYC, to celebrate a birthday and wedding anniversary. Everything was perfect. Entire staff was very cordial and they went out of their way to make this a very special occasion. Would highly recommend to others looking to stay in this area.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was greeted at the door of the hotel when I arrived. The doorman grabbed my bags and brought them to my room. The front desk manager was very nice and quick to get my keys situated. The rooms were beautifully appointed! An amazing hotel with a first class staff!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a high room with park view - fabulous but $1350 night with club access. Great room and service. Club access really worth it if you go for breakfast and lunch. Great food. Cocktails in afternoon a real bonus. Nice to look out at park for sure. Smell of horse manure pretty strong when you walk out the front door as the carriages park on 59th waiting for customers . Too bad. I used the fitness center and it is a good one. Would still go back - a really nice hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were guests at the Ritz Central Park for 2 weeks during a surgery for my child. The staff went above and beyond for us to feel at home. They greet you like family, they anticipate your needs. While the property is an older property that could use some updating it is clean and in my mind the superior customer service out weighs some of the more modern features you may find at some of the other high end properties in the city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect! A wonderful family experience for a very special occasion....my granddaughter's graduation. Could not have been a better experience....from the doormen to the desk staff to the service staff, on all levels! Will be remembered for a very long time!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have recently returned from a 6 night stay at the Ritz-Carlton hotel at Central Park. Overall, I must say the service was 5 star...Ritz-Carlton Personnel are well trained to deal with their customers in the most helpful and accommodating fashion. I especially want to single out the concierge, George, who is on another level of helpfulness. But every interaction...from the front door bellmen who will offer you an umbrella the minute the weather turns rainy, to smiling front desk personnel (Denise from Germany....the sweetest!!) ...you are made to feel like a treasured guest! Now, for the not-so-good stuff:the hotel facilities themselves....outdated, worn, even...it has to be said...downright shabby!.My first room (which I adamantly rejected) was like a dark, bleak prison cell with shabby, stained, worn rugs and no sunlight at all. My second room (personnel does really try to make you happy) was better...I had more windows and some distant park views along with some views of 60th street below...not horrendous. But, a rather small, musky smelling room with...again...stained and worn rugs and a hallway that isn't air-conditioned right outside your room....there is a fan standing in every hallway that's both blowing hot air around and an eyesore to boot! The elevator is likewise hot like a sauna. On some days there would be a table outside across from my room in the hallway with many dirty glasses and dishes on top of it to greet me as I left my room and stepped into the hallway...and even still be there when I'd return hours later....My sink in my bathroom wouldn't drain (it got fixed after I complained...but ran slow again 2 days later...)...my toilet got clogged (also got fixed...but, why was it clogged in the first place...?)...the TV never had good reception....i was watching everything as if living in a war torn country...lots of static and noise in the background. People, this is the Ritz-Carlton, for crying out loud!!! I've stayed at Ritz-Carlton's in Hawaii, in Puerto Rico, in Miami, in St. Thomas, and many many more...never would I have expected this level of neglect and disrepair! The best personnel in the world can't save an experience that falls this far from 5-star that it really should be 3 star or even less!! (Wouldn't really know, I've never stayed in anything less than 3.5 star and even that's been a while...)...but because the people who work there are so so nice I gave the hotel 4 stars. I truly hope they are paying their employees well bc, boy, do they deserve it! As for me, the only way Ritz-Carlton can have me back as a customer (and I do travel to NY all the time)...is if they totally upgrade their hotel and then send me an invite to experience their new and improved accommodations as their guest....then, if I like what I experience, I would consider booking there again. The personnel and the location are unbeatable....the rest, for now....(I'm shaking my head)...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at some of the top hotels in New York--the Mandarin Oriental, Four Seasons, Pierre--and the Ritz CentralParks stands out for true classic luxury.-immediately greeted when we entered -addressed by name after check-in-lobby/bar are classic, elegant, and sophisticated -fantastic bartender--friendly and welcoming -concierge gave us great recommendations for dinner and helped with transportation -room was large and well-appointed--great view of Central Park -beautiful pre-war building right on Central Park south -our rate included breakfast--which was very good--but the breakfast pastries honestly could have been a little fresher--only complaintCan't wait to come back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed here during the last days of July. We ordered room service for breakfast our first morning... that was expensive but that was expected. Room service arrived very promptly - about 15 minutes after we placed the order our breakfast arrived. no gripes or praise about the breakfast; it was exactly what we expected all around. Aside from that, we spent very little time in the hotel room... we were very busy walking around outside seeing the sights we came to see in NYC. The location across from Central Park makes for easy walking to many locations. 5th Avenue is a very short walk, as are many good restaurants. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just have to experience it. As soon as you walk in the Magnificent Ritz you are welcomed by a wonderful staff. The aroma of the Hotel is delicious. The rooms very spacious and clean. And, the food is amazing. Best omelette we have ever had. One of a kind!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nothing but detail and attention was what I received while staying at the ladies and gentlemen of this particular Ritz Carlton. My preferences were noticed and repeated with minimal fanfare and everyone at the club level found a great balance of being attentive without being intrusive. Great location elevates this simple property.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I absolutely loved this hotel. It's not so big where it's impersonal, but not so small where you miss out on amenities. The staff is exceptional, greet you by name, and very attentive. The bar has great drinks, the food is well done, especially for a hotel! The rooms are great! Spacious, and comfortable. Lots of closet space, huge bathroom, comfortable beds, and all the things you want a room to have. The location of the hotel is really good! Walking distance to time square, broadway, shopping, and of course, across the street from Central Park. There are subway stations close by too for easy maneuvering to downtown and all other areas. The lobby/bar is very comfortable and quaint. Old school dark wood and overstuffed chairs. Such a classy place.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a lovely stay at the Ritz Carlton at Central Park. The staff was welcoming, the food services were prompted and I appreciated the little details that made my stay comfortable. My Fage yogurt with coffee was $46, though. That's pretty expensive. The coffee was perfection, though. You're across the street from Central Park which is nice. You're also right in front of the horse drawn carriages which is rather stinky. If you can get over the smell, I'd say it's a great location to navigate NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: the location of the hotel was great to be with kids and the service of overall staff are exceptional but thr restaurant and its food quality and the service of the staff are unbelievably poor quality for the Ritz standards! We visited for breakfast. The restaurant was very small, dark and very noisy and it even smelled vey unpleasantly. We ordered simple American breakfast. Fried eggs has black burned residues of frying pan all over and was too salty and was not edible.. The bacon was served also all burned in black when asked it to be a bit mire crispy! Kids meal was the same! White toasts were requested but wheat toast were served and when asked to be changed, rhe waiter did not even reply but instead took the basket and had to wait a ling time to get new ones . The toast was jot served hot!!!!The waiter was not attentive and did not really bother to hear about our concerns! The restaurant quality should be upgraded!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved staying at The Ritz this time. I don't remember the horse carriages this far up the street though; now they are directly across the street from this hotel. Fun to people watch but a little smelly in mid-July . Don't let that deter you . It's still very worth staying here -beautiful accommodations esp the lovely lobby /tea room, great gym , and spa. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Will definitely return as our top choice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What a wonderful hotel EXPERIENCE! We stayed for one night and the staff that we encountered (Rebecca, Yoneidy, the Conceirge) just made our stay spectacular and memorable. We were celebrating our milestone anniversary and stayed here for a night. We used the Spa (Evan does the best Reflexology Massage---totally recommend it!). What made this hotel great was that it felt personalized. We didn't feel like just another guest. the room was spacious (especially for a NYC hotel). We had the Park View room---just walking into that view blew our minds away. This hotel just set the bar high.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We wanted to catch up on some shopping, museums and attend the ballet at Lincoln Center. This hotel is perfectly located. The staff was very friendly, competent and engaging. We'd return in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I enjoyed a fairytale romantic getaway at the Ritz Carlton Central Park New York. We stayed in a premier suite with a view of Central Park that was spectacular . The staff were exceptional as would be expected, the brand was true to its luxurious heritage and the service equally exceptional! I will remain a Ritz brand loyalist!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Room service excellent. Restaurant food old, overpriced and unappealing at lunch. Room was excellent except for the lumpy bed (610). The overall service was terrific and we certainly will return Great location. Wonderful door service and front desk. Your restaurant looks great but the food --- not so good and yet room service was superb !!
user_location: Thousand Islands New York, New York
user_name:
G4859KDstephenf
Thousand Islands New York, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton has just about everything I needed on a recent NY trip. Close to the Park and a short ride or walk to Time Square. Old and remodeled and was certainly better than the Old St. Moritz I believe. Nice stay...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very very nice experience. I loved the spa and lounge would upgrade lounge a little. The check in was great. The maids did a great job on room. The spa was the best the young lady deserves a raise. Overall good experience

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at Ritz Carlton's before, and this is definitely the best! The location is great and all the hotel employees are very efficient, friendly and eager to please. The doorman offered the hotel's limo complimentary when we asked for a taxi for a short trip (temperature was 94 degrees). This is the first hotel we ever stayed in where we didn't have to ask for more hangers!! And we've stayed in hundreds. Fabulous anticipation of all your needs. I highly recommend it. The location is terrific as well, we had a beautiful view of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: stayed here while on a music tour with my boss and loved the rooms - very spacious - and the service is excellent. The only thing is the in room dining menu does not have too many options so if you stay for multiple nights be sure to try other places. It is not as kid friendly of a hotel since it does not have a pool, but it is on Central Park which is a favorite for all kiddos. I recommend a room on a higher floor since there's less view of the cars and more view of the calm of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the instant we arrived until the moment we departed,we received a warm welcome and fantastic service. Yoneidy especially made our trip fantastic by helping to plan out a romantic picnic in Central Park along with having the room ready prior to our arrival.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went to NY to visit our daughter and attend a wedding. The hotel was excellent as always. Felix the doorman set the tone on our arrival with very friendly banter. The hotel is well-situated and consistently well-maintained. Delightful!
user_name:
Carolyn B
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located on Central Park South, you're steps away from many must-see sights in NY. This hotel is elegant and quiet, perfectly maintained and staffed by friendly people. The lounge in the lobby is great for people-watching and after-dinner drinks. Rooms are spacious and comfortable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Of course it's fantastic and has all the classic Ritz amenities with a twist (your own butler, TV in the bathroom mirror). Very well located. The jazz lounge has famous cocktails (where the Bloody Mary was invented)...Not much seating in the lobby and smaller than most other Ritz's but rooms are spacious.
user_name:
Anasoma
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great experience!!! This particular Hotel presents the model/template for Customer services in any Business. From the time we checked in until the time we checked out, there was NOT one negative experience. And this particular Ritz Carlton is the Best Ritz Carlton by far that we have EVER stayed in!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is exactly what you expect from a Ritz Carlton. Others have trouble maintaining the experience of a fine hotel, but this property maintains that high bar of service. With so many luxury hotels in the city, The Ritz Carlton Central Park still feels like a luxury boutique hotel, where others feel opulent and touristy. Highly recommend and will return ourselves.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I have tried many NYC hotels over the years, but settled on the Ritz Carlton Central Park several years ago---and have never been disappointed. They have a superb staff and service is awesome in every way. They anticipate your every need, usually even before you do. Perfect location across from Central Park, too.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you have not stayed at the Ritz Carlton you are missing out on a wonderful experience. Their service is second to none. Just let them know how they can better serve you, what your plans are, or what you are celebrating and the wheels will start in motion immediately! They will surprise you! If you are looking for that special first class experience look no further than the Ritz-Carlton Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Because my stay here was worse than a Marriott. I expect more from the Ritz and they fail to deliver and the have failed consistently not just NYC but San Juan, PR and South Beach and Chicago. They threw away a few of my cigars. A Cuban and other difficult to find cigars. They failed to make up my room twice. There was more I just dislike this chain. Stay at the peninsula or four seasons.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz really needs to return to its roots of Customer Service before its too late...this hotel is nice with good location but service is slipping and the room décor is old fashion...you can tell that the Marriott influence has taken its toll...sad

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park was a great decision for us! It allowed us to have complete access to the City, get all the benefits and expertise from Ritz Carlton staff, and feel completely at home when we returned each evening. We had a great 4th of July weekend! Thank you so much!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Having had a great experience at the Ritz Carlton Moscow we decided to stay at the Ritz Carlton during our stay in New York. Unfortunately we were underwhelmed. Our room was pleasant and clean although the bathroom was rather dated and it's reasonably well located but the staff and the club lounge let it down completely. There was no feeling of personal service, the lounge was small with insufficient seating for the number of people staying there and the food presentations were extremely limited and of a poor standard. In fact the best thing we had whilst there was the raw carrot! At breakfast there were no glasses or mugs available and we were expected to use paper cups. Now if I was grabbing a take away this would be fine but for a sit down breakfast in a quality hotel!It is safe to say that we will not be going back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was in NYC for a week travelling with my wife and 2 kids ages 13 and 9. We had booked 3 nights here on July 4th, 5th, and 6th 2017 with the intention of extending longer. We were celebrating my daughters special 10th birthday. I am a RC Platinum rewards member and my wife booked this stay with Melody directly at the hotel and we were paying for this stay and not using any points. Upon booking my wife stressed the need for a double room with a roll away bed and was told this wouldn't be a problem. Upon check in we did get a double room #617 but were told that roll away beds were not permitted. After we got to our room we called the front desk a couple times (spoke to Denise) explaining the difficult situation that we were in and that we were assured a roll away bed at time of booking but again were told roll away beds are not permitted and they were sorry for the miscommunication. We were absolutely stunned. Not only did anyone we talked to seemed very concerned they sure were not very understanding and seemed like they could really care less! They did offer us an upgrade to a suite for another +$250 per night but at this point we were so upset we knew we were going to leave the next day and just decided to stay the one night and checked out the next morning. Looking back on the situation we should have just left and not even stayed the one night.We have stayed at many RC Hotels all over the world and were never treated so poorly at any RC Hotel ever. The service and attention to detail is a lot to be desired here. I sent an email to shortly after check in to David Cassidy in guest relations and I predicted a same day response but didn't get it. Finally the next day I got a response and after all that happened to us they offered us a free $40 carriage ride in a predicted response that stated how they pride themselves on service and detail and corrected the problem in the reservation center so it doesn't happen again.While I do appreciate the offer it was actually very quite insulting and a free carriage ride doesn't fix our problem. Really, is this the best they could do for the prices they charge during a time when the hotel was not very busy? They sure didn't have any problem trying to upgrade me to a suite for another +$250 per night! I don't feel they gave this very much thought? This is totally unacceptable and inexcusable. Not for one moment do I feel anyone of the staff at this hotel was considerate enough to put themselves in our situation and how we felt and they should be ashamed of themselves. I plan to immediately cancel my Ritz Carlton credit card and pull right out the rewards program. And once again I will predict that the hotel will respond to this review with the standard form email response apologizing for the miscommunication and how they pride themselves on excellent service and look forward to making it up to me on our next visit. But for me there wont be no next visit EVER! There are simply too many hotel choices in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Terrific experience from start to finish and a location that can't be beat! Thank you to the staff who made me feel beyond exceptional. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone considering it. The staff was exceptional, the rooms were nicely sized for a NYC hotel room and this might be the quietest NYC hotel room that i have ever stayed in.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent hotel, right across the street from Central Park and close to all shopping and restaurants. The service is top notch and the hotel is clean and easy to navigate. Great service in all areas; restaurants and bars, and rooms. I look forward to staying here again when back in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park is not worth the extra money or points. Stay at one of the other Marriott properties instead, for example the Essex House. We were very disappointed with the customer service and attention to customers in general. On a positive note, the beds were super comfy.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed scores of times in Ritz Carltons around the world. This one is lucky it is on Central Park but has been riding that advantage too long. I titled this the Holiday Inn on Central Park but the truth is, I have way more respect for the quality, responsiveness and attention to detail at Holiday Inns.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park continues to amaze. It not only sets the bar at a level that others cannot compete but provides the true decimation of luxury hospitality. A good hotel makes you feel as though your needs are being met. A great hotel like RCP creates the belief that you have no needs.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time at the RC in NYC. Stayed for 2 nights with a family of 3 including an 8 year old on his first visit to the city. Here are all the pluses to the property:Location is fantastic. Right on the edge of the park away from all of the noise but a close walk to everything. 5th Avenue is right there and Columbus Circle is just a short walk down Central Park. Staff is also excellent and serve as perfect ambassadors The the Ritz brand. All were extremely kind and attentive including Ronald with pre-registration, Denise at check in, and Ender. A special note about Ender: he asked my son if he wanted to go "camping" during his stay. He came up to the room and set up a tent! It was awesome. I also want to make note of the doormen and everyone at the front who are equally friendly and helpful. Room was great and relatively spacious for a standard room in the city. I've read the reviews about the need for a renovation but we found the room to be in great shape. It is traditionally appointed but the decor is in line with the building. Bathroom was also a good size. Opt for a park view. We had a nice partial view on the 14th floor which was perfect. My only true minus from our visit was the turndown service. Sunday night they came at almost 9:00 PM and the next night at 10:00 PM! Way too late especially for a weeknight. I've never had turndown service that late. Certainly not a deal breaker but a bit surprising. I would make sure to ask for early turndown service. Overall a great stay. The hotel staff truly makes the difference!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: An exceptional hotel that made a very special birthday celebration even more special, cant thank them enough for all the extras they provided to make our stay and time even better...thank you to everyone

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ideally located between 5th and 6th on CPS. Walking distance to theater and shopping. Extreme comfort and class. The lounge is quiet and elegant. Try for a room with a view of the park. Bobby Van's, next door, is not quite up to the standards of other locales.
user_name:
Ronald K
New York, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Large, beautifully appointed room. Classy hotel. Great service. Clean. Just what you expect from the Ritz. While I don't have anything that stood out as above and beyond I don't have anything negative to say either. We enjoyed our 2 nights here, and would stay here again. Excellent location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I'll begin this review by saying I've been fortunate enough to stay at amazing resorts and hotels around the world: France, Spain, Hong Kong, Australia, Italy, Indonesia, Jordan, to name just a few. And of course, in the USA, my home country. I share this so the reader has context for the statements I am making in this review - statements that might, at first glance, seem over the top. Believe me when I tell you, I embellish nothing.As one would expect of a Ritz-Carlton, the staff are excellent. The food is phenomenal. The club level is unparalleled. And the property is exquisite. But that's not what makes a Ritz-Carlton a Ritz-Carlton. That's just par for their course. What make a Ritz a Ritz is that extra special "something." That small (or big) gesture that catches one by surprise, and that reveals the true character - and captures the essence - of the culture of a company dedicated to its craft. And that essence is embodied perfectly by Ender, the gentlemen who greeted us upon our arrival.We took our daughter to NY to celebrate her graduation (and her scholarship as she pursues a career in theater). What better place to do so than Broadway? Because she's never been to NY, I put us up in the heart of Times Square at the New York Marriott Marquis. But I also knew of the quality of The Ritz-Carlton, and opted to book one night at the hotel (our last night). How I wish we would have stayed there the entire time. On the day of our arrival, we enter the lobby and Ender greets us and escorts us to check-in. I happen to be wearing a Ritz-Carlton ball cap from San Francisco - and before I know it he's handing out ball caps from his hotel to each of us as a gift.Then he offers to escort us to the club (we were early and our room wasn't quite ready). My daughter was holding a few posters from Hamilton and The Phantom (we saw both the previous two nights), and we spoke briefly of our stay, letting him know we had one more play to see before heading home (Anastasia).And this is where The Ritz-Carlton shows that, like Porsche, it has no substitute.We head out to dinner (at the fabulous Quality Meats - no the name doesn't do it justice - which the concierge recommended), and then to the play. We get back to our room around 11:00pm. And then...Remember that "special something" I mentioned earlier - the one that makes one feel special, and cared for? While we were gone, Ender took it upon himself to go shopping. He purchased not one, not two, but all three soundtracks of the plays we saw while in NY!!! We opened the door to find them displayed on the entertainment center - and he had Anastasia playing on the Bose speaker system in the room!!!WHAT? Are you kidding me? WHO DOES THAT? With I don't know how many thousands of people that go in and out of that hotel, and this is the kind of attention we get? And note - I didn't reserve a suite - we were in a regular room!Never, and I mean NEVER have we ever been made to feel so special and wanted at a hotel (or any other establishment for that matter). Staring down at the thoughtful gifts and listening to the music of the play we just watched on Broadway, I watched my daughter wipe a tear from her eye. We were all touched by the gesture. In today's world, this just doesn't happen.It was then that I turned to my fiancé and declared that we would never again visit New York City without staying at The Ritz-Carlton Central Park.... And neither should you.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our visit at the Ritz Central Park was amazing in all ways!! Excellent Consier recommendations. My friend left her leather jacket at a store and the Paige went and retrieved it! Awesome bedding and rooms were clean as could be! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is relatively nice, rooms with grand names are in fact not so grand, the staff are friendly but apparently crippled by hotel policies. The magic of Ritz service has left this building... If you are going to spring for a premium hotel, I recommend finding another - this one charges like premium property but the similarities mostly end there.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The ability to deliver such personalized experiences for their guests is unparalleled from any other company. True taste, elegance and respect is what you are rewarded with when choosing a Ritz Carlton property; most notable at the Central Park location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location is great: steps from Central Park. Service was incredible. I spoke to Yoneidy at guest relations to discuss the possibility of rooms close to each other due to my kids being 10 and 12. Not only did she get us ajoining rooms, but left a personal touch upon arrival for the kids. These little things add up and I am sure anytime I ask my kids where we should stay when heading back to NYC , they will vote the Ritz Carlton, Central Park

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, great hotel, great service, very friendly staff, room with a view -> perfect, we had every morning egg Benedict (perfect), room was spacious and in a good condition, expensive but worth it

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It was great the people where great the rooms great we had a great view of Central Park and the valet service for the car was perfect. The rooms were always clean and were just a perfect size. I also like the toilets they were fun!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The friendliest staff we have ever had. They were very attentive and made sure we were well taken care of! Yes, it is an expensive hotel but you get what you pay for. From the staff to the cleanliness of the hotel to the comfort of the beds, it was perfection.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The legends of the Ritz-Carlton customer service were proven to be true. The location, the building, the staff, the food and the spa all delivered well beyond my very high expectations. If you are traveling to NYC the Ritz should be your destination.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a luxurious room on the 15th floor overlooking Central Park, one of the most beautiful views we have ever seen. We had friends over for cocktails and all of our needs were taken care of. Impeccable service!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my 3rd stay in the property. Everything is as it should be. Efficient, helpful and reliable to all of our needs and demands. Excellent location in the Central park South, perfect for a morning jog and close by to Fifth ave for some serious shopping.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was absolutely fabulous! Their attention to detail is beyond anything I've ever experienced in a hotel. We had champagne, silver balloons and a hand written note waiting for us upon arrival. Also, after the concert was cancelled that we were supposed to be seeing, they brought in a CD of that musician and had it playing in our room when we arrived back for the afternoon..... "New York State of Mind" by Billy Joel. It was a fabulous experience and we will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just had a quick jaunt up to NYC for a couple of nights. We were on 14th floor with Central Park views. The views were great. The room was ok. Everything functioned. It really depends on what you are doing in NYC as to where you should stay as location can be key. Glad I tried..but not my first choice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff is amazing. I have zero complaints and would use all characters allowed to acknowledge all staff names and the kindness and generosity during our visit. Best trip I have had in a long time. Will be returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel over 65 times in 15 years. Best staff in the world. Great security, wonderful rooms and amazing service. I use hotels over 100 nights a year, I stay as often as I can at a Ritz Carlton as it is consistently the best without fail worldwide..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, warm & attentive hotel team. Made our 11th wedding anniversary feel special. Location to the Park couldn't be better Martini's in the lounge were great Breakfast the next day was a great way to people watch and round out the experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent and more! Everything/everyone from making reservations to check-in and check out, to valet parking to escort to the room, and last but not least the dining experience was excellent. When I called for parking and direction information it was excellent. All questions answered promptly. Have no suggestions or recommendations. Will definitely go back and recommend to friends.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. We visit New York City frequently and stay at 5 star hotels. This was our first time at the Ritz Central Park location. It is certainly well located in Manhattan, within walking distance of many wonderful restaurants, top tier retail stores, the Theater District and of course Central Park. We had very nice large room facing Central Park. However at the 8th floor level we were not high enough to see over the trees to see much of the park. If you want a better park view get a room on a much higher floor. We ate breakfast every day in the hotel. The basic "American Breakfast" (two eggs, bacon, toast, potatoes. juice and coffee) was tasty but at $50 per person is a bit high priced even for New York City standards. This is especially true in light of the fact that you can get basically the same breakfast next door at a diner for $6.95.We wanted to try dining at the hotel during the evening but were scared away because we never saw anyone else eating there. We did have a couple of late night hamburgers in the bar area which were fine as most hamburgers taste but at $30 a burger, we expected better quality from the Ritz.The service provided by the front desk, concierge and by the doormen were excellent. We have stayed at other Ritz Carlton's and have always been impressed with these type services. The bar service and dining room service was spotty however. A couple of times we had to flag a server down to get a coffee refill, another time the server brought the check with the breakfast, and still another, we asked for some A1 sauce which never arrived. The bar service was equally spotty with long waits for service despite the fact that there were not that many customers to warrant the delay. Granted, these are not major complaints but for a $800 a day room and high prices for basic food, we expected better from this Ritz Carlton.As with any review, I post, I intend it to be helpful to potential travelers and also constructive criticism for the management to consider. I am in business myself and I want to know how I am doing so I can improve. To this end, if I ran the Ritz Carlton chain of properties, I would model each hotel after the Ritz Carlton in Cancun for service and quality of food. To this day, it had the best of each in all our 40 plus years of visiting top tier hotels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the property in April and the hotel and service was beyond exceptional.The room, the concierge lounge and the amenities were even better than we could have expected.A special recognition needs to be given to the concierge, specifically Shannon. Shannon went above and beyond what my wife and I were expecting and we cannot thank her enough.We will be staying there again in September. Would recommend to anyone who wants to have a truly amazing experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: outstanding time, perfect location, detailed oriented staff. Across from Central Park, in the true heart of the city. Bar is a classic, stroll CP south.... nice as New York city. Ask for upper level rooms, park view is expectacular!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying at the Ritz-Carlton was an excellent experience. Just like I would expect it to be... (Class & Standard). Definitely, my best hotel experience so far. Already looking forward to the next time...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I were celebrating our birthdays and stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Central Park in NYC. From the moment we arrrived we were made to feel very special, and were showered with special "gifts" . All of the staff from housekeepers to concierge were friendly and very well trained. The hotel is beautiful and it's location is was perfect for us.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Over the past twelve years, I've stayed an array of hotels in the City, both luxury and non-luxury. Ritz Carlton's Central Park spot may be my favorite so far. The location is ideal, situation right in front of the park and within walking distance of Broadway. You're near Fifth Avenue and most of the prominent museums in the city. The rooms are luxurious, and the staff is equipped to match your needs. For those trying to choose between this and the Battery Park location, if money isn't a major issue, I would totally go with this one. The rooms are nicer, and the location just can't be beat. The ambience of the Ritz Carlton brand is so much more apparent at this location and carries that feeling of luxury I feel sometimes absent from the other one. After staying at Ritz Carlton properties in a number of cities, I've come to expect some surprises. In the past, I've arrived to free food, magazines, and other items in my room after a long day. That wasn't the case here, but to be completely fair, I never requested such and this location is much more in-demand than some of their other properties who want to spoil guests to lure them back for repeat business. Overall, you can't go wrong. I was very pleased with my visit and will certainly return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What more can you say about the Ritz, They set the bar high and always meet expectations. The hotel has a great location right in the middle of everything. The staff and service always amazing. Can't wait to go back

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We've stayed at a lot of Ritz Carlton properties over the years (DC, Boston, Orlando, Bachelor Gulch, Aruba). But NYC really raised the bar on this most recent trip. I made my reservations through the website, and was happy with our rate for a regular, non-park view room. About a week before, I got an email from guest services asking if we were celebrating anything, and whether we needed help making plans. I responded that we were celebrating my son's first trip to the city, and a milestone birthday for my husband. I also provided my "in process" itinerary, asking if they might assist in filling in some holes in my schedule. I received a response noting our celebrations, and suggesting some good things to do. When we checked in, we were a bit disappointed with the size of the room, and the view inside an interior court yard. We are gold members and often get upgraded. But, all was forgotten when we saw the lovely treat they left for my son welcoming him to the city. On my husband's birthday we returned from dinner after seeing Hamilton to be surprised with the soundtrack playing on the CD, and a birthday treat for my husband. All that attention, but never feeling like the staff was "in our face" is a wonderful balance that is hard to get right. The coffee in the lobby was delicious. Food in the restaurant was great. Location is tough to beat. Easy walk to Rockefeller Plaza and Broadway. The front of the property could get a little stinky with the horses across the street, but it's part of the charm, I guess. We were absolutely impressed with this property. And we are getting harder and harder to impress. We will be back. Special thanks to Yoneidy who took extra care to personalize our stay, and make the experience extra special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were there for a Ritz Carlton event during one of the hottest weekends. The hotel is in a prime location on Central Park but we were put into a room overlooking nothing special (but then I am not in NYC to look out my window.) So if you choose to book this hotel spring for the park view. Breakfast is delicious and the restaurant is perfect to watch the passers by. They do have a coffee cart for complimentary coffee in the am. Be aware the hallways are not air-conditioned and they had to put fans in the hallway to move the air. The room is just a room with a comfy bed and a lovely bathroom. I used the tub to cool off after a hot day in the city. A couple of tips. Go to the Plaza food court just down the street to catch a bite to eat. Many different food choices and when in town we always stop in usually for lunch before hitting Bergdorf's. Also there are several bike rental spots close to the hotel for a ride around the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was a mother daughter trip to celebrate my daughters 25th birthday. After 16 hours of hell travelling due to the airline, it was a huge relief to enter the predictable comfort of the Ritz Carlton. This property is ideally located. Our suite was very spacious. Bed was comfortable. We appreciated having our own bathrooms w/showers. We did not eat in the restaurants but did have room service on multiple occasions. Our food arrived promptly and the quality of the food was satisfying. The spa is small but well maintained. Our massages were lovey. The lobby bar service was good and the atmosphere was appealing. The club lounge has a nice view of Central Park. The service in the club lounge was great. I found the food selection was slightly lacking in comparison to other Ritz properties. I will return to this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to others that are seeking quality accommodations and service…..and not concerned about $$$.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park South and, for the most part, our visit was excellent. The service, the public areas, the bar, our room were all fine, but I can only give 4 stars because of one small, but annoying, problem. The pillows were small and very soft and no replacements were available. This situation adversely affected the sleep for both my wife and myself. It is unfortunate that such a small matter could ruin an otherwise top notch experience, but it did for both of us. I urge the Ritz Carlton to invest in some king size firm pillows to solve this issue, at least some for those that request them. Hopefully my next visit will be a 5 in all respects.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I were at the Ritz Carlton in NY for the weekend to celebrate her birthday - everyone was so nice and welcoming - and a wonderful surprise awaited us in our room when we got back from our day out - chocolate covered strawberries decorated with a Happy Birthday banner! The Ritz Carlton once again shows that it is the best place to stay! Thank you!
user_name:
joseph g
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, professional staff really take care of guests. Easy walking to Central Park, great places to eat, the Subway ... Everything is close by. The door staff remembers your name upon arrival, as a guest you are greeted and assisted coming and going. We felt very safe at the Ritz during our stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: That was no pillow in the room after check in to the hotel. Call room service for 3 times and after 1 1/2hrs then pillow arrived. How can this happen to a five star hotel ? When ask first time, they apologize and ask for foam or feather pillow. 1/2 hr later call again, they said the manager will look into it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: No hotel does things like the Ritz Carlton Central Park. They make every trip amazing!The locations is great and nothing beats there club! Perfect for work or biz.The food is Delian and the staff fabulous! A must have on your New York list

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location---10 starsDoormen -10 starsRoom------10 starsAll staff----10 starsRoom very quiet and very clean. You are very well taken care of in this hotel.Short walk to the Boat House in Central Park for a nice breakfast, lunch or dinner.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This place is simply heaven. I had a great experience as soon as I walked through the door. This hotel deserves an award! Best hotel I have been too in a while. Beautiful decor and the atmosphere was very clean and inviting.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I decided to take the two kids to NYC and this is the hotel to stay! From their own separate check in to a scavenger hunt. Everything was perfect and the location is even better....across the street from Central Park. The kids spent hours in the park and loved everything the hotel had to offer. Another amazing trip to a Ritz property and was not disappointed. I needed to get my kids hair done before a dinner party, the concierge immediately got to work. Within 5 minutes we were out the door to get the hair looking perfect. If you need it, they will get it done.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Elegant is a good word to describe this hotel. The staff are exceptional and the service unparalleled. They seem to anticipate your needs. As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are very quiet and roomy. We've stayed there on our last three visits to NYC. I don't think I would want to stay anywhere else. Perfect location with a great view of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Celebrated Birthday and was the most wonderful experience in every way from start to finish. Every interaction with hotel staff made us feel special. It was obvious that the staff really cared and wanted us to be pleased.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great hotel to stay in due to location, staff and quiet bedrooms. We stay here when visiting our daughter in New York. The location is perfect, just across from Central Park. Nice lobby lounge and bar. Auden wasn't great and pretty expensive for what you get. Recommend Rue 57 for breakfast, which is two blocks away on 6th Avenue. Great food and at least 1/2 the price. Nice spa and gym as well. Doormen are superb as are the reception staff. VERY quiet rooms, which is hard to find in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great Service!! Surprised me with Champagne for my birthday. We're very helpful with tickets to an event. Highly recommended and the location in Manhattan was great. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A pleasure from arrival to departure and ALL points between. With a hotel so full of celebrities that one had to wear sunglasses due to the "glare" and then to be treated as fantastic as we were; that was simply the definition of hospitality at its finest. I would recommend this hotel as a 14 on a scale of 1 to 10. Excellent service and exemplary efforts. Thank you and Well Done

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Really this hotel is the best hotel...Rooms are very good n one more thing Restaurants services are good n fast... I shall be never forget my stay n will plan soon again to visit ....Chefs meets personally ..this feels you great...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Good hotel close to Central Park and walking distance to shopping and theaters. There are a good number of quality restaurants nearby, also the carriage rides are just across the street. The staff is very good at taking care of everyone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Couldn't fault this hotel in any way. All 1st class, staff, rooms, Food and location, Just a walk from the castle, as there is a car park.All in all a great stay... I really enjoyed the hotel and great location, pool side eatc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A wonderful property whose employees made us feel like very special guests. The driver of the house car (John, if my memory serves me) and Felix (the doorman) are two employees who stand out as exceptionally friendly,, welcoming, and personable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying at this property, in this city, in this location gave me a feeling that I had really achieved something so I had high hopes. The service was attentive as one would expect, the room was lovely and well appointed, and you were staying in a world famous location. My wife and I sampled the breakfast which was good and enjoyed a quick drink at the bar as well while we were there with no complaints.One surprising downside of the location that I had never considered was the smell of horses you could catch in the lobby and certainly when you stepped outside.
