I had never anticipated that the great location on the Park would come with a downside in the form of stinky horse smell from all of the horse carriages lined up across the street. I stayed here in the fall but I can only imagine during a humid summer day what that must be like - no thanks. I'm glad I stayed here once but given the price, relative age of the property, and the unexpected horse stink I wouldn't return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When you are close to Central Park, you do expect to see best of the best. This Hotel is not it. You feel the outdated status. Nothing wrong about if you like it. I did't. There are better hotels with the sama price.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My first time at a RC lived up to the hype. From ease of check-in to the decor and amenities, we were impressed. They even prepared a birthday cake! Felt more like a boutique hotel, and our room had a great view of Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent hotel in very central location in New York City. Park view is a must but the hotel is perfectly situated to many attractions and restaurants. Views of the park from your room are incredible.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We've stayed here a few times over the years, and have never been disappointed. The rooms are luxurious and comfortable in the "old" Ritz tradition, and the park views are serene in any season. In our experience, the relatively small lobby never seems mobbed and never feels overwhelming.It's a nice walk (in decent weather) to the theater district and easy also to walk to the east side and west side. Also easy to the subway, and for the most part we were able to get taxis out front (and when you can't Uber is plentiful in NYC). Easy also to the subway.We've also always loved the staff at this Ritz - personable, friendly and responsive from pre-arrival through departure.NYC has a number of great high-end hotel options, and we've stayed at several of them depending on rates, but we always love coming back to the Ritz Central Park when we can.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in Hotels all over the world. This is my favorite. from the door men to the Bartenders, and the entire staff. Always helpful smiling and extremely polite. The entire staff is always willing to help.
user_name:
V850BKstepheng
Palm Beach Florida, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel staff were great with our granddaughters 5 and 6. The Ritz Kids package was very special. They enjoyed all the elements in the packet. The food was very good. We really enjoyed our stay. Will return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything was to PERFECTION. Beautiful view of Park. Exemplary service throughout. Fine food/close to everything. All staff very helpful, and delightful. All services offered, made our stay very pleasant and we will definitely be back. What was a business trip, became an engagement trip! So romance too. This hotel did not disappoint on any level and we will be back very soon!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We usually stay at the Plaza but they were booked so we stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park by virtue of American Express Fine Hotels. We were not disappointed and will certainly consider the Ritz Central Park when we next visit NYC for business or pleasure.The reception clerk and, indeed, all of the staff were very pleasant and accommodating. The room, which was an upgrade, was carefully chosen by the receptionist and had an outstanding view of the Park and 6th Ave. The food and service in the restaurant for breakfast was outstanding. The gym was very functional and had my favorite Pre Cor machine in it. In sum, the whole experience was exceptional and worthy of the RItz brand which we have utilized previously and are going to expand to our European travel because of their loyalty reward system.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park because it is convenient to our children and all of the attractions of Manhattan. We can always count on consistent excellent service. The staff is always willing to go the extra mile to meet our needs. The rooms are comfortable and clean with the necessary amenities.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed at this Ritz many times before. It is recommendable if in your price range. My complaints are petty at best but still complaints. Other than one..... we were in suite 1201, very roomy, two full baths, bedroom and living area seperated by foyer. BUT the sofa was worn out ! Cushions in serious need of replacement. Not comfy at all. Club lounge as I have reported before stinks of onion during breakfast service. Always a full bowl of sliced red oniion on the buffet and I see very very few people taking them. Not a fan of bad smells with my coffee. Bagels are a disgrace. In one of the best bagel cites in the world they are Pepperidge Farm at best. No different than a slice of toast. Only eggs available are cold hard boiled. Quiche is usually served but lukewarm under a heat lamp at best. Not impressed with the lunch selections either as the sandwiches are strange. All in all it seems like they are catering to the international customer with the food selections. Same comments I've had in the past. Never changes

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great hospitality, beautiful facilities, across from Central Park, helpful attendants, rooms are spacious and comfortable, felt safe, really enjoyed our stay, would like to stay here again next time we return to NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is definitely lovely with beautifully appointed rooms and an excellent location. But, unless you get a room with a park view, I feel like you would be better off staying at a nearby hotel without the name and the price. Our room faced another building, and not even a particularly attractive one. I read several reviews about excellent service and staff going the extra mile, but I didn't experience it. If anything, I felt like we were ignored; not in a rude way, they were just indifferent to us.. I left feeling like, "meh - no need to do that again." I won't likely stay there next time we visit the city. Other properties I've reviewed offered much nicer service and experiences.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was amazing and we have never had a bad experience at the Ritz in Central Park. The staff were very friendly and the room was amazing. I would highly recommend this property or any Ritz. We have never gone wrong.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for few nights at the Ritz Carlton, Central Park. Was an amazing experience, really good service, concierge & bell services took great care for the specific needs I had, Spa experience was amazing and food quality both in the room & at the restaurant was upto the mark

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Already provided it in the previous questions. Stating that the staff at the Ritz were tentative, showed genuine need to help and were professional in their service. We felt we could approach them anytime.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Without a question this is the best hotel in New York. Aside from the excellent decor and high level of service the best features of this hotel are the location, the availability of, and the ability to get transportation on short notice, and the 2nd floor Concierge Club.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Absolutely amazing time in New York, much to do with the service and luxury of the Ritz Carlton Central Park location. The concierge staff was outstanding- little gifts and surprises to make our special occasion just that- special! What a treat to be treated so luxuriously! We will not hesitate to return to this hotel in hopefully, the very near future! Thank you everyone at the RITZ!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Always a nice place to stay in NYC location is excellent right off Central Park and close to fifth avenue shopping and dining. Bedrooms are nicely done and big for NYC and bathrooms are excellent. Staff is very helpful and always pleasant.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz Carlton Central Park is a wonderful hotel for family. The quality of service, is the very best. The Central Park location is amazing. We would not stay anywhere else when vacationing in New York City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: One of the best located hotels in New York with staff who made it an extra special stay. Opposite Central Park with views of the pale which are amazing.The service in the hotel and attention to detail sets this above the rest

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved our stay in this hotel. Perfect location, lovely accommodations, great food/restaurant, exceedingly friendly and gracious staff throughout. Whoever thought to put dimmers on all lights, including in the bathroom, is a genius. My husband, daughters, and I look forward to coming back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: NY is getting busier and sometimes I have the feeling of stressful . Traffic is crazy so location is very important. RC Central Park has THE LOCATION & THE VIEW. It's worth to pay extra money and get a CP view room.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is amazing. It is not as large as other luxury hotels and feels very intimate. It is luxury at its finest without the pretense. You feel like your are at home yet pampered at the same time. Fabulous!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is the absolute best for anyone who wants a luxury hotel in midtown Manhattan. Super location, friendly staff, every amenity needed. From check in to check out, the hotel staff insists on making your experience even better than expected. I can't say enough great things about this hotel- my wife and I have stayed there on 5 separate occasions- they remember our names and welcome back as family every time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Timeless and classic beautiful hotel right on Times Square! We stayed as a family of four in a suite overlooking Central Park. The view of the park was incredible. Rooms are beautiful and classic. Furniture in very good shape but not modern. Bathrooms were gorgeous. All marble and new. Only complaint were hallways were hot. My boys slept on the sofa bed as the hotel had no double beds. They complained the mattress was thin and uncomfortable so housekeeping brought up a mattress topper to place on top. There was a small bar in lobby but closed early so if you are looking for a night spot this isn't for you. However we loved everything about this hotel. Can't beat the location. You walk across the street into the park. Would return.... plus around the corner from the fabulous 5th avenue shops!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: NY is greeting tough in traffic. Every year worst so location is getting more important every day.Central Park is still the heart of the city if you're looking for peace and relax. Rooms are nice but small even if you have a suite. A little price but the Central Parks views in a high floor worth the difference to pay !!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Right where any young successful entrepreneur would want to be! Great for thinking of innovative business ideas and you don't have to worry about inspiration because it's truly all around you. I will stay at this location every time I'm in New York!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: At check in, our receptionist asked if we had any plans during our stay. We mentioned that we had theater tickets. On return later that evening, we were surprised to have the broadway sound track playing in our suite. A thoughtful gesture and the kind of personal touch that always comes with a visit to the Ritz Carlton Central Park. Thank you for that "Beautiful" surprise.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The most wonderful location in the city.Across from Central Park .in the spring time there is no better place to walk the neighborhood is lovely .The hotel is great,it should be at this price plenty of paparazzi always looking for the money shot.Rooms are average for a ritzYou can walk to anything from hereHave fun

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with my daughter and granddaughter. The hotel was wonderful and the location is perfect. We enjoyed the room service breakfast and extra amenities were delivered promptly. We were right across the street from Central Park, what a treat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were at the hotel celebrating my daughter's 18th birthday. When we got to our room we were very happy to see the room decorated for her birthday with special treats and decorations. It made her feel like a princess. Even better, the evening we returned from seeing Anastasia on broadway, we came back to the room to find the Anastasia soundtrack CD playing in our room. I still don't know how the hotel knew what night we were going to the show but this was clearly an above and beyond moment which I have been sharing with friends and family - what a delight. I attribute these special moments to Cassidy Davis in the hotel who went well above and beyond our expectations and delighted us during our stay. Will definitely be back soon!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our suite was very comfortable and surprisingly quiet. Having a separate room to handle work concerns made it possible to host friends without disrupting each other. Amenities and staff are first rate. We enjoyed being able to walk across the street and wander through Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz has a great location. The Central Park is right across.Todd English Food Hall where you can eat many delicious food is in 5 minute walking distance. A metro station is in a door stop away from this food plaza. Another one on the way to the Columbus Circle. There's a huge mall near the Columbus Circle too.I tired the hotel breakfasts which was ~$60 each time. Kinda stiff for a breakfast. But food was tasty and the service was impeccable. Their gym was adequate with many treadmills/bikes, weights. Well stocked with water bottles and fruits. A nice hotel and great service. Highly recommend this place.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My dear friend/neighbor and I enjoy an "annual" trip to New York -combined business/leisure. The Ritz-Carlton Central Park has been our choice for the past 7 years. We enjoy dining out, the theatre, sightseeing, and lots of walking. But how nice... to always have The Ritz Carlton to come "home" to.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Luxurious hotel with spacious rooms across the street from Central Park. Classic style with larger guest rooms and bathrooms. Very nice hotel, but well reflected in the price you pay. If you want luxury near the park and shopping areas and don't mind the bill, this is a very good option.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Huge fan or Ritz Carlton Hotels, especially this Gem. Please stop in and allow Felix to welcome you. If you stay for the evening, request the Club Lounge and allow Lazar and Charles to charm and serve.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I travelled to NYC to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and we booked into The Ritz Carlton. From the moment the doorman opened our car door and welcomed us to our departure nothing was too much for this hotel and its amazing staff. Everyone was intent on making our stay the best it could possibly be. A nice touch, on checking in I let slip it was our anniversary when we were handed our complimentary cocktail cards (v nice touch) to welcome us. The extremely personable reception lady (from Czech Republic) must have made a mental note, because on the evening of our anniversary we were sent champagne and chocolates.The Ritz Carlton is a super luxurious hotel but at a human scale and we could find no fault at all during our stay. It was amazing to go to sleep and wake overlooking Central Park.Thanks everyone! We will be back!
user_name:
Stuart W
North Yorkshire, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent service from the moment my husband and I arrived. The entire staff was very attentive and accommodating. We went to NYC to celebrate my birthday it was wonderful. My husband booked through American Express Platinum Travel and was able to obtain upgrade upon request while checking in. The room was true Ritz Carlton decor. Marble bath with a separate water closet. Our original room was shower only with a view of 6th Avenue so we traded back down for a separate shower and tub. Concierge was absolutely great. He gave great suggestions for places to eat and party. He was able to get my husband and I on the list to get in a club that was really hard to get in. He suggested Scalinatella and Scalini Fedeli for dinner (both Italian) and both were absolutely amazing. Also if you like fish and chips A Salt and Battery in Greenwich Village is necessary. This hotel is very convienant to the subway and directly across the street from Central Park. Fifth Avenue is one block away - most of the shopping stores are within a four block radius. I had spa services at La Prairie and absolutely loved it, worth every penny! I had the 30 min. massage and the Luxe Moisture Indulgence. If you are looking for consistency in wonderful service and attentiveness then you won't be disappointed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Ritz. Our room was not available when we arrived at 11am, but they held our luggage for us while we went to a matinee show. When we returned at 5:30pm, our room was ready. They had brought our luggage upstairs, had the lights on, music playing, and a beautiful birthday dessert plate waiting for us. I appreciated the thoughtful gesture and the care they took to making all the desserts gluten free for my daughter. We stayed on the top floor in a large corner room. The room was beautiful and well maintained. Beds were comfortable and the bathroom had every supply you could think of. Had drinks in the warm and inviting bar that evening before dinner. Perfect location for shopping, museums, theatre and restaurants. Loved the late check out. Slept in and ordered room service for breakfast. Everything was delicious! Also appreciated how quick the room service was. Overall we had a wonderful stay and we plan to return again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz Carlton consistently exceeds expectations. Their attention to detail and well appointed staff make every stay remarkable. Our anniversary stay was made even more enjoyable as we were sent a complimentary bottle of champagne. The room was great, crisp and clean and comfortable. We had a great view of Central Park. The doorman is phenomenal, professional and amusing at the same time. The staff is very accommodating and seem to genuinely care about the guests' experience. Great stay, would highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I am currently on my last day of a five night stay at The Plaza, where my stay has been disappointing. Tonight, I joined colleagues for a quick drink in the Star Lounge at The Ritz-Carlton Central Park and wow, what a difference. The room is intimate, warm, elegant and the servers attentive. However, what really impressed me and drove me to write this review, is George at the concierge desk. I only had a simple question - the location of the ladies room - and George was all smiles, warm and friendly. He is an outstanding asset to the hotel. I will rave about this hotel and recommend it to others simply because of George. What a great first and last impression!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: An extended stay (4 nights) for the NCAA East Regional Men Basketball Tournament. I have stayed in many Ritz Carlton's (Aruba, New Orleans, NYC - Battery Park, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Washington DC, Toronto). This was my first trip to NYC - Central Park. This was Reward Travel as well, we were upgraded to a Deluxe Room, with Park view for a small fee on top of the Ritz Carlton reward points. Even though the room was not booked with American Express Reward Points, we were extended a few of the Centurion benefits as if it were. I was traveling with my sons 7 & 9. It was a basketball weekend in the city. Service, as always, was exemplary, but even more so at this location. I was greeted by name at check in, my children were greeted and introduced to several members of the staff, each of these staff members remembered their names throughout the stay. The children were given plush horses as a gift and invited to some Ritz Kids events that they passed on, excepting the feeding of the horses at noon. My youngest really enjoyed that every day of our stay. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The mechanics on the windows did not operate properly and engineering came up to assist, and got them closed tight, but advised against operating them as the mechanics were stripped. Some of the upholstery on the chairs and stools were worn. The desk was perplexing as there were no receptacles for laptops, chargers or anything easily accessible. FREE (with Marriott elite status) WiFi was very fast. It was quite pricey $20 a day, if you had to pay for it though. I had to use the business center to print some show tickets, I found the need to use a credit card and the ridiculous $3 fee to use the internet in the business center a bit disparaging, but everything there worked perfectly.The bathroom, was elegant, and my only issue was with the makeup mirror, the light did not work. I needed it to put in my contacts, not a big deal, but it should work. The kids loved the deep soaking tub and the shower that provided great pressure. Extra towels and toiletries were made available daily just as we requested. Ice was also provided daily for a cooler we had brought, for kid stuff. We ate breakfast in the restaurant Auden, the breakfast was very pricey and just ok. Pancakes were served cold, eggs were cold, toast was cold. Bacon was delicious. Total for 1 adult, 2 kids - $100. Service was a bit over the top, but quite friendly. The concierge was knowledgeable and quite helpful on several occasions. Front desk was attentive to our concerns. The bellman and doorman seem a bit perturbed by guests using Uber & Lyft, to arrange transportation, but I have found that the norm in city hotels these days. They were in no way rude about it, just could tell they feel like they are being squeezed out of a job a bit. The Detroit Pistons were in town staying at the hotel, several team members and coaches were very nice to the kids. They seemed to appreciate the accommodations and remarked to me that they enjoy the hotel on their trips to NY. All in all a very nice stay. I wouldn't say the hotel physically, is as nice as some other properties, I would say that you are paying mostly for location here. The staff is top notch though and while some things are a bit dated, service never goes out of style and that is why I stay at Ritz properties.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is an excellent hotel in a great location on Central Park South. The staff is exceptional. The Club Lounge is fantastic, due to the very professional team that runs it. Overall, this property is one of the finest high-end hotels in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first trip to the Ritz in NYC and we really loved it. The staff was outstanding, the hotel was quiet, and we felt that the ambience and service really made our trip special. The location of the hotel is especially fabulous for anyone wishing to do Broadway or ballet.CAREY from BEACHBUM VACATIONS booked our travel for us and she consistently does an OUTSTANDING job in helping us choose fantastic trip destinations.
user_name:
Julie V
Indianapolis, Indiana, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everybody was so helpful. We had lunch in the lobby and it was delicious. The club level food was delicious and the staff very attentive. Thanks . You need to take this minimum off. Next time I won't review.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our second visit to the Ritz Carlton Central Park. The location is fabulous and our room had a glimpse of Central Park. Every member of the service team took the time to learn our names and to greet us personally every time we came departed or returned to the hotel. The Star Lounge is a fabulous place to sit and have a drink or a meal. The cocktails are wonderful, the service sublime, and the atmosphere nearly always humming with guests of all ages enjoying themselves. The rooms are flawless - every single thing in the rooms worked perfectly. Our room was remarkably quiet as well. We were on the 14th floor. I highly recommend the Ritz for its professional and congenial personnel and for the beautiful and comfortable rooms and public spaces.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Of all the hotels in NYC, the Ritz in Central Park is one of my favorites. I stay here each time I come to NYC and the staff are so warm and welcoming. The facilities are older but impeccably maintained. They do such a great job with kids. I've been taking my daughter since she was an infant and they've accommodated for her each time. Room service is also wonderful, offering great service and great food. The location is close to everything. Overall, this hotel is a great choice!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I booked this 3-day trip as a surprise for my wife for our 20th wedding anniversary - my wife knew nothing about it until we got to Heathrow on the Tuesday morning. The room was large and comfortable and the view over the park spectacular. The location just across the road from Central Park was perfect. The staff at the Ritz-Carlton were totally charming and did everything they could to make our stay special and memorable - nothing was too much trouble for them and we were always greeted with a smile. Special thanks to the concierges Maria and Timothy, Al the doorman, Yolanda in Housekeeping and all of the Reception and door staff, who provided us with guidance on where to go and how to get there for all of the places we visited during our short stay in New York. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at that hotel for a romantic getaway and got a room with the view of Central Park. The room was great, big and with a nice mini bar. The view was not great at all. If you're looking for a room with a great view of Central Park you should consider the Trump International Hotel which is just two blocks away. The service at the hotel was very good.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is perfect and the staff is exceptional. Everyone went out of their way to make the trip perfect. The concierge desk and the bellman made sure all of our needs were addressed and that we were comfortable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best stay ever in the city. We booked a 2/2 suite looking over Central Park for my 40th birthday. Champagne upon arrival, early check-in at 10:30! Always greeted by name throughout the week, including surprise balloons and more champagne in the room on my acutal birth day. Additional coordinated Events throughout the week we done easily with the concierge staff, room service, and Pete, an amazing man from guest relations. Al, who ran bell station was always charming and didn't hesitate to welcome our own guests who decided to share a limo ride back to the airport. He immediately stowed their bags while they joib us for a light lunch in the lounge prior to departure. We requested a later checkout at 12:15 with ease. I've stayed at 7 different Ritz-Carlton properties over the past few years, but this was my first at this particular location. 10 out of 10. My expectations were not only met, but thoroughly exceeded.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: best ritz in new york service location staff! bar is the best bar great bartender Eric! ! ! always love going to this bar. Door men are ghreat so is the house staff always feel special . love to come to this ritz

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Management and staff continue to excel and provide exemplary service. This hotel has become a true home away from home. Recent improvements to the Club Lounge are evident, it now provides not only best in class service, but superb culinary options at each of its five presentations. This hotel does not rest upon its laurels, but continues to improve with each visit and is truly worth of its Five Star and Five Diamond ratings.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my second time staying in this particular hotel. The hotel and service was everything you would expect from a Ritz Carlton. Proximity to everything is great and walking distance to most attractions as well as Broadway, Shopping and the Park. Thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at Ritz in outstanding location on Central Park South. Room was amazing.....large room, view of Park,....and staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend. Will definitley stay here again on next trip

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The professional and intuitive staff at the Ritz Central Park made our stay a truly exceptional experience. Of course, the location can't be beat, the restaurants were wonderful and the amnitis top notch, but the personalized service of the entire staff made the stay truly spectacular.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel, attentive staff, when I came back to my room after seeing Hamilton there was a Hamilton CD for me, complements of guest services, very appreciated. Stayed at the club level, would do so again, food, service great.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our past experience at the Ritz outside of the US was amazing and we were excited spending a night in New York City so close to central park in a Ritz property.Check-in went smoothly though the doorman didn't see us approaching but that turned out to be the habit, even when 3 were present. Free internet and morning coffee, and health club, all nice, but unlike my stay this year at near by st regis, no garment ironing nor complimentary fruit and hot beverage in room on check in. Bed extremely comfortable. Location great.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have a saying that my idea of camping is staying at the Marriott when the Ritz Carlton is full. Well, they didn't disappoint this time either. Everything was right on. Yes if you have a couple of drinks and call your liquor in the bar, the check is going to be big. Remember you're in New York, not Jacksonville. But everything is thought of. Room is not hip, just incredibly comfortable, huge for New York. The staff friendly and helpful but unobtrusive. The location, read the address it doesn't get any better than this. Yes New York is full of the latest hip hotels, but what you thought was going to be an adventurous weekend turns into a royal pain. In New York, it doesn't get any better than this.As always, the Ritz Carlton is an outstanding hotel that does things incredibily right.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location. Great staff. The club room is perfect. Walking distance to great shopping and sights. Was able to secure dinner reservation for me. Try Sarabeth restaurant next door to the hotel for brunch

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband surprised me with a 4night trip to New York for my bday and I have to say from stepping out of the taxi onto the sidewalk I cannot pick any fault with our trip. We had a beautiful view of the park, and it was amazing to wake up and have a coffee looking over Central Park! The doormen we so friendly and always greeted with smiles and happy chat. The location is fantastic. The bed was so comfy! The hotel was just so lovely. Yes old fashioned but perfectly classy! Who wants modern! Everything was brilliant we had room service one evening and the food was outstanding. And room service for breakfast one morning also, yes both pricey but it's part and parcel of staying at the ritz! I was little put out for being charged $25 for pot of coffee for two! It stung I can't lie!! We had a wonderful stay here I would return without a doubt

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is in a perfectly central location to the east or west side of manhattan. The lobby could use a facelift. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. The doorman and house driver Paul were superb and guest focused. Room was a partial park view with a large bathroom and entry way. Highly recommend a floor above 14 or you hear a lot of traffic. The gym is so so - basic equipment to get the job done. The breakfast in room service e came on time but the basket of breads/muffins could have been warmed a bit - as all tasted very stale and hard. The restaurant in the hotel had superb food - especially the hamburger but the staff was extremely slow at service. (only two tables had patrons)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A must stay for a wonderful NYC experience. Right across from Central park and the staff goes above and beyond to assist with any reservations and problem solving! Looking forward to our next trip back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Central Park was enjoyable, but not what we expected. We have stayed at other Ritz properties and we had high expectations of this property. While nice, we felt the hotel was a bit tired; perhaps in need of a facelift. The rooms were comfortable, but the decor old style. The common area was a bit stuffy (high afternoon tea stuffy), but perhaps that is the feel that they were trying to accomplish. Just not our style. I prefer a more modern, sleek feel (like the Ritz Bal Harbour), bit also prefer the Ritz Downtown NYC.So while nice, I dont think we would visit this location again, as there are simply so many other hotels to visit in NYC that better suit our preference.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for three months so got to know the staff well. The only let downs were perhaps the length of time the engineers took to come when the tv was faulty and also the food on the room service menu changed daily and didn't seem to always correspond with what the menu said.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice but need to be refurbished, rooms are old fashion style and not so luxury as other RC, restaurant is below the level expected. The location is amazing, the staff very fine and professional. By the way, the RC NY Central was one of teh best and need to be upgraded to maintain the level through luxury hotels overs NY and the world.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As we were spending 8 days in New York in the summer (July, yes a late review) I had decided once we had booked the trip I would then treat my partner to a surprise afternoon tea at the Ritz for his birthday. He had been to NYC before but had never been to the Ritz Carlton Hotel, where as I have stayed there and eaten there on a previous visits to NY. As we are based in the UK I organised everything via email and liaised with a lovely and extremely helpful lady named Rachel K!! We were booked to be in NY over the 4th July holiday period so in between organising a date/time for the afternoon tea booking I was also asking Rachel numerous other questions about where to go, what to see other than the normal touristy landmarks. Rachel was extremely helpful and went way beyond what she needed to in helping with our trip.We had our afternoon tea in the Star Lounge area of the hotel, the décor is beautiful, traditional but not old fashioned, it is designed in a very luxurious, classy style. Our afternoon tea was absolutely beautiful, how it was presented, how it tasted and how it was served to us by the staff there. Sadly Rachel wasn’t working the day we were there but the staff that were working on the day were a credit to the hotel, we had excellent customer service. Drinks were topped up regularly, check backs were done throughout our meal but never in an intrusive way and we were extremely well looked after. As this was for my partner’s birthday Rachel had also organised a couple of little extras on how the desserts were presented to us, a few extra chocolate goodies, we had a chocolate Empire State Building which we thought was a very lovely touch.Afternoon Tea at the Ritz- Carlton is not cheap (around £170 for ours) but it was worth every penny (dollar), would I do this again yes absolutely. The food was amazing, it doesn’t look much when it is brought out but there is definitely plenty there and it is very filling. I can honestly say there is nothing we could have complained about during our afternoon there, it is a beautiful hotel, the service and standards were extremely high and we were very much looked after. The only downside was that we didn’t see Rachel on the day we were booked, but luckily we still had time during our holiday to call in and say thank you for arranging this for us. Rachel K is a credit to the hotel, nothing was too much trouble for her and she was more than helpful regarding all the emails I was sending backwards and forwards to her regarding other questions not just about the afternoon tea.If you are visiting NYC we would definitely recommend you must experience Afternoon Tea at the Ritz-Carlton…and ask for Rachel K.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel was beautiful n service was excellent. Great place to stay!!!!!! The best was the park across from the hotel. Allowed u to have everything right there. My friend and I thought the place was clean and the restaurant was worth going to as well.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park for my birthday weekend and had a very enjoyable time. As per previous Ritz-Carlton stays the service is always excellent and the amenities offered are top notch. We were specifically impressed with the location of this hotel directly across from Central Park in NYC and how nice the rooms were. We will definitely be returning to this location in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As always, the Ritz-Carlton, Central Park exceeded my expectations in every regard. I frequent this hotel as business brings me to New York and I never leave disappointed (in the hotel at least). An absolutely outstanding luxury accommodation.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Fantastic weekend celebrating my wife's birthday thanks to Yoneidy Carreno and the rest of the Guest Relations staff. The service at the Central Park Ritz, as always, exceeded expectations. We will be back again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our experience at the Ritz in a Central Park was the most memorable experience I have ever had. I had surprised my mom with a weekend away and we were wined and dined from Morning until night. There wasn't an area they missed.We were able to get last minute reservations by the concierge Daniel and Timothy (who are simply amazing) they made sure we had perfect seats and amazing views. We were upgraded by the front desk to a beautiful view of Central Park, they even delivered champagne to our room to celebrate. After seeing wicked on the second night they had the cd playing in my room, such a special touch. We even received hand written cards whenever they did something for us. The bar staff is enjoyable and fun and I can't say enough wonderful things about the bell staff out front who even offered me his umbrella when it rained! One word for our trip and stay AMAZING!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in several great hotels in Manhattan over many year. This included a Plaza suite. The Ritz Carlton Central Park South is best by far... I plan to stay here in the High Park View rooms every future trip--business/pleasure

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was very comfortable, and the bathroom was very large. We were there for a girls trip, so three of us shared a room. There was plenty of space. We all agreed this was our favorite location. Service at the hotel was also fabulous. One day we were given cute red bottomed chocolate shoes. If you're looking for opulence the lobby area is smaller than most Ritz Carlton's that I've stayed at. But for what I lack in the lobby space they make it for in service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I don't think there is a better location to stay in NYC. This hotel is across from Central Park. Just down from 5th Avenue which has all the shopping in the world in one direction and all the art one could desire in the opposite direction. The hotel is beautifully maintained. The rooms are well proportioned. The customer service can not be surpassed. They apparently keep a record of all the special orders or requests and have them waiting for you when you arrive. I drink a soda pop that is not easy to find and they always have some on ice for me. A very nice consideration.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had a fantastic long weekend at the hotel. The location was so convenient to shows, the park, shopping and museums. The room was a great comfortable place to relax at the end of the day. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Food and amenities made for a perfect stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: great location, kids can walk to central park, walk the highline, terrific restaurants nearby. in room dining was fast and delicious, room was not ready when we arrived but overall we would return, there were many families, this is a kid friendly hotel

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff is genuine and considerate. The property itself as well as the location are both perfect. Know that you are in for a real treat if you make use of the club lounge...would highly recommend doing so

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our stay at the Ritz over President's Day weekend was amazing. The hotel is beautiful and the accommodations are amazing. We had a suite and adjoining room facing the park that our kids just loved. Everyone at the hotel were super helpful with all our needs and made our kids feel very special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I, along with our miniature dachshund, thoroughly enjoyed our time at the lavish Ritz-Carlton Central Park. We live in Manhattan and had won the room at a charity auction, but we will highly recommend this beautiful hotel to our out-of-town visitors. While all of the Ladies and Gentlemen of the Ritz were lovely and accommodating, the superlative guest relations agent Ender Ozmelek went above and beyond with his offers to walk our pup, making sure we were comfortable, and in securing our pup's "pampered pooch" package amenities. He is a true gem. We look forward to a return “staycation” soon.
user_name:
geigej
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Even tho our room was not on the same floor as the club level lounge, which was a slight disappointment i must admit, it was a great resource to have access to; all day snack buffet and a calm and comfortable place to relax, check wifi, utilise concierge, chill out between sightseeing/shopping trips. It made the whole trip just feel a lot more like the fancy hotel stay in NYC that it was. Recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is just the perfect hotel in NYC! Every employee - spectacular! Cannot wait to return! The Club floor staff is impeccable - anticipate your needs, food beyond what you would expect and attentive to all you want and need. Great location - central to terrific restaurants, Central Park, and museums. A must for couples and families alike! Dont' miss!
user_name:
Susan D
Meriden, Connecticut, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent location, outstanding service, beautiful suites, great bar and restaurant. Classic Ritz service, warm welcoming and with all the extras you can imagine. Great place to stay for thanksgiving and the parade!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Love the location. The staff is excellent and remembers your personal tastes and are accommodating to your needs. The location is perfect. You are in walking distance to so many places. Transportation is always handle nicely.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As always the Ritz Carlton met the level of service and quality they are known for. The staff is friendly and quick to respond to your needs and requests. The hotel is in great condition and well maintained.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On a recent trip to NYC to attend the opera, my wife and I chose to stay at the Ritz-Carlton at 50 Central Park South. We picked this hotel because of our prior experiences with the brand and its convenient location in relation to the Metropolitan Opera at Lincoln Center. As expected, the Ritz provided us with a luxurious stay, with attentive, service-oriented staff and roomy, well-appointed accommodations. If you are looking for superb lodging or for a place to stay on that special occasion, you would not go wrong by booking a room or suite at the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is lovely and the service is fabulous. We have a lovely spacious room overlooking central park. All of the hotel staff was extremely accommodating. The room had every amenity we could need. Celine at the bar was especially friendly and knowledgeable on the hotel and its history.
user_location: North Kingstown, Rhode Island, United States
user_name:
Deborah H
North Kingstown, Rhode Island, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is great. Best about it is Location. Staff ate nice as well. But it has really dark rooms. Also I dont like their pillows much I will bring my own ones if I stay here again Thanks for this

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz is like no other (and we have stayed in them many times around the US). Amazing people, responsive room service, beautiful room! The staff was very attentive to our needs. We stayed here for a romantic getaway and will definitely be back!
user_name:
jkhirsch
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We'd stayed at the Ritz CPS five years ago, and it was top-notch. More than fairly priced. In the meantime we'd stayed at the Mandarin Oriental on Columbus Circle, with which we were not impressed. So this time I decided to compare pricing for the two properties because we were going to dine at One CPW. The Ritz was nicer, cheaper, and friendlier. It just proves that straying from an old favorite is a mistake.
user_name:
Joel K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: All service personnel we dealt with from check-in to check-out were extraordinarily professional. They all were at the top of their game with pride in how doing their job reflected upon the Ritz brand and your visit to New York City. They worked together as a team demonstrating years of experience in the hospitality field knowing how comfortable and relaxed this makes guests on a weekend getaway.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The room was the biggest room we have ever stayed in that wasn't a suite. The staff was very accommodating and pleasant. The bellmen were funny and welcoming and offered information regarding the surrounding area.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Pros: Beautiful Central Park view; comfortable bed, friendly front desk staff; central location Cons: Don't expect this hotel to be a "smart" one in tech sense. Made requests through Ritz-Carlton App but no one answered. Curtain doesn't close up well. Issue: About food quality: there's mould on breakfast berries which ruins my appetite.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I spent a 3 day weekend at the Ritz for my birthday. Our room was very nice, had a room with a view of the city's downtown and Central Park. The staff were so friendly, they make you feel like family instead of just hotel guests. My husband had told them it was my birthday and when we returned after the theatre I had a lovely birthday gift waiting for me in our room. Housekeeping was great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a hotel that treats you like family and addresses you by name as you come and go throughout the hotel. We had a wonderful stay, can't wait to go back again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I just completed a hectic visit to NYC...The work week was pressure filled and yet everyday I found an oasis at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South...The staff is amazing and truly demonstrates that they are the Ladies and Gentlemen of Ritz Carlton...I thank them all for making week a success.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We felt spoiled from the moment we handed the key to the valet. Relaxing environment and attentive staff made for a nice romantic time. Comfortable, quiet and close to everything. Easy walk to theatre district

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment we checked in until we left we were made to feel we were the only guests in the hotel. The staff knew our names and could not have been nicer and responsive. Terrific view of Central Park from our room.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment I checked in, I was beyond impressed with the impeccable service of the Ritz and the warm welcome by Jenny. Jenny was so helpful and made sure we were checked into a most lovely suite. She arranged for my Platinum Amex upgrade to be a spacious suite that made our quick trip to the city perfection. Jenny certainly represents the Ritz Carlton’s reputation of quality and elegance. Nick and Jorge from in-room dining were so friendly and Yolanda made sure the nightly turn down was just right. The workout room is also a decent size and well equipped unlike many NY hotels. I will definitely return to this hotel as exceptional customer service is spot on!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Decided to try the Ritz with my wife Because of it name, turn out it was a terrible decision. If your middle age or elderly this might be the place for you, as a 30 year old it was like a morgue! No vibe no ambiance and extremely outdated. They must not have updated the rooms in forever. You can not find an outlet to plug in your electronics, we had to unplug the lamp... this is not the 90's! Besides that we found a toe nail in our bed!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, great rooms, efficient and personal service. Had a more aspirational restaurent in the past. This is an area to improve as the current offering is blend and expensive. The decor as well as the food do not live up to the rest of the hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My boyfriend and I recently stayed here over the weekend and it was everything you'd expect a Ritz property to be - welcoming, gracious, detail-oriented, and classically beautiful. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Despite the great location,the price you pay is by far too excessive.The breakfast is a la carte,and in the morning you don't have the same time as dinner or lunch,so a buffet solution is much better.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: FIrst of all, the location is awesome. We could walk to anywhere we wanted which was important for this trip. The bellman, concierge and lounge upstairs and down are all personable and helpful. I was amazed at how helpful they were for the small things, when we called for a few things we needed across the street, they were delivered without us asking, because they knew we needed it that way at that moment, etc. The entire team was warm, hard working and welcoming.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Club lounge great Charles was most attentive and concierges on lounge level very helpful in setting up great dinners, shows, car service plus presented us with a jersey boy cd from the show we attended. General manager met us upon arrival and accompanied us to our room overlooking Central Park where there were balloons and a wonderfully decadent birthday cake for our birthdays which we were celebrating. Everyone very accommodating and professional. A wonderful stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz and enjoyed a Broadway show and dinner, First time at the Ritz/Central Park and the hotel added so much pleasure to our weekend that staying there was almost the highlight of the trip!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the hotel on a trip to see Hamilton which was my Christmas gift to my husband. Upon check in, we told the staff the reason for our visit. When we returned to our room after the show, we were welcomed by the sounds of Hamilton playing in our room. After our initial shock, we realized that the staff had given us a gift of the original cast soundtrack, and had it playing in our room that night. We were so overwhelmed by the thoughtfulness and the personalized gift - truly, an amazing Ritz Carlton experience. While I don't need to be reminded why we stay it the Ritz - the accommodations and service are always exceptional, but this experience reminded us once again why the Ritz is so amazing!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best hotel I have stayed at in NYC. Superb location. Excellent service. Great fitness center with both cardio equipment and weights. Hotel restaurant offerings were excellent and service was prompt and attentive. Ideal location for running in Central Park. Easy to feel at home. Lobby and lounge is intimate, warm and inviting.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a beautiful property overlooking Central Park. (Sadly our room did not overlook it, however). We were fortunate to have a Club Level reservation and had access to the Lounge and all of the food and drink servings each day. Our room was very clean and modern, and service was up to the Ritz standards. My only complaint about the room was the bed. We have stayed at other Rita's and you normally sleep on air in their beds - extremely comfortable due to all sorts of comfortable layers. These beds however were very hard with just a feather topper on it, and I slept poorly each night as a result. Maybe it's just me, so I won't call this a show stopper but I think it's something management should invest in so you get that Ritz Sleeping experience. Anyway, the staff were great as was the Club Level, which was on the second floor and had a nice view of the Park. Interestingly our room was not on the same floor as the club Level lounge, which I think was a first for us. Overall, this place lives up to the Ritz name and I'd recommend it for a comfortable stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Cassidy and the guest relations experts provided a level of personalization and attentiveness that is unsurpassed in all my experience. The entire staff, seen or unseen, helped to create a one of a kind furlough; memories from which we will always cherish.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We try to may it a point to stay at the Ritz Central Park at least once a year in a deluxe park view suite with club access. It is a extravagance but the hotel and the view from this level room is the best of the best. The service by the staff is second to none and they go out of their way to make you feel special during your visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I get away to NYC once in a while. We do hotel hopping if staying longer than one night. This was our second baby moon. We stayed at the Ritz, Waldorf, and Essex. The Ritz was by far the most special experience (it did not hurt I was a platinum Marriott elite). We got a room upgrade with an amazing view of the Central Park. Once the manager learned that we were on baby moon, he had their chef make a special assortment of chocolate for us as a gift. They offered champagne first but changed to chocolate since my wife could not drink - very attentive. We were not demanding guests but could feel staff's attention to our every need. Though pricey, their cocktails (I like to enjoy them in the lobby) are innovative, delicious, and boozy. Hands down, this is our favorite place to escape to in NYC. We feel so pampered here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay there ever year and love the staff and love club level.If you stay here make sure you enjoy the bar and the great spa that they have here. We love our room with the view of the park. Make sure you get a chance to have proper tea and champagne at brunch time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is beautifully situated on the edge of Central Park West. It has a small, intimate feel with a sophisticated yet cozy lounge area where they serve drinks and food. Our room had incredible views of Central Park West which was especially beautiful with a snowstorm. All of the staff went out of its way to give us the best possible service. We were upgraded to a suite which was luxurious and extremely comfortable. I unfortunately got sick with the flu and they were gracious enough to extend our check out time until late in the afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Visiting NYC for Christmas time. Stopped for drinks at the Ritz Carlton star lounge. Service was exceptional. The bartender Celine was so friendly, made our lunch so enjoyable. Food was great!! The elegant atmosphere was so enjoyable!! We usually stay over in the elegant rooms but only had time for a day trip!! Love the Ritz!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This ritz is like every other ritz. You'll never be disappointed. The staff is educated, caring and top notch. The quality of the rooms is excellent. We were on the 11th floor overlooking Central Park. We worried the sirens might keep us up but it was totally silent at night time. Absolutely nothing to complain about at the Ritz Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Magical property for our Family. A perfect location for all activity's in NYC. Now, our second stay, and consistently superlative service, attention to every wish, by a warm and genuinely caring, deeply professional Team. A special nod to Robinson Martinez, at the Front Desk, for his warm and gracious reception; our visit was made perfect due to his care. We are eager to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here with fine hotels and resorts through amex. I so regret changing my reservation to here from an upgraded room and a smaller hotel. I thought the amenities and location on the park would make it worth it. First off my disclaimer is that it was my first time to ny over the holidays. 58th was an absolute zoo and it felt like you were in the middle of a Disneyland extravaganza (not in a good way) every time you left the hotel. Our room with a park view was ok but the bathroom was the best part. A nice soaking tub. Except it was broken. So after waiting a half hour to check in in the crazy lobby, we find out that we won't be getting upgraded and our room has a broken front lock and I can't take a tub.When I called downstairs to tell them the problems they offer to move me 3 floors down and closer to the loud havoc on the street which I gruff lynnie declined. After 4 visits from the (very lovely and helpful) handyman, our room was finally in working order. Not only that but there were no bath amenities in the room and I had to call housekeeping for soap, salts, and they didn't have bubble bath... Silver lining is room service breakfast is divine! All in all wish we would have stayed anywhere else really. Especially considering the very expensive price tag. Not worth it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First of all, the lobby and its bar are small. Service is not up to Ritz Carlton quality. Rooms are adequate. There were marble bathrooms and separate tub and shower (which I really enjoyed). Location is great (for me it is the best thing about the hotel). I would not stay there again. I think there are better options in NYC for the same price.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this property for New Years Eve 2016/17. We have stayed in Manhattan dozens of times and have enjoyed many hotels, but this was our first stay at this property. We loved the quiet comfort and peace, even as the New Years festivities were raging in the city. Great service, great drinks, and great food made for a wonderful stay. We will be making this our exclusive property when visiting the city in the future!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff, location, rooms... can't be beat. The personal service is wonderful. Also the club lounge is beyond. I have stayed at Ritz Carlton hotels all over the country and the Central Park property exceeds expectations!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This elegant hotel not only provides a great location with wonderful views of Central Park, but the attentiveness of the staff makes you feel welcomed and someone very special. The Club Lounge provides wonderful bites throughout the day in a quiet atmosphere with lovely views. All of the staff demonstrate their readiness and eagerness to meet your needs. It makes great memories!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed for five nights over Christmas; in a room overlooking Central Park. View was outstanding. The room was spotless, and housekeeping was fantastic. The room amenities were as expected in a five star hotel. I also had access to the Club Lounge, which was very well staffed and provided ample and quality food and beverage offerings. In my opinion the negative reviews of the Club Lounge are simply not warranted. The Club Lounge is not meant to be an open and full kitchen; that is a restaurant. The hotel staff was very thoughtful and acknowledged an anniversary, my children with kids gifts, and left a nice note and CD post a broadway show we attended. Very nice touch and unexpected. Location of the hotel is near perfect for a tourist, and if you wanted, you can walk to most anything, or take a short Uber or cab ride to anything you would want to see as a tourist. I am a hotel snob, and this is one of only a handful of hotel stays were I did not have a single negative experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is lovely - close to the Park, Columbus Circle, 5th Ave (and other shopping), theatre, great restaurants, etc. The service here is amazing too. We stayed here for a Ritz Carton Fashion Week Experience - and it was stellar. Can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights before Christmas for a mini reunion before the holiday. The location is absolutely perfect and we enjoyed the overall ambiance of the hotel beautifully decorated. We had a basic courtyard room but it was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was fantastic. For NYC this was a great size and comfort having stayed at many hotels in the city. Overall we did not feel the service was anything special so that detracted from the experience. I had communicated in advance the desire to make our reunion special since we live far apart and did receive nice welcoming words and 2 drink coupons but that was the extent of the welcome. We have high expectations staying at Ritz properties so that is part of the issue. Nothing specific was noted that could be negative, just no one inquired into our stay, what we might need, etc. Also paid an lot for the club access and that was really underwhelming so unless there is a good rate would not specifically add here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was a special Christmas visit for me and my daughter. I will absolutely return to this elegant hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful, and personable from beginning to end. The service was incomparable to any other property in the area. The memories created will be unforgettable. The food and service for Tea was delicious and beautiful. I would suggest dining elsewhere for dinner as the food was average and the service was disappointing

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Totally ignored my booking request....both rooms were not matched to our requirements....and no real attempt to resolve....just happy to take the $12k I spent....and the hotel director didn't even bother to meet to help resolve....quite unbelievable

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We love visiting the city during the holidays. This was the first time we staying in the Ritz Carlton. Overall, the hotel and staff were great. However, we'll likely stay at the JW or another Marriott property next time where my platinum status actually means something. Being denied lounge access and not receiving a room upgrade certainly weren't my favorite parts of the trip...My wife and I really enjoyed the room service we ordered. The woman who delivered it was very pleasant. $110 for eggs and coffee was a little ridiculous, but when in Rome...One last issue, we were celebrating our anniversary, a milestone a noted in a response email to the one I received from the concierge before our stay. However, there was no mention made of our anniversary during our stay. Why do you email guests and ask if they're celebrating anything if you don't do anything for them in response?- Collin

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: An elegant and charming hotel with a location that is perfect for time spent doing a bit of shopping, dining and enjoying shows. Warm wood paneling and thick carpets made us feel cocooned and views of Central Park from our 22nd floor room took our breath away. The hotel is quiet and calm, with excellent service. A 'down side' (if I absolutely have to have one) is that the room did not come with tea or coffee making facilities. This is certain to be our #1 choice when traveling to NYC in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful time of year to be in NYC. Great hotel and the only place I will stay when I come into the city during the holidays. First class service and hotel. Comfy bed and pillows. Very clean. Only suggestion I would make is to upgrade your TV's and offer more channels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed here many times before-- always a great experience. The staff is fantastic all around, and the rooms are comfortably sized. A wonderful place to stay in New York, and very centrally located.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Same high prices for sub par service. This chain has long lost its luster. It was once known for impeccable service and you pay the hotel rate because you knew you were in for an amazing experience. Now you are lucky if they don't throw away your personal items or come and make up your room. And then after the fact the cheese plate doesn't cut it. Keep you cheese Ritz! Deliver on the service that made you famous. I'm writing this after a series of horrible experiences with this chain.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We always thoroughly enjoy the Ritz. We are frequent guests and can count on consistency, quality and enjoyment. We highly recommend the Ritz to our business partners, family and friends seeking quality accommodations. Thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The shape of the bed was very old and very uncomfortable. We only got service in our room 1 night out of 2. And our room service breakfast was $76 for 2 bowls of oatmeal, a bagel, and two coffees!! Unbelievable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service here is exceptional. We were there to celebrate a first birthday and they really surprised us with the room set up and amenities. The management and staff were all excellent. We will be back every year.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: from check in to check out, everyone had a smile on their faces..could NOT have been any more accommodating..Sent a large piece of b'day cake to our room, housekeeping actually left me a thank you note! Beautifully appointed, with very nice amenities. Room and hotel is very clean. Called twice for a delivery and both times the turn around time was almost immediate..highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Hotel has a terrific location and has been a past favorite for close to a decade. Must say, though, that the rooms are starting to look a little worn. Miss having the beside plugins for electronics and other minor upgrades, aka RC in Boston. Our visit this trip was fine but not quite up to prior stays. We come every year for Christmas for a long -- sometimes short -- weekend. In years past, the front desk would welcome us back and they would make sure we got a room with two double beds. I booked online so not sure what went wrong with the reservation but we didn't get the correct room and no acknowledgement of our annual return. Not a huge deal but in the past, it was a nice touch. Our program status was not helpful either. We arrived late in the evening so I called down to ask what time the lounge stopped serving food. I was told 12:30 but when we got downstairs, we were told 12. Thankfully our waiter was nice enough to take our order anyway even though the head waiter scolded him for helping us out. Jenny Liu checked us out and she was very nice. Gave us her card and offered to help with the reservation next time. Expensive hotel, especially during Christmas holidays but convenient for short walks to shopping, MOMA, St Patrick's, Radio City Music Hall and right across from the carriage rides in Central Park. Family friendly.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went for our 25th wedding anniversary. The staff went way above the call of duty. Best location to see central park a play and go shopping. We mentioned on our reservation it was our 25th. They then asked for wedding song/artist. It was playing on our arrival in our room. Then some chocolate covered strawberries showed up after our play and dinner. Just a wonderful time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent hotel in a perfect location near Central Park and away from the noise of Times Square. Rooms are far more generous than most NYC hotels. Service was very good. Beware that 5th Avenue is a mess around the corner near Trump Towers - construction, news crews and crowds.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We planned this trip to NYC for the parade early in August, it was to be a trip of a lifetime. I had requested a room with two beds, as there are three of us, along the parade route. When we arrived we were told that the rooms along the parade route would be an additional $1000 per night. We were also told there were no double bed rooms available, so we agreed to be in a room with one bed and a rollaway. We waited for three hours for our room to be cleaned and finally checked into our room with one bed on the park side. There was a strong odor when checked in our room due to a spray that housekeeping uses. The smell was so strong it was making us cough, so we tried to open the window which required a call to maintenance. Unfortunately after maintenance left we were unable to close and they had to come back to close it. We had to do this every time we wanted to open and close the window. We were told we would receive a rollaway bed; however, after waiting several hours, we were told there were none left. This meant all three of us (my husband, 10 year old son and myself), had to sleep in one bed. In my opinion, one of the best things Ritz has to offer is their bed. Unfortunately, this was not the case. The bed was the most uncomfortable Ritz bed I had ever slept in due to a very large ridge in the middle of the bed. We were told there we would receive a rollaway bed; however, after waiting several hours, were told there were none available. There were also several other maintenance issues. The sink in the bathroom wouldn't drain and the light in the bathroom blew out which required another call to maintenance. The second night we were given a rollaway bed, which made an already very small room much more cramped. My husband slept in the rollaway and I slept in the bed with my 10 year old as the bed was that uncomfortable. The third morning we were awoken by a phone call from the assistant manager Lindsay telling us she needed us to move to an inside room as she had someone that was requesting a park view room. I told her that there was no way we were moving after I finally got a rollaway bed and had everything in the room repaired. I couldn't believe how rude she was. I was not losing any more precious time in the city to pack and move just to convenience her. I couldn't even believe someone would have the nerve to ask. I asked to speak to her manager, and he immediately said that we would not need to move. The assistant manager is definitely in the wrong profession. We had limited time to spend in the city as we were only there over the Thanksgiving Holiday. When I think of all the time lost due to all the inconveniences it makes me sad. I wish we could get that time back as there was so much we didn't get to do. Other than the assistant manager, everyone was lovely including Jenny at the desk, the doormen and the house driver. It's too bad that one bad apple can ruin the whole bunch.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Recently, on checkout, the bellman happened to have ripped off the luggage tags from our suitcases. These were special, because they were from the Las Vegas Rock N' Roll Marathon. Just by chance, we called George in concierge. He took the info and said he would look into it. About two weeks later, we received a package at home with new imprinted Rock N' Roll luggage tags and t-shirts. What an example of customer service! Above and beyond the expected!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay in this wonderful hotel. It was a special event-filled weekend, and the hotel did all of the little things to make it even more memorable for us. The concierge handled our dinner reservations and made perfect selections! The housekeeping staff greeted us upon arrival and made sure we had extra supplies. There were treats from the manager left in our room each day -- the first was a note with a tray of holiday cookies -- and the second were CDs of the soundtrack for the musical we had just seen! Such a nice touch and just one of the reasons we will always return, even when the rate seems higher than elsewhere. I expect to pay more to be at this perfect location and at a Ritz-Carlton, but I am always pleasantly surprised by the extra attention to detail and the unbelievable customer service!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: During our recent Holiday trip to New York we had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park South. We could not have had a better experience. Great Hotel and outstanding service!! It was out first stay at the hotel and the staff was very attentive and made us to feel welcome!
user_name:
Z9616PPanthonym
Ft Worth Texas, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Hotel Staff is top notch from the Bell Service, Front Desk, Room Service to Security etc. The views and location to sites & events are perfect! If you like being pampered and catered to, this is the place.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is incredible. It was our second trip back to the Ritz this year. The hotel staff is phenomenal. Beginning with Felix at the front door who recognizes us as infrequently as we come and is always so helpful and accommodating. Special note is the staff in the Ritz Club Lounge. Lazar is extremely friendly and takes care of your needs before you even ask. Charles at the lounge is also so good and so nice. And Shannon is so professional and so helpful with restaurant reservations, play tix, etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
