review_body: WE thoroughly enjoyed our stay on our trip to the Ritz Carlton, Central Park, New York, would stay there again, everything was lovely . Our room was quite and comfortable and would choose t6hat area of the hotel again. The staff was outstanding.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time in NYC, and the Ritz made my experience extraordinary. I enjoyed my stay, loved the room, but would love to see the courtyard decorated. I felt like home when i arrived. I was very happy to the limit that i wanted to check out of my hotel and go the Ritz!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This used to be my favorite hotel in NYC. Poor service and rude employees have changed my mind. The location will always be great, but there are other options. The Ritz needs to step it up. At 600-1000 per night I have higher expectations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service was generally excellent! Club Lounge: The only lacking service was the club lounge. The persons at the desk, did not ever engage customers. They only look up when you make a request, then back to there computer. In addition, there was a server who had terrible body oder. I would cringer overtime he walked by the table. It lasted over several of my four night stay. The Facility: I was actually very disappointed with the facilities. They are very old. The elevators are fast, but many of the doors, (like the club lounge) are broken down and slam very very hard behind you. In addition, there are no plugs near the bed in the rooms. This is problem when trying to lay down and use the laptop for charging. No USB plugs pin the room. The TV has two remotes (very Old School). I would expect integration rather then using one remote turn on the TV and a mother to run the volume. The entrance lobby is very very unimpressive for a Ritz. Actually nothing more then a hallway. I have stayed at several properties on this street and found this one to have the most unimpressive lobby.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a great place in a great location. You will feel safe and can walk to almost everything. Great restaurants only blocks away, across the street from Central Park, Great shopping is all around you.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first stay at this Ritz-Carlton and overall had a great stay. Like most Ritz properties, the service was absolutely exceptional - they really could not have been more helpful and friendly and clearly were trying at all times to exceed our expectations. The location of the hotel is terrific as well and we had a really nice suite overlooking the park which was beautiful. The only reason I went with 4 stars instead of 5 is because the rooms (or at least our room) was in need of updating. The Club lounge is also a bit on the small side (at least compared to other Ritz properties) and could also use some updating. Having said that, the food and service in the Club lounge was exceptional. We look forward to staying here again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There is no place better to stay in NYC. Outstanding location and service from arrival to departure. The rooms have beautiful appointments, and the higher rooms look over Central Park. After a busy day in the city, the Ritz-Carlton is an oasis of solitude and rest when needed. I have stayed at a number of hotels throughout Manhattan, and this is my favorite. The Spa is also exceptional in every way. I only have superlatives for this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton - Central Park remains the best city hotel in the United States. The management and staff at this location have no equal. All of our needs were anticipated and all of our expectations were exceeded. This hotel sets the standard for luxury in a city setting.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had lunch in the bar before returning home!!! We all had burgers which were delicious. Everything was decorated for Christmas which was amazing a lovely welcoming hotel with a lovely atmosphere would love to stay on a return to New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stay here all the time so I'm a fan. The hotel is quiet and in a good location. The rooms are always clean and the staff is excellent. I would put this on the upper end of the Ritz Carlton experience. I don't eat at the restaurant very often and have found it to be a bit funky. I will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Reserved double room for wife, adult daughter 4 months ahead of travel & confirmed several times got stuck sleeping on a roll-way 4 nights @ $1100 a night. Tiny, crowded room! The poor accommodations @ this Ritz was not the same in Chicago or Phoenix. There are many other superior hotel options on the same block in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff and hotel first class. We made the mistake of eating in the hotel restaurant. Should have known better as the restaurant was empty on a Saturday night. My fish was half cook and half raw. It was returned and was not charge ,but it destroy the family meal.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Although reservations emails fell within the description of the room I received, the room I received was NOT a prime room for parade viewing. Had I known rooms for the parade were not all perfect viewing rooms I would have not stayed in this room category. Do not be misled by the room reservations team. If you are not on a very low floor (I believe below floor 5 on 6th avenue side) it is not worth staying in the Room as you can only see the tops of the balloons. When discussed over the phone I understood all rooms in the category were low enough to see the floats and balloons. Not the case. BE CAREFUL! Hotel in general is average. Be prepared for limited dining options and $10 cups of drip coffee at the restaurant.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was staying here using SPG points (good value upon transferring to Ritz points) for my 10th wedding anniversary. In my experience, NYC hotels just do not stack up to hotels in other cities (small rooms, apathetic service, unimpressive decor) and then I stayed here.... First and foremost, Eric at the front desk was pure class. He did his best to take care of us and saw to it that our anniversary celebration was memorable. We stayed in a suite and it was really nice - I have read in other reviews that the decor was dated - but I did not find that to be the case. The bed was super comfortable. There was champagne and strawberries and a letter acknowledging our special occasion. A wise man once said "little details, gentlemen, its what matters most". It seems the RC Central Park gets that. The service was truly outstanding.Location was great - right next to the park, walking distance to broadway and close to the subway (i wonder if anyone else staying at this hotel uses the subway!)I guess the goal in life would be to make this a "regular" hotel vs. a "special occasion" hotel - then you know you made it.
user_name:
adambr14
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The rooms definitely need more plugs and a larger tv as our eyes are getting weaker. Didn't like that they said we would get club level if available. After some complaining they offered club level for an extremely high add on - since we don't drink and we got breakfast with our reservation we didn't accept the ungenerous offer. We were very dissatisfied with the arrangements.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a luxury property at its best, bordering Central Park with a gorgeous view. We reserved a room two weeks before Thanksgiving and a day after my dad passed. From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed the Ritz Carlton family of employees took us into their arms and made us feel like we just arrived home. Thank you Ritz Carlton Central Park for your impeccable service and assistance at our time of need.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a fabulous view of the parade . The staff was friendly & helpful . Jenny Liu above & beyond to make sure our needs were met. I you every have an issue ask for Jenny .  The hotel has the best location for Central Park views , shopping , restaurants , etc .

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Service was 5 stars... rooms need upgrades: more plugs - tired carpet & furniture... bed had huge ridge in the middle #rotateonceinawhile... it wasn't bad but it WASN'T Ritz quality - hence the 5 star rating...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at several Ritz hotels over the years, but never this location. It was a special weekend as I was proposing to my girlfriend. (She said YES!) Unfortunately, the rundown condition of the Ritz forced us to move to the Mandarin, which was superb! Hopefully the Ritz will renovate soon as it's a great location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wonderful views Great staff and impeccable luxury make any stay here worth it. Great location for a walk in the park, some shopping, seeing the Christmas tree or a night at the theatre. Dinning and nightlife are only an Uber away
user_name:
Mark H
Point Pleasant, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best location,very personal service. Everyone knows your name. Amenities in the room are very good quality. Hallways and room furniture are a little dated. Still the best hotel in town. Will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: 5-Star hotel and treatment from start to finish. Still remember the most incredible breakfast we ever had. Love walking out the door directly across from Park. We had incredible communication from the first call and emails leading up to booking and to check in handling several requests. Our room was ready on time, was clean, view of the park and check out was a breeze.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was a great weekend and a great location. The Ritz was great and the staff made the marathon an even better experience by anticipating my needs. I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: great staff at all levels from doorman , reception , dining, drinks bar, concierge and ladies keeping the rooms in good shape, and staying, excellent hospitality, very helpful, courteous, great location, very personal service

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best of all locations possible- Central Park over the road- 5th Avenue around the corner-Staff brilliant from doormen !!!(plural) to concierge :outstanding were Timothy and Denise in reception - they will even arrange your theatre/show reservations if required. Rooms beautifully appointed and spotless.We upgraded to a park view (some internal rooms have limited views so take care to check if this is an issue for you) we did not regret.Surprisingly very little noise from outside traffic and inside the hotel, beyond the bars and reception area, there was a feeling of peace and relaxation just what we wanted after a hard day's sightseeing.Recommend? you ask Without a doubt we answer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful, gracious hotel. After a long cross-country flight, every staff member from doorman to concierge to desk staff was welcoming, accommodating, and couldn't have been friendlier. We were upgraded to a room on a high floor overlooking Central Park, which was spectacular. The room was beautifully appointed and spotless, with a recently remodeled bathroom that included an oversized enclosed shower. Room service was always quick, even at peak hours. Our concierge took extra time to make sure we understood his recommended subway routes, walking directions, and places to purchase Metro cards His restaurant recommendations were spot on. The lounge and public areas on the ground floor are not huge, which is common in NYC hotels, but are beautifully decorated and, again, staffed with personnel who never failed to go out of their way. The location is ideal for access to Central Park, the Met, theatre, and shopping. Expect heavy tourist foot traffic on Central Park South. All in all, a wonderful experience. We'll return as soon as possible.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff, warmth, service, beauty, amenities, comfort, and location are truly outstanding. My wife and I participated in the NYC Marathon and while it was truly an incredible experience, it was also one of the most challenging races. The Ritz made our stay truly special - and quite relaxing! Thank you to everyone for making our trip memorable!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nestled between the Plaza and the JW Marriott Essex House along West 59th Street, the Central Park Ritz Carlton is a fabulous hotel with the nicest staff and a wonderful location across from the park. The rooms are immaculate and the service is impeccable. The beds are extremely comfortable. The feather pillows are so soft and squishy that your head never wants to leave them. If you require a little special time to yourself, La Prairie has an exclusive spa located in the hotel. La Prairie products are amazing. We have been to several Ritz Carlton hotels and this one's staff has to be the best that we have encountered. All were very personable and glowed with enthusiasm for their jobs.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is the best! Everyone treated our children so nice. They went out of their way to make them feel welcome. The room and bathroom were very spacious compared to other NY hotels. Love the lobby bar!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the minute we arrive until the last farewell in the taxi to whisk us off, we feel for a time like royalty. Above and beyond the call of duty, always making our special visits even more special. Go!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed here usually for quick trips to NYC over the past 10 years. It is a lovely hotel in a wonderful location. The service used to be a positive aspect. This time was different. The check in was strange. Someone left a package for us and the concierge seems confused and put upon. In addition while another couple was offered bottled water at check in we were not. We also noticed that we had to open the main doors for ourselves, coming into and out of the hotel. That isn't hard to do, but different from our past experiences. Our suite was strange. We did not get a park view and that was perhaps the problem. However, the configuration of the room was more like two adjoining rooms rather than a suite. There was no flow and it certainly didn't feel like an indulgence. The rate is 2000/night, so perhaps based on location we should not have expected more. The view from the bedroom was of the other side of the building and in between was a filthy outdoor space. We were on the 4th floor, that made it worse. It was really unappealing. We kept the shades drawn and it was kind of unpleasant. We ordered room service and the food was not great. We mentioned it at checkout and they did not seem interested. Overall it seemed more like a 3 star hotel. We will be looking for another hotel for future trips to NYC. It's a little sad because it had been so nice on our other stays.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is one of those experiences that words can't describe. Great stay. The rooms were amazing. View was spectacular. Food was exquisite. The concierge was really helpful and assisted me in planning tours etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: nice location on central park with park view rooms, nice lobby for relaxing, small but pleasant dining room for breakfast, all a la carte. the ritz carlton renowned service applies here. rooms are clean scent size and well equipped. pleasure to stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Also had use of the Club Lounge which provided food, drinks and afternoon tea, which made our stay more enjoyable and convenient. The staff was invariably courteous and helpful in serving items, such as a special wine not ordinarily available,and in printing out boarding passes on our last day.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment you pull up at this Cenral Park location yo feel as if your singing and living the eIrving Berlin song, Puttin On The Ritz. There's no pretense just pure sophistication and exceptional service by everyone you meet. It's nice to still find a hotel that makes it a point to remember your name and treat you with kindness and a sincere sense of hospitality. The rooms are comfortable and quiet, well manicured and the real treat is to include club level in your reservation. The Club is on the second floor next to the wonderful La Prairie Spa ( treat yourself, you won't regret it). The service at the Club is not to be found at any other hotel in NYC. The food presentations could use a little more variety but they are still delightful as well as cocktails, wine and champagne. The evening cordials and deserts overlooking Cenral Park cap off a perfect night. Every time I stay here, I think of Fred Astaire singing Berlin's silly lyrics but even though it's a great luxury hotel I don't mind as Astaire sings: "spending every time having a good time, putting on the Ritz." DJH

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love the Ritz on Central Park. This hotel was built back in the day when hotels were elegant, and service was all about the customer. And it remains that way to this day. From the moment the doorman opens the door as you arrive, to the moment you leave, there is nothing they won't do to help their patrons. The location is perfect: you can get up in the morning and walk to Central Park. It is also walking distant to wonderful neighborhoods, shopping, Rockefeller Center, and the theater

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I travel over 120 days per year and often have to stay in New York. Really not my favourite city. So it is stressful at the best of times. This hotel was like its own mini oasis, and I have to say that I can't say enough about the hotel. Even by Ritz standards.Pros:- can't beat the location if you like to be near Central Park - you are right across the Street- good proximity to lots of restaurants, convenience stores, etc.- rooms are spacious, linens and beds are great- very good internet and tv service- concierge and business Centre is very helpful - in fact I had packages arrive after I checked out of the hotel and they made sure they were directed to me quickly and painlessly- it is right beside a reciprocal club of the one I belong to in Toronto which provided easy access to an amazing gym and pool- room service was really good- the bathroom and tub was amazingCons- none really except for price - which really isn't fair considering it is a Ritz and it is New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I use Ritz world wide, some more glamorous than others. This property is very well suited for NYC, dead center walking to Madison and 5th Ave glamour shopping and restaurants. European ambiance and attentive service with even their basic rooms, large baths, are very pleasing and well appointed. I would like to see the club lounge, next time, but the lobby Bistro was good with attentive service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The reception was not cordial ... It was a very Big Disappointment !!! My expectations were too high .... Ms Christine Almendola didn't have the decency to cater a gold member of Ritz :((((What a big difference from my Ritz Carlton Battery Park !!!She declined my request for a rollaway bed , stated " as a fire hazard concern " but then , my folio showed charges for it !!! What the ????The Ritz Carlton Central Park is overrated every sense of the word !!!The room was small , I can stay in other property with half amount for room rate .I can commend Mr Felix , the valet parking guy !!!The place is cramped everywhere ... I visited their Auden Bistro restaurant , sorry to say , no ambiance . When I checked my reservation a night before my check in with Rachel , she was very cordial & welcoming , I came to see the place & spoke to the reception of the restaurant , stated that their computer was down , got concerned & cancelled my reservation for dinner for 20 people for my husband & nephew's birthdays . Discussed it with my family & cancelled our reservation right away , instead we booked our dinner to another restaurant half a block away which I'm going to review as well , my husband ended up sleeping on the floor since the rollaway bed was declined by the manager herself . For the comfort of my autistic child to be sleeping alone on their small beds . Then, I was sleeping with my nephew's daughter on the other , so , nobody will sleep on the floor in their room. To my high expectation , the view from our room was horrible !!! What a disappointment !!!!I told my family & friends not to bother staying @ Ritz Carlton Central Park !!!!This was my honest experience .The positive experience was the great welcoming service of Mr Felix , valet parking guy .The location is good right across the Central Park .Mr Harrison & Ms Thei at the reception were not cordial , worst dealing with Ms Christine Almendola !!!You can read the difference to every reviews I've done before !!!Not staying there anymore .... Not recommended !!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: While the location of this hotel is among the best in New York, it does not provide good value for the money in my opinion. For over $1,000/night for a standard room, we would have expected much more. The club level was also disappointing relative to other Ritz Carlton hotels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Service and location the best combination for this property. My wife and I walked to two plays, great restaurants, to church and to a museum all without a cab. Very large room, and service was outstanding.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was an amazing HOTEL... I would highly recommend for anyone to stay at this hotel.. Service was amazing from the minute you walk in to the time you check out. I will definitely be visiting again. Great Job Ritz!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, service, ambience and amenities. We loved the friendliness of the staff. It is an older hotel but had all the conveniences we needed. Subtly tasteful and welcoming to all. We had a corner room and even without the park view enjoyed the spaciousness and security.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is definitely the best choice that caters to all travelers. Whether it's a special occasion, business or family trip (which was my case) you won't be disappointed. It was 5 of us including a 4 year old so we reserved 2 connecting rooms. If you're looking for a view you have to let go of the connecting room idea. For us it was important though the connecting factor. The staff are so upscale without being pretentious. The ambiance is stunning and opulent yet very warm and welcoming. I found the service to be reckoned with at this particular location anyway. We usually frequent The Mandarin, however that will not be the case anymore when we go to New York. You're close to everything by foot and I really don't like to walk so if I say you're close its close. To places like Rockefeller, Columbus square, great shopping venues on and 5th and others, Empire State Building, Central Park is across the street, Time Square,pharmacy, cafes and great dining options. In room dining food as is okay however not a representation of the culinary deliciousness NY has to offer. Now with that being said our stay overall was so wonderful that I still would not stay any place else! Also they have great security and such a strong sense of safety though out the hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here with family for 5 days. The Ritz is everything you expect it to be, great service with smiles, well appointed rooms with all that you need, quiet and across the street from Central Park. The beds were incredibly, don't think I've ever slept so well in a hotel. Unlike other properties I've stayed at, this one actually feels a little bit like a boutique because it's got a smaller foot print. There's only one restaurant on the premise but the breakfast was superb albeit on the expensive side. Good option for families or business. Besides the park there were many amazing restaurants around, and it was only a 5 min walk to all the shops on 5th ave.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family had a wonderful weekend stay at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park! We were immediately greeted upon our arrival by Pete, a guest relations agent who also personally escorted us to our room. He and all of the hotel staff we came into contact with during our stay were very friendly and welcoming. We have two young daughters, and during our stay the hotel surprised them with personalized treats and a memento from a Broadway show we mentioned we were seeing. We had a room with two double beds, and it was spacious, nicely furnished and very comfortable. The hotel's location on the south end of Central Park is fantastic. While we tended to use the convenient subways, many areas and attractions are within walking distance including Broadway, Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the Metropolitan Museum of Art. We had a fabulous experience at this Ritz-Carlton, and I hope we'll have the opportunity to stay there again in the future!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Could not get me into the room I booked. Waited hours to get my room even though I had an early check in I still did not get into my room until 4 PM both nights. I most likely would check out other high end hotels first.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location, great staff and good size rooms overlooking Central Park. Feels like a boutique hotel in the middle of the NYC. All the amenities one could hope for. Room service was great but the food (breakfast) was disappointing; but who is there for the food. If you love to run in Central Park like I do this is a great location also close to all the shopping.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Celebrating big birthday! Greeted with attention to our stay.Highly personalized, upgrade, awesomeroyal treatment. Snacks, cookies, bottled water. Well located in heart on NYCDon't miss La Prairie Spa!!
user_name:
Jacklyn C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We only had one night to spend in New York City. Our experience at the Ritz-Carlton was so lovely, so relaxing that we felt as though we were on an entire vacation. We were treated royally from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. I can't imagine how they manage to make each guest feel special!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at Ritz Carlton for 3 days and it is great experience. The service is perfect and you can only feel very well here. It is directly located at the Central Park and Time Square is only a few blocks away. Sure from pricing higher than other hotels but it is worth.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Hotel in excellent location! Staff are ok but Managerscare very attentive. Not a lot of amenities as other Ritz. Room are small and only the 1 king beds have view of Central Park. Quite pricey $12 for a small cappuccino!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were treated so well in every area of the hotel; from the doorman to the spa staff. The hotel even decorated my daughter's room for her birthday complete with balloons, flowers, sparkling cider, and strawberries.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Top notch, will stay there again without hesitation. Service was excellent, room was great, great bathroom with the best hotel shower I have ever experienced. I actually felt the staff cared about our experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Brought my wife for a little business and anniversay trip. The Ritz is a beautiful facility with outstanding customer service. Check in was very smooth and friendly as was check out. Bell guys were thoughful,helpful and funny. Love the quiet of the room;the elegance and location of the hotel . Very nice visit to the big Apple. We will return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Love this property, can't beat the location and is a consistently great experience. One of my fav hotel brands. Directly across from Central Park, short walk to 5th ave or to Columbus Circle/Lincoln Center.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a Ritz hotel in a very good location - so I will not bother to expound on that. You know what you're getting. But, on another point, be careful as you may not know what you will be getting for a specific room once you are in the hotel. We had a very odd experience here. I booked a room with two queen beds and a view of the park. I booked it online, and then called the hotel directly to confirm. When we got there, they told us no such room was available and took us to a king - bedded room. When we protested , in a polite, not hostile way, they took us to a double queen room facing an air shaft. Eventually a manager relocated us to a nice suite (which by the way STILL did not have the bedding we requested - I slept on the pull out couch) but not before insulting us and accusing us of being rude to his staff, which we most definitely were not. He was the most obnoxious man! The only thing that saved the day was a lovely room service butler (Stavros?) who brought us a bottle of wine, apologized for the hotel's mistake, and really demonstrated what service was all about. If you want a room with two queen beds and not a king, this is probably not a good choice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed here several times and it is my Fav NYC Hotel.Right across from Central Parkwith simply wonderful views.The staff is great...the rooms are intimate and quiet.The bar is cozy and you will see the famous knocking back a few brews when visiting the city.The concierge is truly a genius at getting tickets and reservations at impossible to get into events and restaurants.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family love to stay here, totally amaze me and my family. Nice and beautiful view park view from our room.The location is perfectthe breakfast was awesomethe service was excellentPlease keep it up
user_name:
hildabasukisanders
West New York, New Jersey

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I often head to NYC for the weekend for dinner and show. We love staying near Columbus Circle across from Central Park for its convenience. This was the first time we decided to try a different hotel. We were pleasantly surprised that we absolutely loved the Ritz Carlton. Beautiful, well priced, service couldn't have been any better! Wow! A winner! We will be back, Ritz Carlton, the next time we decide to have a weekend in NYC. Thank you Dayna P#TravelDiva
user_name:
TravelDivaDayna
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Felt real sad to leave this hotel but bit expensive for us. Brill location, room, service everything! Would def recommend. Love to go back. One of those special places and should have 10 stars. Breakfast was awesome

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at the Ritz central park several times,and each stay has been excellent.We have always received first class treatment and been made to feel welcome and appreciated.This trip was in celebration of our 30th wedding anniversary and our room was upgraded upon arrival to a beautiful Park view room,we have stayed in other NYC hotels and think it can't get any better than the Ritz !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here while visiting NYC with a friend. LOVED the location. Right by Central Park and walking distance to Time Square and close by attractions. If you stay here try to stay at the concierge level. Great food, great staff with excellent customer service and knowledge of the city. Great view watching the horse carriages lined up across the street.Bathrooms nice and big. Beds comfortable. If you can get a room with Central Park view. Priceless.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the staff to the actual hotel room, every little detail was taken care of at the highest level. Thank you Ritz for employing the most extremely competent and true brand ambassadors of your organization. It was a true pleasure and we look forward to our next stay.
user_name:
Katrina F
Palos Verdes Estates, California

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed at a lot of Ritz-Carltons although the Central Park South location sets the standard for service, quality, location and amenities. This was a fantastic experience and a must stay location in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located to the South of Central Park the hotel is in a convenient, very animated and touristic location. A few minutes from 5th avenue and the hype upper east side, a lot can be done walking. The view over Central Park is priceless and above all, service and attention to details are of high standing. Classic decoration. We've had room service and Stratos made sure we spent a lovely in room dinner. Many stars come to this hotel, i must admit though we've seen none.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Gorgeous property with a great location, loved the lobby and the executive club! The staff is very hospitable and well trained. The views are the best! The spa is definitely a must try. We really enjoyed our stay.
user_name:
KG279
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The view of central park is Priceless. The service here is exceptional and the rooms are great. The bathrooms have separate showers and tubs and are very spacious. I had a massage the the Spa was great, we had room service and ate at the restaurant and both were exactly what you would expect from a 5 Star Hotel.
user_name:
Russell W
Augusta, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located right next to Central Park which in my opinion is best location in New York. All the staff go above and beyond...Larza in the club lounge deserves a special mention....such a nice genuine guy and a credit to the hotel. Club lounge is very nice overlooking the iconic Central Park with a great choice of food and drinks.Wouldn't want to stay any where else if I return to New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved the location of this hotel. Staff friendly and attentive. The room was excellent as was the house keeping. room service was quick and the service next to none. Had every convenience needed. Loved this place and will be back again!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our room was very nice and the staff was very helpful. However, they need to upgrade some easy amenities like having coffee in the room, a small fridge and ice that is easily accessible. Every lesser hotel in the world provides these things. I don't like to have to get dressed to get my morning coffee or call to ask for some ice for my drink. Do not eat breakfast in the hotel. It was the most expensive meal of our trip. The portion was way too large and $10 for toast, $20 for oatmeal, $10 for coffee is outrageous. They could lower the prices 30% and still make a profit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went to NY on business. I was in NY at the Ritz for 14 days. It was absolutely amazing. In the heart of everything. The Ritz is located across the street from Central Park. The hotel is great. The food is delicious. Staff is super friendly. This hotel has it together. Will be returning at the end of the year.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Much of what you would expect from a RC property. Very good staff and very efficient service. We had a deluxe room which was spacious and well furnished and decorated. The room had all the amenities one would expect (luxury toiletries, desk etc.). Located between 6th and 7th Ave on 59th Street, this is perfect for shopping and Central Park. Everything in the area is pretty expensive as one would expect for the location. Concierge service very efficient in recommending and booking restaurants etc. It should be noted that this is a traditional hotel, not one of the buzzier places and as such, does not have a lively bar/restaurant. If you are looking to party in the hotel, this is not the place or district. Our room had an awful view basically facing the inside courtyard and the other towers of the hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've rarely written a negative hotel review before (if any that I can recall) and am hesitant about this one because I believe in the old cliche, "if you can't say something nice then don't say anything at all". People are quick to damn and slow to praise.We moved to The Ritz Carlton Central Park South for 6 days after 5 days at The Crosby Street Hotel Soho. We did this to experience two different areas of NYC as we have done 3 times before on our trips to NY and it works well for us.New York was in the middle of its third heatwave this summer and although a newer hotel, The Crosby air conditioning was fantastic from the nightmare heat.However, we were so sorry we left it as The Ritz Carton's aircon was abysmal and unable to cope, especially in our lovely room overlooking the park.The engineer who came to help, changed the filter and said that 18.5 degrees Celsius was the lowest setting and he couldn't help further. It was completely unacceptable and made sleeping very difficult as on high speed the noise from it was not tolerable either. It took 24 hours to reach something like 22 degrees Celsius which still was uncomfortable.We complained further, to no avail.The hallways were unbearable with no apparent air con at all, but one only had to tolerate this in order to get to the elevator from the room.As it wasn't possible to stay outside for more than 10 minutes without difficulty in breathing, our plans to walk and see the sites and use the most beautiful park in the world were curtailed. Everyone was suffering, even the hotel's doormen.This climate and temperature is not the first time NY has experienced such heat and humidity. "Fourteen of the fifteen hottest years have occurred since 2000 as heatwaves have become more frequent, more intense and more longer lasting". (The New York Times. Aug 20th. 2016) . So, not exactly a new phenomenon for NYC or the hotel.The Ritz Carlton is an oldand clearly in need of much renovation which is obviously happening soon.But, to expect guests to put up with such conditions when clearly this has been experienced by the hotel before is unsupportable.Inexplicably, The Auden restaurant's aircon blasted such Arctic air that it was impossible to eat there without returning to one's room to get a jacket and long pants......the contrast from the rest of the hotel such an outrageous anomaly.I sincerely believe that the hotel morally owed it's incoming guests an explanation and apology about the poor functioning air conditioning in the extreme heat and humidity. Then, possibly the ethical thing to do was to offer them alternative accommodation, should they choose.But, this probably would have meant a certain loss of income at a relatively quiet time in the city?

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Having stayed at other Ritz Carlton hotels we thought that this would be a safe choice for our visit. Upon arrival we were checked in promptly but when we asked if we had a room overlooking Central Park we were told that there was a quite considerable additional charge. Reluctantly we agreed to this and were shown to our junior suite. The room was very comfortable and well equipped, with a good sized bathroom and plentiful wardrobe space. Housekeeping maintained it well throughout our stay. Unfortunately we were extremely disappointed with the club lounge. It was very small and we often struggled to find somewhere to sit. Drinks service was slow and our preferences were not remembered and breakfast and the food presentations were extremely limited and repetitious. Breakfast was entirely self service and they ran out of glasses for fruit juice and expected us to use paper cups! At the very least it would have been nice to have coffee served and topped up. Unfortunately the club level let it down to such an extent that we would not consider ever going back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You could be forgiven for missing the Ritz as you walk down Central Park South, it is unassuming along a street jam packed with grandeur.As soon as you are greeted at the door though it is a different story; every single member of staff was friendly, made us feel welcome and couldn't assist us enough. The service was slick at every moment, our bags delivered to the room moments after we arrived, papers, drinks and ice seemed to arrive just before we needed it!Turn down seemed perpetual even though we rarely saw the maids. The bathroom was stocked with all that we needed (including bath salts, spare collar stays and H&H robes)The room was a great size - not huge but plenty of space for a couple. We booked a city view and we feel like a kind of bonus to have received a view of both the city and the park - it was beautiful.Not once the whole week did we hear anything from any other room, which was pleasant not to be disturbed.In the round I was extremely impressed with the whole week at the Ritz Carlton and I would thank them and stay again in a heart beat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I debated for a bit on how I would rate the Ritz Carlton New York, Central Park. To be fair, my 6-year daughter and I stayed only one night. I redeemed 70,000 Marriott points for the stay. The hotel was smaller than I expected, but nicely furnished. The hotel was unable to give me the complimentary upgrade I was entitled to due to it being unavailable. When I asked if I could be upgraded to the next available room, they said it would cost $900 for the upgrade. No thanks. The room I was given (an interior room with no view) was quite large at approximately 500 square feet. It was well appointed, but in need of refreshing as the bedskirt and wall fabric had some stains. The hotel's location is great. We were so close to Central Park, the Time Warner Building, and Times Square. I will say that I was disappointed by the hotel's service. Last month we traveled to the Ritz Carlton Naples for nine days and perhaps, we were spoiled by Naples' superior service. In comparison, the Ritz Carlton New York was lacking. However, my daughter loved feeding the horses outside and was gifted a Matilda soundtrack which we listened to on our drive home. I will say that the size of the room and the location makes this hotel very desirable. I would consider returning just to take advantage of those two benefits but I would not pay the rack rate for them.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A two-night stay with our 4-month old son, celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary, became an unforgettable experience thanks to the wonderful folks at the Ritz Carlton. Their outreach and inquiries about our visit ahead of time led them to prepare a marvelous surprise for my husband and me after the concierge staff had made arrangements for a delightful dinner at Tavern on the Green. They also had ready some terrific swag for our baby. Everyone from men at the front door to the service staff on the hall were kind, gracious, and helpful. The entire staff struck the perfect balance between formal professionalism and affectionate good humor and warmth. We felt like the most important people in the city. As a same-gender couple, this was particularly welcome and appreciated.
user_name:
Daniel S
Annapolis, Maryland, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the best hotel in NYC. The thing that raises it above all the others is the people. The attention to their clientele is superb. From the bellman to the front desk staff, from the bartenders to the concierge (and especially the concierge), this hotel delivers. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Manhattan.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I are Ritz Carlton veterans. A Ritz visit has long been our favorite splurge. We honeymooned at Ritz Kapalua, had our first anniversary at Ritz St. Thomas and are regular visitors of their Toronto property. So when we chose NYC for our second anniversary, Ritz Carlton's Central Park property was our first choice. There is no service like Ritz Carlton service. Full stop. This property was no exception, and we were thrilled with the front desk and maid service folks. We opted for access to the concierge lounge, which turned out to be very disappointing. I found the staff to be very stuffy (despite the sometimes stuffy clientele, the concierge lounge staff has, at other RC properties, proven to be super friendly). The food selection was atrocious -- small flavorless appetizers, food running out, etc. The drink selection was also quite sparse. The NYC culinary scene is daunting. I tried to use the concierge for restaurant recommendations, but wasn't impressed with anything they recommended. I explicitly asked for 'local' recommendations (i.e. nothing touristy) and was continually referred to overpriced, underdelivering restaurants. Eventually, I just did the leg work myself. From a location perspective, now knowing the layout of Manhattan, I would avoid staying near Central Park. Everything that's 'happening' is south of Central Park, and my wife and I found that we spent hardly any time at all in or around the hotel. In short, if you're looking for a true RC experience, I would recommend you avoid the Central Park location. There are plenty of other big city locations -- Toronto, Montreal -- that beat out this one.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The location is excellent, the facility is outstanding, all of the people are very friendly and helpful, and there are not are not enough superlatives to describe this hotel.When I initially had a problem with the toll-free reservations line, the rooms manager, Lindsay Myers, not only immediately corrected the problem, but made me feel as special a guest as Ritz-Carlton would want to guest to feel. Lindsay went above and beyond, and it is people like Lindsay who will make me keep coming back to this hotel.When I was checking out, there was a possibility that my flight out of New York might be canceled because of Delta's computer problems. Jenny Liu at the front desk was very reassuring and helpful, and went above and beyond in making me feel comfortable that if I needed to stay another night in New York, I certainly had no doubt where I was going to be staying.Thanks to all of the staff at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South for making our visit outstanding, but especially to Lindsay and Jenny for making it a most memorable one.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for 5 nights on a reward reservation and had a great time here. The staff contacted us in advance to ask about any special requirements or if we were celebrating anything, and since it was our anniversary I told them that. They asked me for our favourite song, a picture of the two of us, and our wedding colours. I won't give away what they did with the information, but it was pretty stunning!We were upgraded to a room with a view of Central Park, which was lovely. The room was spacious, and both elegant and comfortable. Everyone we dealt with during our stay was very friendly, which helped make it a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The best location in the city, facing the famous Central Park.The room has everything special that you need during your stay.Beautiful decoration, room, lobby and everywhere. Service exceptional and staffs are very competent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: So awesome to stay here right next to Central Park and also the museum too. This part of town isn't as busy as others so it's a preferable spot for me. I can always just hop onto the subway to all the action anyway. There's so much to do and see, I can never get enough of this city. The hotel is beautiful, immaculate, comfortable and grand.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for the second time. Our first experience in 2012 was so good we just had to go back! On both occasions, we had just made the lengthy trip from Melbourne Australia and it was a fantastic way to start our holidays in North America. The location is brilliant, overlooking Central Park and within easy walking distance of all of the many highlights Manhattan has offer. The building is grand and the rooms are quiet, spacious and supremely comfortable. All of the staff are exceptionally can ourteous and helpful. We particularly appreciated the concierge staff who were able to attend promptly to all of our enquiries (including booking great seats in Broadway theatres.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This beautiful hotel located at 50 Central Park South is a total gem. The grand architecture of the 1930s building is brought perfectly together with 21st century luxury. From the beautifully elegant lobby, elevators gleaming with old fashioned wood work, and rooms full of modern conveniences, this hotel offers the best of everything. Special appreciation to Cassidy in Guest Relations for making my stay extra special. After returning from seeing Waitress on broadway, I found the music playing on the Bose system in my room - totally fabulous indeed! Can't wait to plan my return visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a two day meeting in NY and service and accommodations were good. Banquet facilities were up to par along with food. Menu items reflected fall cuisine. Hearty vegetables seasoned to perfection. Nice diversion from Marriott NY.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It is a very good hotel in extremely well located region, but that combo comes with a price.Room is impeccably clean, although they might forget to leave some essentials sometimes: in my case were the bath rugs.They can definitely make something unique for you (without asking you for it, which is really impressive), but as I did face some minor problems during the stay, I believe I can't say my experience was entirely excellent.The problems? They were all taken care by the management, which maybe shows how different is the management approach to solve guests issues when compared to some of the staff.Again, overall, a very good hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I recently stayed at this property with my teenage daughter for a girls getaway. Everything about our stay was fabulous! The property sits right on 59th St at the south end of the park and the view from our room was gorgeous. The room was spacious and well appointed, from the incredibly comfortable mattress and pillows, to the beautiful bathroom with all the amenities you might need including the plush robes available for your use. Plenty of closet and drawer space in the bedroom and more space than two women needed for all of our toiletries in the bathroom! My only complaint with the room was the hair dryer. I almost always travel with my own but this time I chose to leave it at home to save space in my carry on bag. The dryer provided produced almost no heat and the little bit that it did provide came along with hurricane force winds. I even requested a replacement and they bet quickly brought a brand new dryer up, still in the box. They get points for that, but alas it was only marginally better than the older model. A very small issue as I can always bring my own. A nice touch was the free shoe shine service that is provided nightly. Place your shoes in a bag outside your room and they are returned prior to 7am, nicely shined, no charge! Check in was a breeze. We arrived several hours prior to check in time and they had a room ready for us within 45 minutes. Late checkout (2:30) was provided as well so we could stay until we had to leave for the airport. Concierge service was excellent. Very knowledgable staff and happy to make any reservations you need or want. I would definitely recommend this property and can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Spent four nights at the Ritz Central Park. Was on the 19th floor overlooking Central Park. The greeting from the staff is always generous, sincere and inclusive. The room was perfectly appointed and the views perfect. My current experience and those of the past make the Ritz Central Park my favorite NYC choice. Last time I visited the staff knew I loved my visit to Broadway. When I returned to my room my last night the turn down service was complete but this time the music playing was the cast CD of Hamilton! They'd gifted me the complete CD package as a thank you for visiting their spa. I love getting a massage from their very competent therapist. Looking forward to my next trip to the Ritz Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I visited the Ritz Carlton Central Park again for my birthday. It is a wonderful property. As a Marriott Platinum member, I was entitled to an upgrade but Lindsay Meyers, the front desk manager put us in the Central Park Suite. A truly magnificent room. We also came back to birthday cupcakes. The rooms was impeccable but what makes this property special is the service. One of my favorite properties.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went to the lounge with my girlfriend and had a drink, went out for dinner and came back for a night cap. The bartender was a treat beyond all expectations. He took us on a tour of the world of gin, never knew the science of dry martini!! Now I do! A must visit!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great time in Manhattan New York!We stayed here for one day before taking a Caribbean cruise to the Bahamas, with a stop in Universal studios Florida on Norwegian Cruise Lines. Highly recommended to spend a night (or more) in Manhattan. NYC!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best Hotel in New York City, Very quiet, very safe, best service. The concierge gave us all the information: Where to go, best restaurants. The hotel is clean and the staff is perfect.We will be back, it's worth every penny...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing hotel! Great attention to detail from the moment that you walk in, and even the "superior" rooms are spacious and comfortable. And the soundproofing is second to none. We had a room on a lower floor with a city view, and we could not hear anything. Not even sirens.Each room has a soaking tub, and bubble bath is just a short service call away. And the location is wonderful. It's just a few steps away from one of the main entrances to Central Park West.My family and I are already planning our next trip.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel three times in the last month. It's a good hotel. I sort of characterize it as being like the Waldorf was thirty years ago, only with better service.The location is great if you are working midtown. Good restaurants, near most midtown offices, etc.The rooms are clean. Sometimes you can get an HVAC unit that is a bit noisy. The hallways can be strangely warm in the summer. Pick a high floor for noise.Taxis are not usually a problem. Don't let them drop you off across the street in front of the Park. You will risk stepping in horse dung.The Club lounge is terrific and multicultural. Greta in particular was a terrific help for various matters. Good presentation of food and even gluten free cookies!The restaurant service was almost ridiculously bad. Bringing the wrong food, very slow, poorly cooked salmon. Not sure what was going through my head to eat in the hotel last night when I could've gone to so many different restaurants nearby.The beds are okay, the bathrooms fine.Housekeeping does a great job.Valet service is good, although I had to re-iron a shirt when it came back a bit too rumpled.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Arrive on July 3rd from Anchorage, Alaska. Limousine at JFK, still the same driver as last time who remember everything about me (my 3 wives , and the kids). The suite, same as last trip, always comfortable and perfect, It is really a pleasure to come back here everytime. And what I enjoy more is the sense of feeling home, always the same staff, no new faces. I will return over and over.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have been coming to NYC for years and this is only our second time at this hotel. We had to stay at others due to business. Last June was our first visit to this Ritz (see that review last June). We went one night for July 14th for my husband's birthday from our home in Boston. I did book a club lounge room and we were upgraded to a deluxe room. I will always get a club lounge access room, well worth the money, the food there is enough for meals and delicious. Before our stay I worked with guest services to arrange a small surprise cocktail party with local friends at the Lamb's Club before the play Hamilton. They were helpful in arranging that party there. When we got back from the show, there was a birthday cake for my husband with music playing from the show and a CD from Hamilton as well! The customer service in the club lounge is fantastic. After we checked out of the hotel and were at the airport in Teterboro, NJ. I realized I left my wedding ring and engagement ring in the bathroom on the sink back at the hotel. I immediately called the club lounge and spoke with Felix who along with security found the rings. They then arranged a driver to bring me the rings in a secure envelop to the airport where I met the driver. Yes, I had to pay for the car service to bring my rings to me, but the outstanding customer service to find the rings and deliver them to me was above and beyond! This will be our only hotel now to stay at while visiting NYC. Thanks to Felix and all the great staff in guest services, I can't thank you enough for finding my rings and delivering them to me, I was beyond frantic. At the FBO Meridian at TEB, the lady there said if I had to loose my rings in any hotel in NYC that is the place to do it, she mentioned they sent a team to that FBO for an inservice on customer service to train their employees. We will be back to that Ritz again, thanks everyone!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located right across the street from Central Park, the Ritz has spacious, beautiful rooms. Nice work out room as an alternative to walking/running in the Park. You can use the sauna in the spa as a guest of the hotel. Service is wonderful - everyone is very nice and helpful. If you are not staying in the hotel, stop in for afternoon tea or a drink in the large lounge area. You just never know who you might see!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: That was an experience :)Superb services, in a great locationThe Executive lounge was just amazing, foo, service, athmosphere...wowGym, spa and Sauna...what a treatment..Location, location, next to the centralpark...easy to get anywhere...Stilish in big Apple...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great view of Central Park! One of the classier Hotel in the country! A must if you are visiting NY. The restaurants in the Hotel are also fabulous!!! We like the large, clean rooms and the large bathrooms. We'll have to stay there the next NY visit!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great prestige hotel on Central Park! From check in to check out it was faultless. Traveled with two teenagers, rooms were large with nice big bathrooms, separate shower, bath, toilet. Luxurious toiletries. A very warm welcome from front door to reception, the perfect personalized welcome arrival amenity for our special family visit to NYC for the first time. Club Lounge is a definite must. Felix and Lazar both so accommodating, fun, warm, friendly and professional. Great recommendations for dinner, shows, local must do activities. Nothing was too much trouble. Club lounge for breakfast, snacks, drinks and cocktails made our family gathering later in the afternoons after touring the city relaxed and enjoyable. Great service from all. Thank you for making our family stay so memorable!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed many times at nice hotels in NYC, including Mandarin, Four Seasons, and others. Was excited to stay at Ritz Central Park given reviews, and also rewards program. What a disappointment. Showed up to have keys not work. Next keys didn't work. Next keys issued didn't work either. Escorted to room and let in, off to dinner with a polite call to front desk asking if they could sort out keys when we returned. I noted that my wife had a spa appt that night and it would really mean a lot if they could make sure keys worked correctly when we returned. Returned from dinner, hit the club lounge floor (which we were reserved for), and...keys didn't work. Banged our way in. Considerable time at desk confirming we are allowed to enter. Did I mention that every call to the front desk involved an 8-12 minute wait to speak to someone? Compared to other top hotels in NYC this isn't event close. A joke at the rates they charge. Unfortunately, this is a place I can't recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed here the night of our 30th Anniversary. Everything was beautiful and perfect. Our room was upgraded to a view of Central Park. The room was large with a beautiful marbled bathroom with a stand up shower, separate tub and separate water closet. I think we're going to stay here every anniversary!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was very skeptical about staying here. For years, it's predecessor was the Saint Moritz which slowly, but surely, slid into the dumpdom of a bad hotel. Not anymore. After probably spending millions to fix up the joint, the Ritz is terrific.The public rooms and lobby were well decorated with an intimate bar. My room was a bit small(not for NYC), but well appointed. The bathroom was bright, large enough, and supplied with Asprey amenities. The hotel's location was Midtown central and near what you'd expect.Everyone from the doorman(Alan) to the chambermaids were helpful, polite, and friendly. Often, this area of the City is iffy and expensive.. Not here. The Ritz won't disappoint.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Treat yourself to club level here and don't worry about the rate. It's worth every penny and will be an unforgettable experience. Drinks....breakfast.....desserts....all absolute perfection. On day two of my girls trip, I wasn't feeling great. Next thing I know....chicken soup and tissues arrive with a thoughtful note from the club level concierge staff. Many other beautiful moments came together to make my stay at this Ritz an OTT-excellent experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed there fot a week during our holiday. Perfect location on central park south. Our room has a view of the park, and I can tell that one pays a hefty sum for that view. The room is clean, big (for NY standard) and the staff will do whateverit is that you ask them to do. Such as Securing a last minute reservations in Per se and Marea is quite a feat in itself. One day, one of the housekeeping staff broke a bottle of my girlfriend's make up. It was a unique lotion only avalaible in Europe, they had it replaced and flown in without we even asked for it. Loved our stay here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Fantastic hotel with excellent service. Perfect location. Great room with view of Central Park and proximity to restaurants,theater and shopping. From check in to check out everyone never forgets your name. Great Concierge services and it all started with arrival at front door.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I never felt so pampered and special. What a great property classic and elegant. Food was great, the bar especially the bar tenders just know how to provide 5 star service. I The location of the hotel is ideal we were 5 minutes away from our meetings and tourist locations

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for the last 5 years, hotel is consistent in it delivery of true service and excellence in attention to its clients. Fells like a Boutique Hotel, small lobby and Front Desk. Staff always receive you with a smile and a greetings. Rooms are very confortable, bath also. The Club is also very nice for unwinding at the end of the day and for a quick breakfast in the morning. Location is superb, front to central park and nearby by to shopping, culture and dining. Only concern is that it is an expensive hotel. If you can afford it, you get what you pay for !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've been here on business trip, and I must say it's a very nice hotel. Rooms are spacious and the staff is very accommodating and attentive. It's an old grand hotel, so if you're looking for something very modern, this is not it. What it is however, are grand rooms with all the amenities (couches, living area, tv's, etc..) and a staff that caters to your every need.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful old fashioned hotel with excellent service! Expensive breakfast if its not included in your rate. Very comfortable bed and big bathroom with toilet a part. Good hammam in spa. The rooms need to be refreshed of course, but hey, you are in front of Central Park so there are more advantages than lack of something... I recommend 100% if you want reasonable price and fantastic location!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I visited New York for our twentieth anniversary and spent three nights at the Ritz-Carlton. We're not anyone special, but we were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived to the minute the doorman helped us into our cab on our way to the airport. And while I'll admit that the cost of the experience caused us -- at a couple of points -- to think twice about staying there again, what they did for us on our special night totally blew us away and reaffirmed the Ritz-Carlton as our hotel of choice in New York City.A few basics: The Ritz-Carlton is located just south of Central Park. While the exterior isn't much to look at, the interior is elegant and classy. It has a peaceful, classical feel. We even loved the art! Unlike some other hotels the lobby is fairly simple with just the front desk and the concierge. There is a restaurant/rest area that we didn't eat at but enjoyed walking through. There is a tiny gift shop behind the concierge desk we didn't enter. There is a spa which we didn't use but I toured it and it looks beautiful, modern and very spa like. The fitness center was impressive. The men's locker room felt like a men's club.Our room was beautiful. We had a courtyard view room -- which, on the high floor we were on, meant that we couldn't actually see anything other than other people's windows. I will say in ALL fairness that there are plenty of rooms that face the park -- we just didn't want to pay for them! I certainly don't blame the lack of view on the hotel in any way, shape or form. But I will say that if city views or park views are really important to you, then less expensive courtyard rooms at the Ritz-Carlton may not be for you -- you should either pony up the cash for the view or maybe consider staying somewhere else.The room itself was BEAUTIFUL. A mix of modern amenities in a very classical shell. The walls were covered with framed fabric -- I don't know what you call it, but it was pretty. All of the furnishings were what you would expect from an modern, luxury hotel so I'm not going to go into those. But I will say that the bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom and as far as I can tell it was completely up-to-date. The shower was about the best shower I've ever experienced and it made me re-evaluate our own shower heads at home which up until now we really thought were great.No complaints about the room, the location, or the amenities. What about the service?Look, the service is WHY you stay at a Ritz-Carlton. It was (and always is) the best part of our experience. Sure, everyone is nice. But they go beyond nice. Every single person we came in contact with clearly, consistently WANTED to know how THEY could make our experience at the hotel better.When we checked in they casually asked why we were in town. "For our anniversary," we replied. "Oh, and because we are seeing Hamilton!" Good news -- they had a town car that could take us to the show. Great, we thought. We left our stuff in the room and went off to get dinner.When we returned, there was a bottle of champagne in our room and a personal note congratulating us on our anniversary. "Awww," we said -- really touched. But I'll admit we weren't surprised. That's kind of what we have come to expect from the Ritz-Carlton.What BLEW US AWAY was what happened on the night we went to see Hamilton. First, they gave us a ride to the show. They didn't charge us (we did tip of course...we're not savages). The show great. We took a cab back to the hotel afterwards, still humming our favorite songs. We went up to our room, opened the door and....huh? My wife's favorite song from the show was playing in our room.Whaa? At first we were REALLY confused. How was that even possible? Sitting on the desk next to the CD player was the soundtrack from the show and a card from one of the hotel's guest relations agents. They of course knew where we were, knew what we were doing and went out of their way to make an already incredible night even MORE amazing. Wow. Wow. Wow. I should note, by the way, that my wife's favorite song was playing on repeat. How they knew is was magic (or maybe everyone likes the same song...I don't know. I prefer to think it was just magic).How often does a hotel successfully write itself into the narrative of an already incredible memory by doing something so unexpected and wonderful? It was a great surprise, and certainly will make us think twice next time we're considering another hotel. So...to sum up: great hotel, great location. Incredible, amazing service. Great place to go for a very special occasion -- or, great place to go if you want to be treated like royalty even when you're not. It's expensive, but still an great value when you consider level of service you receive. We will definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband planned a quick get-away here for our 20th anniversary. With help from their wonderful staff, we had a great stay. The hotel is beautiful, in the clubby, traditional, "Ritz" way. I love that, but it might not be hip enough for some people. Our 7th floor suite overlooked the treetops of Central Park. It was perfect in every way, from the view, to the beautiful furnishings and spacious rooms. The best part, though, was the gracious staff. They went out of their way to help us celebrate, right down to having the soundtrack to a show we went to see queued up on the CD player when we got back. This was the kindest, most attentive staff we've ever had at any hotel we've stayed at (and we've stayed at some pretty great hotels). I hope we get to come back soon, and I certainly hope we can stay at the Ritz!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We've stayed at this hotel about 7 or 8 times over the past 20 years so it's obviously a great value to us. The problem, as I see it, is that the Marriott, or whomever owns it at this time, don't seem to recognize previous guests or keep track of your information accurately, like a guest appreciation program should. The hotel, as a gauge against other similar properties, such as The Surrey, Carlyle, Mandarin or The Regis, has a premium location on Central Park. It's incredibly quiet and they have an attentive staff.Pros: The bartender has no peers. The property is comfortable and, if you're on the park, rooms have incredible views. Cons: Their customer "appreciation" system needs some work. For instance, we've stayed here numerous times and there is no record of us being here for years on end, even though we were here six months ago. The room we were just "assigned" is quite a bit smaller than the previous rooms we've paid for. If you're in the AMEX program, that can be a bit disappointing (although it seems that if you've stayed in a hotel before, you naturally compare your previous room to the one you're currently assigned). If that is the gauge, then these guys fail, but if you're a first time guest staying in any room that looks onto the park, it's incredible. Don't opt for the club lounge, it's not that great as club lounges go, and if it's more expensive than the room you've chosen, skip it.Do upgrade to a park view; we've stayed in the back of the hotel, and although it's quiet, it's dark and the view onto the park is exquisite.We haven't tried the new restaurant yet but it looks "clubby" and red-leather-ish. The gym is always adequately equipped as city hotel gyms go and we sometimes pick this hotel just for the gym. The spa is also great. We always joke that "it's not the Four Seasons," which seems ironic since the Ritz Carlton built their whole reputation on over-the-top service.If you get a good deal on the room, jump on it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Was in NYC for a 3 day business trip. With so many choices I felt comfortable going with a name brand and decided on the RITZ-- it exceeded my every expectation from arrival. The bell staff was amazingly helpful, checking in was complete in 3 mins. My room was ready for me to unpack at 11am. Everything was crisp and clean. They earned a lifetime customer out of me.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton NYC is superbly located overlooking the Central Park. The service is great and very personalized. The hotel is old style from A-Z. It is very nice, still well in shape but clearly caters people who are either looking for best location or really like the style of some 30+ years ago. You will be very satisfied if the Traditional Grand Hotel style is what you are looking for. In case you look for a modern, trendy place than you should check in somewhere else. Great Place with a historic touch and grandesse of some years ago.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: They really set the tone for upscale hotels. The service is impeccable, at every level of the hotel. The beds are comfortable, and you for a moment forget there's a world out there that's hectic and busy. Tea in the lounge is perfect and peaceful. What I like so much about this place is that the service is not obsequious, just entirely professional.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We usually stay at Ritz Carlton Hotels throughout most of our travels. This hotel is our "go-to" hotel. The service is dependable and has everything you'd expect from the Ritz Carlton. We've only stayed in rooms with Central Park views.....It's very romantic just to sit and watch the horse drawn carriages and people walk along the park. The rooms are nice and spacious...something hard to find in NYC. The Hotel restaurant reminds me of sort of an upscale farm to table restaurant. Creative with fresh ingredients and a comfortable unstuffy feel. The bar and lounge area is place I could sit and people watch all day and night. Sometimes we a celebrity here and there...but it's mostly relaxed, refined people who are interesting to visit with. Club level is worth every penny!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had a room with a view again.Overall service was better than my last stay. Jogging in the Central Park in the morning and before dark was refreshing. Ritz is in a great location for nature lover. Overlooking the greenery Central Park right from the room is a breathtaking.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everyone that worked at this hotel was friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice and the location was stellar. Bathrooms were particularly lovely. The elevators to the rooms were immediately inside the door so that you can avoid the lobby, which is small. We did have some difficulties with our cell phones working in the building, but not all the time. We enjoyed the stay. Ambiance was very NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I have never been treated so royal as we were at The Ritz-Carlton Central Park. The Concierge service was very personal and went way beyond "normal service". So much so was the attention, that after spending five wonderful nites on the 16th floor...time to leave was tearful...The room was gorgeous! Marble and wall fabric accents throughout.
