I wanted a telescope... Done! Special champagne...done! Strawberries and chocolate done!!! Will need to visit again for sure! We felt like celebrities, and never heard a discouraging word. Ritz-Carlton, Central Park...Heaven in the middle of NY!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with my mum and sister in October for one night prior to our Cruise. It is the best hotel that I have stayed at in New York. So much better than the two time that I stayed and The Plaza. The staff and service were absolutely wonderful and they made us feel so welcome and special. They went above and beyond, my mum was in heaven. The room was great and the beds so comfortable. This hotel is definitely the place to stay in New York. I wish we had been able to spend more than the one night.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family stayed here for Thanksgiving, a yearly ritual where we go to NY to see the parade up close. This year we not only got to stay at this lovely place, but had a room with an eye level corner view of the parade as it went by. Not only that, but they have a private area for people in the hotel to stand on the street which was also amazing. As for the hotel itself, the rooms are lovely, the staff very friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious. I've stayed at other luxury NYC hotels where their food does not live up to their reputation but here it did - not only was their menu delicious, but they were also more than willing to modify anything we needed for food allergies / sensitivities which was refreshing.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: So enjoyed our fourth stay at this friendly hotel. Beautifully appointed, warm and helpful staff, and immaculate. The club has great offerings and the coffee is outstanding. Stayed at many 5 star hotels in NYC and the Ritz is my favorite for consistency. We will be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Me and my husband traveled to NYC in July of 2015 and stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. It was a beautiful hotel and the view of Central Park from our bedroom window was amazing. I would definitely recommend staying here. The bedding is comfortable and the rooms are exceptionally clean. Nice amenities.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellence in everything and that's why it is Ritz Carlton !! - Very nice room, spacious and elegant design- Breakfast buffet has big selection of choices and all tasty- Service is excellent. The staffs could not do enough for you and they are pleasure to help and happy if they can do anything for you. STRONGLY RECOMMEND

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We visit quite a few Ritz and a big part of that is because of the excellent staff, who seem to go far and above the industry norm. This was our second trip to Ritz CP and we marvel at the ability in that City for them to remember guest names from day to day and to do their best to make your stay fun as well as efficient. From bell/door staff like Kermit to Cassity in Guest Services, and all the others we come in contact with at the front desk, housekeeping, restaurant and concierge, there seems to be a commitment to being "the" best. Without going into too many details, we believe they are the best and we look forward to returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the ritz for 7 days as a birthday treat. Been to new york plenty of times but this was by far the most memorable experience. The hotel was STUNNING. All of the staff were amazing, the door men were extremely friendly and informative. The changed our room to a partial park view room as it was my birthday. Ashley was the lovely lady who checked us in and arranged this. We've travelled many times and she has been the best lobby attendant i have every come across. The hotel is in a good location if you like walking and going exploring new york. Its close to the city centre but a few blocks walk from times square. Located right across the road from central park. The rooms and hotel itself are very historic/ vintage in a beautiful way. If you like the more modern design then this wouldn't be the hotel for you. Would stay here again if we were to come back to new york.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This property is obviously ideally located. It is so nice to front up to Central Park. A room with a view is even better and a room on a high floor with a view is one of the best views I have enjoyed anywhere in my travels. It truly is breath taking. The hotel itself and small and quaint which I personally love. I do not like huge properties and people everywhere. The finish out in the common areas and the rooms is first class. But what makes this hotel special is the staff. In general, they are all exceptionally well trained and make you feel like anything you ask for is their absolute pleasure to do. And while you are there, go into the bar and see Eric. He is a true professional and a pleasure to visit with. One night we wanted to stay late and he was more than happy to accommodate us. A great bartender indeed. I did have one negative experience in the club lounge and ran into a concierge with an attitude and as a result I had to call the manager on duty but she remedied the situation and came up to introduce herself almost immediately. I stay at many of the finest hotels in the world and the combination of location, small hotel, views, and truly extraordinary service

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for one night only before before Cruising on NCL. This hotel is pure luxury and the service we received was incomparable. The room was immaculate with extremely comfortable beds, spacious and beautifully decorated. And the bathroom, to die for!! The butler or concierge for the floor was absolutely perfect, even leaving us each a gift from the spa. He remembered our names and said hello each time we left or entered the hotel, letting us know he was there for anything we needed. We each wanted the buy the corkscrew from the bar in the room as a souvenir so we asked at the front desk on checkout and we were given one each, no charge. :)) We had a terrific stay and would stay again in a heartbeat if we get the chance. Very pricey, but very worth it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The check-in experience was quick and efficient. The desk agent asked what we were doing in the city and I mentioned we were going to see a Broadway show. When we came back to our room from the show (2 days after check-in) the sound track was playing in our room with a personal note from the desk agent... this is what makes the Ritz special to me. If I come back to the property, I will get a park view room. One critique: In-room dining seems highly inflated to me (even by NYC/Ritz Standards). The hotel bar was fantastic.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed numerous times at this hotel. Relaxing, calm environment after day in city. Love location on Central Park. Also,close to subway stations. Prefer Deluxe Park view rooms with high floor. Free breakfast with AMEX platinum.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service, location and friendly, attentive staff is unsurpassed. Coffee rolls out around 5am, which is essential for early risers like me... the pastry chef, Anthony d'Adamo, even sent out a basket of fresh yummies for me to have one morning--i was so totally taken by surprise! He is not only fabulously talented, but also extremely personable--oh, to live in New York and have him be involved in a daughter's wedding one day would be incredible! And,after noticing me squirrel around to get comfortable, the doorman brought over a footstool so I could comfortably work on my laptop--I mean, where else could I even imagine this kind of treatment!?!The concierge staff is awesome(surpassed only by thew Ritz concierge group in Buckhead, Atlanta)...they were extraordinarily accommodating...even going so far as to give me his own metro pass to get me quickly on my way when we realized traffic had come to a halt with Trump arriving around the corner.And, the front desk staff...I could go on and on about them and the guys out front. All in all, a truly MAGICAL trip!!! We'll definitely be back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This stay will be my sixth at The Ritz Central Park. It is always welcoming and feels like a home while we are visiting New York. We were in room 1710 which is one of my favorites. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. The noise from the street is not a problem and the view is amazing. The club lounge is so great for relaxing and the staff in the lounge are the best. Thank you Lazar and staff for excellent service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed 4 nights with park view room. We are Ritz rewards member and Ritz residents in another city. We have stayed at several Ritz properties. Including the one at Battery Park. This location was anticlimactic. Don't need to stay here again. Club lounge was in need of a renovation. Concierge in lounge was very nice. Wait staff were not engaged not friendly. Seemed like the wait staff didn't like working there. Not what we have experienced at other Ritz club lounges. Checkin experience was lackluster. However check out was much better. Property is in an excellent location of course but so are other brands. We will stay elsewhere next time. We visit NYC two times per year.Room was very nice. So some good and poor qualities for this Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Now that the Ritz brand is under the Marriott umbrella you can see the positive changes. Marriott is clearly updated the Ritz line of hotels and sinking money into them. This hotel will be renovated by the end of the year and it definitely needs to be. It is very dated. The location on South Central Park is excellent, you are truly centrally located. The best part of this hotel is the service. The employees went out of their way to make my stay special. From Ander at the front desk who walked me up to my room and made sure I was well cared for to the assistant manager that I ran into in the hallway and road down in the elevator with who told me he would check me out if I gave him my room number. As I had access to the club lounge I also had the pleasure of meeting Shannon and several other attendants of the lounge. Every one was very very friendly and helpful. The service was excellent. Even the housekeepers were wonderful. Very friendly and kind. The service in the hotel lounge was lovely too. I will look forward to the renovation and definitely be back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As one of the finer hotels in this part of town, we have always found this fine hotel to not disappoint. Clean and fresh as always. Perfect sleep and great room service makes this our go to when in NYC. One of the friendlier staffs as well with a nice bar that is open late.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Could not fault our 5 day stay here at the beginning of April, from the staff on the door at entrance, to reception ,and the bar, and restaurant, all were so attentive and friendly, they all made our stay special.Our rooms were immaculate and extremely comfortable A brilliant vacation .

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you're in town on a business trip and you're looking for a chic and a quiet place, that's where you wanna stay but I think the "clientele" is a bit older so I wouldn't advise it for younger couples, also the in-dinning service is a bit too expensive, so you might wanna have your breakfast or your dinner outside

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The central park Ritz Carlton is nice for a hotell, but not great as a Ritz Carlton. The front of the building looks like a normal building. The entrance is small. The service is superb like in all the other Ritz-Carltons. You are served like royals! The food in the restaurant is good, quality comed of course with a price. Breakfast could go up to 75$. Rooms are clean and quite big compared to other NY hotels, but the room height is quite low I think. Lounge was a big dissapointment for me, the service is good, quality was ok also, but the interior was like from cheap small hotell.The locations is wonderfull jos south to the Central park, close to shopping and restaurants too.In the end, I would propably not go again to this R-C.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the smiling staff to the polite quiet manners.... Beautiful room... Fabulous mattress and pillow. Every detail accounted for. This morning I stepped out the front doors and ran in Central Park. Few blocks to Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center. Best location. Dessert last night in hotel was perfect! Thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the time we checked in to checkout everything and everyone were outstanding. A special thank you to Courtney Mgr at the front desk, Keone at the Concierge desk and the individuals on the club level , you are all exemplary and sterling assets for the Ritz CarltonThank you againPaula

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a dream getaway with my fiance to see Billy Joel and Hamilton. Welcomed warmly and treated like royalty upon check-in - we casually mentioned we were seeing the two shows. Each night when we returned, the staff has bought CDs of both Hamilton and Billy. Was playing on the room CD player (those still exist!) and made us feel very spoiled and special. The customer service was exceptional and made a lot of difference in a crowded luxury market in midtown.
user_name:
Jon I
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is like home, couzy rooms, the food is exquisite, personal is like Friends they're always presto to attend you. Its close to everything, 5th avenue, central Park right in front, best restaurantes, shops. Everything is there. The hotel has everything for you: care, attention, kindness, amability and Love!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed 5 nights for my 40th Birthday in April. We had an amazing time, walked for miles. Hotel is in a great location overlooking Central Park although we requested a park view unfortunately we didn't get one. Our room was spacious and very clean. Bed wasn't the most comfortable and pillows weren't great but we were so tired after walking around so much we would have slept on a washing line. Bathroom was huge. Excellent touch having a coffee/tea trolley in the foyer first thing in the morning. The staff were amazing, always cheerful, polite and professional. Our favourite member of staff was Norm (bar) what a character! As soon as he found out it was my birthday he made a fuss of me. Bringing a desert for me and a stuffed toy.We only had 1 breakfast, late supper and bar snack in the hotel. All very good, tasty and plentiful. All in all we had an amazing trip and enjoyed staying in the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz for my birthday and it was not what I was expecting. For the amount of money that cost per night ($599.00) I was expecting a bigger room, a cleaner shower, a room with a better decoration, and an ice machine that worked. I eat at their restaurant and the food was not impressive. I have been in many hotels over the years, and the only advantage the Ritz has over others is that it is located in from of Central Park, in a beautiful scenic area, surrounded by beautiful places. Now, if the evaluation is based on the location, any price is worth it because from the hotel, you can walk everywhere, take any public transportation, taxis, etc. I addition, the hotel is surrounded by important train-lines, and hundreds of places to eat and shop.
user_name:
Iberkis
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for a week with my wife recently. We booked a 'city view room'. Don't expect panoramic views of New York though. Our room looked out mostly on to the building opposite but with a good partial view of Central Park. I have had much better views at much cheaper US hotels. The room was nice rather than stunning and the individual staff service was always polite and friendly. However, we were excluded from the bar, lobby and restaurant one evening with not a great deal of warning due to Euretha Franklin's birthday function. During afternoon tea (which was seriously underwhelming and I would not waste the money on) there was a foul mouthed business man on the next table ranting and f'ing on the phone which spoilt the ambience somewhat. I did ask staff to speak to him as there were also children present. However, they would not do this as he was a good customer who obviously put a great deal of money their way. Therein lies a problem in that the big spenders obviously have priority over the little folk like us - not good really when we, proportionately speaking, have also spent a small fortune to stay there. Another point is that the price of food is frankly an insult to one's intelligence and the choice is poor. Including tax and 'auto gratuity' (don't bother adding additional gratuity is it seems to be added for you here) we paid on average 150 dollars for two sandwiches with fries and a couple of average deserts before you get on to spending on any drinks. Afternoon tea worked out at around 180 dollars for what was very underwhelming. Do yourself a favour and eat out - much cheaper and more choice. So, all in all, nice hotel but very poor value for money generally and get ready to be treated like a second class citizen if you are not dripping gold!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Good service. Rooms (if slightly small) have wonderfully baroque furniture. The location is perhaps the best out of any hotel in NYC. Oozes class that is perhaps slightly more understated (in a good way) than the Plaza.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I visit New York quite frequently...stay at various places. I used our Marriott platnum points for this one night stay. All I can say is wow! From the minute we stepped into the door and until we got into a cab the next day, this hotel treated us as is we were royalty . I want to give a special shout out to my new friend Ender. None went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable for all our needs. And the beautiful note he left us with the Hamilton cd was the real icing on the cake! If you want to be treated like a royal...this is the place to stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What can you say about the Ritz everything is fantastic but don't expect it to be cheap it is after all 5 star $12 a beer $19 a glass of wine, breakfast was $23 an omelette and $46 for a full breakfast a nice touch however was coffee & tea in the reception in the morning complimentary.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the Ritz for 3 nights last weekend with husband and daughter. The club level service was amazing, as was service all over the hotel, from the check -in to the door men to the people who cleaned the room. I used the concierge several times, and was able to get into a restaurant that showed up as "nothing available" on Open Table by using the Ritz' contacts.The club had (alcoholic) drinks available all day , or at least every time we stopped. The bites sized portions served at the pre dinner hour were plentiful and had great variety.Breakfast was nice. Would have been nice to include an egg option,maybe scrambled eggs or something. We had bagels with smoked salmon or oatmeal most mornings. The coffee was good as well.The only thing that was not perfect was that each bed nobly had to flattened out down pillows on it , so we asked for a couple extra which were brought up immediately with a smile.Thank you to the Ritz for a memorable stay !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently went to New York to celebrate my daughter's third birthday. Before we even arrived, we started experiencing the Ritz's amazing customer services. I responded to an email about the purpose of our stay, etc. I mentioned my daughter's birthday and literally within five minutes I received an email from Cassidy Davis (one of Ritz's Guest Recognition Coordinators). She asked us questions about our daughter's favorite color, dessert and interests. When we arrived, our room was ready for early check-in (as we requested) and we were greeted with balloons (in my daughter's favorite color), some amazing cupcakes and two coloring books featuring my daughter's favorite Disney characters. She was so incredibly excited and happy when she saw all of this. Another example of how the Ritz really goes above and beyond - in the evening when we headed out for dinner, my daughter (having missed her afternoon nap) started to have a bit of a meltdown and started crying in the lobby. One of the doormen immediately went and got two stuffed animals and gave one to her one to my younger infant son. He also offered some soothing, comforting words to my daughter and she immediately calmed down. These are just a couple of examples of how the Ritz made us feel incredibly welcome during our entire stay. The room and amenities at the Ritz were superior (as you would expect). What we will always remember, however, is the incredible customer service and how all of the staff made my daughter's third birthday very special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is a lovely warming old style hotel. Not the same as the London Ritz thats too much glamour. We loved the service. They know how to look after you. over looking central park. Restaurants and 5th Ave shopping. Note if you looking down town where the liberty is and ground o. Then the other Ritz down town is the best as this looks over the river view and oppersite the old trade centres.A bit chilly when we went so please check the weather.Hope this helps.Regards Shafiq
user_name:
Shafiq M
Beaconsfield, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel has thought of everything! I could not fault it if I tried! From being given a bottle of chilled water whilst checking in, to having someone walk is up to our room and explain where everything in the massive oversized room was, through to assistance in booking tours, sending a suitcase home for us, and a very pleasant checkout, this is one of the best hotels I've stayed at. We had a few early starts with day tours to other places and upon coming down at 5am in the morning there were tea and coffee facilities available with take away cups. We stayed in the standard rooms, and although the view was of an internal courtyard, we weren't in our rooms often enough to enjoy a Central Park view. Amazing hotel! Nothing was too much trouble!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If only I had Elizabeth's team in my home, I would be living like a princess every day! From the moment we stepped in front of the hotel we were welcomed and pampered. Our room wasn't immediately ready when we arrived so we enjoyed the lounge for a fantastic Manhattan (of course) before our keys were brought to us with bags already in our room. We were pleasantly surprised to find our one bedroom suite was upgraded to the two bedroom corner with a breath-taking view of Central Park. We only wish we had the chance to stay longer as the bed, the wifi, the location, and the service simply make each stay the most enjoyable experience you can have. Big kudos to the R-C team.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The ritz is incredible. Mind. Blown. The staff makes you feel so special, the room feels so clean- like it was made for you. What I realllllly love is the boardroom on the 3rd floor- it's like home away from home. So comfortable and luxurious I don't want to be anywhere else in the city. It's not cheap, but it's beyond worth it. I LOVE. Can I just live here forever??

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a lovely hotel. Service was excellent and the view of Central Park from our room was stunning. Clean and comfortable. Fantastic location. Nothing was too much trouble for the Concierge, Bernd sorted all our ticket requests with no fuss or hassle at all and was charming. My BIG complaint is the scandalous price of food. Our first breakfast cost 170 dollars, 44 dollars for 2 fried eggs. Room service adds 18% to bill for tip and 6 dollar a head just to deliver, there is seriously no justification for these prices. Wifi was very good but cost 15 dollars a day.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love this hotel. It has wonderful service, great rooms, comfy beds, and is right across the street from Central Park. I stay here a few times a year, and it's my all time fave. Everything you need is right there, plus excellent staff to get you whatever you need. During the last visit there were issues with wear and tear - door didn't latch properly. It had to be hip bumped to close. That's a little odd for them. We came back once and the door wasn't locked. Apparently, it never closed completely. Nothing was taken, but it's strange to leave doors open in NYC. I'm headed back in a few weeks. I can't wait!Oh, and this place is great for families, couples, and business. We usually do a suite and with the desk and couch it's really comfy. Noise isn't an issue. Guests need a hotel keycard to use the elevators, which is a nice security feature. The restaurant downstairs has a great steak. The Italian place next door has the best ravioli known to man!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I just got back from a wonderful stay at the Ritz Central Park. Upon arrival, we were treated like royalty by the reception staff and were upgraded to a suite. The room was incredible, with amazing views of central park. The bed was heavenly, the bathroom was spacious and luxurious, and the living area was equipped with a pull out sofabed for the kids with a separate bathroom. We had club lounge access, which is a must-do - the food displays were plentiful and the staff was incredibly accommodating to my children and brought them french fries and kid-friendly sandwiches. Upon checkout, the hotel manager, Terry, introduced himself and was extremely warm and friendly - I truly felt like family at this hotel. After this amazing stay, I can't imagine staying at another hotel in New York. Yes, this Ritz property is expensive, but you truly get what you pay for. I have stayed at dozens of hotels in NYC, and absolutely nothing compares to the Ritz Central Park. The location is perfect, the staff is incredible and the property is impeccable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this Ritz property over last weekend. I was running the NYC Half Marathon and the start line was right across the street so it made sense from that standpoint and also given its great location in general. I have stayed at many Ritz properties and am always impressed but this one was above and beyond the service I have experienced before. Our room was outstanding - a completely unobstructed view of Central Park - and they made up these wonderful "goodie race bags" for the runners complete with everything participants needed (goos, Gatorade, foot care products, water bottle, etc) including hand and foot warmers (to help with the especially frigid conditions) that no one traveling for the race would have thought to pack. Every staff member we came into contact with was happy, helpful, and genuinely seemed interested in making our stay the best it could be. I can't wait to stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for the overall, all around, five star experience!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My friend and I brought our two sons to NY to celebrate their 10 birthdays--we chose the Ritz Central Park to stay. It was a perfect choice. Not only is the location exceptional but the service was above and beyond what I've experienced at other Ritz' or other high-end hotels. They made our two sons feel so welcome and special--everything from having them pick out a welcome gift, to sending cookies and milk to our rooms, to buying them a free movie to watch in the room to making their birthday celebrations extra special by sending up chocolates and a gift--truly a special place. Cannot recommend this place any more highly--everyone here was exceptional.. We especially enjoyed "Ender" (not sure of the spelling...) Thank you to the Ritz for a perfect getaway!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is absolutely incredible!!!!amazing service, bath amenities, food, gym and great people. The bed is so soft and even though I was only one night there I highly recommend it. Its absolutely a great and high standard place.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night on our way to Paris and then for 3 nights on our way back from London. We have nothing but wonderful things to say about the hotel, the staff and the facilities. In typical Ritz Carlton fashion, the staff went out of their way to welcome us. This whole trip was a 25th wedding anniversary. Upon returning to our room the first night, after dinner, we found the entrance to our suite paved in rose pedals. The path of pedals led to the bedroom and there on the bed were more pedals in the shape of a heart. Upon our return from 2 weeks in Europe, the staff had placed a plate of cookies and chocolates including a chocolate picture frame that contained a chocolate "picture" saying "NEW YORK PARIS LONDON NEW YORK". Now, I have stayed at many fine hotels, but for a hotel to (1) ask their guests why they were staying and what their plans were and (2) actually listen to their guests and (3) take the initiative to act upon what their guests said is incredible. We would stay here again without question. The staff we interacted with was attentive, polite and professional. The Club was excellent with diverse food offerings and incredible staff. The only issue we had was resolved promptly and if anything the hotel over compensated us for the problem. I cannot say enough about the quality of this hotel. Location was excellent as well.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a great time here. We had some issues at first but they were handled beautifully and we couldn't have asked for better service. I have stayed in many four start hotels and some can be on the snobby side. Everyone here was so courteous. Thank you to everyone who made our stay great. Rooms are nice could use a slight update but the location and staff made up for that. We had great breakfast and dinner. The fine hotels benefits are worth it if you have them and they know your benefits so you don't have to go through the hassle of making sure they're correct. Love this place and will stay here again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Overcharged my credit card three times the amount. Was reversed when I questioned it. Charged for valet as well as overnight parking. Seems outdated for the price. The club lounge was adequate but they had unattended children running around not so great for the price.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Here for business and the room is located beyond housekeeping office (apparently) as I have to maneuver past the carts and hear phone calls from the bathroom! With all the new hotels in the area it's unfortunate they are so blind to basic customer relations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife booked the Ritz-Carlton to celebrate my 50th birthday. We both have stayed at many luxury brands, but this was our first time at a Ritz-Carlton. I can tell you without hesitation that they exceeded our expectations and made us feel like we were celebrities. From the check-in experience, to the waiters and hosts to the bellman and bartenders, the entire staff showed themselves to be the ideal hosts, demonstrating a friendly and professional demeanor that has not been matched anyplace else we have stayed. The accommodations were luxurious and beautiful from the oak paneled lobby and elevators to the hallways and of course the rooms. The acknowledgment of my 50th birthday was celebrated by the staff throughout our stay from deserts to fruit plates and Champagne. We were overwhelmed as they truly brought this celebration to a higher level. Not only will we be planning our next stay in the near future, but I will happily recommend the Ritz-Carlton to friends and family for their special celebrations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Typical Ritz Carlton; high standard of excellence. Had a deluxe king room on a high floor facing the park. Very attentive staff and high quality bedding. Very expensive drinks, spa services, and food. Which is expected for a 5 star hotel on Central Park.
user_name:
Ron P
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed here many times and it is by far the best hotel in New York City. The staff is fabulous - attentive without being overbearing. Go see Catherine in the Restaurant/Lounge - her service is impeccable. The rooms are well appointed. This time we had a non-view room but it meant we were tucked back in the corner of the hotel and so quiet. We never heard anything. Love this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing, location, rooms, service, and food. The Ritz Carlton is within walking distance to everything you need to see. The Best experience I've had with the staff at any Ritz Carlton I have stayed with.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved the location of the hotel. The room was very comfortable and the service was superb. The only negative is that I called in advance and asked to be placed as high as possible not only for the views but because I did not want to hear the traffic below while I was trying to sleep (I am a very light sleeper). Unfortunately, the 10th floor was not high enough - I could hear the traffic at night so I did not sleep well.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You will not be disappointed with your stay here. It was expensive to eat and drink at the hotel (especially the room service) but you couldn't fault the service and quality.It is the cleanest place I have ever stayed! location was good, directly opposite central park, a 10-15min walk to times square! honestly it is highly recommended! ps: there was a spa there (no pool) i cant comment on these facilities as I never took use of it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Love love love the Ritz Carlton on Central Park! from the minute we arrived we were made to feel like royalty, even though we hadn't paid royalty prices! (got an amazing deal in the UK - £599 for 3 nights and flights!) - on arrival, got a complimentary upgrade to the Club Lounge, this was amazing! so a delicious breakfast every day overlooking Central Park, heaven and fine wine/champagne and nibbles on our return at the end of the day. The room was great, the bed SO comfy and huge! after pounding the streets all day couldn't wait to get into the bed! which had been turned down with chocolates and water by the side of the bed... Total attention to detail with everything. Such lovely door men and concierge, special thanks to Vincent who was always so cheerful. Would love to return one day... thanks everyone at the Ritz Carlton - No 1 hotel in NYC!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Located in upper Manhattan right opposite Central Park, the Ritz Carlton is the best way to treat yourself whilst in New York City. From the moment you set foot into the hotel, you are welcomed by courteous, polite and smiling staff who will take your luggage and escort you to reception. After check-in, concierge will escort you to your room. This was actually a really nice touch after a long flight and nightmare journey in due to traffic: the man who took us to our room was really friendly and chatty and i though it made for a very warming welcome without being too much.Our room was on the 9th floor and had a side view on Central Park and the opposite building. I believe there are higher rooms with a full view of the park though that didn't really bother me. In terms of size, the room was very spacious including a super comfortable and large double bed, marble bathroom with walk-in shower and a separate toilet.Room also has a minibar, TV and benefits from turn down service every night.The decor of the room and the hotel in general is very upscale and classy, though it all looks a bit 90s (though everything is very well kept and not tired looking - I think the hotel would just benefit from a little refresh).The hotel restaurant is amazing - staff are so polite and welcoming and the food is fantastic albeit rather pricey. A breakfast for two can cost you over $150!There is also a small gym onsite equipped with weights, machines and treadmills which is always a bonus - unfortunately there are no spa facilities but that really wasn't an issue for me.In terms of location, the hotel is 2 minutes from 5th Avenue and a short walk from the subway so it's really well connected.I had a fantastic stay at the Ritz Carlton - it really made a difference to my stay in NYC and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone visiting the city!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park for a combination of business and pleasure. For business, it was much appreciated that the rooms still had desks (since some hotels seem to be doing away with these). I had a problem connecting to the internet but in true Ritz Carlton style, it was quickly resolved with little trouble for me. The remained of the trip was for fun. We were traveling with a 9 year old and the Ritz Carlton Concierge was super helpful in finding activities for us to do. They gave some great recommendations like visiting the Natural History Museum and checking out the Broadway Musical Matilda. Every member of the staff was welcoming and so helpful. We were said to leave and look forward to our next visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed in this hotel several times and each time has been wonderful.I can't understand how anyone would not be happy staying here.The folks in club level are fantastic and make you feel special can't wait to return this fall

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from New York and our stay at the Ritz Carlton was amazing. The staff were all very friendly helpful polite and professional at all times. The Hotel itself is beautiful and central. We travelled with friends to celebrate my 50th birthday and celebrate we did, from the hand made chocolates to the lovely birthday cake that was left in our room made it so special. I mentioned to the staff that I found the bed a bit hard and they immediately changed the mattress and offered us an upgrade by way of an apology, we already had an amazing room so they upgrade was not needed, we instead were treated to breakfast by the hotel, how fab and thoughtful. I cannot praise the hotel and staff enough and would like to thank them for everything. We will be returning for a second stay before the end of the year. The Pritchards X

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We just arrived home from a fabulous NYC weekend. The staff at the Ritz went above and beyond to make us feel special. We were celebrating my husband's birthday and Ronald made sure to get to know all of our family members and welcome them by name - he even left a CD for my husband of the play we saw, which was playing in our room when we arrived back. We were amazed! The food is delicious and the beds extremely comfortable. An all around magical and relaxing weekend away!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The view wasn't as expected... The food was ok and the service was ok too. The lobby gets very busy due to the public spa and bar. The best thing about the hotel was the spa which I have reviewed separately and gave it five stars. I wouldn't recommend staying at this hotel, there are other better options available across the street or next-door.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Came here for a long weekend with my husband and we loved it! The beds are comfy and it's such a clean hotel. Beautiful views, beautiful designs, wonderful atmosphere. It's the perfect place to stay for couples, friends, or family. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wonderful hotel. Staff were so friendly, helpful and courteous. Hotel is beautiful, rooms stunning and pristine. Really could not have wanted for more. Great location, would have loved a park view but other than that faultless!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed as two couples over President's Day Weekend 2016. The overall theme of my review is incredibly inconsistent service. Upon arrival, no one was manning the front door. No bellman, nothing. The weather was below freezing and it was very difficult to manage my luggage while trying not to catch hypothermia and get the incredibly heavy front door open. Not a good first impression. However the following three days there were several doormen manning the doors, who were very nice and helpful. The Room They were able to give me an early check in... To the room closest to the elevator (1009) with zero cell phone reception. The wifi was spotty and with no cell reception, communication to the outside world during my stay was a challenge. This room was also somewhat loud due to the proximity to the elevator. The decor is very traditional but also very dated. I think this place is definitely due for a refresh. On my first night there were 4 small waters delivered with turndown service. I never received water again until the fourth night, got 2 waters with turndown and then no water the last night. Very inconsistent. My bathroom door had something that looked like smeared blood on the door surrounding the handle. I grabbed a housekeeper from the hall as soon as I found it, pointed it out to her and she wiped it. However after she left, there was still stained residue on the door. Meaning she only half way cleaned it up. GROSS! No one ever cleaned it during my 5 day stay. Room service was $100 for a pot of coffee and oatmeal with a side of berries. I'm not sure how that is possible but it is. The food was just so-so. One afternoon during the blizzard we had friends come to visit us and we sat for cocktails in the lobby. My sister and I eventually got hungry and grabbed salads from a nearby take out spot (Chop'd - great salads). Once we started eating, a hotel woman came over and asked us if we were staying in the hotel, to which we responded "yes." She then told us we couldn't eat in the lobby because it's hard for them to know who in the lobby is and is not a hotel guest. Note this is the only area to sit in the lobby. We asked her what we should do and she told us we would have to eat our salads in our room. Even though we were drinking drinks from the lobby bar and had a colleague visiting (with whom it would have been very awkward to have sitting on my bed in my hotel room while I ate a salad). We packed up and left the lobby (furious) and called the manager. She apologized and sent us a bottle of sparkling wine and told us that was not their policy in the lobby and that the woman was mistaken. We sought assistance with show and event tickets from the concierge but found that their prices far exceeded StubHub tickets, so we bought them on our own. In summary, the service was quite inconsistent and hotel seems to need a refresh in decor/cleanliness and retraining of several staff members. With all the great places to stay in NY, I will not return to this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had stayed in Ritz hotel for two nights . Although I had booked twin bed but!!! Couldn't get it as the hotel already full ! The front desk lady offered me a suite that I have to pay extra 800$ per night plus it was a king bed not a twin bed! Or offering an extra bed! But come on both of us old enough. The room was small although nice view " Central Park". The only thing that I like about this hotel was the location ! It was few steps to SaraBeth restaurant and few steps more to the Plaza Hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent a long weekend in October for her birthday celebration. I travel extensively and spend over one hundred nights a year in hotels. The Ritz Carlton Central Park was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Key points:- Location is perfect, directly on Central Park- Guest relations reached out in advance of our visit to understand our plans while in NYC and to be able to assist whenever we needed.- I was greeted at the front desk *by name* when I checked in. Obviously the staff had done some short research and knew who I was and from where I had traveled. - EVERY staff member we encountered would do anything and everything asked, happily. Every staff member was an absolute pleasure from the bellmen, to front desk, to concierge, to room service and housekeeping.- The hotel actually had a “small hotel feeling” from the extreme attention to personalized detail. - The room was outstanding. We booked a deluxe park view room on a high floor. Every class of room is clearly described on the web site. Staying in a beautiful room overlooking Central Park is not inexpensive, but you know precisely what you will get and there are no surprises when you finally see the room.- The room layout, furnishings and bathroom were all excellent. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was large and efficiently designed.- Completely quiet.Thanks again to the staff of the Ritz Carlton Central Park and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here several times and it never disappoints, The rooms are a bit dated but the location makes up for it. If you want to see the whole park make sure you get a room on one of the upper floors. The food is great and the hotel bar is a great spot to see and be seen.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for a night while on a business trip while transiting New York. New York in itself is a great city and the Ritz makes even better.The service at the Ritz is impeccable, not to mention the staff that contribute to it.The Ritz is close to all major attractions like Central Park and commuting to the financial district as well if you are visiting on business.Will definitely visit again and stay at the Ritz only.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent staff that goes the extra mile to make sure that your stay is amazing. Large rooms, nice linens, great dining selections and convenient location makes this hotel a good choice when visiting Manhattan.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were so looking forward to our visit and we were not disappointed! It was the first thing we had booked to do on our jammed packed week of activities! The service, food, drinks and even the matching crockery were faultless - worth every penny! The attention to detail is second to non, just what you would expect from a hotel of this standing. The best and biggest cherry scones I have ever tasted!
user_name:
StaffieZeb
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything and more that the name Ritz conjures up is delivered at this beautiful hotel.The location is perfect and from the minute Al welcomes you and opens the doors into the splendour of the reception and lounge you are transported into a world of high quality and luxury.The room we were given was superb with views over the park.We booked a club room, highly recommend it, fantastic value for money, the club lounge is a great facility with top quality food and drink from 7.00am through to 11.00pm and the staff all lovely and highly efficient.What a benefit and luxury the Club concierge was too, nothing too much trouble including help in booking trips, on line check in for our flight home and much much more, they are golden.If you want to spoil yourself in a perfect location then book the Ritz - Carlton Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had a great time here, the service was amazing! So personalized which was great. Cons: I did not like how they did not always have someone opening and closing the door. Also if you do not get a central park view room, the view is not nice at all. I love exclusivity, and I think this hotel does have that feel.
user_name:
Globaluxtravler
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the property in June and October. The staff made us feel so welcome on both trips. Gifts for our daughter on both trips. The brought us whatever we needed and went above and beyond.On both trips we had great views. The lounge and restaurants were great. Food was awesome. Drink specials were even better. Concierge was so helpful. I can t say enough.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this hotel in early January. Immediately after making the reservation I reached out to have an employee contact me to make some special arrangements, as the trip was a surprise for my husbands birthday.From the very first correspondence, I was certain that I had picked the right hotel. Information on car services and cakes and balloons to a detailed and thoughtful list of restaurants nearby. I never felt like I was imposing with so many questions and, quite honestly, continually felt that she was just as excited as I was that this trip be a special one.Valet parking is made extremely convenient for the guests - just pull up and someone will take your bags and take your car for you. Check in was warm and welcoming. (Thank you Ms. Myers) It was as if we were old friends coming back again. The woman I had corresponded with on all of the details of the birthday surprise came to meet us in the lobby and escorted us to our room to be sure that everything was to our liking.And it certainly was.I was asked to send a favorite picture of my husband and myself via email prior to arrival - and it was in a lovely silver frame on the nightstand upon our arrival. The cake was ready in the room. And there were even balloons to make it extra fun.Everything was perfect and not a single detail was overlooked. When I mentioned that we would not be having the cake until later, a refrigerator was immediately sent up to keep the cake perfect until we returned later that evening.We booked a Deluxe Park View room and the room and view were spectacular! The room itself was large by NYC hotel standards, well appointed and absolutely spotless. The view was incredible. At first I was quite concerned, as we were in a room that was right off of the elevator. We never heard a single thing. The bed was so comfortable and the linens were luxurious and the shower was fantastic. The temperature in the room was never too hot or cold - I could not find a single complaint about it if I tried.We loved the location of the hotel. The park and the skating rink and the shops on 5th Avenue and restaurants and it was very quiet in the evening, which made sleeping much more pleasant than other hotels we've stayed at in Manhattan. Just perfection.We went down to the bar to have a couple of cocktails prior to leaving for a concert and little did we know that we were about to have a brush with greatness. Norman is the epitome of the quintessential old school New York City bartender. His skills and personality are everything to the point where we did not even want to leave for the concert! We are both grateful to have had the opportunity to meet him and hope to again in the future. We would return to this Ritz Carlton for a thousand reasons - and Norman is absolutely at the top of the list.I can not say enough about the service here. Every single person we came in contact with was knowledgeable and professional and friendly. That includes valet parking and the doormen, bell services, the front desk, concierge services, housekeeping, room service, the bartenders - every single person.We did finally manage to pry ourselves away from Norman to leave for the Billy Joel concert. My fabulous contact person had made me aware of the house car and we were fortunate to have it available at time prior to the concert to take us to Madison Square Garden. The driver was made aware in advance that the location we were going to should not be disclosed as it was a birthday surprise. Again - not a single detail was overlooked.When we returned to the room that evening - there was a Billy Joel CD playing in the room. There was also a children's book wrapped in a bow. And then a hand-written note saying that she hoped we enjoyed the concert and would continue to enjoy the music back in our room and with hopes that reading the book to my grandson would bring back a fond memory of our visit.We were absolutely blown away.I did not even recall mentioning my grandson. But obviously I did. And obviously she was listening to me and to every single thing I said.Attention to the details is everything to me. That is where good customer service becomes extraordinary stellar EPIC customer service.Bravo, Ritz Carlton.BravoThere has not been a single person that I've shared this experience with that was not beyond impressed with the service we received.It has been exactly two weeks now since our stay at this hotel and I still smile every time I think about it. I recommend to anyone who will listen to make it a point to stay at this hotel when visiting New York City. I will never forget this place and these people and we will absolutely be returning in the future. We couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.Thank you Ms. Carreno-Urena for making our stay a wonderful memory that will last us a lifetime. Thank you for giving us the best customer service and the best hotel experience we've ever had. You made it all look effortless and you a truly gifted and an invaluable asset to the Ritz Carlton.Until next time, Ritz Carlton Central Park - Thank you!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Hosted a bridal bachelorette weekend ! Hotel rooms are great, great place for breakfast and the views of the park and location are to die for. Perfect experience!If you can get a room with a view of the park its breathtaking !
user_name:
Diana M
North Salem, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family of five and I just spent a night here for our last night in NY as a bit of a splurge after having 3 nights at a fantastic hotel in East Village earlier. We were all pretty disappointed and underwhelmed by the Ritz Carlton, especially given we were paying USD1,50 a night for our suite. Firstly, incredibly Wifi was not included but extra, and per person. And when I questioned this they provided us a free code which whilst good simply highlighted the out-of-touch policy and very strange reactive-approach to customer service! Secondly, we asked for our extra kids beds to be setup at 5pm. Come 5pm, nothing. I had to call at 6 and ask again. Thirdly, no extra towels were included in our room for the 3 kids, even after the extra beds were setup. Again, I had to call and ask. The TVs were fuzzy. The heating noisy. It just all felt very out-of-date and not worth it. It's as if the staff felt they could lazily sit-back and think that their old brand name was a privilege enough in itself. Very odd. To be clear, much of the experience was nicely done and there was some OK service. But given we had been staying in fantastic stylish hotels earlier in our trip that were half the price and twice as nice, I really don't know why you'd bother with this old classic (even given its location on the park). Never again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: we have been visiting NYC about twice yearly and found the Ritz Carlton after staying at other great properties such as the Palace Hotel. The Ritz has a fantastic location, within walking distance of theaters, museums, shopping and outstanding New York restaurants. Moreover, the rooms are wonderfully indulgent; spacious, light, inviting. To top it off, we love the staff. Courteous and engaging whenever approached, whether you talk with someone at the front desk, the concierge or the staff on your floor, each person is proud to work at the Ritz and interested in how they can be helpful to you. We will always consider a stay at the Ritz to be very special and to be the only way to truly have our New York City experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: always an excellent stay here, the staff is extremely helpful at every turn. This is definitely a one in a million place, no wonder every review is excellent. The rooms accommodate a business traveler impeccably and the breakfast is to write home about. Beautiful lobby, stunning views, all is good.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfectly situated on Central Park, lovely rooms. Best of all the staff who were totally amazing, always one step ahead of our needs. We went to see the jersey boys ( which was fantastic) on getting back to our room to have the sound track playing topped off the evening.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is well worth the money. The service can not be beat and the room was comfortable and nicely appointed. You must visit Norman at the lounge downstairs…he is a hoot and a real "star" in own right!!! Drinks are pricey, but it is NYC and that is that. A nice touch…hot coffee put out every morning in the lobby. Great way to start the day! Thanks again Ritz!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Always pleased with my stay her and this time was no exception. Comfy beds, quite rooms, great water pressure, phenomenal room service and very convenient location. Wish I could have stayed longer.....or permanently.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the RCCP with my two teen daughters after a cruise out of New Jersey. We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. We had a standard room with two double beds located in the back of the hotel. There was no view to speak of but that didn't matter. The room was very spacious. The room included a large foyer, ample closet and drawer space and a small sitting area. The large marble bathroom had a deep tub, a large shower and a toilet room. Every imaginable toiletry was provided. The beds were well equipped with luxury duvet and linens. The service was impeccable. We mentioned to the room steward in passing that we were going to see Wicked on Broadway on our first night. After the play upon returning to the room, we heard music from the play coming from the CD player in the room. The room steward, Ronald, left us the CD from Wicked along with a lovely note. What a wonderful gesture. We ordered room service twice. Each time our order arrived hot and on time. The food was so good. The crab salad sandwich is amazing. I had it two nights in a row. However, the price of room service is too much for me (I'm not the typical Ritz customer). Each night our order exceeded $160 for a burger, an omelette and a crab salad sandwich with three soft drinks and fries. It was really good though. The location was very convenient. We walked to Times Square and Broadway. The park and a subway stop is right across the street. The Ritz Carlton Central Park is a wonderful hotel. We plan to return

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wow - the warmth shown on arrival by Felix, the welcome by the reception team, there commitment to serving the very best hospitality and that is even before we checked in. This is simply the finest hotel experience we have encountered, not just in New York but in the world. The room and views of central park (19th floor) simply cannot be described in words. The quality of staff and service at the bar, restaurant and in room dining beyond expectations. Absolute admiration for the hotel but more so for it's people.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My boyfriend and I went here for afternoon tea during the week. The sandwiches were delcious, although I felt that some of the bread could have been fresher as it tasted a little stale. I didn't say anything at the time as I thought that was how they were meant to taste, not having tasted the speciality breads before, although I had the breads later that week in another venue and they tasted a lot fresher. Having said this it didn't affect the enjoyment of the lovely sandwiches.The petit fours were out of this world as were the heated scones.The service was fantastic and the servers were very friendly. I ordered a Manhattan to have with my tea and found that the taste of whiskey was totally overpowering, I actually flinched with every taste. In the end I gave it to my boyfriend as it was too hard to drink. Overall I cannot recommend the service enough and the tea was thoroughlyq enjoyable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a great area to be in for shopping, Rockefeller, theater and fine dining, not to mention Central Park. We are new to the Ritz loyalty program and I think the verdict is still out on that after years of being very loyal SPG people. We arrived around 3:15pm and our room was not ready. We were escorted to the lounge for a complimentary drink while we waited. I was hoping for a room upgrade which I always get with SPG but unfortunately not. We did however get a high floor and the room was awesome and roomy for NYC. Lots of nice amenities, very comfortable bed and a fridge in the room. The room was also super quiet and we got 3 glorious nights sleep so the view was not really that important. The first night home after dinner we had a bottle of champagne chilling with a spectacular fruit plate and balloons for our Anniversary it was a very nice touch. I do agree with the place is needing cosmetic upgrades but our room was very clean and I know they have renovations in the works. We did have high tea which I highly recommend doing. The food was wonderful as was the service. Reservations are an absolute must. One evening we did come back to have sandwiches in the lounge. The food was not great and the service wasn't as you would expect at a Ritz property. The last morning we had breakfast in the restaurant which was delicious and the service spectacular. The bellmen and doormen are all incredibly friendly and helpful. All in all I would stay again after they have made the interior renovations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have to admit, that I expected a lot more from this hotel.After arrival I though, that maybe I should move to another hotel, but decided to stay here.The rooms were ok, people working at the front desk were professionals and locations was great.Still everything seemed outdated and worn out. Waiters at the bar were not really friendly and then there was the lounge. That was the major disappointment of my stay. Bad to non-existing food, total lack of service and overcrowded during my stay. Not the kind of place were you want to relax after meetings. I really hope, that this place undergoes major renovations. Then I could come back and maybe spend the 1000usd/night. At the moment I will not come back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Lovely boutique hotel located south of Central Park, just round the corner from 5th Avenue. We booked a suite and I loved the super comfortable bed as well as the completely silent room which made for great sleep quality. Super location with fabulous shopping area minutes away by foot and within comfortable walking distance from Times Square. Lovely lobby area leading to very cosy yet spacious room where to enjoy afternoon tea. Would have been absolutely perfect with a coffee machine / kettle in our suite, which were strangely absent. All in all, a truly memorable stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We checked in on Christmas Day, and left on the 30th, before the madness of New Years Eve. The hotel is right on Central Park South, and very convenient of all of the uptown shopping, restaurants, etc. We had a light snack on Christmas Day since we arrived late, but did not eat in the dining room again. Our room was on the 7th floor, and had a great view of Central Park. Old friends came to visit and we had a drink at a quiet table near the bar. This is a wonderful, comfortable hotel. It did not have free Wi-Fi, which I found unusual, but then we weren't in the room much anyway.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel with great concierge service and front desk staff. One down side. Carriage vendors from Central park push their services in very close proximity to the Hotel. Their tactics are both offensive and aggressive. I recognize this is outside the hotel's control, but the experience would make me pause and reconsider a future stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I came to New York city for a small vacation with my partner. We wanted to experience as many aspects of the city as possible, and dining at the Ritz Carlton hotel was one of them. We booked our afternoon tea reservation on Christmas Day, by walking into the hotel and speaking with the restaurant manager. At first, no one gave us any clear directions where to go and make a reservation - which was a bit of a come down compared to The Ritz, London. However, the restaurant manager luckily managed to make us a reservation at a very convenient time. On the day we came to The Ritz, our table was situated in the lobby / seating area - not the best seating area to enjoy afternoon tea. We was then greeted by a lovely waiter who was quick and attentive throughout service. The afternoon which was served had an adequate amount of savoy, scones and cakes available. The food tasted excellent and we also had a choice of a hot beverage each. We both tried the lovely Earl Grey tea - which was topped up frequently during the service. Overall, all the staff were dressed professional, were efficient and the cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. Also, the cutlery on the table was laid out nearly, and the china used was very clean.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I were out in New York and decided to stop at the Ritz for a drink. It's just wonderful. December is great in New York - a little chilly, but who cares. The Ritz has a wonderful lounge/bar with a huge tree, lovely decorations and presents under the tree. There are beautiful paintings on the wall similar of seasons, tourists coming in for a drink with their shopping bags along with people who stay there. I have never stayed at the Ritz, but I'm sure it's great any time of the year. New Yorkers also come in for drinks, they know what's good. It's just a beautiful place and wonderful for people watching. The service is great and very relaxed. A must if you're visiting. I've been to several Ritz Carlton's for drinks and this is one of the best.
user_name:
delospoppy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here after our company holiday party. Had a drink in the bar and then went to our lovely room with a beautiful view of the park. The next morning the staff in the exercise center could not have been nicer, even remembering my wife's name as she left.
user_name:
Jesse H
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at The Ritz-Carlton New York during our honeymoon. What stood out above all was the exemplary staff there who all remembered us by name and who were friendly and helpful.The room itself was a good size (especially for New York) with a wonderful bathroom and particularly nice sheets. The 'turndown service' was also a nice addition. We would definitely recommend this hotel and return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed 2 nights using our Ritz Rewards. We are thrilled at the experience and the hotel. The location was perfect. Our room on the 16th floor was beautiful! The service and attention to detail was phenomenal. The turn down maid even left us a note on our door with our chocolates since we turned in early and had the "Shh..." Sign on our door. We ate Lunch at the Auden Bistro shortly after arriving. The staff provided impeccable service and the food was wonderful. My only complaint, which led me to give sleep quality a 3, was that we were disappointed in the mattress in our room. If it was a Stearns and Foster, it definitely needed to be replaced. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stopped in "just to see what the Ritz looked like" and were warmly greeted over and over by the staff. Danny asked if we came for Tea. however we needed a reservation, but he said he would see what he could do to seat us in the lounge/lobby area. We were seated, and ordered a drink. He took our picture by the gorgeous Christmas tree. When the time came to settle up, he said it was "on the house". What a wonderful Christmas gift. Thanks so much to Danny and the staff at the Ritz. We will return, for sure - this time for a longer stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time here but quite familiar nearby hotelsSmaller than many Ritz hotels so seems more intimateGreat location -- on Central Park and around the corner from 5 th AveChristmas lights and decorations are great this year-- Bergdorf Goodman and Saks really outdid themselves!Hotel staff and service are excellent esp. Lobby staff and housekeeping, but several bartenders just don't listen to what you are orderingFood is quite good but pricy naturally

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My Wife and I just got home from this hotel for a 3 night stay. A little business for her plus a celebration of her birthday. We go to NYC quarterly I'd say. We are RC Platinum so we typically stay at RC Battery Park.This hotel is different location wise, but has the same great Ritz service. Some of the other reviews talk about the age of the hotel. Honestly, I'm very picky and critical, and the hotel is NOT shabby. It's just an older more historical feeling hotel. It's top notch luxury though and the service is exceptional. Battery Park RC is newer, this hotel is older. Both are incredible RC properties.Cassidy Davis emailed me prior to our arrival and was helpful with working with us on activities as well as making our stay exceptional in terms of my Wife's birthday. She is incredible and made all the difference in our stay. Truly. The other people on her team (I think they're called guest coordinators) were similarly so amazing upon our arrival.The gym was really nice and clean.The club lounge was definitely not as good as the battery park club, but it was still very nice and good, and the service was solid. But, if you normally stay at Battery Park RC, you will notice a difference in the club level for sure - size, food offering, no coffee/espresso machine, not much hot food, etc. it's a small difference and is stillExcellent. The location is great of this hotel - perfect place to go for a run in the park... Great proximity to shopping, restaurants, etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On my wife's birthday she wanted to stay at the Ritz with a view of Central Park. The Ritz cannot be beat for service and the location is perfect. We wanted for nothing during our stay. Beautiful room and view of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz was amazing. We went to NYC for the week of Thanksgiving. Everyone on the staff we went above and beyond! We were there with my parents and boys ages 6&9. They gave my boys a ritz scavenger hunt, special surprises in the room and a lot of kid friendly attention. Would definitely stay there again the next time I'm in NYC!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife wanted to spend her 50th Birthday in NYC at the Ritz. What a wonderful experience. The hotel upgraded our room to a park view for her birthday. I worked with the hotel and ordered flowers for our arrival, and they were perfect for the occasion. The hotel reserved space on 6th Ave. for Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade. We were able to come down to the lobby at 8 am and were escorted the the viewing area. The hotel staff served us warm cookies during the parade. The superb location combined with the attentive staff, created an experience we will remember forever.I have stayed at several Ritz Carlton hotels over the past three years and this hotel exemplifies the outstanding service for which the "Ritz" is noted. Combine the service with the beautiful room and convenient location, and you will have a perfect New York City experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is very well decorated with lots of fancy accents. The rooms are great with very comfy beds. The TV's have a lot of pre realized movies for a movie night. A variety of snacks are available. A wonderful weekend stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best tea in the town need reservations but easy to make just go there one afternoon for tea Great for people watching and if you lucky you may rub elbows with a celebrity or two This time of year is ideal time to go

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is well located opposite Central Park but is badly in need of an upgrade. The rooms are a great size but you can't watch TV and have the air conditioner on at the same time due to the noise of the air conditioner! It may not really matter as the hotel only has 8 or 9 Digital TV channels the rest are analogue with such poor reception you can't really watch any shows! Seriously!Service within the hotel was inconsistent, which was interesting, however, after raising my concerns at the experience I received at the hotel, the Hotel Manager responded in a manner expected.At the prices charged it is also hard to understand why the hotel gouges on Internet charges in the business centre. The days for this type of behavior are well past.As a loyal Marriott customer I would not recommend the Ritz Carlton to anyone and perhaps suggest considering the JW Marriott a few doors away on 59th Street or an alternative hotel.Having recently stayed at the Marriott in Newport RI the Ritz Carlton management could learn a lot from this team.Disappointed!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park two times in the last month. The first time was for the NY marathon and the second was for business. Both rooms I had were very nice, although my most recent room was the best. It was on the 16th floor and had a Central Park view. It was definitely worth the extra cost because waking up to that view every morning was amazing. The rooms were large and decorated in the classic Ritz style. Same with the bathrooms - nice and large. Beds at the Ritz are very, very comfortable.Service was great as always. The staff was very friendly and accommodating.The restaurant, in my opinion, is just okay. I think they can do better. I've only had breakfast, but I think the food could be kicked up a notch or two. Instead, go two doors down to Sarabeth's - it's definitely a good alternative. The food in the club lounge was good. It was fun to sip on champagne while looking out and watching people at Central Park.I went to the spa for a manicure. The staff at the front were very nice. My manicurist was very friendly, professional and gave me a great manicure. They give you a class of champagne to sip on while relaxing and enjoying the treatment.While I was there, the elevators went down due to a fire alarm. Although I had to walk down 15 floors, the staff was very calm, professional and on top of trying to get the alarm turned off and the elevators working. Everyone has their favorites and I'm not stuck on just one type of chain hotel, but the Ritz is definitely a good choice. It's in the perfect location - across the street from Central Park, near great restaurants and the best shopping. The subway is also a couple of blocks away. And, if you like service, you'll like the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ah the fine experience of afternoon tea especially on a nice cold winters day. The ambience was wonderful, the scones with the clotted cream and jams, perfectly crumbly and delicious. They had a good range of teas to select from including the masala chai though it could've been a tad less milky. Kabir our server was attentive and friendly and knowledgeable about the various teas and food served to us. The only change I would recommend is the choice of music. The music had a feel of elevator music to it. Maybe a better choice of classical would enhance the experience further. Otherwise all in all a great experience to have in NYC.
user_name:
Avantikka23
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: the hotel was great. the view from the window was awesome. we could see the statue of liberty from our room and it was a beautiful view. the concierge and hotel staff were awesome. the food was great and even the price of the room was well worth it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
