review_body: We decided to take a short trip to New York for a spot of Christmas shopping.The Ritz Carlton is in a great location opposite central park on the south side perfect for shopping, our room was lovely and spacious with a view never central park.The only thing i think the hotel could have done better is have the doormen on the doors at all times.We had a fab time went to see Les Mis on arrival did a helicopter trip on second day also did the dinner cruise which was amazing and went up the Empire State building.If you get the chance you must go into STK great steak house.Chanel was my favourite place to visit staff were amazing.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect location. Restaurant has good food and drinks. Rooms are comfortable and clean. We were impressed with our stay. You can walk to time square, Central Park, shops and restaurants. Nice friendly staff. We would stay here again. Beautiful views.
user_name:
Jennifer B
Mansfield, Texas, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: One of the most personal experiences I have yet to experience. When you talk to staff, they listen and the take good notes. Everytime I stay, they always reference something I liked and insure I have options to do what I like when I like. They know what you enjoy and the little details like no one else. This property is unique. While the Ritz properties on a whole are very nice, this is exceptional. George was the manager last night when I checked in who made it a point to say hello and not much more, and I remembered him from the last visit and how he looks after his clients. I was travelling with my daughter and a baby, they not only had a crib in the room but a balloon and teddy bear and so much more of the little things. From Joe at the front door to George and all the staff. You will feel great staying here. A true gem.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The concierge team consists of up to the minute friendly people who guide you to the hottest spots in town. They even provided shopping vouchers for Bloomingdales!Spacious rooms and bathrooms, the Park View Suites have the best views.Breakfast in the club lounge was very basic.The elevator and carpets are looking worn out need to be changed. Overall pleasant stay ,would stay there again and recommend it based on location,friendly staff and brilliant views.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything is always perfect at the Ritz. The spa and hotel rooms are amazing. The only thing I would suggest is that you tell them you aren't paying for internet access. How silly is that? The hotel isn't cheap and yet they charge you to get online. The front seat will happily give you an access code if you just ask.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This place really is out of this world amazing. We have just got back from staying here for 4 nights. We celebrated my Birthday whilst on our stay and was upgraded to a park room view. It really was remarkable. The room and view was so amazing we didn't want to leave. It really is five star plus service. The staff could have not been nicer or more professional. The location is perfect and the setting truly remarkable. Rooms are exceptionally clean and such little things like the turn down service really make you feel in total luxury. Thank you everyone at Ritz Carlton for making my Birthday and our stay in NYC so perfect. WE WILL be returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a small - boutique style Ritz Carlton directly on Central Park South. You can walk across the street and be in the park - or head two blocks over to 5th Avenue Shopping. The rooms are perfect. Very well appointed, gorgeous bathrooms and beds you could sleep the day away in - if you were not in the middle of too many great attractions. The door man knew me after the first few hours and was there for anything i could want. Loved the overnight shoe shine service (just leave them in the provided box outside of your door). There are too many restaurants to mention - although one of our favorites for amazing NY pizza is Angelos on West 57th. Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center and Broadway are easy walks. Living the good life when you stay here - they put on the Ritz but in a way that is not snobby or pretentious. Another great stay!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best location and view of Central Park. Hotel staff are friendly and efficient. Club lounge is average in comparison to other Ritz hotels around the globe. Club lounge and certain areas like the lobby waiting area, including the lift are looking quite run down and could do with a bit of a face lift. Concierge personnel are very efficient. The door men are very friendly and warm whenever guests leave or enter. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Park view suites are best.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I visited the Ritz while visiting new York on our honeymoon. I was really looking forward to the high tea as I imagined it couldn't get better than high tea at such an exclusive hotel in the heart of New York. Unfortunately we were a bit dissapointed. The service was quite slow to start with although was more efficient towards the later part of our stay. The first course of the afternoon tea consisted of savoury sandwiches and pieces. We found these stale, dry and flavourless. The second course was freshly baked scone. It was nice but was hard to eat as it was so huge (about the size of 4 scones put together) and quite crumbly. The dessert petites were very nice. As it was our honeymoon , we were surprised with a small plate of chocolate petite fours which were complimentary. When paying, we factored in a tip and paid cash, a bit extra, however were never returned with any change. We were happy to tip the standard 20% but assuming a 30% tip was rude and presumptuous. Overall, we think the high tea experiences back home in Melbourne are much better and have the 'luxury' feel which we expected.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Thank you so much to everyone who made my family’s stay memorable in the best way possible! We were celebrating my Dad's birthday and as always the entire staff went above and beyond. We were surprised with a chocolate birthday cake and a personal letter from the General Manager! Throughout the entire week the level of personalized service and attention was exceptional. This is not just a hotel, this is a second home. Thank you again to everyone!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We celebrated our wedding anniversary with a trip to New York. The hotel was the perfect choice. Door staff lovely,funny and helpful. Reception staff polite and organised. Nothing was to much trouble. Public rooms beautifully appointed.Our room didn't have a view butl was otherwise perfect. Bed very comfortable, bathroom large and Asprey toiletries luxurious. Maid staff a credit to the hotel.We had club access which was excellent. Food drink and service were all brilliant . Special thanks to all of the club staff, they really made our break memorable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Visited NYC for first time with family of 5 for a double birthday celebration. Booked a park view suite with club access. Room worked great For The kids with additional rollaway bed. We had an amazing view of the park and everything was right out the front door. Club lounge provided great service and easy breakfast lunch snacks and drinks. Fantastic club staff filled every request. From the moment we arrived the doormen knew my kids by name. Gave us apples for feed the horses one night after a carriage ride. The ritz always does a super job for our family but these guys really have their act together!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A celebratory afternoon tea in the Star Lounge. Reservation was made over the phone and confirmed by email. We had a 4pm reservation and when we arrived a table was set and we were expected.A fantastic tea selection, opted for Afternoon tea which was delicious. The sandwiches were diverse and very tasty. The cake stand was full of very enjoyable cakes and the warmed scones served with conserves, cream and lemon curd were very good. We complimented with a full glass of champagne.A thoroughly enjoyable experience and would recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz- Carlton once again is over the top regarding service and comfortable clean rooms.The doormen give you their fantastic welcoming smiles and overwhelmimg helpful information about the city. Having a fast and easy check in made the arrival go even smoother to start our day in the big apple.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is an ageless property that commands one of the finest views in all of midtown Manhattan. The expected Ritz touches are all here. The staff is courteous and welcoming. They always seemed to be there when you needed, and invisible when you didn't. Our weekend revolved around dining, museums and shows. In between, we sought the refuge of a comfortable room (extremely large by older NY hotel standards). Bathrooms that begged you to spend an hour in the shower. Love the Asprey toiletries. We would be remiss if we did not mention Norman and Erik in the Star lounge. Both of these gentlemen treated us like regulars coming in after a night on the town. If you are so inclined, tell either of these guys what you like to drink and then let them concoct something for you. Promise, you won't be disappointed. As others have said, if you are looking for trendy, big and loud; you are in the wrong place. If you want intimacy, splendor and class; step right in. The Ritz just does it right!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A superb quality location for a New York break. The hotel ambience, rooms,and service was everything you would expect from a ritz Carlton hotel. The staff were exceptional in their friendly ness and helpfulness throughout our visit. That applies from doormen to reception and concierge personnel to house keeping staff. The rooms were furnished to an excellent level of comfort. Perhaps the only thing missing for us was the lack of tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The slight disappointment was the quality of the restaurant. The food was of a reasonable standard but was more bistro fast food than cordon blue that one might have expected in this standard of hotel. However we enjoyed every minute of our stay and it was an excellent location for discovering 'the city that never sleeps'

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location. The room was spacious (for NY), nicely appointed tub, desk. Fast internet. There were no surprises. It has an efficient staff, a great breakfast, intimate bar. Definitely not trendy. Excellent hotel. I'll definitely come back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park, is a beautiful hotel on Central Park South. It's a gorgeous building with a very "classic" luxury hotel feel. The staff was great, and remembered me after the first time of meeting them. The restaurant was great for dinner, but seemed pretty overpriced for breakfast, even at a Ritz-Carlton. The Club Lounge was great and had great food, though I didn't see many hot options for breakfast (other Ritz-Carlton club levels I've stayed at have had things like bacon in the morning in the Club). All-in-all, the hotel did a great job of making a trip special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Came through NY with my wife to see The Book of Mormon on Broadway and we decided to splurge and stay at the Ritz on Central Park. What a great time. We were both a little overwhelmed by Manhattan and New York City in general, but the quiet refuge of our room and the lounge at the Ritz Carlton made the trip incredible. It's one that we tell everyone we meet about. Central Park is incredibly accessible and there are lots of interesting sights very close by. We were able to visit FAO Schwartz before they closed and had a great time talking to the various staff that we interacted with. Our room was well appointed and had plenty of space for bags and clothes if you plan to shop. ( I think we were in the Central Park Suite ) This particular Ritz Carlton has incredible feather bed toppers on their mattresses that make for absolutely heavenly sleep. I ended up purchasing something similar for my own bed from an area shop after the experience. I would highly recommend this property to anyone considering it. It's well worth the cost and although I am unlikely to visit Manhattan again, I would stay in this property if I were to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was very disappointed with my room at Trump Soho where I was booked for 4 nights with my sister from Iowa. So, called American Express Travel and they have arranged my move to Ritz Central Park. Since I have stayed at Ritz Battery Park last year I thought I would give this Central Park Ritz a go this time. Boy, was I glad I did because from the doormen to the reception to everybody, they were very nice; attentive; cordial and very professional. Everybody made you feel genuinely welcome without overdoing it. A special mention to the receptionist Orlando Ocampo who realised right away that I only had my accommodation booked that morning and asked why is that so. When he found out I was very disappointed with our room at Trump Soho, he right away went into action -"Since you had a hard time at Trump Soho, let me see if I can get you a very nice room...Oh, there's one but the occupants hasn't vacated yet. Can you wait for it to be vacated?" I obliged. My sister and I went around Central Park just across the road and had a great time. @ 4:30 PM we went back and it didn't need for Orlando to show up but another bellman who right away recognized us and he said right away: "Oh, welcome back Mrs. Hoyle, I have your keys ready for you." It is really amazing when people do this extra attention to you as a guest - make the guest feel special. Then off we went to the 22nd floor and the rest is history....Love it here! Wish I could stay longer. Now, I am waiting to see if Amex can change my flights so I can stay here longer instead of 2 nights in Dubai on the way home. Will definitely come back and stay here again. The hotel room is excellent but the people are the ace of the property. Thank you Ritz Carlton Central Park - you just made the last days of my trip special. This is one guest very grateful and very happy.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is wonderfully located on Central Park and has very large rooms and bathrooms by NYC standards. My adult daughter and I had requested a room with two beds when we made the reservation, but found that only kings were available when we arrived. The front desk let me know that there are only 12 rooms in the hotel with doubles, so make sure you get a confirmation if that's what you want! We were provided with a rollaway bed, and we were able to change to a double the next day, so the hotel managed the situation as well as they could. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only reason I am giving the Ritz 4 stars instead of 5 is the restaurant. We only had breakfasts there, but they were very average and very expensive. Service was good, but the food was just okay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing view of the Statue of Liberty and the harbour. 12th floor very quiet, excellent service as you would expect. perfect. Takes a bit to get to the midtown but lovely.It was our anniversary and they had cupcakes and chocalate covered strawberries for us.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great place to stay with kids. Room and bathrooms are large by NYC standards. Room service food was great. And super close to central park. the lounge service was a little slow and disorganized at times, but not any big issues. Really happy we stayed here. Close to a great breakfast spot-Sarabeth's too.
user_name:
Juhls524
Los Gatos, California, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everytime I come to NYC, I have to stop by the Ritz and have a drink with Norman. He is so good he probably remembers the last drink I had there even though I don't. His warm and friendly manner is charming but not imposing. Over the years, I've been there often in both business and personal situations. Normal makes New York a friendly place to visit. Don't miss Norman at the Ritz the next time you go to the Big Apple.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We checked in a bit late to a warm and friendly welcome from the front doorman to the front desk people. All the employees seem to really care about you and seem to take extra steps to make sure your stay is enjoyable. Our room overlooked Central Park with a view of the horse carriages. We did have a room with concierge level which meant we could get snacks and drinks on the second floor. The level of service, drinks and food was well worth the extra cost. The hotel has a restaurant which was good and a spa which we didnt use. This is a great location for walking as we even walked to a show on Broadway, the Today Show and favorite restaurants. Our stay was during the United Nations week so we had Diplomats in the hotel and everything seemed to flow ok with that many people (it was booked).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Room amenities service AAA, always a bit pricey but you get what you pay for, one of the best hotels in any city, country you travel to, atmosphere is what i look for in a hotel, valet parking no worries, anything you want just ask for it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here recently on a getaway with my husband. Fantastic staff, and some top notch ideas from George. He arranged all of our shows and dinners for the weekend. We had a lovely view of Central Park from the 16th floor. I would recommend the Ritz Central Park to anyone looking for a romantic getaway.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We like to stay at hotels with great location in a city and a great club lounge for relaxing in between sight seeing and tourist fun. The food on offer from breakfast to dessert was good and varied T he afternoon tea was great plus the wine selection was good and the staff pleasant. Early morning coffee in take away for our early morning city walks was also welcome. The view across the park was great the room in general was worth the asking price

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Did a overnight dinner and stay in NYC and stayed at this location. The drive up to the entrance, we were greeting professionally and it seemed once the staff knew who were were, everyone knew our names. We were walked over to the check in where an upgrade to a deluxe room was offered. We were informed that the room wasn't ready, but since we had dinner plans it wasn't a factor. We took the upgraded room. Upon returning from Dinner, the check in process was complete and our bags were already taken to the room. Service was exceptional. The room was what would be expected at this level, clean and comfortable. Given it's NYC not that large but again expected. For the 10 hours we spent at the hotel cannot find any negatives. The location is great and the staff certainly made the difference in making the quick stay enjoyable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We, and another couple, decided to spend 5 days in New York and chose this hotel to have a 5-star experience. It was!!!! Lov d the location and fabulous guest service. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love the Ritz-Carleton NY, so I'm regretful about downgrading it from five to four stars. I just have to admit that it can't really compare to all the really luxurious hotels out there. It has many things in its favor: a great location on Central Park South, right opposite all those horse-drawn carriages and central park, near Bergdorf's and Barney's for those who like shopping, great strolling along Madison Ave. The staff are wonderful, and the Club option is a great value: the Club Room on the second floor serves great light breakfasts, lunches and dinner as part of your room cost and is a great way of avoiding restaurant hassle (though the Lobby Restaurant is good too, and has a lovely ambience). Prices, of course, are astronomical--that's just the way it is. But on our last stay, the worn-out beige color palette of all the rooms, and the empty space in most of them (as if there was a furniture shortage) couldn't help seem lack-luster in comparison to the brighter, more updated hotel rooms elsewhere. Everything (!) is beige--no color anywhere--floor, carpet, sofa, chair, curtains, bedspread, etc--and I really think the RC should be in line for a renovation. The other beef we had -- and this one is brand new -- is that our room *reeked* of cleaning product. We opened the door and were hit with a throat-gripping aroma that made us feel slightly queasy. It would get better during the night, but after each day's cleaning it was back. Are they cleaning the rooms with industrial-strength products? Why? It's hard to be comfortable when your room smells.I hope these complaints will be noticed by the RC management. There's no reason for such an excellent hotel to be going downhill in these regards, even if it remains top-notch in every other way.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton Central Park is a lovely selection, if you want a NYC luxury option on or near Central Park, shopping on the main avenues, etc. The service is exceptional and the typical Ritz-Carlton experience can be expected - with the notation that this is an older style New York City Hotel. I find this hotel to be charming, however it could use interior upgrades. Its location on the park is a big plus. If you prefer modern features, higher ceilings, updated interiors, a big lobby area or an impressive entrance - you should consider looking at other options for this price category. NYC has so much to offer in the luxury hotel market. The location makes this Ritz a great selection, if you do not mind passing on more updated design and modern room features. We stayed in a corner suite, which was spacious and quite comfortable - but there was no "wow" factor with the decor. Simple and elegant with fantastic linens along with a heavenly bed. Also, the staff at the Ritz-Carlton really went out of their way to please.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night at the end of a recent NYC trip a couple of weeks ago. We were upgraded to a partial park view room at check-in… something to check off of the bucket list! The front desk attendant was very friendly too. We have stayed at a number of 5-star properties and a lot of Ritz Carlton properties and this was definitely one of our favorite hotel stays ever! The room was very large and the bathroom huge for NYC standards. And the bed was SO comfortable!The location can't be beat. You walk out the door, cross the street, and you're in Central Park. Many subway lines are easily accessible and many attractions are just a short walk away. A hotel room here definitely comes with a hefty price tag but it's a great place for a splurge or a special occasion. There are so many special touches throughout the hotel that make it feel very luxurious.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Never disappointed. Expect and receive. The RC staff never ceases to impress us. From ck in to ck out we are always greeted with a kind and professional attitude. The rooms are immaculate. If you enjoy bath salts or a well prepared kettle one dirty martini's, just let them know upon your first visit and you will always be happy upon arrival.. We will continue to be loyal customer, both in NYC and across the globe,
user_name:
Anne L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The management, ladies and gentleman of the Ritz Carlton, Central Park, NYC, provided everything we required to make my birthday celebration a memorable event, including a hand written note, a special birthday cake, and decadent chocolate treats. My daughter and I hope to celebrate other special occasions at this grand hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Quiet, serene, elegant. Wonderfully sophisticated.Warm to the children.The service was excellent-- we requested so many little things and each request was met with a smile. The rooms were kept totally clean. Special pillows were brought.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue Shopping, Times Square, () and even Radio City Music Hall!Restaurants next to the Ritz & even Horse & Carriage rides!Standard Ritz Carlton exceptional service & quality rooms.You can even bring your dog! Next time we will bring our dog and let him enjoy walks in Central Park!Very friendly & professional front desk staff who will get a cab for you at any time!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The view from the room over Central park was great. Excellent location- linked to the mall, which was convenient during the rain. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Check-in: very professional and welcoming

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was my fourth stay at this lovely hotel. I chose to upgrade to an upper floor park view and it was fantastic. Everything about this hotel is phenomenal. The decor and cleanliness is first rate. And don't get me started on the out of this world bathrooms. The shower is so nice and then having the separate tub (and toilet room) takes it over the top. What really sets the Ritz Carlton's bathroom apart from other 5 star hotels, is the SIZE! It truly is large. I've had the opportunity to stay in two room categories, both with equally fantastic bathrooms. I've also stayed in two other 5 star hotels on, or near the park whose baths don't hold a candle to the Ritz. Just be sure to ask for a bath that is NOT handicap accessible. A handicap accessible bathroom will remove the separate walk in shower. Housekeeping and room service are first rate. Enjoy!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had the chance to stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park in August. In short, the hotel and the ladies and gentlemen who make it what it is - are absolutely spectacular. There was only one issue with the Club Lounge which I will get into later. Despite this issue, I have given the hotel the highest rating as I believe the Club Lounge almost operates under different rules and culture.This Ritz is THE quintessential luxury hotel in the most perfect location imaginable with its entry right across from the south entrance to Central Park. It is a 1 minute walk to the most luxurious shopping imaginable, and its prime location puts it in the culinary heart of NYC as well. Let's break the experience down into some categories because this hotel deserves that.ServiceThere is no other hotel chain on earth that has better service than Ritz Carlton. I have said it before in other reviews. The front desk staff are second to none anticipating your needs just as the restaurant staff and the concierge staff. In short, they made me feel welcome.RoomThis is also one of the Top 5 rooms I have ever stayed in. When I checked in, I was a bit earlier than check-in time, so they had me go to the Club Lounge. To my surprise, they upgraded me to a Park View Suite which was spectacular! I had a corner suite with full views of Central park, a gorgeous living room which was tastefully decorated, and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.Room ServiceThe food at this hotel as well as the menu are first class. I loved the creative green salad with quinoa and skirt steak I had in the lobby lounge, and I loved the house smoked salmon I ordered in room for breakfast.Club LoungeThe club lounge in this hotel is not like other Ritz-Carlton club lounges I have experienced. This particular one is not friendly at all. During my stay, neither of the two attendants at the front desk greeted me during my stay in the lounge. They were busy when I walked in, but neither even came over to introduce themselves although I was there for over an hour. This stands in stark contrast to the amazing experiences I have had in the club lounges of the Ritz Carlton in San Francisco, Philadelphia, Dallas and Marina del Rey. In short, for this hotel, the club lounge is not worth the money. The club lounge is supposed to be a highly personalized experience which affords the guest a higher level of service. Central Park fell very far short of that.Overall, again, despite the Club Lounge experience, this hotel is 5 star all of the way. While it may be pricey, there is no better placed hotel you can stay in within New York City, and the experience is second to none.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location in unique as it is overlooking central park, near the plaza food court, Time warner center, 5th Ave shopping, apple store, etc. The service is great generally but they forgot to deliver our birthday champagne and over charged us. So they didn’t get the little things right. The room is very nice although there was no coffee machine in the room and most importantly, the beds are very comfortable. I would go back if they reduced the room rates.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Such a timeless establishment. Courteous, friendly staff and clean rooms. Concierge level was fabulous and I looked forward to tea and cookies everyday. The hotel is located perfectly so that you can walk to the park or shops or wherever you want.The bar area is nice and quiet with good drinks served by professional servers.Very quiet atmosphere. This place IS class.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I had a truly amazing experience this past weekend at the Ritz, Central Park, New York City…at every turn, we were greeted by professional and top shelf Ritz team members… Anticipating our every need. A few standouts include Ender, Lazar and Eric at the bar…ALL of the staff were extremely courteous, warm, and most helpful. From leaving the club with an attendant asking us if we would like to take some cookies with us to; leaving the restaurant and hearing the waiter say "would you like to take some condiments with your leftovers?" to; Eric offering up late night snacks and treats at the bar...these moments of truth really made our entire experience a memorable one… One that we look forward to re-creating again in the not-so-distant future....THANK YU!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Back again to the Ritz after a year. Got upgraded to room facing central park, what a pleasant surprise. The staffs were friendly as usual, fantastic location. The room service staffs were a bit uneven on the helpfulness level, other than that, everything are as expected out of Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for 3 days with wife and son, all staff were superb. They really made you feel welcome. The breakfasts were wonderful. The location was excellent for the park and shopping. The staff were happy to assist in booking tickets for top of the rock, natural museum and zoo. Worth a visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had a room with a view...greenish Central Park. It was awesome to leave the windows open to watch the stars to sleep.The room was not as good as "Ritz-Carlton" should be.The front desk service was not impressive.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Absolutely fabulous for service, decadence and tremendous quality of care from Concierge George and Bellman Allan. Sorry that we did not see Norman again this time as it was a short 3 day visit, but will sure see him next time when we visit from Scotland! Best place to stay when in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It is true, there are an endless amount of places to stay in New York. However, there is only one Ritz Carlton at Central Park! From the spa amenities to the overall care and craftsmanship of the establishment, one finds themselves in a feeling that they have found a slice of heaven. The warm staff is always accommodating, smiling, attentive, understanding and helpful. Need directions? Absolutely - Mr. Smith! Need a house provided car service? Our pleasure Mr. Smith! Your pillow is not as soft as you like...enough said Mr. Smith!If you've stayed at a Ritz before, you can bet this location will be one of your finest experiences in this genre of lodging. I recommend the Club Level (always). The view of Central Park is timeless and a one of a kind experience while staying in the big city.I can go on and on regarding my recent and memorable experience. However, I suggest you create one for yourself.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a frequent traveler i accumulate points and miles in fairly large quantities. I never use them. I hoard them because i have the mindset that points and miles carry a stigma and the hotels/airlines don't treat you like a paying customer. On this trip, i was so wrong.In the four years that my soon to be wife and I have been together and frequenting NYC, we have never had the quality of service, the quality of accommodations and the quality of overall experience as we just did at The Ritz Carlton Central Park.Yes we've stayed at top notch hotels...but the level of care, the level of genuine concern, the level of friendliness and helpfulness has not compared to what we just experienced this past wknd.From moment one, when we were checking in fairly early (before noon), there was a determined effort by the desk agent, Ender, to find us a great room and upgrade us (without our asking) to the club level. We would end up leaving our bags and getting to some wedding related appointments but during that time we received a text that our room was ready. Upon our return we were checked into a very peaceful room on the 9th floor with access to the Club and its numerous presentations. Ender was the sole reason our trip started on the right foot...and it just flowed from there.The room itself was clean, well appointed and very comfortable with a turbo charged AC to compete against the 90+ temps outside. Everyone we came across over the next three nights either remembered our names, knew we were guests and otherwise were genuinely interested in seeing that we wanted for nothing. Let me also remind you that i was here on points...my hoard not so large anymore but so well worth it.Nightly drinks in the lobby, snacks in the club and taking advantage of arguably the most perfect location for a hotel in NYC are certainly just a handful of the numerous highlights this property has to offer. And for those who think this hotel is even remotely stuffy, i beg to differ. Friendly, warm smiles/greetings at every turn.On any given night this hotel has rates that range from 695$ to well over 1000$ a night depending on room size/view and season. It's worth it...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed four nights and had a great experience. The room was lovely and all of the staff were extremely helpful responding to any request. I would stay again and highly recommend this hotel. We used the Club daily and did notice that wine was removed 30 minutes before closing to prepare for the next morning, so we had to ask for a glass of vino which was provided without a problem. I suggest they leave it out until closing so guests can partake if they so choose.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After being a very loyal customer of the St. Regis New York I got a promo offer from the Ritz so decided to stay there instead. Both are about $500 per night. The Ritz is in a great location on Central Park South. The hotel is very beautiful and the rooms are very nice. What was very disappointing was the fact that the standard rooms do not include butler service (the St. Regis includes butler for everyone) and the TV channels were terrible. No Bravo or Lifetime, among others. After a long hard day at work I want to unwind with some mindless entertainment like Housewives-but not here. Nice place but you can do much better for the same price.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The club level of this hotel will provide you with service not found in any other hotel in NYC - Over the top - friendly staff wonderful cocktails - champagne at the blink of an eye. Help your self to the cookie box sit back relax and enjoy -

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You're pretty sure things will be alright when you book a Ritz Carlton and they absolutely were. Reassuringly expensive with great service. Four stars because it took 20 minutes plus to check in and after a long flight we wanted it to be be 1 minute.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: for a visit to NYC. We got a room on the 15th floor for a week with a stunning view of Central Park. The concierge was very helpful with restaurants- and we were able to take advantage of a use get one night free with every two nights.The lobby is small, quiet and beautiful and well appointed.Service was equal to, perhaps better, than the Four Season (my measuring stick for any luxury chain). Well done- highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This property has received many awards for service in NYC...you'll know why as soon as you walk inside. It's a blend of old school with modern. The rooms are well appointed and very modern. Showers are roomy and bathrooms are the size of small New York apartments. The risk in NYC you get small (and I mean really small) rooms. These are great. I will also say I didn't hear one siren at night...the windows must be thick. The service at the property is off the charts....they look out for you and anticipate your needs. Had a need and one of the Managers, Jorge was an amazing ambassador for the hotel and chain. Overall, well worth the decision to stay there and will be back again in the near future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed with a friend at your property for one evening and it was amazing! It was an easy check in process and a friendly gentleman, Adam escorted us to our room. He even sent us a great amenity to our room with a lovely card. Also, Anthony the pastry chef was so great and made my stay so special with the treats he put in our room. Thank you for the great service and I'm so happy I got to stay at your property!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park South is a beautiful property. The staff was solicitous. We didn't feel like we were in a big anonymous hotel but rather an intimate luxury inn. We were greeted by name as we came and went. The front desk staff was accomodating to our needs and the concierges were helpful. Quite a professional staff. The gym is functional and while not exciting has everything you need for a workout. The onsite restaurant Auden, was great for breakfast (it was included for us during our stay--but it is very expensive). The staff there was exceptional. See my review on that. We didn't do club level. Also, if you have to feel anyone who missed breakfast by sleeping in, there is a good sandwich shop around the corner south on Sixth Avenue for a quick bacon, egg, cheese sandwich. The location of this hotel is central and convenient. While the rooms are clean and beautiful they do need some freshening and an electrical outlet bar for iphones and other devices would be an nice updated feature. The carpet needs to be replaced. For an NYC hotel room there is ample space both in the room and bathroom. Water pressure good, separate WC, ample toiletries and hairdryer at the ready. A/C was very effective so getting into that incredible bed while the room is cold in the middle of the summer was delicious.We didn't stay in a park view room so we never really looked out the window. For us being price motivated we were fine with that. The room itself was beautiful so we didn't care. All the rooms are furnished the same so the quality is consistent minus the view. While not modern and sleek, The Ritz Carlton is timeless, elegant and well staffed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel, great location and fantastic service. Wished we could have stayed longer, we were upgraded on arrival and were given a fabulous suite for our family of four- the kids were happy on the sofa bed and we had a very comfortable enormous bed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I generally like the Ritz Carlton as they usually have found a way to delight us. This time they did manage to get us a table at Ralph Lauren's Polo Bar, which is not easy. This particular property has been high on my list as it is located next to the Central Park and views from the Park View rooms are simply amazing. Otherwise, this location has started to deliver mixed service standards mainly in Food & Beverage Area.I always stay at the club level and I found that the service level had really dropped drastically since my last visit few years ago. The presentations during cocktail hours were very poor from variety perspective and the breakfast was kind of disappointing as well. Lunch and Afternoon tea service was pretty nice. We also tried the room service once and the food was less then innovative. In the lounge, the staff was not very proactive for example they did not ask during the breakfast if we would like to have cappuccino and during the cocktail hours guest had to go to the kitchen to ask if they could have a drink as the staff was not managing the tables. Generally, only the person at the concierge desk said something to us. Others did seem pretty much tuned out.Usually, the Ritz have had employees at the main doors in uniforms to greet guests, when they leave and return to the property. This time they did not have them there. Few times some employees without uniform were opening the doors, and I was not really sure if they worked there or not.Few times we sat down in the lobby bar and there were people working behind the bar, but nobody came over to us to ask if we wanted to have a drink or something. It pretty much seemed that they did not have proper amount of staff in duty during the evenings.Overall, it looks like attention to detail mainly at the Club Lounges is something that some Ritz Carlton hotels, like this one, have started to fall behind and sometimes for this reason the better choice from price-to-service ratio perspective could be to stay in other Marriott brand hotels like the Edition or JW Marriott (or maybe even "outside the family" in the Peninsula or the Four Seasons). I may not return to this property after our experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time in New York with my wife and twelve year old son, our room had a superb view of Central Park and was quiet,immaculately clean and very comfortable with a great bathroom and seperate wc.Our son had a comfy fold away bed. All of the staff are superb, very friendly and professional and would do anything to help you.The location couldn't be better and you are not far from all the main attractions. The club lounge is a must and provides a constant flow of food and drink throughout the day as well as its own concierge service with a view over Central Park, a real haven. I would highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz lives up to the reputation. Fabulous Staff. Beautiful hotel. Wonderful suite. Central location. Nice restaurant. Great Service. Friendly atmosphere. Culture of Excellence. Just pick this one.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After booking my wedding in Central Park we looked for a hotel within the area. The ritz carlton was perfectly located and we could access attractions, I enjoyed staying in this area, much more civilised than staying around Times Square.From the moment we pulled up the door man joe was a delight, nothing was ever too much trouble during our stay!Check in was warm and pleasant and rooms were clean, elegant and well presented.I was greeted by the steamer and full length mirror I had requested weeks before, I couldn't believe they had still remembered I had requested these! As I got married during our stay, it was really important we had a flexible bunch of staff who were organised. I could not of dreamed how kind, caring and thoughtful the the team at the ritz are. After steaming my dress perfectly and pressing the suits to perfection I felt organised for the big day.After getting back from the wedding I was overwhelmed to notice a bottle of champagne, flowers organised by the concierges and rose petals decorating the bed, complete with a photo frame with my picture inside.(I don't know how they sleekly took a picture in my dress, but the detail and thought was amazing) I was also give a fragrance of the park to remember my big day!Not only did the staff organise a sprinter to get us home in style, they also stored my relatives bags and our own without even being asked before our flight home.All in all this hotel can not be beaten, the staff are genuine and warm people. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know who is staying in New York City. I feel that all the staff really embraced our wedding party, I will always keep the ritz carlton in my heart! 5 star service with a heart! The wood/Newell family xxxx

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There is no better location for me in NYC than the Ritz Carlton Central Park South. We just checked out today, and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. We found it easy to get everywhere...especially with the help of the staff at the hotel. We found they could provide anything we needed. We also felt very secure, as the doormen seemed to pay attention to the comings and goings, AND a key is needed to go up on the elevator. Everyone was delightful: the bellmen (Jose remembered our names every time he saw us!), the front desk staff, the concierge staff (service with a smile), and the room service staff (Patricia was especially friendly). Room service, in addition to being friendly, was especially efficient as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I found our 10th floor city view/partial park view room to be very comfortable. The A/C kept us cool all night (rare in hotels these days), and we experienced no street noise or hotel noise (our room was well insulated). The water pressure in the shower was great, and we found we had everything we could possibly need. This hotel is highly recommended for the location and great staff.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is our 3rd trip to this hotel and whilst we love the location, the old world elegance and the general level of service, we felt that this trip some standards had slipped a little. We had a super check in experience and a lovely touch of chocolates for our special occasion but the rooms were a little tired; a musty smell in one, and turn down, servicing the room was a little haphazard at best. We were not addressed by name after our arrival and we were underwhelmed by the service in the club lounge. The food and drink offerings are much reduced since our last visit. Service is polite but not welcoming and small things like failure in programming our room keys, giving us poor advice on museum entrance tickets, lack of storage of bags on checkout etc did not impress. It pulled down the tone on what has been and should be a top hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After enjoying afternoon tea at the Ritz in London to say we were disappointed with our experience at the Ritz Central Park would be an understatement. We arrived early and thought that we could enjoy a drink in the bar but we were shown to our table straight away. The seating area was dark and gloomy and lacked ambience. For most of the afternoon there was no one else in the lounge and we were the only ones it seemed booked in for afternoon tea. We were each served a small teaplate of approx 5 buns with fillings after which we were given a warm scone and finally a small selection of cake which was served on a very plain silver platter. There was nothing special about the food or presentation at all and cannot be compared in any way shape or form to the fabulous and opulent experience at the ritz London. The one saving grace were the waiters who were very pleasant. We did share our concerns with the duty manager but left feeling our comments would make very little difference. Such a shame as this very expensive experience was booked by my husband for our anniversary. We would certainly not visit this hotel again and suggest that management take a look at the standard of afternoon tea served in the Plaza.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I spent 2 nights recently at the hotel. The service provided by the entire staff was amazing. I've stayed at multiple Ritz-Carlton locations around the world and the service provided by this staff exceeds all others. They were personable, friendly and very helpful. The rooms are a great size and the housekeeping services were excellent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: i would be hard pressed to try to find one thing wrong with this hotel- the only thing i can think of is their putting the wrong name on my daughters birthday cake which they profusely apologized for and then proceeded to offer us front row seats to the lighting of the rockefeller center christmas tree- WOW! and then decorated our suite with everything justin bieber- from posters, balloons, candy, a cake with his photo on it, you name it, it was there- we were in town to take our daughter to the j.b. concert so that was an awesome surprise for her that more than made up for the cake error- the staff could not be more gracious and accommodating. the rooms are lovely and well appointed. the ambiance of this hotel is warm and wonderful-

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I spent many days here for a family vacation in NYC. Everything was perfect. No complaints. The location is perfect. Everything is within walking distance. Steps to great shopping whether on Fifth Avenue, Madison Avenue, or Columbus Circle. Great views of Central Park across the street. The hotel itself is beautiful with old world charm combined with modern amenities. The rooms are luxurious, and the beds are beyond comfortable. The Club Lounge and their food offerings are superb. The staff does a great job pleasing so many people, yet keeps the food coming and the lounge concierge (located in the club) is excellent. Everything about the hotel is top notch; but the thing that sets this hotel apart from all the others is their excellent staff. The bellmen, the doormen, the wait staff, the front desk agents, the housekeeping staff - all greet you with a nice, warm smile and will do anything to make your stay more enjoyable. They pay attention to the details and know what to provide sometimes before you even ask. We will be back, hopefully real soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have always dreamed of staying here. It is as glamorous as it's name. The lobby, jaw dropped. The staff was so polite and professional. Go up to our room and yet blown away. A room for a princess with a view of Central Park. Perfect location, perfect hotel to drink peach bellinis.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I came her for afternoon tea with my family. The setting was absolutely beautiful and service second to none. The food was also fantastic with a wide variety of tea-time favourites. Highly recommend for an attentive and memorable experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment we arrived until we left, we were treated with excellent customer service. I cannot begin to say enough good things about this hotel and staff. Our room was very spacious, clean and updated. I was a little nervous about the noise level being right off the elevator but it was very quiet. Our view of Central Park was amazing. The location was very convenient and easily accessible to everything.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On this trip, the intention was that I was staying here alone with my 8 year old daughter for 6 nights. But since it was our 20th wedding anniversary this week, my husband, who works in the Caraiben for half a year decided to surprise us! He had emailed the hotel about it before. So they knew, we didn't. We stay a lot in RC hotels around the world and whenever in NY we always stay at Ritz Battery Park. We love the view over the water and still so close to the city! It was always a dream to stay here...My decisison to stay here this time was of the location, close to the park, shops, restaurants etc. Check in was smooth and Adam gave our daughter her Ritz check in.. he spoiled her! He was so nice to talk to! Our room was way in the back, low floor, no view at all....I saw in an earlier review this might have been because we sked for 2 queen beds...Should I have known I would have asked for a King..Being a Marriott Platinum member I expected more...We went to the lounge which had a beautiful view overlooking the entrance of Central Park and the horse carriages. There was a nice food presentation. But somehow, it didn't feel good...We almost had to beg for a drink, after we tipped the men, he was a little more friendly. However, our daughter is very well behaved, very well travelled, she was very quiet, has good manners, some guests looked at us down for being here with a child. Also the staff in he club-lounge were polite but not over friendly. We liked Charles (?) very much! He was great! After our 9 hr flight we decided to sleep. Loud airco so you couldn't hear any noise from the streets behind ;) Same stand-off atmosphere in the lounge the next morning. We had breakfast, overlooking the park with poor people (do not know the english word for them, sorry) on the banks sleeping in front of us. Nice choice of breakfast but like warm egg or waffle or pancake was missing..No-one offered it to us as well... After a walk, we came back to the hotel, our daughter did the horse feeding with a very nice lady from the hotel! It was a great adventure and she was so nice to talk to!!! When my husband talked to the very friendly and very experienced lady conciierge I had a look at the bar-menu on one of the tables and the waiter came to me with an attitude of "what I was doing there". We decided to have a cold drink after the hot temperatures outside in their lounge but we were ignored totally by waiting staff...And we tipped the man the day before ?!?! Why, we did not know. Finally, after I went to his kitchen and asked for a cold beer, he served it. It was definitely not his best day. They took all the beautiful paintings from the walls (for renovation or inspection) and you could see how long the paintings had hang there already.must have been for years.....After being ignored again we decided ; "this was it!!" From my room I called to the Ritz Battery Park, made reservations there and we checked out. The doorman called a cab for us, he was very friendly at first, my husband came a few minutes later, check out took longer than expected. But my husband expected I had tipped the doorman but I did not have any dollars so nobody tipped him unfortunately, he slammed the door of the taxi behind us and said something not nice.....I am not sure why but we had very much the feeling that we did not fit in the hotels's picture.... for some reason....maybe because we are Europeans?!? Maybe we were just tourists at that time....We travelled all over the world, stayed in the most up-class hotels, but even in the Burj-al Arab in Dubai where we have stayed several times we did not feel this 'snobbish' atmosphere!!I still have to say that communication with the hotel before arrival was great!!! The concierge gave us a nice envelop with tips of excursions I asked for! Great!Not sure if wifi was free, it was for us, being a MRW platinum.We were so happy when we came back at Ritz Battery Park, glad to be home!! See my next review! We had the opportunity here to meet the American World Champion Soccer Ladies as well!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: 4 nights and 5 days here. Had park front room on 11th floor, staff great and professional, fantastic location for everything you need. Comfortable and clean accommodations with a great restaurant.Highly recommended to all, another great hotel from Ritz Carlton. Columbus circle tube station 3 min walk. 5th avenue just around the corner.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was my second stay at this hotel. We were welcomed by Mr. Robinson at the front desk. He was wonderful and extremely accommodating. On this day, we had a park view suite which was very comfortable for the three of us. The room was clean and well put together. The housekeeper had a great smile and was very accommodating for our requests for extra towels and toiletries.We also experienced the club lounge and had a nice time talking to Kelly who was one of the assistants. She is an excellent staff person and should be acknowledged. The food and drink selections were varied and fresh and enjoyed by all in our party. This location is all was one should expect at the Ritz Carlton and I would stay there in the future without reservations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Previously, my husband and I reserved visits to this hotel for when we traveled as a couple, but this week we brought our young sons (7 & 5) with us, and it has been fantastic. The beautiful view of Central Park is so fun, and we can easily explain the layout of the city right from the window (midtown, upper east side, upper west side, etc). Having quick access to the Plaza Food Mall is so convenient and such a fun experience in and of itself. The staff was so welcoming when we arrived after a long travel day of flight cancellations and rerouting. The manager opened up a closet in the lobby and let the boys choose a toy from an overflowing red wagon of goodies (they each chose kites). We ordered room service one night very late and it was top notch. The rooms themselves are spacious, well-appointed, very clean, and the housekeeping staff is the friendliest we've ever experienced. The beds are amazingly comfortable, and provide a wonderful retreat after an exhausting busy day taking in allthe many offerings of Manhattan. The bathrooms are perhaps my favorite part of the rooms here, with marble showers, huge soaking tub, and private enclosed water closet. The vanities are large with lots of storage too. We love it here, and will continue to visit and stay here!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is a hop and a skip from the Plaza Hotel and right opposite Central Park. The service cannot be faulted at all. The rooms are wonderfully spacious and the staff know what one wants before we do.
user_name:
LanaDavies
Cape Town Central, South Africa

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from 4 night stay to celebrate 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is amazing had a deluxe park view room which was amazing with a view to die for. All the staff were attentive and friendly. We had a bottle of wine delivered to our room as they new it was our wedding anniversary. A special thank you to Tamara our welcomer who on hearing we were going to see wicked had a copy of the soundtrack and a lovely note in our room for when we returned outstanding service!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had the pleasure of spending two nights here this week for a wedding. Beautiful lobby and bar, but what really made the stay was the staff. Without exception, they were courteous, friendly and always helpful. This is what you expect hotel staff to be like and rarely get with this consistency. Will definitely return here on our next trip.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed here several times for special occasions. The club level is wonderful with plenty of different foods and great view of Central Park. Great service and very welcoming. Rooms are luxurious although could use some updating. Always our favorite place to stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Having stayed at this hotel many times, I looked forward to a night in NY and booked a room. We were welcomed as warmly---as always--- by Joe, the Door Gentleman who began there years ago and whom I have come to know and respect greatly. The other greeters and Front Desk Staff were also friendly and helpful. I upgraded by choice for a suite with a Park view and wanted to have a special stay for a special business occasion with a person from Australia. I'd suggested The Ritz. I asked if we could please have a telescope and they said that yes, they'd get one out of another unused room for us. Bags were brought up promptly and we were happy and felt at home as always whenever we stay here. We had a drink in the longs and the server was distracted and hurrying. We wanted to feel relief from the pace, so it was what it was and we left, tipped 20% anyway. Anyone can have a hard day! The room (1514) was dingy, lifeless. The decor was tepid and unwelcoming. No spark, nothing special. We were very disappointed. It was certainly NOT worth an upgrade. Housekeeping was terrific and collected laundry and had it back to us promptly the next morning cheerfully, and we tipped with appreciation. Breakfast: VERY disappointing! We expect more from Ritz than this! Mustard in the Eggs Benedict was too strong, arrived cold--not on the side as ordered. Waffle was not hot. Fresh fruits were lovely. Even the coffee (!) was NOT HOT. I'd called for a NYTimes which did NOT arrive. The bed linens were fresh but turndown service never arrived. WHAT HAS HAPPENED? The telescope---you guessed it: it never arrived, either, and it's the reason we upgraded so that we could watch planets in the night sky along with the moon. I'm a Ritz Club Member. This stay gives me every reason to consider The Four Seasons or The St. Regis next trip. I've stayed here so many times that I cannot count them. Upon departure, employees were observably stressed---too much so. They were working hard, too. The Bellman was doing his best but the man in charge at the front door (not Joe) was barking orders at workers! This was rude and embarrassing for all. We left amid a chaotic front entrance and management was observably poor. What a waste of a suite, here! The Ritz needs some major changes: this was made clear to us.Note to management: Happy employees=happy guests. Get back on your game. I have NEVER written a review for Ritz that has ever been anything but complimentary. Bad stay, bad food, bad feeling when we left.Problems with Internet connection required the maintenance tech to come to the room, and then it only worked until morning. NOT a good stay, Ritz!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time in NYC for Christmas with my wife. The hotel was just amazing in everyway possible and we stayed 5 days in total. First we were greeted by Joe the doorman with the biggest most friendliest hug ever. The hotel décor was very warm and welcoming all ready for Christmas. It was all the little touches that made the difference so forget about the all the glam in the hotel, the hot apple and cinnamon drinks before you went out shopping or on your return from the freezing cold that really sealed it for me.Rooms and beds was very comfortable and at night not a noise could be heard. the staff were all very pleasant and this Ritz could not have got any better. If you can make sure you include the breakfast deal in your package. Loved this place and I will be back. Looking forward to see the doorman also.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Where do I start, the Ritz Carlton Central Park South is one of the finest, glamorous, up class 5star hotel that I have ever been in. I travel more then five times a year, and I travel only luxury style ( meaning first class only and stay at only top 5star hotels ) yet still some 5star hotels need more improvement to reach that standard. To us "Ritz Carlton Central Park South" deserves a 7star standard in my opinion. We checked in July 11, stayed in room 1205 with a Central Park view "a big wow"From the moment our limousine arrived to the hotel, the welcoming that they greet you at the entrance door is unbelievable. Then, the check-in was superb, everyone is there for a reason and that is to make you feel so welcomed. I have never in my entirely life experienced such great service. Indeed, I would have to say the Ritz Carlton Central Park South staff are top notch, well trained, nothing is too much for them when it comes to your happiness and making your stay as pleasant as ever. This I have never experienced not even at a Four Season hotel. Thank you so very much for making our stay one memorable one, a big big thank you to Mr Terry MCANENEY "Hotel Manager", Mr Ender OZMELEK "Guest Relation Agent", and Mr Robinson MARTINEZ "Front Desk Agent". A special thanks for the lovely chocolates, strawberries with champagne from Patty in room Dining and Casserole Indy Davis the guest relation team. We do hope to visit soon again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was alright. The staff was amazing but I felt that their was something missing. The bellman was great at offering ideas on where to go. We stayed in a standard room with a view of the park. The location could not have been better. But I felt the prices were outrageous even by NYC standards. I expected this place to blow me away. This place felt like your average hotel. I paid $900 per night. I feel ripped off.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location of this hotel is untouchable, the staff is excellently trained. Housekeeping is perfect. We were traveling on a family trip, so I was rooming with my daughter, we requested double beds, there is only one double bed room per floor and the view is NOT good. The room is still beautiful but had I known I would have gone with a king bed. Not a big deal but be aware. The hotel is wonderful no matter the view.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were able to reserve a room on the 21st floor with a view of central park. The staff here is top notch. The Club Lounge is really the best way to go. There are delights served throughout the day. I've always stayed close to Times Square, but i think now, it's only the upper east/west side for me.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz in New York with my family (two rooms). We had no view, but the hotel is beautiful and is very well located. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There are only a couple of negative points, but I want to share them with you as I did find them disturbing. The first is that the air-conditioning system is noisy. At night, it woke me up. I mentioned it to the front desk and they sent an engineer, but I guess that nothing could be done. It remains noisy. That said, it shows that everything else is very quiet! The second (less important point) is that the safe is small and has no plug in it (which is kind of standard in hotels nowadays).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: the location is really good and the service was amazing the price is a little much but it is one of the best hotels in new york maybe even the best i cant recommend this enough it is really amazing so manny things close to it

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent a few days at the hotel to celebrate a significant wedding anniversary. Everything was just as it should be for a hotel of this caliber and price. The staff could not have been more attentive, the room more perfect or the services more impeccable. My wife had made a number of special requests, each of which the hotel met and then exceeded.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park for the second time. Our first stay (a few years ago) was very good but not quite perfect (which is totally ok, as perfection is hard to attain!) It is safe to say that our second stay was as close to perfect as it gets. The highlight of our stay: A staff person (whose name I have forgotten, sadly!) was riding the elevator with us on the morning that we checked in. She asked about our plans for the day. We said that we were taking our 11-year old daughter to her first Broadway show -- Wicked. She wished us a great afternoon and we went our separate ways. Hours later we came back from the show and walked into our room. Imagine our surprise when we heard the Wicked soundtrack! It was playing in the CD player. Next to the player was the CD cover and a note from the staff member that she hoped we enjoyed the show and to please keep the CD as a gift on behalf of the Ritz. Incredible! My daughter was over the moon. Magical is really the only word to describe it.That experience just set the tone for our entire stay, and everything else was as wonderful as you would expect from the Ritz. In addition, the location can't be beat. We've stayed all over the city at many nice properties, but the Ritz has won our hearts and that is where we'll return the next time we're in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton has impeccable service, dining, and proximity to Central Park. Our suite was very sizable and met every single need for our family. The concierge service was incredibly helpful as we utilized the hotel's car service for our trips to and from the airport as well as our trip to Yankee Stadium. We never want to leave the hotel on our departure date.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first trip to New York. There were lots of hotels to choose from, but Ritz Carlton was always a favourite given previous reviews, plus my experience of reading about the Ritz Carlton values and ethos in a number of business books I have read.Staff remembered our name and ensured everything was made easy and ran smoothly. Worthy of particular mention is Sumi, one of the concierge staff. She was excellent. Her knowledge, warmth and helpfulness was exceptional. Now here's a really nice touch... Sumi knew we were going to see the Jersey Boys on Broadway and, when we got back, after the show, she had arranged for the Jersey Boys CD to be playing on the Bose player as we entered our room. That's special! It was a gift from them to us. One of the breakfast staff, Cathleen was also very welcoming. After day 1, she remembered our name and room number and always thanked us for choosing to have breakfast at the hotel. She also remembered which table we liked and tried to keep it for us.We had a Park View room, which is a more expensive option. It was certainly worth it for the view over Central Park. The room size is larger, with more closet space. The beds are very comfortable and I slept really well. The windows are double glazed and noise is very minimal. We were on floor 16, which gave a great view into the distance.The Ritz Carlton do their best to anticipate a need you don't even know you have. I happily give them 5 stars, for our 5 star experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed for a few nights here, is was a fantastic place. Staff provided a great service, and would like to thank them for making this an enjoyable stay. Good location and a lovely view over Central Park. Hope to come again soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I'd first like to say that every employee we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond to make our stay special for our young daughter. This included things like a welcome gift (blanket), kids experiences (Ritz Kids) like feeding the horses at Central Park where she received a printed photo and stuffed horse, etc.The property was in great condition and met every expectation I have of a Ritz Carlton property and luxury accommodations. One touch that we especially appreciated as parents is that every light in the room is dimmable, which meant that my wife and I could have some light available while our daughter was sleeping.Some of the service was unfortunately hit-or-miss. For example, the person who walked us up to our room offered to have our refrigerator emptied. It didn't happen, and we saw him twice more throughout the week and he would ask if it happened and each time he would say that it would be taken care of. It never was over the course of our six-night stay, and we eventually gave up asking. The housekeeping service seemed to miss different things each time they came. I'm not sure if they were trying to rush to not disturb my wife and daughter in the room, but there were a few times where we didn't have any shampoo or body wash and had to ask for it later. Fortunately there was always evening turn down service and we could get any issues resolved then without much trouble. One night we got a phone call at 9pm that woke our daughter up to tell us that maintenance was outside of our room to install a missing second toilet paper bar in the bathroom. We didn't request it (I guess the turndown person did) or even know it was coming, and we would have preferred to have it addressed the next day when our daughter was awake.The highlight of the club lounge for us was the food. Everything presented was amazing; the quality of ingredients, detail, and presentation were excellent. The personal service was also impressive. Since there were a small number of guests and staff they got to know some of my habits like what drink I liked in a to go cup each morning and would just have it ready as I left. The convenience for my wife and daughter who were near the hotel all day was great as well. One thing that was apparently miscommunicated to us when we made the reservation is that the breakfast is primarily cold. Especially for my daughter, but for my wife and me also we like things like eggs, hot meats, potatoes, pancakes, etc. at least occasionally. This is just a personal preference, but the person making the reservation set our expectations that we would get at least some of these and we were looking forward to them. Because of the miscommunication they did try to accommodate us, but it's clearly not what the club serves and so the club probably just isn't right for us, which makes us sad because everything they did have was amazing and much better than comparable items at say the JW executive lounge down the street, which is included with our elite membership (since the club offers much more it's not included). The only other concern I had was that many things other clubs include were not included here, such as a club floor on a high level (there's no club floor here), upgraded bath amenities, private check in/out in the club, and hot breakfast. None of these were promised anywhere for this hotel, but they're available at some other clubs and would have been welcome touches.At the end of the day, we have a trip back in a month and we need to decide where we're staying. Overall we really liked the property for all of the reasons above, but we're not sure that we can justify the cost of the club lounge when we'll also end up paying for some breakfasts from the hotel restaurant or elsewhere. The alternative is something like the JW where the food included in the lounge is more our style but not at all as good.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed for three nights and couldn't have been more pleased. Got a great deal through Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts. Lots of amenities add to the value including spacious room, Club Lounge with view of the park and carriages, resort credit and breakfast was included. Hotel provided a nice quiet escape from the fun and bustling city in the summer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect position over looking Central Park. The staff are so very attentive even when you look dreadful following a long flight. The rooms are large and very comfortable and I could never get bored of chocolates on my pillow lol. The bathroom was huge and we did not see a speck of of dust our entire stay.We will be staying here again and would not consider anywhere else in the Big Apple.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I travel often and always choose the Ritz-Carlton if one is located at our destination. As always they provide impeccable personal service and everything one would require of fine hotel: service, comfort, cleanliness, quiet privacy and location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Will make this short. Friendly staff. Good location. Way overpriced. Loved the city but not the hotel. Yes, had a nice room ... should have been for $,1000 a night but, honestly, have had so much better for half the price. You're made to beg for everything ... even ice; they treat the basics as something you have to call for to be delivered. Wasn't there to watch TV but will mention it didn't work for half our stay. Would agree is within walking distance of everything but location isn't everything. Wouldn't stay there again but, hey, maybe someone else would have loved it. We didn't. 'Nuff said.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here for two nights 6/13-6/15 for an early Father's Day present. I worked with the front desk staff (Cassidy, who was great) before our arrival and we were given a free upgrade to a Central Park view. The only problem is I should have stuck with the room in the back due to the street noise from our room 614.
