We did move to a higher floor the next night to room 1510 for some extra money, but it was from the regular room rate of the park view not the regular non view club level room we already had. $ 941 for a AAA non view club room/lounge is pretty steep, even for NYC, but we do like the club level perks, stopping in there throughout the day for food and drinks. Staff in the club lounge were first class and helped us book a dinner cruise and get us moved to a higher floor. If we do go back again, I would get the club lounge room, but skip the view and get a quieter room. Having been to NYC many times this is my first time at this hotel, since we usually stay at another due to it's location for business. This is the hotel to be at for pleasure trips, spent much time in Central Park and walking to the museums.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just back from a short family trip to New York City. The Ritz-Carlton, Central Park is a great location for shopping, sightseeing and the Subway. The hotel was beautiful and the staff, beyond fantastic; all were so friendly and incredibly helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Special thanks to the whole breakfast team, but especially to Zaheer in the dining room who was wonderful re his efficient and friendly professionalism. Also important to thank too the hotel chefs who made sure that gluten free meals and snacks throughout the hotel for our younger daughter were delicious, diverse and hardly different at all to our choices. Can't recommend the hotel, its facilities and the whole team there enough. We will be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park South is my "home away from home" in NYC. I stay here frequently and have been doing so for many years. Service:Excellent and friendly staff. From the door men, front desk all the way to the room cleaning staff. Probably the best in NYC. Location:Again, I believe the most centrally located and convenient in NYC. Unless you are specifically doing business downtown, this is a great location near mid-town meeting and at the foot of Central Park, excellent for tourists. Food:Room service is excellent always. Spa:The Spa is fantastic with excellent masseuses. I am not writing a very long review here because it is just such great place, not too many words need to be said. The one issue is that it gets VERY expensive on busy weeks in The City. Be prepared for some of the highest prices in NYC. For me it is worth it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have never been a fan of crowds and crowded situations. For that reason I had avoided NYC for years.On a whim we decided to see some Broadway shows and booked this hotel with the Club Room access. I have been blown away by the quality of the hotel, the staff, and the non rushed non hectic ambience.We are long time Four Seasons clients and have just returned from their amazing around the world tour on their private jet. This hotel's service is every bit as good, and the amazing club floor tilts the NYC advantage this way.This is now our "go to" hotel for Manhattan.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything you'd expect from a Ritz. Amazing service, beautiful accommodations, and spectacular views! We took our 2 girls (8 & 6) and stayed in a Park View room. We enjoyed the Afternoon Tea service and loved getting to feed the horses outside the hotel! Perfect stay for us!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I booked into the deluxe club room and with my gold status, I had hoped for an upgrade. I did not get an upgrade, which is the risk you take. The only issue I have is that the view (2 windows) to a central, roof/exhaust area was simply disgusting. I wish I had known just how bad the view was, so I could have reserved for at least a city view - but it was too late (none available). Word of warning - these rooms are not worth the rate.Pros: Great location, easy access to Central Park and subway. Bed was comfortable, room was clean (great housekeeping service), although there is not a nespresso machine in the room and the club only has coffee for the breakfast service - otherwise you have to ask for a coffee. Good size room (425 sqft) and bathroom was large with separate tub/shower and great amenities (water pressure was ok). Offer afternoon tea in the club and it was lovely - great English scones with clotted cream. The fitness center was clean and had what I needed for my workout. The staff was friendly. No problems with wifi, but I'm not a huge user during vacation.Cons: Club-The food presentations in the club were the same for all three days that we were there. They only have wine, water, soda and tea out for self pour, otherwise you have to ask one of the attendants for any other drink - including a cordial or coffee after dinner. Worst Ritz Club candy cart-ever. We had to haul our luggage through the two entry doors, which are heavy glass - no bellman in site. No pool and one steam room in the spa. The relaxation room is immediately outside of the treatment rooms, so it could be a little awkward going in/out - or possibly noisy if a couple chatty ladies are waiting. Our dinner at Auden Bistro was meh- the sushi flatbread was good, but the monkfish was a bit tough and really tasteless.I don't know this for sure, but I'm guessing that they are preparing for a renovation in the very near future. You get the feeling that they are just trying to get by with what they have and will not go out of their way to improve what is currently available. They may be a little under-staffed.If you desire to have a luxury stay near Central Park, I would have to recommend Mandarin Oriental at this time, even though I'm a RC fan. Sigh.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a NYC landmark that does not disappoint. A bit pricey, but worth it. Staff is very accommodating, food was good. Nothing like room service in the morning! Central Park puts it over the top. Treat yourself for that special occasion or just a solo pampering weekend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here over the memorial holiday weekend, my wife and I LOVED THIS HOTEL; the staff is super friendly and responsive. The SPA is GREAT!!!!! And let me apologize because I don't remember everyone’s name there but Rainelle, Rebeca, and truly everyone in the SPA is great! The appetizers at the bar are yummy, breakfast is good not great but good. My wife wants to make this a tradition so see you next year Ritz! FYI - NYC is expensive can’t do anything about that...
user_name:
SSS30
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great Ritz...wonderful staff...gorgeous lobby and awesome views of Central Park...the only problem I had was trying to get motivated to get out of the awesome bedding!! Very comfy with great sheets. Large bathroom, distinctively decorated and clean. Great workout room...looked like a great spa, but did not get a chance to partake. Breakfast available on concierge floor....they are really specific about closing times...so make sure to get there before closing...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love the Ritz at Central Park. The location is superb and the service is generally over the top. No problems there. We spent a night mid week to enjoy some Broadway shows and we were 'upgraded' to a park view room. While the room was quiet and well appointed I felt the hotel is need of a 'refresh'. The a/c in our room was rather inefficient and noisy. It didn't matter what I set the thermostat to, the room never got cooler. The hotel just feels a little tired. The exercise room is exceptional. Will definitely come back and hope for better.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A very nice but very expensive Ritz Carlton the club level,suites all need new furniture its stained and dated. The location is wonderful and I have stayed regularly because of it. The restaurant is simply underwhelming and it either should close or redo itself. The staff in the club level are wonderful and the service spectacular. The fitness center needs all new equipment and refurbishing.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wonderfully appointed, room had a telescope in so I could zoom in on the statue of liberty. Amazing service, discreet but very attentive. However did take about 45 mins to get downtown by cab in rush hour! Across the road from the hotel there is an amazing fish restaurant highly recommended - concierge suggested it as an ideal place to eat and to be able to look out over the water. Rooms very clean and large although lacked a mini bar or coffee facilities

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location of the hotel is fabulous - right across the street from Central Park and easy access to almost any place in the city. The staff is exceptionally attentive. The rooms are beautiful. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel service is superb as is the quality of the rooms. The lobby bar has in my mind taken the place of the central dining room at the nearby Plaza. It is a meeting place. There are superb restaurants nearby which are much better than the one in the hotel. The only downside is the aging electronic and audit video. In short the room and especially the bathrooms are among the best in the City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Was there visiting for a meeting and had a great experience , the hotel is of high standards and the location is excellent... There were a few things that could be improved but in general the hotel was a great find and would return for the right room rate. The only items I would mention that surprised me was on day 3 of a 5 day stay after departing the room at 7am and returning at 1pm the room was not cleaned ... I called house keeping and said I would be out 1:30 returning at 5pm .. and the room was still not clean ( - 1 star ) also the shower area had what I would identify as 'black mold" in on the granite which was small but was there . This hotel will always do well it has great service in most areas and a friendly staff.... As a member of the Ritz club the complimentary wifi is nice and always ask for a view if possible for the inside room are darker and look out at the side of a gray dirty building ..... The elevators are small but they seemed to arrive fast for I think there are 4 of them. The area around the hotel is congested sometimes taking 10 min just to go a block in a taxi.... All in all a good pricey stay at a small sized Ritz , Restaurants galore around and some of the worlds best shopping a walk away. Also the subway is really convenient to this hotel as well.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed here many times...they know that by the record. The employees are terrific..nothing wrong there. The housekeeping is terrific as well. I feel that I need to comment on the overall "looks" of the hotel..just a little worn down this time. We are also Centurion members and were there at a quiet time. The best upgrade was a room several floors higher. Same room. This was not satisfactory for the amount of time and loyalty we have shown. We also had a room on the "locked floor" with the lounge. I must say that the quality of the food offered here has suffered greatly in the years since we last visited. Not the same place. Also they say no children under 12 and there were toddlers there running around and making the usual accompanying noise one would expect. I am afraid that this will be our last time at Ritz Carlton Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had the pleasure of spending the night here. We had a beautiful room overlooking Central Park. Could not have asked for a better stay. Short & sweet review - everything was fantastic. Other than my bad experience in Aruba,where nothing is up to Ritz standards, I have always been able to count on the Ritz for a great stay. Treat yourself and stay here!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Centrla park in new york is classy exemplified by the brand of the ritz carlton . The staff are friendly and attentive treating each guest warmly like celebrities, luxurious rooms , highly recommended

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel and rooms are elegant. It is extremely clean and the staff is very accommodating. Room service is excellent. The hotel car is available for short trips to nearby destinations. The only complaint we had was that the air conditioning unit in the room was noisy. We complained and maintenance changed the filter and alleviated most of the noise. The bed was very comfortable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The venue was just past the entrance and a fairly grand but cozy setting. Menu has a wide variety of teas which I would assume would suit most people and my selection (Oolong Jasmine i think!) was delicious and tasted better through the courses as it got stronger.Sandwiches had a nice variety and very tasty (looked TINY when they came out but over the courses you are glad they werent any bigger)...included egg salad, chicken salad and a couple of others that i cannot remember but enjoyed them all nonetheless!The scone came as a surprise, it was possibly the biggest i have ever seen and seriously fills you up.....as a tip you might want to leave a quarter of the scone so that you can finish the sweet dishes at the end....the scone was nice otherwise.sweet dishes were nciely varied and delicious.Staff throughout were very friendly and gave you plenty of privacy but were also happy to help, talk, take pics and generally mingle.would definitely recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed in a large park-view room on the 10th floor and the view over Central Park was gorgeous. Room and hotel very elegant and homely, every detail was perfect in our opinion. Most importantly our baby was looked after extremely well, with the room set up with the most beautiful and luxurious crib that made her feel like she was at home, plus all the little extras like the Ritz kids bag and choosing a toy when she left. Service was outstanding and food downstairs and room service were great, really important for us as we have to dine in hotel in evenings due to baby.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We burned some Marriott Rewards points and stayed at the RC Central Park for one night over New Year's following a long safari vacation in Africa. The hotel was exactly what we needed - an unbeatable location, warm and friendly staff, clean and comfy room and fast in-room WiFi for uploading the hundreds of photos that I took during our safari.Location, as you can imagine, was super convenient to get just about anywhere. We walked to Bloomingdale's on Lexington, and later took a stroll over to Nobu's for dinner. Our room was facing Central Park and was on the 16th floor, and was whisper quiet. The room itself was modern and immaculately maintained. The bed was among the most comfortable that we've ever slept in.Overall, it did the job. And while spending upwards of $1000 a night over New Year's probably would not have been in the cards for us, it was a great way to spend some hard-earned Marriott points to enjoy some peace and tranquility in a high specification hotel that's located right on Central Park South. Thumbs up.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went to New York for the first time for St Paddy's Day Parade and stayed at this hotel (March 2011). Gorgeous hotel...room pretty tight but luxurious. Great bar downstairs and ideal to people watch! This hotel's in an ideal location and our room overlooked Central Park which was fantastic.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz luxury again, this is our third visit in three years to this hotel and it is fast becoming one of my favourites. The hotel has not changed since my last review and is still as fabulous as ever. The staff though are amazing, quick friendly and efficient, how many other hotels can you go where the doorman remembers your name when you return.I definitely cannot recommend this hotel highly enough
user_name:
Fred S
High Wycombe, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our third stay at this hotel and as always the staff were friendly and welcoming. Good gluten free options, including maple cinnamon pancakes which were so good I could hardly believe they were gluten free.
user_name:
Tina S
High Wycombe, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a weekend in NYC to visit family and friends. It would be easy to write off the high level of service we received by simply stating: "It's the Ritz, what do you expect?" but it was so much more than that.Pre-trip we were very familiar with the location having stayed before at the New York Athletic Club down the street. I don't think you can beat midtown for a tourist weekend...especially being on the park. You have lots of close-in subway options for both the East and West side as well as the NR down Broadway. It's also easy to get a taxi or uber being in such a dense 5 star hotel area.We arrived early in the day after a long flight and were overjoyed they had a room available. We had told them while making the reservation we were celebrating a weekend away without the kids and they upgraded us to a room on the park. Even though just on the 5th floor it had a beautiful view and was QUIET. I don't know what is in those walls and windows but we literally could not hear a thing from the street which is rare in NYC.The room felt large, huge by NYC standards. It has an enormous marble bath with separate soaking tub and a separate WC. Wow. Great water pressure and amenities. The bed was top notch...great mattress, smoothly pressed sheets and pillow slips.There was a nice personalized note of welcome for us with juice and pastries! Later we would find a very nice bottle of champagne as well as plush toys to take home for the kids. The absolute topper was our bed covered in rose petals on our last night which blew both of us away.Aside from the over the top in room spoiling the few requests we made to the front desk, housekeeping, and concierge were carried out perfectly and with a smile. The complimentary coffee service in the morning was nice to enjoy after our morning runs as well. Somehow the doorman knew us by name was very helpful when waiting for an uber. On our departure day Central Park South was closed as was 6th Ave for a bike race. We already had an uber en route to pick us up upon checkout. The front desk was quick to explain the situation and recommend where we should meet our car. That was a huge help.Although we were outside of the hotel most of the time, whenever we were back it felt like our luxury home away from home with lots of very friendly staff to ensure we had everything we needed and then some. We'll be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I love staying at this hotel; indeed, have done so six times in the last six years, including being married here in 2012. I've spent a small fortune over these years in this perfect location with views over Central Park.This time round I found the hotel experience less than before and service (with one exception) to be off its game. Is it because I wasn't in a corner suite this time (which would make this far too personal) or is it indicative of a broader resting on its laurels (probably).My title and surname were used correctly about three times across four days and used incorrectly a couple of dozen times. Poached eggs for one breakfast were set hard by the time they reached my room; breakfast on the following morning delivered an eggs benedict that was almost cold. I had booked a high floor looking over Central Park only to find on arriving that I had been allocated the very first level of these 10 upper floors despite, when I asked, discovering an identical room available several floors higher. Any upgrades, even to the executive lounge? - "no, Sir, we're very busy" - to which I replied "yes, I'm one of the many reasons you're busy". I was surprised given my stay history and my silver loyalty scheme status.These are indeed generally small irritants but they do add up to diminish the customer experience. Overall, it spoke to me of a lack of attention to detail and a certain resting on its laurels. Disappointing.On the other hand, the woman who cleaned my room every day was just a delight, the epitome of service, responsiveness and good humour under pressure.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What an amazing location. The doorman was not at the door when we arrived bug that was quickly forgotten when we met Ender Oz me lek at reception.he was polite and cheerful and chatty and informative. What more could we want? He personally took us to our amazing room and explained how everything worked. The bed was sumptuous and the bathroom beautiful. The bar didn't have great service and we did test it out on a number of occasions, however the food and service in the resteraunt was very good. We loved staying at this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had afternoon tea here on Friday May 1st for my girlfriends 30th. However we are still searching for the perfect afternoon tea. I thought we would get it here. What we did get, however, was more than adequate. Positives; 1) The quality of the English breakfast tea, 2) The sandwiches, 3) The scones, 4) Good effort made to make the occasion special by providing a place of treats with a candle. Negatives; 1) We arrived 15 mins early and were told to come back, rather than being offered a seat to wait, 2) The tea pot was left at a central table as opposed to our table which would have been much easier for us to access, 3) The desserts were a bit too synthetic and didn't taste homemade. So overall it was enjoyable but we didn't leave feeling that it was the most memorable of occasions.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Close to the theatre, Central Park, Fifth Ave. Some of the rooms are really small, even for NYC. The club floor is very nice. It is on the second floor of the hotel and overlooks Central Park. The service is great, and the food presentations are varied and delicious.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I treated my daughter to a weekend in New York this past weekend, and we can't say enough about the Ritz. It is as luxurious as it should be, and the service was impeccable. The location on Central Park South was super-convenient for our outings, and provided easy access to both midtown and the upper east side. The check-in (unannounced early arrival) was a breeze, and our room was perfect. We choose a room NOT park facing in the interests of quiet, and I can't even describe just HOW quiet it was. The beds were beyond comfortable as well. We didn't have the time to enjoy any of the other amenities the Ritz has to offer, so we'll need a return visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton for a quick visit to NYC. We highly recommend staying at this hotel. We arrived early, checked in immediately and were personally escorted to our room.Service was wonderful and everyone on the staff was very pleasant and genuinely interested in us and our needs . We had beautiful room with many amenities. Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be treated with the "personal" touch.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for a couple of nights pre-Christmas. Great location on South Central Park. Generous sized room and bathroom but no view. I paid using Marriott points and cash and had selected the lowest tiered room.Used the spa which was nice.The gym was very small and doesn't seem like it was custom-designed, more that it was the only available space to put the gym equipment. It is an L-shaped room and not very wide so not a lot of space. Had afternoon tea there also and was disappointed in the service. Whilst the food was good, they kept the tea pots off the table as they want to pour it themselves. That's fair enough but they really ought to be faster. I was finishing courses with an empty cup sitting in front of me. First world problems I know, but the service just wasn't right. My other complaint also involves tea! There was no teamaking facility in the room (there was for coffee) and so I asked for boiling water and a tea bag. They brought it alright, but it was accompanied with a $12 charge! That one really annoyed me. $12 for boiling water and a teabag just isn't right, especially when you consider what the hotel costs.Staff overall were great. Door staff were especially helpful and courteous. Pre-Christmas, there was warm apple cider and cookies in the reception which were a great way to warm up when returning to the hotel.It's a classic hotel, and I would stay here again despite the minor flaws I have pointed out.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have just returned from a five day break to celebrate my birthday in New York and stayed at The Ritz Carlton, Central Park, and cannot praise it highly enough. The room was understated luxury - housekeeping and cleanliness exceptional, and all staff went the extra mile, from rushing to get two umbrellas for us without request to go out in the rain to breaking the lock on our suitcase before we left as it had jammed. The extra details to celebrate my blirthday escalated from balloons and card to chocolate strawberries and wine to having the soundtrack from Jersey Boys playing in our room when we returned. Thank you and well done.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: great hotel, worth every dollar. location is as good as you could get in my opinion. rooms were spacious and luxurious. we had two doubles, with one front door, and interconnecting hallway. perfect for family stay. hotel lobby bar and restaurant were first class. service was attentive and friendly. concierge helped with restaurants outside, and felix the doorman was a great help for breakfast recommendations

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We booked afternoon tea for sons 21st birthday, we were travelling from Scotland to meet our son who is working in USA. Had a fantastic time, food was excellent and staff could not be more helpful. The hotel had set up table with balloons, sang happy birthday and gave us all a glass of bubbly. Superb service and a birthday to remember, would recommend afternoon tea to anyone looking for something special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I wanted to surprise my mother with a stay a the beautiful Ritz Carlton on Central Park. Front office manager Marc Rafeld made the experience even more amazing. The room was beautiful with partial views of the Park. He often check in to see if she was having a comfortable stay. His service was truly exceptional and accommodating. I travel the world for my business(Europe, Asia and South America) and have not truly come across anyone like Marc in hospitality. He is to be commended for his service. Thanks again Marc for a great stay!!! I look forward to seeing you when Im back in NYC. I will be sure to me colleagues know about my experience. My Best, Patrick Clark
user_name:
Patrick C
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I went there with my bf and wee hesitated between going at the Ritz, the Andaz and the Langdam. The hotel isn't a bad one, obviously, but cost wise when we compared it with others the Ritz wasn't worth the price.Big bed and lot of pillows Shower: too small and oldish water distribution Good location in front of central park

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Business trip with toddler along for the ride. Booked a suite overlooking the park. Gorgeous and expansive views but intolerable street noise for types who need a more hushed daytime experience. Get a room at the back of the hotel if you prize quiet. Fantastic service, though, and my wish to relocate was met with a determined diligence to make my family totally comfortable. And we were. Enjoyed our stay despite the booming bass of the street performers (who do not perform at night but many times during the day) and the staff was truly exceptionally patient, detail-oriented, generous, and cheerily formal.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I just finished three nights at the Ritz Carlton celebrating both of our birthdays and it was wonderful. Cassidy Davis (Guest Recognition Coordinator) had cake delivered to our room which was a wonderful surprise. She and Daniel Perez also helped with info on Tom Ford cosmetic services, hair styling and a spa booking before our arrival which was much appreciated.Service on property was as good as you should expect from RC but I have to say that the doormen were exceptional. So nice, pleasant and helpful. There was a doorman (older, grey hair) who works weekdays who was a real stand out. Not only did he recommend the Italian restaurant next door for our lunch (which was delicious) but he walked us over and introduced us to the manager. Well above and beyond my expectations. Club: The club was nice with a great view of the park. The presentations are standard Ritz fair and the concierge service was great. It's a little on the small side and got really packed on the weekend but was perfect on the week days. Spa: I had the best mani/pedi ever in the spa. Great service and very reasonable prices. Side note: If you want a good steak walk around the corner to Quality Meats. Excellent dinner!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter and I stayed for several nights and the entire experience was faultless. From check-in to check-out each and every staff member was friendly, helpful and professional. We had a gorgeous room overlooking Central Park (up on the 19th floor). We could have spent the entire time looking at the view....but the location is ideal for exploring the shops, the park and seeing some shows on Broadway.The Club Lounge was great value (included in our room rate). They happily made take away hot chocolate for my daughter.All the amenities in the room are lovely - especially the big bathtub and the bath crystals.Room service was exceptional. Yes, it is expensive, but the portions were large and the food was much better than your average room service!We would return without hesitation - just loved every minute of it!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary, we were treated like royalty at the Ritz Carlton Central Park. One of the best service experiences and friendliest hotel staff ever! When we walked in to the hotel, we were immediately greeted by our last name. We were given a great room overlooking the park with a complimentary bottle of wine, warm greeting and congratulations by the staff. The bellman on staff; Jose, was incredibly nice and full of good information for the area around the hotel. Make sure you have a cocktail at the Star Lounge. We met one of the city's most famous bartenders, Norman. He made us his favorite cocktails to celebrate with - what an interesting person! If you go for an anniversary - make sure you mention it. The hotel loves to have guests celebrating special events. Thank you Ritz staff for making it special!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a most beautiful hotel in a superb location. Our rooms were traditionally furnished with high quality linens and very comfortable beds. Bathrooms were large and luxurious.A real plus for the hotel is the quality of most of its staff, particularly the doormen and concierge, who made us feel welcome and very special! So why only 4 stars? I had booked two rooms and, about 12 weeks before we were due to arrive, I emailed the hotel to ask if we could have rooms close to each other. I received a reply stating that this would be no problem. I was therefore surprised and very disappointed when we arrived at Reception to be allocated rooms which were not even on the same floor! It was clear that the staff member did not believe me when I told her I had emailed, so I showed her the email on my phone. Despite this, she informed me that the rooms could not be changed as apparently every other guest in the hotel had already checked in (it was around 3.30pm, so I found that very difficult to believe). A hotel of this stature ought to be able to deal with a simple request like this, made several weeks before we arrived.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We thought we would spoil ourselves for this visit to New York and book the Ritz and we have not been disappointed with the stay we've had.After a day of travelling and long queues at JFK we arrived at the Ritz Friday evening tired to be warmly welcomed and made to feel special from the off-set. We were upgraded to a room on the 18th floor with great views of Central Park. The room was exceptional, the bathroom bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in and the bed extremley comfortable. The only downside is we would have liked tohave tea making facilities in the room but a very small detail.The staff can't do enough for you. We are so impressed with this hotel we will certainly be coming back and recommend it to friends and family. You couldn't get a better location, close to some of the best shops, Central Park and a short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller and Empire State Building. A 5 star hotel worth every star!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice hotel, ritz Carlton service and ritz carlton prices , great location, restaurant is just ok! The concierge lounge is a good convients. The rooms are nothing to jump up and down on but cozy and clean!
user_name:
Marty D
Sherman Oaks, California, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Lovely hotel but could be more warming and inviting. Maids were great and turn down service is fab. But need more doorman available and when asked for a cab it took ages and I just got my own, so that was annoying but overall nice. The tea is much better in London it feels like your in the foyer and sandwiches are not topped up, trust me London tea is 20/10 (that good!), New York 6/10.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On a recent trip to New York we decided to stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park. The room was spacious with an updated bath that was larger than most hotels in this area. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The service at this hotel was outstanding! The Front Desk, Concierge and even the Housekeeping Manager that we met in the elevator, were all very helpful and pleasant. I cannot say enough good things about our stay except that we cannot wait to return and I would highly recommend it!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On a recent trip NYC, I had the good fortune to spend three nights at the hotel. Central Park is directly across the street and easily accessible. It's Manhattan, so there's plenty of shopping and restaurants. Had Club Level access, which is on the second floor and looks directly into Central Park. It's a great place to hang out until the shoppers in one's life return. The gym is ample and clean, though a little smaller than I expected. I really appreciated the delicate balance between historic charm and modern touches. In my opinion, a wonderful place to stay when visiting NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel have some of the best views in town, especially from the high floors facing Central Park. As almost every Ritz-Carlton hotel, this one gives you flawless service, spacious rooms and is close to everything in Midtown. Ritz-Carlton purchased former Hotel St. Moritz, renovated it and re-opened in 2002. they managed to save historic charm combined with contemporary amenities.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton central park for the night of our 10th wedding anniversary. It took me quite a while to decide whether to stay at the ritz, st, regis, mandarin, etc, since they are all in similar price ranges and 5 star. I chose the ritz because of the central park views, and our experience with the ritz. Although we already booked a deluxe central park view room, the hotel upgraded us to a suite with two bathrooms and sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne. The service, treatment and room were lovely and a wonderful choice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here for the weekend with my girlfriend. The hotel room was very nice. Very spacious, comfortable bed and amazing tub and shower. I had a club suite that had a really nice sitting area seperate from the bedroom. The location is ideal right on Central Park. The lobby is small but we had a few drinks at the lobby bar and the service was very good. The only thing compared to other Ritz hotels is the club lounge was not nearly as good as other Ritz hotels. It is on the second floor overlooking the street and the park. The service we got in the club was not as good as other ritz properties.But overall nice stay at this hotel. Service overall was up to ritz standards.
user_name:
Eric E
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: All we can say is The Ritz Central Park exceeded our expectations. Last Thursday our flight was redirected to ATL due to Laguardia closing while we were in the air because of a runway incident. We were put on 2day standby to NYC so we called the Ritz to cancel our stay. We were soooo disappointed, we had hotel booked, restaurant reservations made, tickets to Live with Kelly & Michael and theatre tickets. All lost. We returned to our home in Houston late the same night as we did not want to spend two days in ATL. On Saturday Federal Express delivered a handwritten note and multiple Broadway CD's . Thanks to Michael Beltran for being so thoughtful means so much to us, we were so disappointed to have our trip go bust. Many thanks. We are re-booking in a few weeks.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It is always such an amazing treat to stay at this luxury hotel and now, for me, it's like staying with your favorite relatives. The rooms are spacious and sumptuously decorated with great tv/cd player/minibar amenities. Housekeeping makes sure the toiletries are well stocked and plentiful in the beautiful marble bathrooms. Room service breakfast is like having your own mom bring you breakfast in bed! ( shout out to the gentile blonde woman who treated my daughter and I like we were her own!) Lunch, tea time and cocktails are always a treat in the main lobby area and everything is delicious! From Joe greeting you at the door, Ender helping you with your reservation, George helping get that tough reservation for dinner or a show and Eric getting your evening started right with a fabulous sidecar at the bar, you are treated as the most special guest in the hotel... Maybe even the whole city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You siimply cannot beat the location for many reasons. In the surrounding area, great restaurants, shopping, and Central Park. We had a wonderful view of the park. Even though it was snowing, like crazy, the visit was excellent. The spa experience is wonderful and wish I had time for even more in the spa.Ladies and gentlemen were on point in every interaction and extremely helpful for local places to go. We simply love this hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is exactly what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton. I celebrate with my wife on valentine day , It was really great experience for both of us. the staff were really helpful and welcoming us. they really have nice views , and a night the place was really amazing!!.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is exactly what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton. The hotel is amazing, staff are attentive as always and the location cannot be beaten. However we did encounter a few hiccups which we would put down to the fact that you simply hold a hotel like this to a higher level of service. I wont go into details and all were minor annoyances, once brought to the hotels attention the management went above and beyond remedying the situation. Also we stayed here over Thanksgiving so the hotel was extremely busy. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel and we are currently planning our return trip to enjoy New York at a warmer time!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from a short break & we can't rate the service and friendliness high enough. Nothing was a problem, the room was beautifully clean, shower was to die for and the bed was so comfy......Adam & José were extremely helpful with suggestions of where to eat, which included a fantastic restaurant where we had the best steak ever & cooked perfectly. Was a little under cooked for our son but they wait at the table to ensure it is cooked to your liking. Impeccable service from Heather! Can't wait to go back ❤️NY xx

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I recently stayed at this property, and I would say it was the best hotel experience I have ever had. The facilities were impeccably kept, and the welcoming staff met every request that one made with a smile. The service from the staff was absolutely unparalleled; never have I had an experience where all employees, from the housekeepers to the maintenance staff greet you in such a way that it just makes your day all the better.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A typically nice Ritz Carlton hotel. The lobby restaurant/bar is small but beautiful. The rooms are very nice with nice big bathrooms. The location couldn't be better -right on the edge of central park with many fine dining options near by.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed in suite 707 (corner) with amazing views of Central Park. We were treated like old friends which is an art form in itself. Celine at the bar made us so welcome, we came back every day and she smiled and chatted as though we had known each other for years. Alice in the restaurant was a lovely lady, so friendly and helpful. George and the concierge team and Adam from guest services went out of their way to book restaurants, they were all wonderful. Ronaldo made our day on our anniversary with a lovely bottle of champagne and a small present.Overall a wonderful anniversary visit. Thank you Ritz Carlton

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here from 14th - 19th Feb, First time in NYC so we thought we would stay at one of the finest hotels. The Ritz did not let us down!!!, We are now planning a trip to The Ritz on Barcelona. Not a huge room but extremely comfortable, the bed was the best bed I have ever slept in. Staff were so friendly and helpful, they made the stay perfect.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at many hotels and I don't think I've ever stayed at a hotel where the entire staff's goal seems to be for excellent service. The location of the hotel is excellent. It is has just the right amount of luxury. We always get a park view room. This is where we usually spend our wedding anniversary and the hotel never lets us down. Definitely what a luxury hotel should be.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have never been disappointed with Ritz Carlton, and every time I go to New York, the Ritz Central Park is my preferred hotel destination. It is centrally located, with access to the best shopping, restaurants and of course, Central Park. The staff is always very accommodating, and service is top-notch. The rooms are not huge, but they are luxuriously appointed, immaculate and comfortable. The Ritz Carlton beds are some of the most comfortable beds out there, even better than the Westin Heavenly Bed. I usually don't like wall to wall carpet in a hotel because they tend to be dirty and have visible stains, or are very worn, but the carpet in the RC rooms are light and clean. I am a stickler on bathrooms, and they are always clean and have a lot of counter space for make-up and toiletries. The bar is upscale and serves a good selection of wine and cocktails. They close fairly early, as do all the other bars around that area so if you're looking for a late-night drink, you might have a hard time finding it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This really is a great 5 star hotel. The location is fantastic, right on Central Park South. The room I had was spacious, and welcoming, with great linens, and a super comfy bed. I was there for a work meeting, and we were very well looked after, the food was delicious. The staff are also very friendly.I had a spa treatment whilst I was there, which was great.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our stay was exactly what you would expect from the Ritz and what they always deliver, excellence all the way. The room was large, beautiful, comfortable and well appointed. We were upgraded to a view of Central Park, which was nice. The bathroom was very nice as it had separate tub and shower and products I would use other than at a hotel. There was only 1 sink in our room, but the vanity was large enough for 2 and there was storage for my toiletries, which is always appreciated. Admittedly, I am a bathroom snob and this one I liked. The super comfy bed with luxury linens was hard to leave in the morning. This property is unusually quiet. We never heard hallway noise, not even the slamming doors you usually get in hotels. If you hear anything from the street, your window is open. Yes, that happened to us and you can hear traffic 10 stories up.Of course, the excellent service is what sets the Ritz apart. We came back from a theatre performance to find the soundtrack and a nice note from the guest services gentleman that had greeted us on day one. How he remembered we were seeing that show on that evening is beyond me. As we checked out, the desk clerk asked me how I liked a different show we had seen. Mind you, we bought the tickets ourselves, not through the hotel. The concierge delivered spot on recommendations for lunch and dinner and gave helpful hints on getting around during the cold and snow. Everyone called us by name, making us feel as though we were the only people in the hotel. The proximity to Central Park (across the street), shopping, theatre and restaurants makes this one of our favorite places to stay in NYC.There is a small, but very nice spa at the hotel. I enjoyed an excellent deep tissue massage that worked out the kinks from flying.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When I checked out of the Ritz Carlton Central Park, the associate at the front desk asked "how was your stay?" I answered "It was the best night of my life!"It wasn't just because the hotel and staff were amazing, I proposed to my girlfriend of 6 years in the room that night. The staff of this property went above and beyond for one of the most special moments of our life. After hours of research trying to find the right place to stay the night of my proposal. I decided on the Ritz Carlton Central Park because of their reputation and the famous surrounding landmarks we love. My original plan was to propose somewhere outside but as the day approached, weather was not going to comply with my plans.I contacted the concierge to explain my dilemma, this was the beginning of how much the Ritz Carlton showed me they appreciate their guests. My revised plan was to propose to her in the room as we walked in. I asked him if they could make a path of roses petals from the door leading to a rose petal heart on the bed. It was something I saw online when researching the property from a previous guest. He promptly said yes and was extremely kind and helpful.The night of we pulled up to the hotel where I was quickly greeted at my car for valet parking. Within in seconds I was checking in. The front desk associate was so friendly and upon hearing my name began smiling even more than before...no doubt because she knew of my plans which made me happy. My original reservation was for an interior king guest room but to my surprise she explained we were upgraded to a Central Park View Suite. At that moment I was blown away. As we opened the door, my girlfriend walked in first and noticed the path of rose petals. Immediately she knew something was happening and began to cry. I took her hand walked to the middle of this beautiful suite over looking central park and went to one knee and proposed...she said yes!The warm and over the top customer service continued from our in room dining waiter to the lobby staff and front desk at check out, all of them congratulated us and knew of the proposal. It was a magical night that we will never forget, without the Ritz Carlton and their excellent staff it would not of been possible.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights recently and first time at this hotel. This is a great location and we were upgraded to a lovely room overlooking Central Park. The location is convenient to shops, restaurants and theaters. Front desk staff are courteous and accomodating as well as the bell and doormen and the rooms are beautufully appointed and spotlessly clean. The Club Lounge was very disappointing, though, from the standpoint of service and amenities. I have been to RC club lounges all over the world so in comparison this one rates at the very bottom. First, the staff seem more inclined to converse with each other than anticipate and serve the customer. For example, they were very slow to clean up tables, replace food items, or bring requested items (that are not out of the ordinary such as expresso, gluten free bread, plain yogurt). No anticipation of the guest's needs-just a total sense of uncaring and complacency. In fact, on my third morning for breakfast, i asked for these items for the third time and was greeted with a reluctant acknowledgement plus I overheard the concierge make a snide remark to the servers. As a female executive traveling often, I have never encountered this in an RC club lounge previously. My gluten free bread arrived with one heal of the bread loaf, quite shameful in a 5 star hotel. Overall, in spite of the lovely location and beautiful rooms, this experience does not compel me to return nor recommend to my business colleagues. There are plenty of other excellent hotels in NYC who will appreciate your business.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A lovely hotel right opposite Central Park , had a room with a side park viw which was lovely . We had the club loung package which was well worth it , a variety of continental breakfast with smoked salmon eggs and lots of luxury extras , 230 till 430 was high tea and 5 till 8 was appetisers canapés wine then 8pm desserts came out , you could have as much tea coffee and sift drinks throughout the day as you wanted.. We had sparking wine and a cake left on my 50th birthday and on our last say we were left a ritz Carlton hog dog bed 2 China ritz dog bowls dog treats ect , with a lovely note to say sorry your missing Ollie ( our pet bichion ) and to take these treats home for him and bring him the next time,.Had a lovely stay , regret not having a La Prairie treatment in the spa , service was good and would 200% return next time I visit New York , hopefully when there is less snow so we can get about more .

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Our first trip to New York and was treated to the most luxurious stay at the Ritz Central Park. Location is great to many major tourist spots, walking distance to many.The room, bed and bath were very warm and inviting and a good size.Service was top notch, very friendly. Cleaning service and turndown service were prompt. Concierge service was more than helpful and friendly with all of our needsThe best surprise was for my birthday, the hotel sent up a lovely bottle of sparkling wine. What a treat.My only complaints; we splurged on this hotel and I can understand that to many people, money is no object. But for 700.00 + a night, I have a hard time also being charged for wifi in the room but ok not necessary. The worst part for me was $10 for a cup of coffee. I just can't wrap my head around that.Other than that The Ritz was a dream hotel that made us feel special and comfortable. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A very enjoyable stay, great location and excellent service. We upgraded to higher floor, city view - the view wasn't as great as expected but very high! A park view would be amazing I'm sure! We didn't eat in hotel, as lots of options nearby. There is a small bar area which was typical hotel prices (expensive!). 10 minute walk from Times Square. Just cross the road to Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What's not to love about the Ritz-Carlton NYC Central Park? Location - perfect. View - perfect (in my opinion, the extra bucks are worth the bird's eye view of Central Park and the fun going on at street level on Central Park South - particularly if it snows ever so lightly, almost on cue). High Tea - perfect. Bedding - oh, so perfect. Staff, none better. So why only a "very good" rating? Well, I found myself in need of help with my hair, and they don't have a hair salon (first time this ever happened to me, so I just assumed they had a salon, but no). Also, I had wanted to spend the better part of one day at their spa, but it's really not that kind of spa - they offer great treatments, no complaint there, but the space is what older hotels have to do in order to have a spa in the first place - they're small and crowded, and no "water works," like a pool or hot tub, or even a quiet room with a view. So it's slightly disappointing and not the relaxing treat I had anticipated. I don't like going elsewhere for a spa, I like having it on site. And NYC isn't the place to go traipsing around for a spa anyway. So I love this hotel and we've stayed there many times and will continue, but I won't be looking for a hair salon or an elaborate spa the next time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You want a room with a gorgeous view and close in walking distance to one of the best parks in the world. Step into the Ritz. I've been here a few times and every time I'm happy to come back enjoy the service and comfort of a familiar face. A good choice but the room service menus could have more variety.
user_name:
aivlys570
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It is everything you would expect from the Ritz! Great rooms, great beds, great service, great bathroom! We didn't have a view of anything, but you can't beat the location. SarahBeth's next door for brunch, and walking from 5th avenue!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I would like to thank the excellent front office team, that had my check in done so smoothly, everything from the rooms to the dining experience was flawless. no wonder my company puts me up there everytime when im in NY. thank you so much, please extend my regards to the GM, do tell him the drink on him is still pending :) .will come back with family the next trip aroud.. till then au revoir

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at this lovely hotel multiple times now. The location, right at 6th and Central Park South, is hard to beat as it is central to everything and within walking distance to so many different NYC sights/options/etc. First, allow me to comment on the wonderful.The people. The personnel are beyond fab. From the front desk folks (especially Jenny) to the club level concierge team (Felix and Lazare were on it along with EVERYONE else there) to the housekeeping staff, everyone gave us 110%. The lobby lounge had the only staff who were not 110% - and they still were at a solid 95% haha so seriously....great teams, excellent service. Next, the not so wonderful.The rooms are starting to show some wear and tear. And when your most basic room is at 700 bucks per night, well, let's get on this, shall we?? Also, the room service was consistently sub par. And beyond that? Room service pricing was beyond absurd. NYC food is going to cost you. But this was well beyond anything I have seen. My son would order 2 scrambled eggs. He is 6. He would order them in the club room and RS would deliver. It was 50 dollars each time so after a few days of this, when we realized the ridiculous cost for cold and mushy eggs, yes....we put an end to that. The menu is limited, chicken noodle soup is beyond flavorless (seriously - how is that even possible? Campbells chicken and stars tastes better!!) and we gave up after a few days. The same applies to the high end restaurant downstairs. Food was so so and way overpriced for quality. We had Christmas day dinner and the service was slow, order done wrong (a couple of times), and it was not conducive to a classic top notch Ritz experience. Go to Sarabeths or Villagio or around the corner to Angela's for great sandwiches and crispy fries. If I am going to pay 20 bucks for fries they better rock my world. And that did not happen. ;)While I still love the location, and I personally feel the service can not be beat (especially club level), I would suggest the St Regis, Peninsula, Palace, or Plaza for location and food until the Ritz can get back to a solid 5 star rating.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for one night over the holidays. The location of this hotel is excellent; directly across from Central Park with lots of the touristy things to do within easy walking distance (Museums, 5th Ave shopping, Rockefeller Center, Broadway, etc.). We had a booked a standard "Deluxe Guest Room" and I was a bit disappointed that as a Marriott Rewards Gold Member we were not at least upgraded to a room with an exterior view. Check in was efficient and although our room was not ready when we arrived we were promised that we would receive a call when it was ready. The person at the front desk took our bags and told us that we did not need a claim check. When we had not received a call by 5:30pm we decided to go back to the hotel. Indeed our room was ready. Since we did not have a claim check there was a lot of confusion over our bags. We did get them shortly thereafter. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms are very nice.Although the staff was very pleasant and professional, we were disappointed that we did not receive a call, had an issue with our bags and were not upgraded. We will try another 5* for our next visit to the City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We arrived on New Years Eve to a champagne reception. The staff are the best part of this lovely hotel but runners up are the bed you sink into and never want to get out of, the amazing views of Central Park and the pristine bathroom with everything you could possibly need. I honestly cannot find anything negative to say. Thank you so much for wonderful stay and making me feel like a princess for four days!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a great place, ideally suited for the holiday maker. From the hotel's location on Central Park you are perfectly situated for Broadway, 5th Avenue, 6th Avenue, Rockefeller Centre and many more great sights.The staff are all incredibly helpful and knowledgeable and cannot do enough to make you feel comfortable and attended to. But then in fairness, almost everyone in New York is the same. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and quiet (high floors are always favourite for quiet) with huge bathrooms and comfy beds. There's free coffee in the lounge which was great as we found the breakfast prices a little high for us - we loaded up on coffee and then grabbed a snack elsewhere in the city where prices were a little lower!Food in the restaurant and in the lounge was lovely and we can attest to the quality of the English tea here as well, which is often hard to find in NYC!All told, a great stay and we look forward to returning.Thanks

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have been a loyal ritz traveler from Montreal to Dallas. Nothing compares to this one! I highly recommend you have tea in the lounge on the first floor. I love the relative short walk to Fendi and Vuitton, Barneys and Hernes. Excellent service and though I have a Jpmorgan and Merrill lynch accolades card which offer generous upgrades they aren't applicabke to this property. Though I was immediately upgraded from the club level to suite. The staff is professional and although I love the peninsula and mandarin, the Ritz has the perfect location to shopping . Encourage to stay when in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff at this property is fantastic !! Ana at the front desk will make sure your needs are taken care of. Felix and Lazar on Club Level will insure excellent service. Celine and Jakay at the bar are masters of there craft and have personalities that match. This is bar none is the best example of what this brand is about. I look forward to many more memorable stays . Bravo!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Words cannot describe how wonderful and attentive the staff are at this hotel. They are extraordinary. I had made several communications through mail from Ireland and each and every time they were ansered within a 24 hr period , when we arrived all my requests to make the night special for my fiancee were covered and we were made feel so special and welcomed to your hotel. Especially Cassidy Davis and Denise at reception. They were truly what in my option made the hotel so memorable ( besides the engagmebt!) Wonderful hotel , gorgeous food and views are outstanding we stayed on 18 floor so try get a high floor for the view. Excellent and well worth a treat every now and again

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When I think about a first class trip to New York City one hotel rises above the rest - The Ritz on Central Park. Traveling with our ever growing children (late teens and 20) to Manhattan is a real treat and luxuriating in 2 stellar suites at the Ritz makes it all the better. The rooms are everything that you would expect from a marque property of one of the best hotel groups in the world. The suites are large by NYC standards and contain everything that one expects from an urban Ritz. The food and the service at the hotel's restaurant is refined, well presented and excellently prepared. What sets this property apart from all other NYC hotels at which I have stayed is the premier location. Walk across the street and you are in Central Park. A short 3 minute walk and you can dine at any of the great Time Warner Center restaurants in Columbus Circle and you are in the middle of high end shopping central. Once you get past the rates, including the valet rates, you have to admit that there are few urban properties that match the Ritz on Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in this hotel over the New Year period as needed a hotel with rooms on a lower floor as my mother doesn't like heights. My wife and I normally stay in the Mandarin Oriental and what a contrast, this hotel is nowhere near the standard of the Mandarin on all levels (despite charging similar rates). Also, what didn't help its cause was when we arrived at the hotel just before 4pm we were told our rooms were not ready (check in time is 3pm) and my parents room was not ready until nearly 6pm. For us this hotel lacked style and the only positive is its location and the concierge. The reception staff overall came across as disinterested and robotic. Nothing like the MO staff who are truly world class.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wow - as always this is an amazing hotel. No better location is possible , just near the Central Park ... and the view - nothing like it! This is a real luxury hotel and we loved staying at this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I loved this place! Great location and it's like an oasis Of calm as soon as you get through the doors! The tea lounge is so cosy especially at Christmas with the decorations! Nothing was too much trouble! I'll definitely stay again when I visit next ! Just loved it !!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Of all the hotels I stay at regularly, the Ritz Central Park South is absolutely my favorite. Location is great, and service is always fantastic. Weather on business or traveling with my wife they always take great care of me.Decor is very well done and traditional, experience is definitely tailored for professionals who want a top notch experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location in NYC. We initially selected The Ritz over the other five stars in the city because we wanted a park view--and this really delivered! We loved watching the ice skaters from the Central Park rink. The bed was heavenly--maybe the best I've ever stayed in with lots of fluffy down that you could sink into! The service was excellent and offered us a great upgrade and the food was amazing! I would return and recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It doesn't matter if it has been over a month since my last visit; they always greet us by name and the bartender remembers my favorite cocktail. The concierge desk always goes above and beyond for last minute reservations and car service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for three nights starting on Christmas day. All went well until we actually needed something. My son got sick on the Sofa Bed about midnight. My wife called the operator for a new set of sheets and a blanket. The response was it would be up in 5 minutes. Twenty minutes later no one has come. We called back down and the response was we only have one person working. It took four calls and over one hour to get someone to bring my son his sheets. For $2000.00 a night? Never again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Unfortunately we only stayed for two nights in the hotel. The service is what differentiates them from any other hotel in New York. All employees were amazing and greeted us by name. The rooms are spacious and the beds are the most comfortable beds ever. We had club acces included which was worth every penny. The employees in the club are the kindest and absolutely caring. The ambiance is great, the food is amazing and its a great spot to enjoy the beautiful view of Central Park. Ender at check in was so kind and showed real Ritz-Carlton spirit. Kevyn who assisted us with our luggages was wonderful and remembered us every time we saw him. Felix as club concierge assisted us greatly with our plans during our stay and has an amazing attitude. Last but not least, an employee who really impressed us was Lazar as club agent. He always made a chat with us as soon as we entered the club, we loved to hear his stories about his children and his time in New York City. He made us feel at home even when we were miles away from home. Thank you so much for taking such good care of us. Staying at this Ritz-Carlton has been a wonderful experience that I can recommend to anyone.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wide and I recently returned to this amazing hotel and were once again delighted with our entire stay. Our room was amazing with a super large closet that made all the difference in our comfort and room organization. We were greeted by name throughout our stay. The staff at curbside made our stay most pleasant by providing us with a car to our restaurant during a rainy evening. How cool did we feel! And let me add that the Club Level experience was just the icing on the cake as we enjoyed amazing food, presentations and a welcoming staff.We love the Ritz Carlton Central Park and thank all at the hotel who made our stay memorable. We can't wait to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel is centrally located, across from Central Park and down the street from the Plaza and all the shops on 5th avenue.Every single employee in the hotel made our stay perfect. Our room was really nice, a spacious bathroom, and tub and shower separate. It was our anniversary and it was casually mentioned when we checked in.Cookies and chocolates with a candy number of the years married arrived in our room. I love this hotel and it lives up to it’s reputation.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Best location, best view , best services, best lounge club in Central Park New York. Full equiped room. Lounge open whole day with options of food and drink. Location perfect to shop, dining and outdoor activities.
user_name:
Marco P
Rio de Janeiro, RJ

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is a classic, quiet, small hotel overlooking Central Park.It has the eccentricities of older properties -- the bathrooms have multiple shower / tub combinations, and rarely are two rooms the same. I like this. The lobby has the feeling of a London club.It is comfortably furnished, and well located if your business or pleasure is mid-town.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is located on West 59th Street right on Central Park. I called up and reserved afternoon tea for two a few weeks in advance thinking that I’d need a reservation to avoid disappointment, it turns out they’re not that busy on a Tuesday afternoon in October. We were given a lovely table, excellent service and a wonderful selection of savoury and sweet horderves, scones and plenty of tea. We also opted for a glass of champagne each to toast our trip to NY and can confirm that the Ritz was certainly well worth a visit and fairly reasonably priced.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: the ritz is a phenomenal place to have drinks, just a stones throw from central park, it has so many things to do in and around the hotel, take a nice horse drawn carriage ride around the 'parkgo shopping on 5th ave, fao Schwartz for christmas shopping. if you can't think of anything to do, go to the concierge and they will give you great ideas where to go and do.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Every year I take my mother & a friend to NY the first week of December. And we always stay at the Ritz Central Park location. We get a room with two queen beds and Club level access. The Club is fabulous! Lazar & George can't do enough for you. And the concierge will make dinner reservations. We love the location because it is so easy to walk down 5th Ave for shopping or to check out the fabulous holiday window displays. And it convenient to Time Square to see all your Broadway shows.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This isn't as much a review as it is a thank you. We spent one night at the Ritz to celebrate our first wedding anniversary, and it turned out to be a more magical experience than we ever could have imagined.We booked the stay using Marriott points, which means we weren't even paying actual cash for the room. Nonetheless, when the staff learned of our occasion, they went so far above and beyond to make it something I know neither of us will forget.Though my elite status at Marriott entitled us to very little at the Ritz, we were upgraded to a beautiful room overlooking Central Park and gifted club access, which was extraordinary. We enjoyed a wonderful tea service in the afternoon and breakfast the next morning.On the request of the hotel manager, I had passed along some information about our wedding and my wife before arriving. When we walked into the room, our wedding song was playing, and a picture from that night was framed and left on the bedside table. When we returned at night, white rose petals were laid on the bed in the shape of a heart.We couldn't have imagined anything close to what we received. Thank you to everybody involved.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We like to stay at the Ritz Carlton hotels and stayed here at our most recent vacation. We checked in Saturday, November 8 through Wednesday, November 12. We booked through American Express Platinum Travel. We arrived at La Guardia airport and took a taxi to the hotel. The rates to be picked up in a private car via the hotel were very expensive - $260 and up, so we decided to take a taxi from the airport, about $60. There was a lot of traffic. The ride was about 40 minutes. As soon as we arrived to the hotel, the bellmen took our strollers and bags right away and we headed to check in. While I was there, a gentleman came out with a wagon full of toys so that our 2 kids could pick out from. That was very nice. I love how the Ritz always puts a smile on my kids and us too :) We then headed to our room. We had requested a park view and did get it. The view was perfect! We were on the 8th floor. Enough to see the horse carriages down below and also the park as well as the buildings near us. Our room was the perfect size. It was clean and we were very content overall. Although it's loud outside with all the traffic and the echoing of sirens when they went by, it was pretty quiet overall. We had breakfast in the restaurant. The cinnamon buttermilk pancakes were so GOOD! Everything we ate was delicious. When we called down for room service or anything we needed, it was delivered quickly. The doormen and other workers called my kids by their first names. Hands down the best customer service. This hotel is located across the street from central park. We could cross the street and be in central park. We were about 10-20 minute walking distance from almost everything. We loved it and will be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the most amazing hotel! From the moment we arrived the staff was so friendly and accommodating that we will never stay at any other hotel while in NYC. This was a girl trip for my daughter's 14th birthday - she received a tray of brownies and a small gift from the hotel - which was such a wonderful surprise for her! The Concierge staff was so helpful but George and Sumi were the best! They were quick to assist us and to make suggestions for dinner. GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Firstly I want to say a huge thank you on behalf of myself and my family for a wonderful stay. We felt spoiled and cared for and we could not be happier! Your whole team went out of their way to provide us every courtesy and service. My daughter will not forget the special Lion King CD or the wonderful cookies and my wife and I truly appreciated the upgrade to a suite and all the special touches we experienced. The restaurant recommendation from the Concierge to Telepan and the securing of a table at short notice was genius. Due to the Marathon we were also provided a Sedan to the airport and a driver who knew where to go and that saved us the hassle and stress associated with trying to navigate transport in the city that was largely shut down. The list can go on.I will not hesitate to recommend you again and again. Please thank your whole team on our behalf. The service and warmth of your team is what sets this hotel apart.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Right in the centre of Manhattan this is a wonderfully charming hotel with wooden panelled lifts and lounge area. The staff are so helpful and courteous, nothing seems too much. The rooms are average in size, but well appointed with elements of old world style. It does not feel like a large chain and verges on the boutique. We were really impressed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What a charming and elegant hotel. It's small but so beautiful and comfortable. The staff is very professional. I loved being on the Park. Yes, it's pricey, but this is New York. If you want to be pampered and relaxed, go here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The ritz on Central Park is perfect! We stay at the club level and it's simply perfect. First, there are the views of Central Park - I could just stare out the window all day! The club is run by a terrific team. Kelly, Lazar, Charles and Aziz made us feel at home and were like family. We look forward to seeing them every trip! After running around the city seeing the sites and taking care of business meetings, it's fun to hit the club or lounge to unwind. The gym facilities are also very nice. I can't make up excuses for not using the gym, since it's always empty and since the equipment is modern and in great condition.We look forward to many happy trips here in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz is relatively small but very well located on the park and as expensive as it gets evein in New York. The lobby is a model of serene luxury not designed to hit you over the head. The lobby, reception and concierge staff are highly attentive and professional.I used the steam sauna and fitness room which was also high quality, well stocked and with ample machines. There was available trainers, yoga, pilates etc. which I had booked but cancelled as I moved hotels for reasons I will explain below. I did not eat at the Restaurant but it the menu was quite nice if pricey.The room: Finishing, linens, furniture, bathroom and toiletries were all of the highest quality. BUT, the room I was given was perhaps the dimmest room I have stayed in bar none including quality inns, motel six etc. My view was of a rooftop boxed in by towers, with a bank of AC condensers, fans running.
