By the second day when I had to turn on the lights to read mid-day I decided to move to another hotel.The first night in my room was booked as part of an event but the three night extension was booked through my concierge at the Ritz residence where I own a condominium. I was assured by the concierge that I would have a premium room, and indeed paid a premium price, well over the extension group rate that I could have had, with tax over $1000. per night. I was extended many apologies and given the group rate for the second night before I moved but did not expect this at the Ritz, particularly since I reside in one of their properties and belong to the "owners club'.I booked the remainder of my stay at the Pierre around the corner. The service and room is every bit as nice as the Ritz. As an expedia top tier, I was upgraded to a park view room on the 39th floor where I had front row seats to the fireworks opening ceremony for the marathon.I would recommend the Ritz as a luxury treat but would caution you settle which room you are getting in advance, unless you don't care for a view or natural light.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was a guest at the Paris Ritz 3 years ago and based that experience upon deciding to visit NY and have an afternoon of Traditional Tea at the NY Ritz. I was a solo guest, as I was in Paris, but the treatment was quite the opposite. I was placed behind a column with a single seating. The food, a very frugal food accompiment of ..4 little sandwiches (sized like a quarter).. 1 scone and 4 petite sweets...room had no ambience, poor music selection on intercom, and a waiter who made me feel like I was an inconvenience...no class. Paris you are the best! Piano pop selections..classy service and excellent food. Ritz NY you need to check out Paris for Traditional Tea instructions and guest relations!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at Ritz-Carlton for 4 nights on our way from London to Costa Rica and were impressed with the great service. We were celebrating an anniversary and received a complimentary upgrade to a suite overlooking the Central Park. The hotel staff were attentive, professional and knowledgable.A memorable stay and yet another solid performance from the Ritz-Carlton team.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: i will start with the positives: The location is great, and my room was decent sized and clean. But even by New York standards, prices were ridiculously high ($50 for a room service continental breakfast, nearly $700 per night for my room). My room service order got botched, and the desk area lacked sufficient plugs.The low rating is a function of the high prices, which resulted in unmet high expectations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed 3 night here at the Ritz. Great service of front desk staff and front door staff. There were several hiccups in communication from guest services to housekeeping. We had an extremely quiet room with a comfortable bed. Very nice amenities are available, including an ample sized bathroom.Good location-depending on your activities. Directly across the street from Central Park (south).Easy walk to 5th Ave. About a 20 min walk to the Broadway theatre area. Easy walk to upper east/west side museums from here-as well as shopping.Solid (and convenient) Italian restaurant next door and plenty alternative breakfast restaurants close by. Breakfast service in the hotel was lacking, as was the breakfast. Overall very good.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was the perfect hotel to stay in for a special family holiday, the staff were amazing and could not do enough to help us. The views are absolutely incredible and the location is spot on. I have wonderful memories and hope to return again one day.
user_name:
Jessica M
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending five nights here on our first visit to NYC. Nothing is too much trouble for the incredibly friendly staff who do an excellent job to make you feel welcome and valued. The hotel is beautifully presented and our room was immaculate and well furnished - the bed was especially comfortable. The public rooms are equally pleasant and the lounge provides a very relaxing space to enjoy a reasonably quiet drink or snack when returning from a day of sightseeing. The hotel is perfectly located for access to the busy shopping and tourist areas yet is just a short stroll to the delights of Central Park and all it has to offer. In general, a fantastic stay in an excellent hotel in a fabulous city. We can't wait to go back to NYC, and will most definitely try to book the Ritz-Carlton Central Park again. Thanks to all there for contributing to a truly delightful experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You can't fault a Ritz Carlton and this one at New York Central Park is iconic. A truly classical hotel in every sense, elegantly decorated rooms with period-look furniture and warm colors, and exquisite house-keeping to match. All rooms are of good-size as I can see from the floor plan. I had a room overlooking Central Park, and they even provide binoculars (and with a booklet on bird-watching) so that you can have the best view of Central Park. The Club Lounge is elegant and serves food and drink virtually at every hour. Service at reception is perfect. The location is about the best if you look for highend shopping, and even the Metropolitan Opera where I went to is only 15 minutes' walk away. With many new luxury hotels going "modern" and even "minimalist", it is simply great to be able to return to some classical, understated elegance of a bygone golden age. Room internet is charged but internet in Club Lounge and lobby are free (a strange American practice).
user_name:
牧 黄
Hong Kong, China

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First of all I would like to stay at plaza hotel, but then decided to stay at this hotel. If you go there do not hesitate to book a room on the top floors and park view! It is spectacular. Unfortunately the wifi is not free, but it was not a problem. The staff is great and professionalFinally I've visited NYC and stayed at the great place!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful, exquisitely maintained, fabulously located luxe hotel which looks and smells almost exactly like every other Ritz I have seen. If you have visited other Ritz properties and been happy, you will be very happy here. Complete opposite of a Four Seasons - which, depending on where you stand or what you are in the mood for is a good thing or a not so good thing. If you want dark wood, 1980's style - plush and comfy versus cool, austere, and angular, there are few hotels in NYC that can top the Ritz. The staff was impeccable in every way. Shout out to Lindsay Michelle (so said her name tag) who, at check-in was just fabulously warm and professional. Only tip - if you are looking for a view, request one as many rooms have a close-up view of the back of the hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Afternoon tea was lovely. Have you ever seen that move somewhere in time? I felt like I had been transported. Though I resisted the urge to run around like that kid off home alone even though my inner child wanted me too I behaved like the 30 year old adult I should have. The service was top notch. I think it's the quitest I've ever been as I gazed around the room and took in all of its splendor and I thought. I'm having tea at the Ritz. If you could give 7 starts I would.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We just returned from 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton Central Park South. We were on the 12th floor with a Central Park view, Club Level. New York prices at deluxe hotels are extremely high at this time. If you are in the market for a deluxe property and are willing to spend the money I think the Ritz Carlton is worth it. The service was excellent. The décor is traditional but not stuffy. The rooms, starting at approx. 425 sq ft, are well appointed and the marble bathrooms have a separate bath and shower. The double pane windows kept out the noise because we didn't hear any traffic sounds. The beds were very comfortable The Club Level offered continuous food offerings throughout the day. The menu changed throughout the day depending on whether you were there for breakfast, lunch, tea, cocktails or after dinner drinks. The food was nicely presented and quite good. It was a peaceful retreat for us to enjoy a glass of wine, cup of tea, canapés and complimentary WI-FI when we needed to take a break from NY noise. The bar is fairly plain, but the surrounding area is quite nice relax with a cocktail . If you are looking for a European feeling and traditional service I would recommend the Ritz Carlton Central Park South.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Amazing place. Top quality service. Top luxury decor. If you can afford it you will not be disappointed. Top class location near Central Park. Food top quality. Rooms very luxurious especially the bathrooms. Overall a super hotel location in the middle of New York City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My partner treated me to a wonderful NYC weekend staying at the Ritz. It was PERFECT! Special kudos to Ronald Delostrino, Jr. for many personal touches. He made the stay a true Ritz moment!Location on Central Park and near all great NYC attractions makes this hard to beat. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There is great service, and then there is the service at Ritz Carlton Central Park. From the moment we pulled up to Valet the car, the service was simply excellent. Beyond anything my wife and I had experienced (even at Four Seasons). Our valet was named Felix, and he was outstanding, from letting us know about a 100,000 person protest scheduled the next morning, to directions on anywhere we wanted to go in Manhattan. Felix helped us with our bags (and must have radioed to the doormen (holding the door) as they both greeted us by name (literally 2 mins after we pulled up to the curb).Orlando was at the front desk when we arrived - he knew it was our 5 yr anniversary (I had called ahead) so he gave us complimentary club lounge access (beautiful room overlooking Central Park, with complimentary soda, water, wine, champagne, and light sandwiches and snacks, coffee/tea!!). Ronald came to fetch us from heaven (AKA the club lounge) and escorted us to our room where they had (unknowingly to either of us) spread out white rose petals all over the room and bed. My wife was amazed. They also had a bottle of champagne and choc. covered strawberries waiting for us. Shortly thereafter, Jose arrived with our bags and proceeded to arrange a courtesy car for that evening to take us to the FlatIron district for our dinner reservation. The hotel itself is just AWESOME. Lobby and lounge are great, the bar is very ornate. I didn't get a chance to visit the spa - but it looked inviting. Our room was a standard room, but the "standard" room at this hotel is equivalent to a suite at a Marriott or Hilton (where we typically stay)The price is up there, but for the level of service you receive - I'd tell you it's worth every dime!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: it lives up with the Ritz Carlton brand - excellent service from the front desk staff - super professional and enthusiastic. One down side is if you stay at the standard room - hotel does not have a bar or public area where you can view the central park
user_name:
hmn2012
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have visited this hotel twice, once for my Wife's birthday and once prior to Christmas Both times we experienced friendly and helpful staff who go out of their way to make you feel specialThe Christmas lead up is a fantastic time to visit
user_name:
Fred S
High Wycombe, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the second time I've been in this hotel and it's was in absolutely amazing ,and it's my wife birthday , we have a special treatment for the birthday gift ,The service was very good The breakfast this very good ,The staff service very good , when I come back to New York This is my hotel !!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I were recently in New York to celebrate our anniversary and to attend the premier of "Boradwalk Empire". Prior to arriving in the city I spoke with a member of the conierge staff, Maria. Upon arrival, I sought her out and confirmed the reservations she had made for us. She was beyond gracious and was most helpful. She made dinner reservations and arranged for cars for us as well. All her restaurant recommendations were wonderful. The lobby, reception area, the dining rooms and our room were all beautiful. On the evening of our anniversary, we mentioned to her that we were attending the Broadway production of Cinderella. When we returned to our room, the music from the show was playiing on the CD player. A member of the customer support staff had purchased the CD of the soundtrack from the play. He left a note saying that the hotel staff hoped we had enjoyed our stay and that the CD was ours to remember our visit. This was one of the most considerate and thoughtful gestures I can ever remember experiencing in my life. It topped off our most wonderful trip. On top of everything, the room was beautiful with a spectacular view of Central Park. Our entire stay was top drawer and guaranteed that upon our return to New York, we will absolutely stay at the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Of course this is a great location, although Central Park South can be congested with tourists. Still, it's great to just walk across the street into the park, and it's convenient to be close to the Time Warner Center, which is a great upscale mall (has a delicious Bouchon Bakery by Thomas Keller for breakfast) and also has an enormous subway station. I liked the lobby a lot, very luxurious and comfortable, and big enough so that it was never over-run. There is free coffee in the morning, iced tea and treats later in the day, that was a great touch. I saved up a year of business travel points to redeem 3 nights here, and got Gold status in the process. Supposedly I should get a room upgrade for my troubles but there was no way to tell, got a small room facing the back (not exactly an elevator shaft but from the 4th floor room there was really no direct sun in the room ever). The room is nice enough but the furniture is getting worn and the bath fittings are fine but no question outdated. This is in distinct contrast to the St Regis in Aspen where we just stayed, everything is top of the line and it does feel more luxurious. Aren't you expecting the best when you stay at a property like this?Had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, service was great, food was ok. Coffee is good. had room service for dinner, again the food was average but not outrageously expensive at least.The staff is phenomenally trained, everyone was professional and incredibly helpful. That was very impressive.The last night I knocked a glass of red wine over onto the carpet and this was handled in impeccable fashion. Of course it was just so embarrassing but within 2-3 minutes someone from housekeeping was at the door with a steam cleaner and had it all handled in 5 minutes, looked like it had never happened. I was very impressed and they told me not to worry about it and really seemed to mean it, I was very appreciative.One final note: I did like that there were absolutely no charges for the room when redeeming points- no resort fee, taxes, nothing! My only charges were for the rollaway for my daughter and the food we ate.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the RC NY last May for one week. I have enjoyed the lobby, rooms, executive lounge, and particularly the location. The lounge provides a charming look at the infamous, Central Park. you could sit their for hours and enjoy the scene. But let me tell you, after the RC of DC, i am not sure that this RC is at bar. We were a group that checked in 23 rooms at the same time. Of course you expect best treatment! but they put me in a lower floor with dimmed lights. Called the reception manager, George, who was nothing but unhelpful if not rude! he lied about availability of other rooms and spoke with condescending tone and language that made me hit the roof. So I requested to speak to the manager who was much better person and managed to relocate me to a nicer room at higher floor. I told them that this person should not talking to client. He offered an apology which i did not accept. Anyways, the next time you visit NY and can afford the Ritz, go to the Plaza.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As part of our honeymoon we stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 6 days. New York was amazing as always and the location of the hotel is just great, just of Central Park South. Initially we were given the wrong room and, despite having been in contact with the customer service manager up front (both regarding the honeymoon and the fact we are platinum members) our special requests were not followed up.But, upon contacting the front desk on these points, the Ritz Carlton staff made every effort in giving us a great stay and provided us with complimentary drinks and dinner.The fact the overall score comes to average is noy only due to the disappointment while checking in, but also due to the fact that the Ritz prices are high. And the overall customer experience you get in return is just not up to par. The rooms are nice, but small and in need for remodelling. As are the hallways and some of the public spaces. Furthermore we would have expected more qualified staff as well. At slightly lower rates we would have given the Ritz a score of 4. But, again, good hotel in a great location. Oh and by the way, the beds are simply devine.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for the second time over Labor Day weekend. The rooms are beautiful, spotless and very comfortable. The service is outstanding. We received an upgrade to a Central Park view and they sent champagne and strawberries to recognize a special occasion. The location is also great, especially for shopping and restaurants. For joggers, it's also very enjoyable to step right out of the hotel and go for a long run in the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The bottom line up front is that the Ritz-Carlton Central Park is what you would expect from one of the very best hotels in one of the best cities in the world: friendly, courteous and effective staff, beautiful rooms with lovely amenities, and unbeatable northward-facing views of Central Park.After having somewhat of a rough arrival into NYC, our arrival at the Ritz made us forget the terrible journey that it took to get there. Andrea checked us in quickly, offering us bottles of Ritz-Carlton bottled water while we waited, but informed us that our room (which was upgraded to a suite overlooking Central Park) was not quite yet ready. While we were perfectly happy to wait for a bit while the room was prepared, Andrea offered us complimentary access to the hotel's Club Level, which featured four types of wine, several types of light food offerings (which appeared to change every 30 to 45 minutes, which was quite nice), and a very knowledgeable dedicated concierge named Felix who really knew about NYC. Although we already had several restaurants and other activities booked, Felix told us about various food trucks, coffee shops and stores that we simply would not know about without his advice. After about 20 minutes, Andrea came to the Club Level to tell us that our room was ready, so off we went.I have stayed in hotel rooms in several cities around the world for business and pleasure, but none to date have made such a positive first impression upon entering. It could have been the size of the room (which is quite large for NYC), the fact that we had "his and hers" closets, the lovely welcome chocolates and letter, or the bathroom that contained everything that you would need or want in a bathroom (separate toilet closet, independent shower and bathtub, large mirror and counter space, surround sound speakers that are connected to the television in the main part of the room, among other things), but we were very impressed.If there is one flaw with this hotel, it is the same one that affects all of the 5-star properties directly adjacent to Central Park - that is, all four streets immediately around Central Park (8th Avenue, 5th Avenue, West 59th Street, West 110th Street) naturally have a lot of traffic on them, but none more so than 59th Street West. This street noise is somewhat audible from the sixth floor, however, the reason that I do not subtract a star from this review (aside from the rest of the hotel being so amazing that it still deserves five stars) is because the audio dock next to each bed offers different musical and ambient noise settings which, when combined with the good speakers in the room, more than drown out any noise that you might hear from the street. The Ritz-Carlton Central Park really has thought of everything, and I can only give it my highest recommendation.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The rooms were comfortable enough but the service was truly exceptional - attentive and caring without fail! The view from the rooms facing away from Central Park is negligible but the price is much lower too! I really enjoyed my stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The reception staff immediately accommodated our request for a higher floor, still with adjoining rooms, with a great view over central park.The rooms were an ample size, and the room service was really first rate. We had a dedicated housekeeper who got to know our family really well - often leaving extra treats for the boys - which is pretty rare in US hotels. The concierge was equally accommodating in planning our trips out. The quality of the beds was outstanding - so much so we had to find out where they got their mattresses from and buy some ourselves back home!The interior has a traditional feel, family friendly during the day with the bars relaxing for couples during the evening. Its a great location to explore the City by foot, using Central Park as the landmark. We would certainly consider going back there when we next go to NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I spent 4 nights at this hotel during Labor day week end. We had a room at the 15 floor with a beautiful view of Central park. Room size was OK ( but you are in NYC..), perfectly clean and very well kept.Bathroom was small ( only one basin) and pretty outdated but immaculate. I liked the old fashion furniture as well as the decor of the lobby, the bar and restaurant. The executive lounge served good breakfast ( included) and the lady at the lounge reception was extremely friendly and helpful.You can find better restaurant in NYC , but our dinner at the hotel restaurant , even if was not memorable....was fine ( a little bit overpriced...). At the end, great location, relatively small but clean room and impeccable service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is perfect, the rooms are up to date and of the luxury you would expect for the cost -- unlike most NY high end hotels. Unlike the Pierre, and others, the bathroom has a fair amount of counter space and the water closet is separate from shower and sink. There is plenty is closet and luggage space for two travelers with a lot of clothes. The Conceirge Level is a great amenity, the servers remember you, have warmth but don't intrude and the views are great. I would recommend as the top option for a 5 star NY hotel. Book an upgraded room with a view of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I took my mum to New York to celebrate her 50th birthday and was toying between the Ritz and the Plaza. I 100% made the right choice!! From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, champagne on arrival to celebrate mum's birthday then a room with a Central Park view. We had a major delay getting in so we missed our table reservation at Roberts (highly recommended) the reception staff called Roberts and rearrange the table, took us there in a range rover for free and secured us the best table in the window!!! The rooms were incredible, massive very tasteful and comfortable! On mums birthday she got cards and chocolate covered Strawberry's! Anything we needed they delivered it. We can't recommend this hotel enough. Thank you to all the staff who made our trip magical!! Katie and Diane x

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Also the service is impeccable. You walk right out of the lobby and into Central Park and shopping is all around. We walked to Eataly which is one of the best places on earth to shop and dine on Italian cuisine.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel was so welcoming and made our holiday to New York. This is my third trip to New York and some hotels are large and impersonal but not the Ritz Carton. We stayed in their standard room with no view of the park but it was large and very comfortable. The staff were so helpful and kind. Some more expensive hotels can be very stuck up but not here. You feelVery relaxed from the hustle and bustle of the city. Highly recommend this hotel !!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stopped by the bar for a couple of drinks and I was blown away. Eric, the bartender was so attentive and friendly. He made the BEST Bloody Mary I've ever had! Between the beautiful atmosphere and the impeccable service, I count this as one of the best hotel bars I have ever been to!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I happened to be in NY with friends and we popped into the bar on the first floor and had a glass of wine while we were contemplating our next move. The lovely Irina served us and was just a delight. The wine is expensive and fabulous and we had an amazing time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had the great fortune to stay at the Ritz Carlton Central Park with my wife for a little "stay-cation". There is no hotel quite like the Ritz Central Park. While the views of the Park were amazing and staying at a hotel with the USA Basketball Team was very cool, the service and care that each member of the Hotel Staff put into make your experience extraordinary is what makes this Hotel a "must visit". Everyone from Jenny to Ashley to See et al were amazing and we are so appreciative.We cant wait until we come back again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff make this hotel one of the finest I have ever stayed in, nothing was too much trouble. We checked in early and we're rewarded with a room on the 22nd floor - outstanding view! Our room was well equipped and spacious. Room service breakfast was perfect.The location was ideal for accessing all areas of central NY with great shopping easily accessible!Hope to return

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was a memorable trip. We were celebrating my 50th Birthday, and our 24th Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel made us feel special by upgrading our room, providing us with a bottle of champagne, and chocolate-dipped strawberries on arrival - all with a park view room. Wow!Understated elegance sums up this hotel, without stuffiness. (I did see some very strange outfit choices in the lobby lounge, but they were of the teenage kind!) It was the guys on the door in the morning who greeted us by name (who told them?) who made us feel very cared for. They were only opening the door for us, but it seemed that we mattered.The cocktails in the bar are seriously strong, the breakfast is yummy, and the ambiance is such that anyone could feel at home there. We would definitely go back - and are planning already!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the doorman to the General Manger, everyone made us feel very welcome. Great location, south side of Central Park. Walking distance to everything. Ate lunch and breakfast at Auden - food was delicious each time. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife arranged a birthday weekend in NYC at the Central Park Ritz and loved it. We had a deluxe suite with two baths facing central park. Not cheap of course but it was a summer special that included one night free. The room was super clean and the service was excellent. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate and you feel like royalty but without the stuffiness. We had Club access and also had late night drinks at the Star Lounge. All reflected the same level of attentiveness. This was our second stay here and we look forward to returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Oh wow!!! What a wonderful experience. I love New York anyway so I am slightly biased but there are no words to highlight how amazing this hotel is. Expensive yes but you get exactly what you pay for. Entire New York experience was second to none, I have already booked for December see you then guys.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Many people say when traveling to big cities where you stay isn't that important. While it's true that you are not at the hotel like you would be at a resort location staying at the RCCP made our great trip to NYC perfect. We were traveling with our children ages 7 and 8 and from the moment we arrived the hotel staff made us feel like we had stated there 100 times. Service was amazing and while I could note multiple examples, one moment sticks out in my mind. I went downstairs to the front desk one am and mentioned that I needed some cold medicine for my wife. After a full day in the city we arrived back at the hotel. 10 minutes after we arrived back into our suite the staff delivered chicken soup with a handwritten note for my wife telling her that she hoped she felt better. Beautiful hotel, beautiful rooms, awesome club level amazing staff. We are from savannah, ga (voted the second friendliest city in the country) so we know a thing or two about it! Everyone working in this hotel was genuinely kind and eager to meet your every need. Our kids still talk about Victor to this day and they even made bracelets for him. Don't think just book it and enjoy!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: stayed here for my 40th birthday for 3 nights.beautiful hotel, the staff were incredibly friendly.our room was lovely however, it did lack a little "finesse", even thouhh it was modern it was a little tired in the decor area and little things needed a bit of a lift, especially in the bathroomhowever, we stillhad an amazing time and i would definitely go back there and stay again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I celebrated my 50th birthday at this Ritz, and are very glad we spent the big bucks on it. It's ideally located near midtown and across the street from Central Park. The interior is simply amazing, the staff are polite and happy, and the bed was so comfy. Our suite was much larger than expected, with two bathrooms, a living room, and foyer with door bell. We took our small dog, and while it cost us $250 plus an amazingly-outrageous $45/hr dog sitting fee, we're glad we did. The gross smell from the horses that stage across the street is very strong as you exit the hotel. The hotel gave me a plate of chocolates for my birthday, and two personalized cards. We had an oblique view of Central Park from one end of the suite, and of a building from the other.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at this hotel many times and the never-ending quality continues to amaze me. From the moment of arrival to checkout, the service is exceptional due to the staff that truly goes above and beyond. Joe, at the front door, always greets with a smile and a "welcome back." Carlos and Allen helped us in and out with our bags. These guys are the best; true professionals that provide both a warm welcome on arrival, and when departing, make you remember why you want to come back. Excellent food, beautiful presentations, and superb staff make the club lounge a must! Felix, Lazar, Charles and Kelly are always friendly and very attentive. They anticipate what you may need, and it is provided before you even ask. The Star Lounge on the first floor provides great light bite options and delicious desserts. Lada graciously assisted us and provided excellent service with our nightly dessert orders! We had a city view suite, very roomy and beautiful with an extremely comfortable bed. We stayed on a high floor and had beautiful, partial views of Central Park. The location is perfect. Central Park is right across the street; shopping on Madison Avenue, 5th Ave, and Columbus Circle are all in walking distance; as are Times Square and most Broadway plays. Numerous restaurants are also within walking distance, and if you don't want to walk, a house car is available to take you wherever you want to go. What more can you ask for? I look forward to returning and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great Place, Great Staff. Wow! Wow! Wow! For sure I will be back again. Eric u were wonderful. Loved the cocktails. Thanks everyone who made my stay worth it. Wish the gym was a little spacious though.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This stay was wonderful. The front desk was professional and attentive, Jenny. They honored our early arrival and we were upgraded. The room was spacious, clean and it looked out to Central Park. It was a quiet room making sleeping a pleasure. Everyone in the Club Level was attentive and friendly. The food fresh, tasty and always well stocked. Felix and Lazar were a pleasure. The spa is small but Melissa gave an excellent massage. Bernd at Concierge eager to help. Adam always greeted us with a smile upon our return. What a difference a year makes. A wonderful stay looking forward to our return, The location of this hotel cannot be beat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had the warmest welcome, all the staffs are extremly nice , the general manager was very present and made sure we had everything we nedeed . This is the best Ritz we ve been to. The beds are incredible confortable , the room service is fast , and we have 3 children , and i must say it is a kids friendly hotel. The gym...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I knew that I'd love the Ritz, but this experience went over the top! We got off to a rocky start when the room was not ready at 3 pm. But waiting in the bar and getting to know Eric, the bartender, made waiting (until nearly 4:30) more bearable. After that, the service was excellent. If we asked, it appeared. The park view rooms are quiet, the hotel is exceptionally well taken care of, the beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were always well stocked with towels. But most impressive was that when we returned from the theatre, the CD for the musical we saw was playing in the in room CD player. The hotel staff had arranged to have a complimentary CD sent up to our room. Fantastic!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had the warmest welcome, all the staffs are extremly nice , the general manager was very present and made sure we had everything we nedeed . This is the best Ritz we ve been to. The beds are incredible confortable , the room service is fast , and we have 3 children , and i must say it is a kids friendly hotel. The gym is small but they even provide free new head set if u don t have yours for the music.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way possible. The entire staff is friendly, unlike most New Yorkers. They go out of their way to make sure your stay is amazing. The rooms are decorated beautifully and the bathrooms are sparkling clean. The Star Lounge is filled with great food and servers. In Room dining is great, and they'll even make you anything they don't have on the menu! I have been to this hotel so many times I can't count. I can't wait to go back. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone whether it is romantic, business, or just leisure.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Visited multiple times while in NYC. Good little snacks and ambiance. Nice lounging after a stroll in Central Park and before dinner. A few times thought about going to Plaza but the lounge bar seems to be...not so confy or cozy :-)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Been in several Ritz' around the world. Club lounge are a pleasant environment, same here although food and beverage supply is a little less abundant compared with other locations. Rooms are perfect, well maintained and great house keeping. Location of the hotel is obviously fantastic.Would recommend hotel but would also recommend hotel management to visit RC club in San Francisco for example. Just a bit more flair and certainly more luxurious food and beverage supply through out the day.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Upon arrival there is a very warm welcome from all the staff. Check in is easy. Staff are very knowledgeable about the local area and will make recommendations and will also book tables for you at your request. Rooms have good views even from non park view rooms and are very clean

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz for 3 great nights. There's not much I can complain about. We had a Central Park view suite. The bathroom was MAYBE a tad bit old in terms of furniture and décor, but was very clean. The room was spacious and clean, not much of a Central Park view from the 4th floor, but we checked in early, so I think that's why we got the room we did. Surprised there was no coffee maker in room, but available upon request. I guess the same people who do room service don't handle appliances because each afternoon we got back to our room the area with coffee maker was untidy ,but the room was done up - very well might I add. No pool, but who goes to NYC to swim. EXCELLENT location for 5th avenue & Madison shopping, walking distance to Time Square, if that's what you're into, and of course across the street from Central Park! Great service and attentive staff, how ever I was with my male partner and felt we could have been treated a tad bit more warmly...(in other words we felt we were treated a tad bit different because we were a male couple). And that's about it. If it's in your budget, stay at the Ritz for sure!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We originally booked the Penn NY for an 8 night stay and checked out after 1 night for a variety of reasons. We landed at the Ritz Carlton and our interaction with Mark from Front Desk set the tone for the duration of our stay- it was simply outstanding. Also a special thank you to George and Maria from concierge and the entire team for making our time in New York very special.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is a superb choice! Stayed for 2 nights and got upgraded to a suite on the 19th floor. Had a beautiful view of all of Central Park. The bed was amazing and huge. The shower in the bathroom had great water pressure. What I was most I'm pressed by was the customer service. It was excellent from the moment we checked in to the moment that we checked out. I also liked the location. Usually I stay in times square, but it was nice to stay a little further away from all the hustle and bustle. Would highly recommend the ritz!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights with my family over the Christmas period. I wasn't disappointed but I wasn't impressed with the hotel. It seemed to lack atmosphere, and was a bit dull.Aside from that, the staff made up for this by being so incredibly helpful. Being greeted by name and welcomed upon arrival each time and remembering the little things are all small touches that made the stay great.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I stayed at this wonderful hotel in late June. Our suite was spacious and well furnished. The most exceptional factor of our visit however was the superb personal service we received. Upon returning one evening from the theater with our grandchild and her cousin we were welcomed back to our suite with the original cast CD of Les Miserables playing on our in room CD. Ronald and Maria of the front desk had sent 2 CD's; one for each of the girls as a remembrance of our Broadway theater visit. Additionally, Robinson at the front desk and all of those at the concierge desk promptly and courteously helped with any question or request. Al, our doorman was helpful too. The list could go on and on.............We will return to the Ritz Carlton on Central Park on our next visit to the city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for 7 nights. Top notch room with stunning views of Central Park. Service outstanding , nothing was too much trouble. Beats some of the other high profile hotels hands down. The location is perfect.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just came back after a 3 night stay and the hotel staff was superb. The staff was the most attentive and accommodating of any hotel that we've stayed at. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was completely silent. The room was spacious with 2 closets. Only complaint is the charge for wifi. It should be included for the price of the rooms.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had an amazing experience of first class personalized service at this ritz over the weekend. Everything from dinner reservations, to a personal horse and carriage ride , help with any and all arrangements for special event Can't say enough about the personal touches that we experienced during our stay. The concierge Brian and his whole staff went above and beyond. We have stayed at about a half dozen Ritz Carlton's and the one is Central Park is by FAR the most personalized experience we have ever had. A MUST stay when in New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've stayed at or otherwise visited numerous luxury hotels in NYC, and the Ritz ranks among the best in the city. The location is ideal for tourists (and not bad for business in Midtown). The service is excellent. If you are celebrating a special occasion, make sure to let the staff know and they will not disappoint you. The lounge and dinning room are very comfortable and well decorated. My recommendation would be to take a room with a view of the park. Otherwise, the premium price really isn't worth it.
user_name:
NYCBOS
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Weekend getaway with hubby. Great location. We took full advantage of being right across the street from Central Park for our morning excersice - amazing sights! Service was right on par with The Ritz-Carlton. Housekeeper was so sweet and attentive! Definitely look forward to returning, maybe we'll bring the kids next time :)

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed at multiple Ritz Carlton properties and the Ritz Carlton Central Park did not disappoint. My wife and I came down from CT for a last minute city getaway. We arrived at the hotel later in the evening and were warmly greeted. With the hotel being quite full, I did not receive my typical upgrade. But, the front desk attendant, Denise was extremely helpful in finding us the best possible option for the room type that I booked. We enjoyed well made cocktails in the lounge, while waiting for our room to be inspected. The prices are what you would expect for NYC and the Ritz Carlton. Denise personally showed us to our room and offered to bring anything else that we needed. We elected to have complimentary coffee service for the morning (no coffee maker in room, unless requested) and it was delivered shortly thereafter. The room is large, by NYC standards and extremely well appointed. I was particularly pleased with the very spacious bathroom. The bed and pillows were absolutely heavenly. The location of the hotel is fantastic. Overlooking Central Park and within walking distance to several areas of Manhattan. The concierge helped us with last minute dinner reservations and we ended up at Porter House. The meal was very nice and the service was impeccable. But, the restaurant lacks ambiance for the price that you pay. Had I realized that it was inside the mall, I would have made a different choice. The morning of our departure, we didn't have much time for walking and waiting in line somewhere. So, we enjoyed the coffee service in room and headed down to Auden for breakfast. Service was fantastic from the moment we were greeted till the moment we payed the bill. The meal (once again priced like a Ritz Carlton in NYC) was wonderful. We split an omelet and the pancakes and loved both.There may very well be less expensive options that provide a better "bang for the buck" experience. But, I have nothing but praise for this property, its location, and its staff. We'll surely return!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a frequent guest of the Ritz for business and personal travel we have to say don't stay here. This is so far beneath Ritz standards you will be very disappointed. We had our family traveling with us and needed two rooms. The check in process was awful and our guarantee of rooms being at least on the same floor did not happen. We had certificates for one room which really threw them. Our turn down service either never happened or was happening at 11 pm. Our request to make up the sofa bed by 8 pm never happened without us calling. The Spa service is the priciest I have ever seen and the faculties are tiny. Unless you have two hours to spare DO NOT eat breakfast here. We asked for car service and were told the rates were 300 an hour with a minimum of two hours for an SUV. Here is a tip use Uber...while the location is great the hotel feels tired and dated. Lots of better options at and below this price point. If you have to use Ritz use Battery Park option they are fantastic and make this place feel like a goat ranch. Insult to injury 30 minutes to check out because they had the billing all wrong with mystery charges.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my fourth stay across six years. We were married in the hotel 2 years ago and returned this June to the very same suite overlooking Central Park. Greeting us on arrival was a complimentary bottle of Tattinger champagne and a wonderful chocolate basket assortment with hand-piped anniversary wishes. The location on Central Park South remains the perfect base between uptown Metropolitan Museum, Frick Collection and Guggenheim Museum, the delights of midtown 5th and 6th Avenues, and downtown Times Square, Meat Packing District and eventually SoHo.iA room with a view over Central Park is, simply, worth it. Front Desk, Concierge personnel, door staff throughout called me by name across the whole week. The various Concierges were wonderfully engaging and helpful to boot, clearly proud of their role. Service throughout the hotel was excellent at all but one low touch point and that hiccup was dealt with quickly and appropriately. Lazar in the Club Lounge should be elected a national treasure.If New York calls, try to stay there.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a long weekend here for a birthday celebration and could not have been more please. AMEX Platinum package withe the late check out made the last day a veryrelaxing one. We stayed on the lClb Level, and the experience could not have been more satisfying. Wonderful food and drink, but most of all, incredible personal serive from the staff in the Lounge. After the first day they realized our preferences and met our every need. The quality of the food was wonderful--a few more choices would have been nice--but it was first rate.Looking forward to our next visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have no idea what has taken me so long to write a review of this hotel, but better late than never! I've stayed at this hotel probably 20 times over the past 7 years and I can say this is THE best city hotel ever. I'm comparing this hotel to not only every other 5 star hotel in NYC, but many throughout the world. Everyone from the front desk staff to the concierge to the amazing doormen (and Ender!) make this hotel what it is. Don't get me wrong, the hotel itself is beautiful and done in top-notch style, but for me the service is always more important than the hotel. Every time I come here the staff remembers me and makes me feel welcome and at home. I recently came on Father's Day with my 2 year old daughter and it was the most memorable weekend I've spent with her yet. She was OBSESSED with the horses and the staff treated her so fantastic. From the present on check in to the special chocolate milk at lunch to the feeding of the horses and then the cookies and balloons in the room. She had a smile on her face throughout the entire weekend, and I have the hotel to thank for making this trip so extra special. That weekend with my daughter reinforced why it's worth it to spend the extra money on such a fabulous hotel...when your children are treated better than you are it's priceless!Thank you RC CPS for all the years of amazing stays and for all the future ones to come!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The only drawback for our family(6 years old son) was that there is no pool. Otherwise, we loved the hotel and especially the club level. The food,beverages and service on the club level completely made our stay worth the price.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I took my family into the City to see Aladdin on Broadway and we stayed at this classy hotel. I did Club Level on this trip and at check-in, we were upgraded to a premier suite on the 15th floor that overlooked Central Park. The suite was spacious and handsomely appointed. Having the extra half bath is always a plus when there are four of us. The suite was simply beautiful and the view of the Park was stunning. The Club Lounge was fantastic. We enjoyed the wonderfully prepared presentations of the food before dinner and after the show and then breakfast the next morning. The hotel staff could not have been nicer or more professional. Everyone we encountered seem to have a great attitude and enjoyed working there. The Ritz Carlton Central Park was simply outstanding in every way.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed for several days with my son and nephew who are 15 and 13 years old. I felt safe and welcomed by the staff. I enjoyed the location of the hotel. Felt comfortable walking to 5th ave shopping, Rockefeller center, times square, and of course central park. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious. The staff was very helpful in finding activities for us to do. Will definitely plan to stay again. Felt the restaurant was a little expensive

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Recent 4 nite stay, $1000.00 per nite for Club access room, which, by the way, our room had a view of a brick wall. This room was tiny and featured elevator noise. We have stayed at a number of Ritz's recently, usually club access. There are no vintage wines, and the usual appetizers. They couldn't come up with my beer of choice and made no efforts to acquire. Housekeeping is exceptional. The rear bumper of our Acura 2014 MDX had damage, dented in, which we noticed on checkout. This car was loaded by me at home, driven directly to the hotel and I unloaded the bags at the hotel. This car has 6000 miles and I unload my own suitcases to avoid problems.The Doorman instantly produced a damage report. We denied that our car arrived damaged. We were told this report was filled out on our arrival, although we were not copied. We learned our car was picked up by an outside garage employee, who fills out a report, a service that the Ritz farms out. Your car is not on site and will not be available for in and out service. We have since learned that this report does not get completed if it is really busy. That means it can be filled out anytime while the car is out of your possession. I don't drive or have cars with dents. If I had that misfortune the car would be in the shop getting repaired, not driven. I have other cars at my disposal, so why would I chose a dented car to drive to New York. The lesson learned, take photos of your car at checkin. Smarter yet, google parking garages in the area and park your own car. What is the Ritz/ Marriott position? They have a damage report and I Arrived with a damaged car. "I should contact the garage". "Maybe the garage might compensate me". This would be their contracted garage, who I neither had any knowledge of our contact with. I Paid Ritz for Valet parking. Money is no longer the issue.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I recently visited the hotel for a brief weekday vacation in NYC. Everything about the stay was outstanding. The staff were extremely attentive and made extra efforts to address all of our needs and beyond. The room was large and immaculate. The Concierge was extremely knowledgable and made an effort to find out details about the Presidents visit so we would be sure to avoid the potential gridlock. We will be staying here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had the enjoyment of staying a Ritz Carlton Central Park last Christmas. The location and service were supreme. Property encompasses old and new... Be mindful, like most RC properties, it is not for the budget traveler, but well worth the expense!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Enjoyed staying at the ritz. Doormen was awesome check in staff great lobby breathless. When I arrived to my room on the 27 floor gorgeous smelled good the housekeeper was amazing down to earth and kept good conversation room was always refreshed and kept up with bottles of water can't wait to come back to ritz and stay on 27 floor with the amazing housekeeper a++++

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We visited the cocktail bar yesterday and had some truly fabulous cocktails. The service by Eric was excellent, and he has a really pleasant manner. He made some good restaurant recommendations. When Eric went off duty, there was another bar person ( older man) Morgan(?) who was entertaining and clearly very well travelled.I would highly recommend a trip to the cocktail bar at the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This property opened early last decade and it is still going strong. It once had the best hotel restaurant in the city run by Gabriel Kruthier, but he left around 2005 for Modern. Since then it's changed hands a number of times. Nearly everything else at the Ritz has stayed the same and Im glad it has. The lobby still has amazing artwork, the bar is still manned by Norman, the Club Level still delivers great service, and the rooms are still plush. I truly hope they do not think about giving anything about this property a large make-over. Just keep putting polish on the gem.Sure, I miss some things like Fekkai amenities and caviar in the Club (actually the latter is a big issue)...but on my varied stays at NYC 5-stars, the Ritz is still my favorite. Highly recommended; even in the entry level rooms...which have no view, but communicate a quietness that is rare in NYC.
user_name:
Frank F
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We visited New York at the beginning of April this year and the Ritz Carlton made our visit! The location is superb, the staff are welcoming and extremely helpful - especially Al at the door and Maria the concierge, the beds are super comfy and the decor is very grand. As a young couple we wanted to be in a good location where we could experience the whole atmosphere of the City that never sleeps, the Ritz Carlton is situated in a perfect place right by the park with breathtaking views, not too far of a walk from all the shopping locations and a short cab ride from most of the main 'attractions' as a tourist. There is an amazing restaurant which has opened next door called 'villagio' I would defiantly recommend a visit there and so would the doormen!!... Nothing seemed like too much of an effort for any of the staff they was all very attentive. The only one thing I would say is on our last day we had a late night flight, so we was asked to leave our room for 11am and had to wait around until 6pm to be picked up, they was happy to look after our suitcases but other than that there was no late checkout option etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a world-class hotel. From the golden elevator doors to the large rooms (of course relative to other New York City hotels) to the beautiful lobby with immaculately-shined marble floors, everything oozes luxury and class. The location is ideal, right across from Central Park and pretty close to most things - easy enough to access Subway right around corner, centrally located if you're taking a cab. The room was large, with an almost-wasteful entryway, a wonderful bed, a chair (but no footrest), and a gorgeously large and opulent bathroom. In terms of physical facilities, the hotel and rooms are beyond reproach.Unfortunately, along with that comes quite a bit of stuffiness and pretension. If you’re a younger traveler, or don’t enjoy dressing in couture, you might get strange/unfriendly looks from other guests and even some staff. Both happened to me more than once during a one-night stay. Further, service seems to be relative to expected wealth; my requests of the concierge were sometimes honored, and sometimes more or less blown off (I asked where I could find bath bubbles for the bathtub and was directed to the salts already in the room, which, I know, is totally minor, but nevertheless not service going "above and beyond" in any way). The exception was the bartender, who was very friendly, but the wait staff in the lounge area were not very knowledgeable about their drinks, and, again, seemed to attend to certain clients more than others. Wi-fi was not free, which is shameful in 2014, but did work as advertised. There was somebody (security? butler?) walking around my floor occasionally who never introduced himself and made me feel less rather than more comfortable, but that could have been due to a specific guest I imagine.If money is no object, go for it. You certainly won't be disappointed in anything about this hotel. But if you're somebody of average means looking for a special occasion, as I was, you might find yourself better served somewhere more welcoming.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This place is one of the most places I would love to stay .. The size of the rooms are pretty ok .. But the bed is super comfort ..! We called it marshmallow bed .. When you try the bet you will hate to get up from it ..Location is the best in Manhattan .. I stayed for one month .. And can't wait to visit this bed again..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We've stay at many, many Ritz's over the years and this is by far and away my favorite. The service is always consistent, the staff courteous and helpful and the rooms, well-appointed.I highly recommend staying club level. The views are wonderful and the food is great!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is very attractively located at Central Park, close to 5,6 and 7th Avenue as well as Columbus Circle and Columbus Avenue and of course opposite a Central Park entrance. The entrance of the hotel and the reception area make a somewhat outdated impression, in the evening the entrance is dark and not very inviting. However do not let yourselves be misled by this. We stayed for 4 nights at the 19th floor in a Deluxe room. Everything is what you can expect from the Ritz: comfy bed, nice quiet room with enough space and dimmable lights, bathroom is very comfortable indeed. The service is impeccable, just a wonderful stay. Let's not forget the very helpful doorman. They can blacken the room for guests that, like me, is sensitive to light. Tea, water all taken care of, if you like they bring a coffee machine with all amenities. Everything that makes a stay very pleasant indeed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We just stayed one night using points and were pleasantly surprised at a park view upgrade on arrival. We requested an early check-in and the room was available. The room was lovely with plenty of closet space and amenities. The bathroom was spacious with a separate bath and stall shower. The gym was full service and had all the modern equipment that my home gym has. The spa looked very nice but I didn't have the opportunity to use it this trip. The hotel is centrally located to many restaurants and museums and I look forward to staying again. We ended up walking to dinner because the location was so convenient. Thanks again for a wonderful stay!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed many times over the past few years at NYC's Central Park Ritz Carlton! We love the location, great access to shopping, restaurants, and the Park!! It is a great value for NYC. We love the rooms, and the service! The doormen will remember you after one visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Enjoyed this hotel very much. Everyone was polite, attentive and professional. Customer service was excellent.I'm recently retired from the U.S. Army, and I treated myself to a short weekend. My room was clean, quiet, and well-appointed. The complimentary congratulatory gestures from the guest services team, including a giant bowl of chocolate-covered strawberries and a nice card, were very nice touches. NOTE: This is not a place for you to come and complain because its offerings are "overpriced," or "dated." Yes. The restaurant is pricey, even for coffee and water. If old-fashioned door handles are a bother, or you need a large lobby and the most modern furnishings, then this may not be to your liking. If you want something "just as good for less money..," then consider going elsewhere. But if you want to treat yourself, or be pampered just because you can, and absorb a little history in the process, this is a nice option. The price for accommodations seems comparable to that of other luxury hotels.Considering what I read of some of the other reviews, I'd be interest to know when the last renovation was completed on this property. I found everything to be well up-to-date and working nicely, but I read several complaints that didn't match my experience at all.
user_name:
Ry S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service at the Central Park Ritz is impeccable and friendly, as it is in every Ritz we have visited. The location is central and perfect as well, if you don't mind being in a busy and touristy section of the city. The only problem here, really, is that this Ritz doesn't measure up to others we have been to in San Francisco, Boston, Naples, etc. Especially the food in the club lounge, which is definitely not great. If you have a room overlooking the park, it may be worth the big bucks. But with all the great hotels in New York, why not save a couple of hundred dollars and stay at the Essex House (just down the block, same Central Park view), or the Mark, in a lovely and quieter residential neighborhood.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My daughter and I recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Central Park and the service was just amazing. Everyone went out of their way to do anything they could for us. We had access to the club lounge which was just amazing. Great small plates of food throughout the day, great service and a lovely view of Central Park. We wanted two queen beds so we had to take a room with a "courtyard view." which means basically a view of an airshaft and another building, but we were told about this ahead of time so we knew what to expect. The rooms with the 2 queens are not on the park. Nonetheless it was a beautiful room with a great Ritz bathroom. This really is a great hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently did a multi centre holiday to New York, Toronto, Niagara Falls and Washington DC to celebrate one of us turning 40 and this hotel was the first stop, and best hotel of our trip. We paid extra and upgraded to the club lounge and this was a very wise decision and really enhanced our experience. For an additional $100 a day (don't forget to add the tax to that) for the two of us we were able to have breakfast (07:00 - 11:00), lunch (12:00 - 14:00), afternoon tea (14:30 - 16:30), Hors D'Oeuvres and cocktails (17:00 - 19:30) and evening desserts and cordials (20:00 - 23:00). We found that the food was of a very high quality and included plenty for non meat eaters and the drinks were also very good and even included champagne within the price. The club lounge is located on the second floor and gave excellent views of the entrances to Central Park.All staff that we encountered during our stay were helpful and pleasant - from the doormen, to waiters and the concierge. Our room was of a very good size but we didn't have a view (but then we didn't pay for a Central Park view). It was spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. A nice touch was the books in the room which included a pictorial history of New York and photos of Central Park. The bathroom had a bath and a separate shower - the only hotel that did during our trip. Another nice touch was that the hotel acknowledged that this was a special trip and sent up a birthday cake for me. Location wise this is a good hotel for access to Central Park and walking distance to Midtown. There are couple of Metro stops near the hotel which makes it easy to get to other parts of Manhattan i.e. Battery Park.Overall this was a very enjoyable stay in luxurious surroundings and we cant think of anything that could be improved upon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The last stop of a tour of the East Coast, with very tired teenagers in tow. We were treated wonderfully well, the doormen in particular were fabulous. The concierge were impeccable and couldn't assist us enough. The location was ideal for the skateboarding son to go and skate in Central Park, and of course to visit all the highlights of New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were upgraded to a gorgeous room overlooking Central Park but everything about the hotel oozed class. The service was impeccable, you could choose which type of pillows you desired and we were even given chocolate covered strawberries as it was our honeymoon. Not cheap but even if you just splurge for one night it's worth it-definitely upgrade to a park view room.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: it was spring, and it was chill.. This hotel provides enough facilities for me doing business in new york. I love the restaurant and the room where i stayed. The staffs are friendly and very helpful. The location are also strategic, i only need to cross over the main road to go to central park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My room on the 22nd floor overlooking the park was breathtaking as the 12 inches of snow began to fall. The bellman were so helpful in getting me to my meeting but the sidewalks were frozen. When I returned the just grabbed my frozen self and carried me in! Yes! I love them! The club lounge was amazing as it should be and enjoyable to watch out the windows. I had an amazing massage. Customer Service was at the top of the scale! I love Ritz Carlton and this is only a few reasons why!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After having a superior experience at the Ritz Carlton in London (live piano music, superb tea delicacies) I cannot begin how disappointed we are with today's tea at the Ritz Carlton in NY Central Park. Inattentive service, mediocre treats and tip charged on my credit card when gratuity was given in cash. Strongly encourage their management to seek training from their counterpart overseas - NY deserves better.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with friends whilst visiting NYC for 4 nights, and it absolutely did not disappoint. From the first moment we stepped into the hotel it's cosy yet luxurious tone made us instantly relax and feel at ease. The staff are interested, friendly and helpful no matter how small the question. Our room, a 'double double' with a city view (basically a view of the next building), was comfortable and very well equipped - the bathroom was very spacious and coped well with four girls all getting ready to go out at the same time. Would love to return her one day and would certainly recommend this for anyone looking for a luxurious city break.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: That was my first visit to NY and I decided to choose at least good hotel, because you never now with the first time. Stayed for 5 nights in a double room. I could say it was a good choice, I was satisfied with the price/quality ratio. Location is perfect as is the staff. Had no opportunity to try out the local dining options as I had too big plans for that short trip. Could sleep very well and the room cleaning was done good. I forgot my watch in the room and after contacting the hotel reception from the Airport, they found it and shipped to my next destination hotel - San Juan, Puerto Rico. Thanks for that.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Fantastic location on Central Park South, the doormen are so friendly and welcoming. We requested a room with 2 double beds for myself & my Mum which are quite scarce at the hotel. Our room was lovely ans well appointed but with no view whatsoever.
user_name:
JH-Travels2016
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay at the Ritz Central Park when we are in NYC. They know you, they are happy to see you return, and that great treatment starts at the front door with Joe, Al, Felix, and all the bellmen and extends to the front desk, concierge and then continues to the Bar, where Norman and Eric are true professionals.Rooms are well appointed, clean and the housekeeping staff is excellent as well.The location is as good as it gets, bordering CP on the South side and in a perfect Midtown spot.We will be back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned home today from a 4 day trip to New York City. The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park is one of the prettiest hotels I've ever stayed in. Starting with location, it is in the best area of NYC. Directly across from Central Park and away from all the craziness of Times Square. You don't need to be in the heart of Times Square to be close to everything. We had no problem walking everywhere even in the pouring rain! We walked the entire stay in New York and the Ritz is convenient to everything. The rooms are impeccable. Very clean and very spacious. I cannot say enough about service. The doormen are helpful and very very friendly. The font desk staff very very courteous. Call for extra towels and within minutes your needs are taken care of. All of the staff were wonderful. Great lounge and restaurant. Wonderful food! Anything you need they will help you. With my next trip to NYC I will definitely stay at the Ritz again! Thank you for a wonderful experience!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went to New York last summer to celebrate our anniversary and visit friends. Wanted to stay in the Central Park South area so chose this hotel. The hotel was truly spectacular with it's charm and beauty, fantastic location and wonderful staff. Room was beautiful and staff were very helpful.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Every vist to NY for the last 10+ years has included a quick and sometimes longer visit with Norman the bartender at the Star Bar at the Ritz on Central Park South. It is like being back in a lovely, comfortable place, where yes they do know your name. Norman is the Mayor of this bar and he is the quintessential New York bartender. He knows everyone and they all know and adore him. I can't say enough good things about this man and his bar. Watch him make and pour a martini..he makes it so exactly that when he pours it into the class, it come just to the top. Perfection. Year after year, he is written up at one of the top 10 bar tenders in NY.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton at Central Park is ideally located at a prestigious NYC address, and the service and amenities at this landmark property are what you come to expect from a Ritz. We have stayed here before, as well as many other Ritz properties, and we were just as impressed as we always are. We came to celebrate our 2nd wedding anniversary, and we were upgraded to gorgeous room on the 9th floor overlooking Central Park, the same place where we were engaged! Upon entering the hotel, everyone made us feel welcome and they were attentive without being obtrusive. The rooms are spacious (by NYC standards they are huge) and meticulously appointed. We booked the Club Level (well worth the extra $) and upon returning from afternoon tea, we were greeted with a beautiful display of chocolate covered strawberries that read "Happy 2nd Anniversary" left with a card, in our room. It was a lovely surprise. The staff truly cares about making you feel special. This hotel is the perfect sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city, but its still in the middle of all the action when you step outside the doors. I highly recommend this hotel, it is the perfect blend of sophistication and elegance in Manhattan. There is absolutely nothing to complain about at this property. You will not be disappointed!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful room with great bedding but the hotel is really not what I think of when I think Ritz Carlton. Small, very small lobby which we could never find a seat in with slow service. Great location but overall I din't care for the layout of this choppy hotel. Service and people were very helpful but...for the $$$ I expected more....oh well!
user_name:
Tom F
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a good hotel well located and not stupidly priced although you do have to deal with the hotel direct to get a better price. The staff are friendly and helpful although not intrusive and if you get the opportunity to stay on the Club Level it is worth the little extra. Rooms are good without being great for size but then this is New York and over looking Central Park. The views of the park are one of the best we have had in many stays in the Big Apple.Overall it is a good hotel well located for the many things NYC has to offer and is not too expensive and is certainly child freindly. Worth a visit!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with my husband and another couple for a 3 day break. The hotel has a lot going for it but lacks the finesse to be truly rated 5 star and to be given a review higher than 3.5/5 on TA. ProsThe rooms are lovely - large and well appointed with a good size bathroom. The rooms were quiet with no street noise at all. Concierge were helpful and the doorman friendly. Coffee was served in the lobby each morning which was not charged for which was a nice touch. The bar was cosy and pleasant with attentive servers. ConsThe shower in our bathroom took 10 minutes to produce hot water. This was reported to the hotel who looked at it when we out. They assured us it was fixed. Took a shower the next morning and it took 10 minutes to run warm. Not fixed. I reported it again on check out. I was disappointed that on having emailed the hotel prior to our arrival that it was a very special birthday for my friend during our stay that this was not acknowledged in any was by the hotel. A small gesture would have been appreciated and frankly expected from a 5 star hotel. Turndown service was hit and miss. We only received bottled water by our bedside on 1 of the 3 nights we stayed. Overall this hotel was reasonable but not outstanding. I would try elsewhere on my next visit.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the first 5 star hotel where I have felt relaxed and at ease. After hundreds of hotels where you were just another short term visitor, despite the luxury, the Ritz Carlton made you feel at if you were a valued long term resident. You are not greeted with the sickly 'have a nice day' auto response that grates on the English phycology. The hotel is of a very high standard with no tatty corners and the service is impeccable. The concierge support is excellent taking a personal interest in your problems following them though to a conclusion without prompting. If vacationing in New York you can not do better. It is also ideally positioned as a start point for the must see attractions.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were here a few night after our trip to Anguilla and we found it to be excellent! We stayed in a park view suite on the club level and loved every minute of it! We lived in NYC many year ago and it was great to be back for a few days staying on CPS with a great view of the park covered in snow.
