It was very cold so we spend lots of time in the club room enjoying different cocktails, and food. They offer a few different selections throughout the day but if you want you can call room service and they can bring anything you want to the lunge or your room. We had breakfast included in our rate so we ate at the restaurant everyday and they made my eggs just right. It's about a 10-15 walk to the shows depending which one we had so we really didnt cab it around. Everything is so close by that you really don't need to take taxis everywhere and if you want there is a train near by. Service was great you'll enjoy yourself but don't look at the bill, lol..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Firstly , all those people who have been staying at the RC Central Park for years gone by and years to come I do understand why you choose this year on year. For those of you who haven't read on! In this world of competition in luxury hotels there are better hotels to stay in NYC.I am no stranger to 5 star hotels and I am no stranger to hotels that trade on their "good name and reputation". I wouldn't say it's a 5 star hotel but I would say it's 5 star price. It is over priced and over rated but this is one person's opinion and I know there are so many who will love this hotel. The food again, expensive and I don't mind paying the price if the fayre reflects the price but it doesn't unfortunately.The hotel does offer the Central Park view rooms , which if your budget affords , do indeed go for that option. Overall The RC is a little jaded and a little tired and unfortunately some of the service reflects that same image. Saying this I know people will continue to go and love this property and all that goes with it.I am just not one of those people and I so wanted to be.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have been coming to New York every year for 30 years to attend the Metropolitan Opera and have stayed at a variety of hotels. This time we stayed at the Ritz Carlton and were glad that we did. We like the location because we can walk to Lincoln Center and several museums from there.Our room on the 9th floor overlooked Central Park. It was large, clean, quiet, and well appointed in every respect. Our rate included service at the club level. At one time or another we had breakfast, lunch, tea, and pre-dinner cocktails there. The quality and variety of food was outstanding. There was always room for us.From the front desk to the concierge to the bellman to the room maid, service was outstanding.As for value, the Ritz Carlton is expensive. But many New York hotels are expensive and so you might as well stay in one that is flawless. The Ritz Carlton met that test.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was not exactly impressed by this Ritz. I've been to several and the quality and service seemed to be below what I had experienced at other Ritz Carlton's. I'm sure the next time I'm in New York I will try some place else. However, Central Park is a nice location and I did have good views from my room.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just a short stop over for work, before I head back to snow covered Ontario. Not to say the weather is any better here, though when your in another city you just don't notice the cold! Anyways on to the hotel. Great place! Classy and "ritzy". Located over looking the best park in the world, makes waking up to a beautiful view! The room was nice. The concierge is very helpful, even though I have been to this city so many times always something to learn! The food was very nice. Though we only ate breakfast a few times. Dinners were out and about...but fantastic! Shopping near by... ;) if you have time to spare. Lovely place. Will return to NYC - but to be honest this place is good but not a favourite! ....now back to my cold city before traveling south with my kiddies! I love NY

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We booked to stay for 10 nights from 27th December and were so looking forward to a wonderful vacation in what we thought was one of the best hotels in New York. Bad weather in the Uk meant our flights were cancelled so we arrived a day late. Our travel agent had made all the arrangements for us and the RC was advised. When we arrived the front desk said that they had cancelled our whole booking and were treating us as "no shows"!!!. They eventually found us a room but it was dreadful. the view was awful - see attached photo and was right next to the elevator and every time it went up and down the room vibrated.the next morning we asked to see the Duty Manager and he listened and said we would be moved to a better room and to leave our things and he would call us at 2pm. The call didn't materialise and we waited until 3.30. We were shown 2 rooms which were miles better with a view of Central Park. This room had issues though and the toilet was broken and kept overfilling to the point one day it spilt out all over the bathroom floor, with effluent everywhere. We had to call on 4 different occasions to ask for the loo to be unblocked and no one seemed to actually fix the problem.We also had issues with one of the staff in the club lounge, called Kelly. I asked her for a decaf coffee one morning and I got an eye roll and a huff. The food presentations were not replenished so if you arrived shortly afterwards there was just scraps for you to eat.. I did mention this and was told it was a busy time of year...there are some good points... If the Management team had not responded positively to our complaints we would have rated this hotel and stay as terrible. The senior staff did try and resolve our issues but added together we had quite a few.Gabrielle in the Club lounge was very professional and efficient and it was a much better place when she was on duty.Lazar is a star, a true New Yorker who looks after his guests very well.The Duty Managers including Samuel did their best. We eventually have been refunded for the first night by the hotel. which was good of them.The location is fantastic... maybe it was the time of year that was a problem, but this is nothing like we are used to with the Ritz Carlton chain of hotels... our stay the last time we were in New York at The Pierre was far superior.
user_name:
Sue B
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A luxury hotel can often curtail you from experiencing the local culture; I've certainly experienced this at many hotels. This Ritz Carlton however, provides luxury and immerses you with the local culture. Like what many neighbors of the Ritz Carlton experience, I felt like I was returning to a luxury residence building. You enter effortlessly past bellman that remember you, and into what feels more like a private foyer rather than a "lobby." From there you can be up to your room in no-time given elevators that you rarely have to wait on and our rooms proximity to the elevator - which is what I loved given my 35pound dog traveled with me.The "Parkview Guestroom" we had on the 6th floor was beautifully decorated and had unforgettable views into the park. Since it was winter, we were able to look right into the park - specifically viewing a sanctuary and large pond. The room was also very well laid out, and even with a rollaway bed it felt spacious.A spa treatment at the onsite LaPrairie Spa was very private and relaxing. Auden Bistro & the Star Lounge feature classic menus with discrete service. Espressos ordered through Room Service arrived quickly and hot. And the complimentary coffee and tea in the bar was appreciated.The Ritz Carlton certainly extends their service and amenities to pets as well. My dog was treated like a prince! He was given several welcome amenities and genuinely recognized by the staff each time he passed through the lobby.The purpose of this stay was to celebrate my mom's birthday with my parents. They recognized the celebration and provided a unique amenity for my mom - a large silver frame with the Ritz Carlton logo! I even really enjoyed the location, with a great espresso bar around the corner, a very casual Italian restaurant recommended by the concierge, and of course the park.Some staff outshines others, there is a faint sound of street noise from the 6th floor, and there's the smell of horses when in front of the property - but none of this takes away from the hotel's well deserving status of being a Forbes 5 Star & AAA 5 Diamond property. I will return.
user_name:
Traveler_424
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a quintessential Ritz Cartlon, doing what they do best, helpful and courteous staff, elegant rooms and good food. But .... The only twin bedded rooms in the hotel are hidden away at the far reaches of the end of the world ( well not quite !)There is no such thing as a twin bedded room with a view .. Unless you count a fire escape and/or brick wall. Come on RC group you can do so much better than this. I, like many on a NYC trip, was on a 'girls' trip so did not want a double room or a double room with a cot bed ( as neither of us is 5) PLEASE consider allocating some twin rooms to better locations in the Hotel .

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Rarely have we stayed at a hotel that is impressive on every level as The Ritz-Carton NY, Central Park is truly exceptional. The staff are all efficient and friendly and seem genuinely happy to do their job. The concierge lounge on the 2nd floor really went out of their way several times to assist us and make us feel at home. We had a deluxe room with a view of Central Park, which was spacious and cheaper than the suite. It's definitely worth paying for access to the club lounge. The food and service in the lounge is fabulous.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I took my daughter to New York for the first time and stayed at the Ritz. We had a wonderful stay. The rooms are beautiful and have a warm feeling. The staff at the Ritz really make the experience. They are so nice and helpful. We went to a play and came back to a copy of the play soundtrack. This was a really nice touch. I would definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent Christmas at The Ritz Carlton, Central Park New York.This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed - everything about it is just excellent!We had a beautiful room with a view over central park, we dined at the Auden restaurant twice (Christmas lunch was just fabulous) & spent many a happy hour sipping cocktails at the bar.The staff are professional, but also extremely friendly (like all New Yorkers!). We can't wait to go back!!Bob & Nicky Cheetham

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First let me preface my review by saying that I have stayed at almost every 5 Star rated hotel in the city. Trump, Four Seasons, Mandarin Oriental, St Regis, and now the Ritz Carlton Central Park. I have not had the Pleasure to stay at Trump Soho or the Ritz Battery Park as of yet. It would be difficult to pick one over the other but the Ritz is special. My wife and I had a beautiful suite overlooking Central Park. The rooms are beautifully appointed with some of the finest furniture that I have ever seen in any hotel room. The Staff is relentless in their pursuit to make you completely satisfied. The Concierge Floor is always an added treat. The food selections were varied, well thought out, and very well prepared. Here's what probably sets this hotel a level above most. As we were being accompanied to our room upon check in, the young man asked us the reason for our trip to New York. We mentioned that we were hear to visit our daughter and that we had tickets for Kinky Boots on Saturday. He said he had heard a lot about the show but hadn't had the opportunity to see it. That was the end of the conversation and he politely showed us our room. When we returned from dinner Saturday night, our turn down service CD player was playing a CD from the show with a note hoping that we enjoyed our day. Sure its expensive but this attention to detail made both of us feel special. After all, isn't that what you are paying for ? The only criticism that I had, and this is really minor, is the towels and especially the robes are much better at the Four Seasons. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice, comfortable room, but not exceptional. Mostly Pleasant and accommodating staff and service. Exceptional service from one waiter in lounge, but not the lounge concierge. Great location., would return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I came up from Orlando to experience New York at Christmas. We had such a wonderful time at the Ritz. The hotel remembered our annual trek and greeted us with complimentary chocolate strawberries in our room. The room was fantastic and the views of Central Park are unbeatable. The staff is always so friendly and attentive. I have yet to find another hotel brand that can match the consistent quality of the Ritz. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at hotel ver New Years for. Five night stay, had to call each night for turned down service. New Years Day room not made up until 6:00 pm. Rooms are nice and newly decorated, location is great, but not for a $1000 a night

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Facing Central Park south, it's on great location in NYC. However if I were not in business trip, I may not stay here. First of all, the room is nothing special. Most of the staff are very good in service. But one of the evening when I was leaving the hotel for dinner, I saw a bell staff holding an umbrella entering the lobby. So I asked him if that was raining outside. He answered me yes and kept walking without offering me his umbrella. Then I asked him if I could borrow his umbrella, he asked me to ask someone else and kept walking. I was totally shocked. Isn't it Ritz Carlton? Does he know how much we are paying for that? I really won't pay USD800 per night to get such service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I travelled to the Ritz-Carlton for 4 nights to celebrate my mother's 60th birthday. After writing to the hotel in advance, she was thrilled when, on arrival, the reception staff wished her a Happy Birthday, as well as, upon entering our Park View room there was a birthday cake with a personalised hand written note. The Room:We were in Park View Room 908 with spectacular views over Central Park. The room was immaculate with all amenities anyone could wish for. The in room dining experience was a delight with prompt service and delicious food. The Restaurant:Although we felt the breakfast was a little expensive, again the food was lovely with plenty of choice and excellent service. We only ate in the restaurant for dinner once; however, the food was delicious with excellent service from the friendly staff. Location:FANTASTIC location. The hotel is set on Central Park South which is just a short walk/cab ride away from 5th Avenue/Broadway. Opposite the hotel was the Horse and Carriage pick up point which is a must to see Central Park. Either a short walk away, or a cab ride away there is Columbus Circle where there is a variety of shops and restaurants. I can thoroughly recommend taking a trip to A Voce restaurant which was recommended to us by a lady on Concierge. Must do:We crammed as much into our trip as we possibly could. We went ice skating at the Rockefeller Center and in Central Park. If you go early enough in the year, I would recommend the first skate of the day at Rockefeller. We took a trip to the 9/11 memorial and although we had not pre-booked a visitor pass before we went to NY, the concierge team were on hand to book this for us. Our trip to Statue of Liberty was an experience to say the least. We had pre-booked tickets to ‘climb’ to the crown. Very naively we assumed there would be a lift, how wrong we were. Instead we had to climb up the tightest of staircases I have ever been on which are definitely not suitable for those who suffer from claustrophobia or are perhaps a little larger. We had pre booked tickets to go to the top of the Empire State Building. With these Express tickets we were able to skip the long queues and head straight to floor 102. A visit to New York isn’t complete without a trip to Broadway to see a show; we saw Wicked at the Gershwin theatre, it was brilliant!The Staff:The staff made our trip for us; they were so friendly and could not do enough for us. A special thank you to Yoneidy Carreno in Guest Relations for organising the cake as well as the staff on the Concierge desk and on the door who were very so helpful and very friendly. Overall, I cannot fault the Ritz-Carlton at all. With the fantastic staff, location and beautiful hotel this is the perfect place to stay in New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Let's acknowledge upfront that this is an expensive, luxury hotel. If you are looking for a "deal," then you should probably stop reading my review. This is one of the top hotels in NYC, and that fact was apparent very moment of our stay. I am a New York resident and booked a night through AMEX platinum travel to celebrate a special birthday with my wife. When I mentioned this at check-in (I was asked!), we were upgraded two levels to an amazing park view deluxe room, and sent a very nice note and bowl of chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate the occasion. Very nice touch. The facilities and service are top notch. Our room was spacious, well-decorated, and comfortable. The view of Central Park was incredible. The bar is classic and the cocktails are delicious. The service at Auden was fantastic even if breakfast is way overpriced unless it is included in your rate. Spa services are also top notch. My one complaint is that the men's relaxation room is really not much of room, and not that relaxing. Certainly not compared to the female equivalent. Location cannot be beat. You are right on CPS and equidistant between 5th Avenue and the Time Warner Center. You can create a great walking itinerary for yourself in the park, to a restaurant or shopping. All in all, a memorable experience. I'm glad I splurged, I would do it again, and most importantly - my wife loved it.
user_name:
NYFFlyer
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Last December, my wife and spent four lovely nights in a great room overlooking Central Park. The rooms were wonderful, and the service was absolutely outstanding. This is certainly one of the top hotels in New York City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Such a disappointment as a client and a runner. The service was shameful the weekend of the NYC marathon and they gave no little tokens of recognition to any of the runners that were staying at the hotel. As a hotel that is known for their impeccable personalized service I expected a little note of "good luck" or "congratulations". Not only did we get ZERO personalized acknowledgment for this legendary race, the service was awful. Cold food, slow service and not so much as a high five. I'll run again but I'll stay at another hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed 3 nights for a business trip in early December. While certainly a top hotel in town with a great location, considering the room price, I can only give an average rating. Nothing about the hotel seemed exceptional, other than perhaps the bathroom facilities in our room. The room itself was small, comfortable and well appointed, but with minimal closet space. I would rate the condition of the room as above average. The bathroom seemed more recently updated than the room itself and was quite nice. Service was fine, but again not any better than many of the midtown hotels I have stayed in. All in all a very nice hotel at the south end of Central Park, but next time I will save a few bucks and walk a couple extra blocks.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was, by far, the greatest hotel experience I've ever had. Just across the street from Central Park in NYC, this hotel boasts not only the perfect location in all the city, but stellar amenities in the most hospitable environment. I stayed here a few years ago during the week of Thanksgiving, and was completely blown away by everything. We stayed in adjoining suites on the 5th floor with corner views of the park. Our room came stocked with everything one needs on vacation, including a bottle of Johnny Walker Blue Label and dried fruits put out daily. It was a completely lavish experience and one I will cherish forever. We dined downstairs for Thanksgiving dinner, which of course was a bit of a disaster since the place was obviously overbooked, however the foods was gourmet and delicious, and the service was a bit slow but kind. There was nothing better than enjoying a glass of Prosecco in the lounge area just inside through the foyer. Anyone is welcome to dine and drink in this space, which made for a lively atmosphere.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful hotel, fabulous rooms and the best location. We enjoyed a huge suite that was just great. Beautiful furniture, great bedding and quiet. Service in the bar and restaurant was a bit slow but hey--it's NY. Overall--the Ritz always delivers.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the ritz Central Park this past December. The staff was always polite, attentive, and 'smiling'. I had the best Manhatten I've had in a long time. The location is such that we could walk everywhere and the holidays were beautiful!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is by far the best hotel in nyc! Have stayed there 2 times this year and love it! Staff is fabulous service is fabulous ! Can't wait to go back! Great location .. I have stayed at other hotels in the city and this has been the best! My children loved it as well! Location is great too!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed for three nights whilst attending concerts at Carnegie Hall and opera at the Met.Firstly, the hotel location is great, especially for the purpose of my trip. Everything I needed was within walking distance, although saying that I've walked from Central Park to Battery and back before!The check-in was very functional, not warm and certainly not welcoming. As a Marriott Platinum Elite member I expected better (and have received much better at other Ritz-Carlton hotels), especially when paying over $1000 per night. Unfortunately, check-out wasn't much better - I wasn't even asked if I had enjoyed my stay! Overall, I did not find the staff at all helpful or friendly, and certainly not up to level of service I have found elsewhere in New York. Reading other reviews, maybe I just experienced the staff on a bad weekend.The room was lovely, looking right down Central Park, well furnished, clean and quiet, although the mattress was too soft for my liking - one night I actually slept in one of the chairs as I found it more comfortable. However, for over $1000 per night, the room (not a suite) was small, although I was almost certainly paying more because of the view. I don't normally use minibars in hotel rooms, but the Ritz-Carlton branded candies and snacks looked too good not to try and they certainly lived up to expectations.I only had breakfast in the hotel once and didn't think it to be very special and overpriced for what I ordered. The other mornings, I just went out and found a lovely little coffee shop nearby. This probably one of those hotels you have to stay at once, and for me once was certainly enough.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We sat in the lounge for a few cocktails and some snacks. We had meatballs, hummus, and caviar. The food and service was outstanding. We told them it was my birthday and they surprised me weith hot molten chocolate cake, ice cream and a song!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just spent 2 nights and 3 days here 12.20 - 12.22. The staff are all truly spectacular. The property is perfectly located across from Central Park. We had a beautiful suite overlooking the park on the 16th floor. Club Lounge Access is well worth the additional charge. We used the lounge throughout the day for a break from walking and the hustle and bustle of the city. Truly 5 star from start to finish. You definitely get what you pay for here!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: While in NYC this past weekend my travel companions (4 of us) stopped into the Ritz for a drink to warm up after frolicking in the Central Park snow. To our dissatisfaction we waiting 10 minutes at the bar without even being looked at. Once we finally order our drinks (3 hot chocolates' with Baileys & 1 Irish Coffee) we were told it would just be a few minutes. We asked for a few waters in the meantime & that never came. 45 minutes later & 3 different managers assuring us our drinks would take just a few moments longer and having to ask 5 times for a glass of water we received cold hot chocolate, half a glass of water and barely an apology. I am never one to complain as I was in the service industry my entire teen/early twenties life & get crass customers, but this was not the case. Trying to be friendly as it was Christmas time we asked for the bill so we could get on our merry way. We got the bill and as I am a Platinum Marriott rewards member I picked up the tab with my Marriott credit card. $80 for cold hot chocolate & a mediocre Irish coffee. Nothing was comped and there was not even an apology. We did not stay here, nor would I ever, but I can honestly say I was less than impressed with the hospitality.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Delightful rooms, excellent service and much pampering. The location was perfect for a weekend in Manhattan. The staff was excellent and took great care of two women alone in the city. I highly suggest a few nights here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The suite has a touch of class while still being modern. The room looks over Central Park which is an amazing view any time of year, from the plush greens in the summer to the changing colors of the trees in the fall you can not go wrong, There is even a room for staff/security with a small kitchen area, but kept private from the rest of the room.The lobby has remained with the traditional look but with upgraded furniture, Staff was very friendly. There is a restaurant attached to the hotel with a cozy fireplace to keep you warm in the winter but there are plenty of bars and restaurants around if that did meet your needs.The other rooms were a good size, when last seen, they needed some upgrading on furniture, i am sure has been completed.
user_name:
JMF521
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Of course the hotel is exquisite and the location is amazing. But what surprised me was how lovely, helpful, and kind every single employee (whom I encountered) was....literally everyone...the doorman, the front desk, housekeeping, etc. I know they are 'supposed' to be nice...but this is New York...not to mention the snootiest area of the New York...so I guess I expected a little more aloofness or something. I am always when my negative stereotypes are proven wrong :-) And you should have seen the amazing chocolate extravaganza they sent to our room to wish us a happy anniversary!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Nice stay at a lovely hotel. Room was spotless and in excellent condition. City/partial park room offered a nice view of the park. Wonderful location as well. Housekeeping was very thorough and accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Y stayed in this hotel august 2008 and it was amazing.The room was a standard but very comfy. Great Service as in almost every Ritz Carlton.... a guest service agent even show me around the hotel!! club and presidential suite! the works!The location was incredible, my room overlooked the park and it was amazing. very close to subway, colombus circle and of course the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The staff at Ritz Carlton is well trained and attentive. The fitness center is quite good as well. The location across from Central Park is superb. The room was quiet but somewhat small compared to other Ritz properties that I have stayed in. We had a play that ran longer than expected so when we returned, the Auden Bar and restaurant was closed. The lounge was packed but we had a seat at the bar. They served a nice meal and sometimes sitting at the bar can be more fun than a table. Ritz Carlton Central park has a great location and attentive, well trained staff.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very busy day when we checked in (moving from Chelsea Pines Inn to here), quite a difference. Efficient check-in, got the room upgraded to the one overseeing Central Park. Generous sized, super comfy bed and excellent service. Nothing much to fault here, except that the lobby was exceptionally busy...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfection....that is all you really need to know....there is no better hotel in NYC!Rooms were so quiet, I forgot I was in NYC. I was a little disappointed that my room was not on a higher floor, but I found that I had so much fun people watching that I was no longer disappointed. The lounge is another place you want to spend some time. So cozy and beautiful....A nice respite from a busy day in the park and shopping.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first stay at this RC and it surprised us in a couple of ways.The hotel is small, yet ultimately very cozy.The service was superb in every aspect.The food, albeit typically pricey was scrumptious.The rooms were not gigantic by any standard other than NYC, but were quiet andverycomfortable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My fiancee and I recently stayed here to celebrate 5 years together and our recent engagement. The Ritz did an impeccable job during our stay.We were upgraded to a beautiful park view room and arrived to delicious chocolate pearls and chocolate covered strawberries with a "happy anniversary" note. When it was time for dinner, the hotel provided us a wonderful driver who was friendly and accommodating. When we returned from dinner, our room was covered in white rose pedals - very romantic!The facility was pristine and rooms what you'd expect from the Ritz. I think we just locked in what we'll be doing for our honeymoon as a result (although in a destination somewhere). Thanks so much to the wonderful staff for making this an absolutely memorable trip -- everything was perfect! We will definitely be back here again!
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
MRC1285
Washington, District of Columbia, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Rarely have we stayed at a hotel that is impressive on every level but The Ritz-Carton NY, Central Park is truly exceptional. The staff are all efficient and friendly and seem genuinely happy to do their job. The concierge lounge on the 2nd floor really went out of their way several times to assist us and make us feel at home.We originally booked a suite room but I changed it to a delux room with a view of Central Park, which was very spacious and cheaper than the suite. It's definitely worth paying for access to the club lounge. The food and service in the lounge is fabulous.We used the spa several times and were impressed with the services there as well. The gym is well equipped and open 24/7, which was great at 4am when I could not sleep from jetlag!This was our 5th visit to NYC in 3 years and after a very unimpressive stay at the Plaza last year, we've decided we won't go anywhere else in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A faultless stay at this hotel. The staff made this trip very special, absolutely nothing was too much trouble for them from housekeeping to concierge! The level of service was outstanding, the rooms were spacious and serviced to a very high standard. This hotel has a curtesy car available on a first come first served basis for short local trips.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My stay at the Ritz Carlton was the best hotel experience that I ever have had in many years of traveling. I had a confirmed reservation at the Marriot Marquis for a business trip. As is typical, I was delayed flying into LaGuardia. When I arrived very late, although I had a confirmed reservation, Marriott had given my room to someone else. Long story short, I ended up at the Ritz. The service in every aspect of the hotel is outstanding. From the moment I walked in, it seemed like everyone knew my name. The lounge is outstanding. Every person who worked at that hotel (from the front desk, concierge, bellmen, etc.) went out of their way to make sure that my stay was outstanding. Clearly, the room rates are expensive and for most people have to be factored into the decision of whether to stay there. Nevertheless, from top to bottom, the hotel, management, and staff are outstanding.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I stayed here on a short weekend in the city at the end of the summer. We usually stay in Times Square but we decided to try something new. We were very surprised and pleased with our stay here and hope to come back again.Hotel and Rooms: The hotel is very elegant on the inside with chandeliers and fancy art everywhere. It is very beautiful and not too stuffy like some five star hotels. We always felt comfortable even with a younger child in our party. The room was very spacious and the beds were super comfortable, with a lot of pillows for comfort. The bathroom is huge with a large bathtub and separate room for the toilet. Plenty of robes and towels. Only downside was our view was on some inner buildings of the block instead of Central Park itself.Service: Bell man was very helpful and quick. We ordered breakfast in bed one day and they were very prompt with serving it and cleaning afterwards. Front desk is super helpful along with the Concierge who helped us book all our tours and dinner.Food: Ate at the restaurant here for breakfast and really enjoyed it. By New York standard, breakfast prices were regular but beware for those who are looking to save money.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What great staff !! From the stepping out of the taxi arriving to departing a few days later, the doormen; the front desk; the concierge team; housekeeping; bar staff - all very friendly and customer focused. Anything you wanted or had a question about was answered. The accommodation is first class. Truly a wonderful experience.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I used Marroitt points to get away for a night. The Ritz treated us as if we were special guests. The concierge made spa and dinner reservations. We were upgraded to a Central Park view room with a wonderful view. It was a Perfect night.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is the king of Style. The staff is focused on making sure you have a great stay and they will do whatever it takes. The lounge for members is nice and relaxing and the food they display is superb. The attendant gave me great suggestions to take clients out to dinner she even called and made a reservation for me. My room was spacious clean and the view was spectular.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Puttin on The Ritz. Excellent location on Central Park South. Across from the Artisans Gate in Central Park. The staff in every department was first class. The doormen were simply the best. Need a cab? They have one in minutes. The 2nd floor lounge was extremely terrific. Great food three times a day. A nice place to relax after a day in the City. Saw The Book of Mormon and when I returned to my room a complimentary CD was waiting for me. The room was nicely appointed and the bed was very comfortable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Thanks to Kerri, Regena, Brian, Felix and so many more Ritz associates for helping to make our recent Sept. stay a delight. Yes, let's admit at the top of this review, staying at a Ritz property costs $$$$. Whether you're booking with points or paying with hard-earned cash, this is a five-star property. Having said that, those Ritz associates have no idea who or what you have. To them (our experience), they treat everyone the same...and that's with lots of special care. Every experience we encountered, from checking in and out, requesting help from the concierge, doors being opened and greeted when coming and going from the hotel, the club lounge servers, the domestic staff, the bellman, etc. All, top notch. We had the pleasure of being at the Ritz during the UN mtgs., which in many cases, meant crazy traffic and more then normal activity at the hotel. We found the excitement of meeting people from many countries, hearing foreign languages and seeing unique dress only added to our NY experience. It's not every day you meet and share an elevator with someone from Kenya. Our room was a deluxe king with a Central Park view. Gorgeous, comfortable, inviting and a welcome sight every night when we climbed into comfort and luxury. Upon entering our room the first day, the radio was on and tuned into a great station. That was a welcome touch that we continued throughout our five-day stay. On another note, we opted to enjoy the club lounge for breakfast, a few lunches, and often cocktails. Yes, it's an added daily expense. Given the cost of NY restaurants and bars, I do believe we saved money by dining in the club lounge. Great service, good food and a wonderful meeting place when traveling with friends or business associates. Note to the Ritz: There were guests who did not honor the "no cell phone" request. It would be helpful if the staff enforced the rule for the pleasure of everyone's experience. As you enter and exit the lounge, they have these glass containers filled with at least four different cookies, and the likes of Tootsie Rolls, caramels and other fun "child like" assorted candies. Nice touch. Three out of four of our party enjoyed a massage and/or facials at La Praire at the Ritz Carlton Spa, located on the same floor as the club lounge. My experience was excellent. Again, it's more then you would pay at your favorite spa at home, but well worth the extravagance.The location of this Ritz is smack in the middle of great people watching across from Central Park, a hop/skip to two convenient subway stops, and amazing restaurants and shopping.Horse carriages across from the hotel entrance...we did hear that they could be on the way out. Yes, there is a smell, however, we were more concerned about the well-being of the animals. That alone, hopefully, will motivate the city powers to do what's right. The smell never bothered us. We were forewarned. The amazing experience at the Ritz outweighs that small inconvenience. If you get to the Ritz at Central Park So., please say Hi to Felix (at the door) and Kerri, Regena and Brian...the best concierge staff we've ever encountered.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My stay here on 9/13-15-2013 was Amazing,From the Valet Attendant's,to the Door Attendants,To the check in experience,Every department of this hotel has my STAMP OF APPROVAL,We left the shhhh sign on the door(DND),came back later to the hotel and notice it,Call Housekeeping and they came within 10mins to clean our room,We booked a Tour of New york at the concierge desk,got to the dock to board and was told the tour was sold out,Call back to the hotel and the apologize for the error and took the cost off our bill,by the time we got back to the hotel,They place some chocolate covered strawberries in our room,with an apology card attach,Thank you so much to all the staff that made our stay very pleasant,comfortable and easy!!...
user_name:
Kandie L
Gainesville, Florida, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In true Ritz fashion this hotel has a gorgeous location on the corner of 5th Ave overlooking Central Park. The club lounge is lovely... Offering you a way to experience the park without being assaulted by terrible smells. The rooms are large and spacious for the city and decorated in warm cream colors making you feel welcomed and relaxed. Be sure to enjoy one of the flatbreads for a snack

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the front desk to the concierge and all other members of the hotel staff, they could not have been more helpful, pleasant and truly concerned about our well being. The room was spacious, well equipped and comfortable with attractive decor. The hotel is an excellent value among New York luxury hotels. For anyone preferring a firm bed, make sure to notify the hotel prior to arrival.The standard bed is too soft for those suffering from back problems.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: New York around Christmas time is magical anyway and nowhere more so than the beautiful big Christmas tree that greets you as you enter the Ritz Carlton. From that moment on you will have the most luxurious stay with nothing being too much trouble. The Doormen are fabulous and the spa is amazing. I had a room overlooking the park and could see the iceskaters which topped off the whole Christmas experience, it even snowed a little! Obviously this all comes at a cost but when you get what you pay for it's worth it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the ritz Carlton. We brought our standard poodle with us to New York. He was welcomed with treats and the use of ritz Carlton bowls and dog bed. The concierge department graciously found us restaurants that allowed dogs in their outdoor patio. The door people greeted us every morning on our way to Central Park! The room was comfortable, quiet and spacious, by New York standards. A lovely stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: booked this hotel on short notice and as we walked thru the doors it was amazing. The room was excellant as was the staff and they looked after all our needs, from the doorman sugesting a good resyurant to the front desk. If you want a place to go and relax and not worry about anything during your stay.....stay here.Bill H.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Had an amazing stay, the service was wonderful. I felt very welcome at all points of my stay. The staff catered to our needs perfectly. The location is very central and a walking distance to all the major attractions New York has to offer

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: And our stay at the RC would have been 100% perfection had it not been for a waiter in the drinks lounge who was busy bossing staff around if another guest dared sit on a sofa which was meant to have been reserved for another guest...but had not had the reserve sign put on. This waiter also demanded we moved!! Not nice, and we felt un welcomed by him. But he was a small thorn in an otherwise top hotel, I guess there is always one!! The concierge team were the best, so helpful and knowledgeable, our room attendants were the best as was room service, the door staff and the rest of the bar staff, the room was very comfortable indeed and we would definitely return to this luxurious hotel. Just a gentle note here....are guests are equal!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I spent 5 nights in March of 2011 for our honeymoon and I have to say, it was the trip of a lifetime! The entire staff addressed us by our name and took note of the things we were doing and did something special for us each night! The first night we were overly exhausted and wanted to relax so they sent us complimentary pizza and beer! The next night while we were out to dinner, we came back to a huge rose petal heart on our bed, with chocolate covered strawberries and champagne! Another night, while we were seeing a show on Broadway, they were thoughtful enough to get us the soundtrack for the show we saw and put it in our room for our homeoming! The entire experience was absolutely amazing and unforgettable! They made us feel like royalty and I would never hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone! It is an EXCEPTIONALLY SPLENDID 5 STAR HOTEL!! Thank you so very much!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A great hotel across the street from Central Park. We had a great view of the park. Everyone was very nice. Great internet. Great showers even with high pressure. Great fitness room. HDTV at least on the lower channels. No HDMI jacks however. Overall worth 5 stars.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After staying in Dubai at its sister hotel, I was curious to see if this matched up. However on a very smaller scale this is one of thee most splendid hotels I have visited, we only stayed for afternoon tea but service and the toilets were luxurious and fabulous.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I always stay at Four Seasons while visiting NY. That time I choose Ritz-Carlton because I needed a 2-bedroom suite and suites of that kind were twice as cheaper at RC. The good side of the Ritz is the location - right in front of Central Park with the short walking distance to main stores of 5th ave.The bad side is that the hotel is really dated. What I have to mention the door-handles were way to uncomfortable. It was even painfull to use them.Next time I choose another hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in RC for a last minute weekend trip during second week of August. Picked this property because of its location, rates (in comparison to neighboring properties) and RC reputation. Hotel did not disappoint. Comfortable, clean rooms, spacious by New York standards. Very clean and well stacked bathroom. Great toiletries. Wonderful and welcoming staff. Concierge Susanna went out of her way to secure us tickets to statue of Liberty for the time we wanted. We had breakfast in room and in hotel restaurant and both were great. Overall great property, would definitely consider staying there again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Apart from the great location for Central Park and shopping, the RC is beautifully appointed with luxury rooms and excellent bathrooms.The staff go out of their way to make you feel at home and the response time for room service is the fastest ever! We had a very good breakfast in-house.A great place to stay for exploring New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went for a four day visit to New York City with my daughter and my father this June. The Ritz Carlton, as usual, met my every expectation. From the moment you walk into the hotel, they make you feel welcomed and relaxed. We were close to everything and walked or took a quick taxi ride. They are refurbishing the exterior of many of the buildings, but this did not prove disruptive in any way. And as it has been a hot summer, yes, you can smell the horses from the carriages around the block, but this again, was of little concern to our comfort. The rooms are large, clean and comfortable and after a long day running around in the city, I would enjoy soaking in the tub in the bathroom. The rooms were extremely quiet from any outside noises and we slept great due to the blackout curtains. I used the work out room several times and they had fine equipment (for my purposes) and it looked like a lovely spa. Unfortunatley, I did not make time for any treatments. We went for the Broadway shows, shopping and eating. A bonus, was meeting Carson Daley not once, but twice in our elevator while he was staying there to do the Today show. He was very friendly and adorable! Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would certainly come back again. Loved it!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We've had a few disappointments at various RC properties, feeling that the RC brand can be a bit inconsistent from one property to another. This was Ritz Carlton at its' best. Our suite was a corner unit on the 2nd floor, so the "Central Park view" was a bit overstated, but the overall quality, condition, fit and finish of the room was what you expect from RC. Our room wasn't ready at check-in but the issue was handled quickly and professionally while treated gratis to afternoon tea. Our experience with the concierge desk was superb, the attitude, helpfulness, and friendliness of the entire staff was beyond reproach. We were never made to feel anything less than the most important guests at the hotel...the best compliment I can give.
user_name:
Marshall T
Salt Lake City, Utah

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a club access room during our stay in April 2013. The room layout and design is absolute premium Ritz-Carlton quality. The location of the hotel is fantastic as well with central park just right across and subway station only a short 5 mins walk away Everyone at the hotel gave us terrific hospitality, especially Ender from Guest Relations and Lazar from Ritz-Carlton Club. The F&B offerings at the club was fantastic with the service of Lazar being extremely attentive and engaging throughout our stay. We will definitely choose The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park again for our visit to New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service is exceptional, the location can't be beat! The door men always have a smile on their faces. The restaurant staff knew what I liked after just one visit. The concierge went out of her way to find us a city MD and there is a in house doctor if you want to spring for it. I couldn't justify $500 to fix my daughters head cold however it is good to know if something went wrong, we could get immediate help.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ritz Carlton staff are among the best in the industry and the staff at this location was the best of the best. From the doormen to the front desk to room staff you are immediately transported to more gentile times. They anticipated our every need; you had a sense they really cared. I had a special request for connecting rooms and the staff went out of their way to insure this request was met. The lobby bar and Bistro were just excellent and offered a very varied menu. The location is great with many wonderful dining choices within steps. Beds were extremely comfortable with the highest quality linens and huge fluffy towels. There are many thoughtful touches which included a huge bowl of freshly baked cookies delivered upon arrival. The facility is a bit older and while definitely not worn looking, a bit lived in. Air conditioning unit in the window sill seemed to never provide the right air flow. We had rooms facing 58th street which were very dark and virtually without view.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is an amazing hotel! The staff are very nice from the second you walk in, and the location is perfect because the rooms look on Central Park. I am from the countryside and I love New York. I would recommend this hotel to everybody I know!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I live in NYC and wanted to surprise my wife with a nice night out at the Ritz so I asked my agent to set something up last minute . I emailed her at 8am and by 12:30 pm I'm checking in at the Ritz. She had booked a city view room with club access and received an upgrade to a park view which was great! The room was nice with great views of the park and Central Park south. I want to thank the staff for everything they did for us from Orlando at the front desk , Kerry the concierge , and everyone else who went above and beyond to assure that our stay was what we come to expect from The Ritz! The club lounge is a great escape from the hustle and bustle of the busy NYC streets and is stocked with food and drinks through out the day. We had breakfast at the hotel although expensive but well worth it! Room service was on time and on the money, food tasted great and the waiter set everything up for us so we can dine in peace. Everyone working at this hotel provided us with excellent service and can't wait to come back! Thank you!
user_name:
Knicpo
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: wow wow wow!!! Beautiful traditional hotel in a prime location overlooking Central Park and close to Broadway and Times square. Fantastic service with very friendly courteous and helpful staff - made every guest feel very special - absolutely loved it!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed as a family, 2 adults 2 children for about 3 nights in a 2 room suite. I thought for the money it was a good value. These suites were definitely on the larger size for NYC. We have stayed at the Penninsula and the St Regis and those suites are definitely smaller than the Ritz Carlton. You are literally across from the Park too and a block or so away from Bergdorf's and shopping, so the location is excellent. I think NYC has the best concierge services in the world and the concierge personnel here are all excellent, knowledgeable, friendly and not out to push their own agenda. Our only gripe would be housekeeping. It seems housekeeping standards in general in NYC are poor compared to other international cities. We just flew in from Stockhlom where it is so clean so the hotel's cleanliness really suffered in comparison. I wore white socks which were gray by the end of the evening, plus the cleaning products they do use smell unpleasant. The bathrooms are beautifully designed, lots of statuary Carrera marble. Room service was just OK.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed for 4 nights with family during a business trip. Rooms and services in Ritz were always top notch. Because this hotel is located by the Central Park, we were expecting a good view of the Central Park and the city; however, we only got ugly views.
user_name:
Alex L
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Ritz earlier this month. It was our first stay at the property. Upon our return, I went back and looked at all of the glowing reviews on tripadvisor, and I’m a bit perplexed. It’s not as if our stay was terrible, but we are frequent guests at Ritz Carlton properties, and we generally stay on the Club Level. In the last twelve months, we have had club level stays at the downtown Atlanta, New Orleans and Amelia Island (twice) properties. Perhaps, many of these reviewers who were so impressed by the Central Park hotel simply haven’t experienced how great other properties are? Frankly, for us, this was the lowest level of service and worst quality of food we have ever encountered at a Ritz Carlton. And for anyone who thinks that perhaps I just don’t understand New York, please note that in addition to being a frequent visitor, I lived in Manhattan for many years. Before getting to the issues we had with the club level, do note that when booking a room, if you don’t request and pay for a view, you may be looking at the backs of buildings or even at an air shaft. I don’t think the hotel is misleading about this, but some of the possible views are pretty terrible, so you may find that it is worth the extra money in the grand scheme of things. Beyond issues of views, the room was a fairly standard Ritz Carlton room. For those who have remarked that the rooms are small, I did not find this to be the case at all. In fact, I found ours to be in line as far as size with other Ritz Carlton properties. The bathroom was nice with a separate soaking tub and shower. Storage options are a bit odd and for some reason, there was no iron. Also, the elevators are tiny and a bit slow. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. Now with regard to the club lounge, overall, at all just seemed sloppy and nowhere near the standards we have encountered previously. With the exception of one club lounge staff member, no one ever called me by name and no one ever thanked me for being a frequent customer (Marriott Gold Status). One other staff member was super friendly and helpful, but again, she never bothered to learn or use our names. We stayed three nights. This may seem petty, but for us, it is part of the experience that we have come to expect over the years. Concierge members of the club lounge staff (most notably the women) seem to think they are “above it all” and “better than the other staff members”. I have never encountered another club lounge where they sit at their computer constantly. We were lucky to get a hello on entrance or some other greeting on departure. Generally, at other properties, the concierge staff members work to refill drinks and engage the guests just like the rest of the staff. There was there was one such employee who did this (the same one who bothered to learn our names). The others were completely unhelpful and unfriendly. The staff was so disengaged that they did not notice all of the people who were “sneaking” into the lounge. Several families openly spoke of how they had paid for one club level room but used their keys to allow their traveling companions (aka their teen aged children) to use the lounge. Now, I realize that “guests” to the club lounge are possible, for fee, and I was not privy to every discussion, so perhaps these were “paid” guests, but I don’t believe that was the case as the guests openly referred to what a great “deal” they were getting pulling this off. Again, at other properties, the staff is engaged enough to have some clue as to who is supposed to be in the lounge. Food offerings were significantly less generous and not as well prepared compared to other properties. For example, typically, at least, two hot dishes are offered at breakfast. There were none at the Central Park Ritz. Also at breakfast, the smoked salmon (my personal favorite) was poorly sliced, there were no capers and the onions were way too thick. Champagne was not regularly set out in the afternoons. The afternoon crackers were just out of a box rather than the beautiful sesame seed covered options seen elsewhere. No one ever refilled our glasses or asked if we wanted another beverage. On a more subjective level, I was just not impressed, again compared the other club lounges at other properties that I have visited in the last 12 months, the food was not as good and there was less of it. In addition to the quality and quantity issues, food items at the presentations were not labeled. At some presentations, there were no labels at all. At others, there were a few. Typically, again at other properties, a menu is set out for each food presentation each day and separate labels are offered for each tray so that you know what is being offered in general and specifically what you are eating. This was not done leaving us to hunt down staff to ask, for example, if the meat in the noodles was chicken or pork. The food (particularly the fish dishes) started to spoil on the longer presentations. We were visiting on a very hot weekend. The club lounge was quite warm in large part due to the fact that they apparently have no cooling vent in the service area. Accordingly, the door to that space is always open (and the large window fan the staff uses to try to keep comfortable is audible). The primary food presentation station is in the middle of the room, and nothing is done to keep everything at temperature. This may not be a consistent problem, but in any case, several of the fish items got terribly pungent after two plus hours in the warmth of the room. Club Lounge hours and specifically, the hours for the food presentations are not as stated. We witnessed several cases in which the items were set out late and/or picked up early. All printed materials indicate that the lounge is open until 11PM. In other markets, this means that the presentations are continued until that time. Here, this means that the staff starts removing the food at wine at 9:50PM and that the place is set up for breakfast by 11PM. Not only that, one staff member refused to serve us because he had “locked everything up.” This happened to us when we came to the lounge at 10:45 PM. All food and drinks were removed, and the staff member would not retrieve an after dinner drink for us. As a general comment, in my experience, at other properties, the offered items are replenished throughout the service period such that, if one were to arrive 20 minutes before the end of service, all items would still be available. Here, once they ran out, the item was not restocked even an hour or more before the end of that presentation. In all, we were very disappointed with our stay. I suppose that I had assumed (wrongly apparently) that the Tiers into which the hotels are placed were indicative of something other than how many Marriott points are required for a stay. Clearly, being in tier 5 is an indication of nothing other than being in an expensive market. We didn’t hate this, but it could and should have been so much better. As a final note, we had a great rate for this room. I really would have been disappointed if we had paid in excess of $1000 per night as some people did.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staying at the Ritz Carlton anywhere is luxurious but Ritz-Carlton Central Park was exceptional because of its great service and extra helpful staff. The Ritz-Cartlon decor is classic so if you are looking for modern this might not be the place for you. The location is great because Central Park is just across the street and on leaving the hotel you are greeted with the beautiful horses and carriages of the park. The rooms facing the park offer a great view of New York so if you book ahead you can secure them.All in all a pleasant stay, great service and attention to detail.
user_name:
Ash T
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I surprised my boyfriend with a stay at the Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park. Once booking, I received a standard email from the Guest Relations Supervisor, Yoneidy, asking if I wanted to do anything special to personalize the stay. Of course, I chose mimosas upon arrival, etc. We arrived at the hotel, well before the 3pm check-in, so we went to the bar for our mimosas. Yoneidy, actually found us at the bar and introduced herself. I was stunned she was real, even though we had traded a couple of emails back and forth finalizing our stay. I had requested an early check-in, but they weren't able to accommodate. That was fine as we headed to Central Park to people watch and have lunch. Around 3pm we returned and our room was under going final inspection and the front desk would call when it was ready. About 30 mins later we were telling the hotel bartender our story and she was surprised we were still waiting. I thought nothing of it when she left the bar for a moment, and was happily surprised when she returned with our keys in hand and a complimentary glass of champagne. Our room faced Central Park, it was very large with a seating area, beautiful bath and rose petals covering the bed. Classical music was playing in the background and we fell in love. Even though our check in process was a little off, it didn't matter, the staff was amazing, the room was clean, the attention to detail was noticeable and much appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again. Aside: The last time I was in New York I stayed at the St. Regis, which is a fantastic hotel, but the staff here at the Ritz is enough to make us come back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Overall a great hotel that excels in service, as you should expect from a Ritz and the price. I was fortunate to be able to use Marriott points for this stay, although it only got us a "standard" room with a "courtyard" view. We had a king bed, and a roll-away bed for our daughter. The room is fairly large and well appointed, by NYC standards, and the bathroom is very large with a separate toilet room. The lack of any view was offset by the all-night quite, which was very nice after long days in the loud and congested city. The concierge service was excellent and very attentive. My chief complaint is the lack of common spaces: the lobby and the lounge are small, and our rate did not give us access to the 2nd floor lounge. Great convenient location across from central park. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment my mother and I arrived to meet my sister at the hotel we were treated like royalty. We were whisked to the Club Lounge and immediately offered treats and drinks. We had connecting rooms with more than enough space for the three of us to relax. We didn't want to leave the hotel but managed to explore New York with a lovely tour guide. The horsey smell was obvious only at the entrance to the hotel, but it didn't bother me as I love horses. Each morning about 6am we explored Central Park and enjoyed our coffee thanks to the lovely pot waiting at the front door. I will be back with the family!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were originally staying at the Hotel Giraffe in mid-town, but couldn't get enough rooms for the whole family there on one of the nights so decided to move to the Ritz near Central Park where we could get 3 rooms. Ok, so we didn't reserve well in advance, only a few night in advance, but we got 3 crummy rooms looking at walls of other buildings. It felt like a dungeon and we never opened the curtains. We paid over US$600/night per room. Each room had 2 beds and were pretty standard. The bed quality was good and the bathrooms were large in each room. The ceilings felt low in both the rooms and the hallways. I guess that's what you get for staying at an old hotel. Our first room was ok, but the modem was broken and we had to be changed to another room as we can't go without internet. The second room was different set-up and was a smaller room. Unlucky us. The service was fine. Standard 5 star hotel type service. The lounge is good. I think we paid $100-200 per night to use the lounge service. They have food and drinks all day long and also a concierge. If you plan on staying in the hotel, this would be handy. Wouldn't recommend, but glad they had 3 open rooms that night!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from a 5 day trip to NY and had yet another excellent trip at the Ritz CarltonAs always the service was outstanding nothing is too much trouble. From the maids to the front desk every one greets you with a smile and a happy to help attitudeRooms were excellent, spotlessly clean, bright and large (which makes a change as most of the other hotels I have stayed in NY have been small and dark)Used the restaurant for the first time and can highly recommend it Worth every penny

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the first contact with the porter to the late night in room supper, we found the personnel, the service, the decor and the over all experience to be exceptional. A view of the park provides a welcome respite from the concrete valleys. The bar here is world class. Norman is famous, and for good reason.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were there for a long weekend to celebrate my birthday. I would say that the best part of the hotel is the staff. They pamper you from beginning to end. The staff in the restaurant is wonderful. They really take care of you and make you feel welcome. They greet you by name each time they see you. We had breakfast twice and ate ate lunch once. The quality of the food is great too. The room was very nice. We were upgraded to a bigger room with a view towards the park. The location of the hotel is great: close to 5th avenue shopping, Central Park and not far from the theater district. The only part that I think needs to be remodeled is the entrance/lobby area. It's a little cramped and dark for a hotel of this quality. They were remodeling the outside though.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What can you say about this hotel in the heart of Manhattan and Central Park. We came here on a rewards trip from my company and loved every minute of our experience. It's a Ritz and it was Christmas, so I would've never paid what the rates were for this hotel if I was paying my own way ($1300/night)The treatment by the staff was fantastic. After we checked in, dropped our baggage off upstairs, everyone seemed to know what our name was after that. We were always greeted by our names when we left and when we arrived to breakfast in the morning on all three days we were there. It was very nice and impressive in many cases. The highlight for me was getting about a 3 minutes experience sitting next to Leonardo De Capprio and Jamie Foxx in the lobby. It was really cool and they were really quite accomidating to a fan that just wanted to meet two very famous people. We enjoyed our trip greatly and would love to experience the hotel again one day but would probably just experience on Marriott Rewards points as $1300/night is a little steep. If you have it however...I wouldn't hesitate to experience a great location and hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Rooms are small but gorgeous and it is in an amazing location for shopping but I think it is extremely overpriced. When a light breakfast for 4 people comes to over $150 something needs to change. Even though everything was extremely expensive, we had an amazing time during out stay, the staff are there to help you with anything! I would suggest if you stay there to stay on the club floor because that gives you access to some free food and drinks including wine. It's worth the little bit of extra money.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In town on business...hotel and staff are terrific! The hotel needs a better restaurant for breakfast/lunch, as they're limited by size and menu...still a great hotel . Would come and recommend into to anyone looking or a first class experience. Great location near Central Park and shopping.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I lost a valuable cufflink. Housekeeping found it and returned it to me!! great service, small room for the price but it is in a great location... There was no remote to the tv when we got there but we got one immediately.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 days and enjoyed it immensely. Whilst our corporate rate only got me a internal facing room for $400 a night, the room itself was beautifully fashioned and incredibly comfortable. It may sound a bit weird, but the best steak I have had in years was the room service meal on my first night....simply awesome ! The service from the team was impeccable, with an especially helpful Concierge. If you stay at the Ritz, do yourself a favour and head down to the food hall in the basement of the Plaza Hoel which is only 3 door down the road....wow.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were recently guests at the Ritz Carlton for our anniversary, and have also stayed at the hotel on several other occasions, without incident. The experience at the front desk this stay was not good, the experience with the front desk manager was even more disappointing, the room we were "upgraded to" with a window had completely dirty windows that you couldn't see out of, and it was a handicapped room with no tub and a long, narrow shower with handicapped seats and a hand held shower. We are not handicapped. A normal shower would have been nice. Beyond the front desk experience, most of the other staff was superb. I will surely return to Four Seasons for an excellent customer experience, and will also not be looking at their residence clubs, which we were considering. One bad apple (in this case two) can really spoil the entire bunch....

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My best friend took me to New York for the first time for my birthday. What an amazing city! He travelled to New York partly for work and we were put in at The Ritz-Carlton. What a fantastic hotel! Location is perfect, at the south end of Central Park. The service from the doorman, to the room service was superlative. The room was spacious, beautiful in the classical way. The bed is so comfortable that I felt I was sinking in! It has a fully equipped gym. We had a very good stay on a special weekend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A very big thank you to the folks of The Ritz Carlton Central Park for making my birthday weekend very special.The lovely corner room overlooking the park was immaculately clean and furnished with all the amenities required for absolute comfort. Relaxing in a tub is not something I often have time to do; however, that hour long soak was heavenly.Breakfast at the Ritz was excellent. Staff very welcoming and attentive. What a great way to start our days in the city.A very special thanks to Joe the doorman, who always had a welcoming smile on his face. Even in the middle of a tremendous downpour he procured a cab for us and made every effort to keep the rain from ruining my wife's hair.Then there was Norman the bartender. He made feel so welcome it was difficult to pull ourselves away. I can't recall a bartender that made us laugh so much. Oh yes, the drinks were top shlef. Cheers to you Norman!We look forward to stay at the Ritz on our next trip into NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location continues to matter and rooms overlooking the Park are best around. Concierge service remains best ever. However, check in service, lighting in the bathroom, which is not good for older eyes, and some of the doorman services seem to have been down graded or less than what one might expect for the price being paid. Hope this is not a sign that things are beginning to "slip."

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Could not fault this hotel - great spacious rooms in good condition, quiet although overlooks Central Park, courteous and helpful staff (especially concierge and doormen). Nice and cosy lobby. Had fantastic time.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When you ask real-estate people what's more important they have a few answers : location,location,location ! We selected the hotel and paid a premium for rooms with a view based on this adagio ; it's been nice to be able to have a look from above to the Central Park, one of the marvels of NYC. Still, there are other, more practical considerations that matters also.Long before arrival , I asked the hotel to arrange for transfer from the airport and they obliged. We landed late, at about 1 a.m. and progressed confidently to the exit . There we had a surprise : NO car ! I phoned the hotel and guess : No answer ...The room has been nice but nothing special, except for the advantage of hearing clearly and loudly whenever the guys in the next room were having shower. An other fact I will remember long time : its price !Next morning and the following ones I found that the breakfast was good but the choice was quite limited and the service rather slow. During the peak hours you may have to wait to get a table. The a la cart service is perhaps adequate when the serving area is much larger...What has been really outstanding : the quality of the team from Concierge , highly pro and friendly.One final remark : no one could beat the software of that hotel in foreseeing the amount of money you intend to spend there ; in my case it has been guessed right to the last cent !! Considering the amount they blocked at the time of check in I had nothing to pay at the time of check out !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton overnight for our 25th wedding anniversary. We used 70000 Marriott points and it was totally worth it. The hotel is gorgeous...the rooms are beautiful. The location right on the park is great. We stepped across the street and onto a horse and carriage ride thru central park.The staff at the hotel are so helpful. Anything you ask for they immediately see it's done. I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. And even though you're in the heart of Manhattan the room was completely silent. No outside noise at all.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have travelled to NYC many times and have stayed in some great hotels.However,this hotel is the best...!The quality and service was non- stop first class!We were extremely impressed by all the staff.Everybody was exceedingly kind and helpful and it was clear that they really cared about all their guests. I would highly recommend booking a Club room and treating yourself to some true luxury and pampering in this beautiful hotel.The Club offers five different dining services with cocktails and champagne in the evenings.You won't want to leave!We are looking forward to our next visit to the hotel and hope it will be SOON...!Many,many thanks to you all.A fantastic stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We only went to Ritz Carlton at Central Park to have lunch, and after a theater performance we returned for drinks because we really like this place.We had newly created burgers for lunch, and we thought they were excellent. Celine, the bartender, is the loveliest person and very personable, just a pleasure to be around. However, when we returned to the lobby for drinks at night after going to the theater, we were totally shocked by the attitude of two waiters whose names I do not remember. They were not attentive, very snobbish for no good reason, and I am sure would not have risen to the same "heights" in the country where they came from.
