When I said that the bunt cake for $16 was not good, the waiter told me that he would pass on the information to the chef. He did leave the charge on the bill, however, and was very matter of fact about it. It might be the Central Park air which makes these waiters high and mighty, and I really hope that this is a passing episode, because we live this place a lot and would want to come back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel with great service! We love the proximity to the park & surrounding attractions. The view of Central Park from our room made this country boy feel at ease with the fast pace of the city. We had a great time at the bar downstairs. GREAT SERVICE!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed with points or would never have stayed here. It is very luxurious and fancy, but really not our style, we had just as nice a stay at a Courtyard the night before and the East Side Marriott last summer. When we checked in they couldn't find our reservation for some time - which was fairly unsettling, and there were several people in the lobby all dressed up looking like they thought they were better than everyone else. Our room was a corner room with a terrible view but very clean and comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfortable, nice tub with very nice products, magazines to read, books to read, CD to listen too, lots of expensive item in the minibar, robes, slippers, no noise at all!.... the room had it all. We didn't expect the maid to come while we were out for the evening but she did and it was so nice to return to a turned down tidy room - like being on a cruise. We didn't take advantage of any of the services/dining so cannot comment on that. It was fun to stay in such a fancy hotel and the room was incredible. For us, we would rather use fewer points or spend less on a less fancy hotel where we felt more welcomed and comfortable in the public spaces, I really don't want to put on a suit to check in when I am on vacation just to fit in!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you stay using rewards points, be prepared for steerage service.Our stay was at best, unpredictable, and at worst, insulting.From the reviews, you would think this was the only Tier 5 property in North America, and it is, for those paying full price! We do a tremendous amount of business with the brand, and as such, have accumulated so many points that we don't know what to do with them all. We thought, let's stay at the 70k point a night place, because honestly, I have had romanced views of this property since I was young, the location can't be beat, and you chose a brand location because you expect to get the same service at every location.My daughter was celebrating her first birthday, which in the korean culture, is a big deal. It was a major milestone birthday for me too---the big X0!We called the platinum elite member line and made reservations. The lovely reservation specialist was able to book the room, and even went as far as to contact the hotel for upgrade requests. if you are platinum elite, you are given a complementary upgrade (not a suite or club), and with the Ritz Carlton Black card, you get another complementary upgrade. Typically, because we literally spend 170 nights and a TON of money in catering and events with the properties, and we do not have many opportunities to travel for pleasure, so when we do, we want it done right. At 70,000 points a night (for $1 a point, that is $70,000 a night), we expect typically marvelous Ritz Carlton service.Because of this, we are almost always given a club suite upgrade, and if not a club suite, a suite with club access. We know this is not guaranteed, and based on availability, and at the discretion of the property. Therefore, we called first to see what their load was like and if we could be accommodated.Actually, our platinum elite reservation specialist called on our behalf, and confirmed guaranteed club access, guaranteed room upgrade, and a request (i.e., not guaranteed) upgrade to suite, based on availability. The front desk manager she spoke with suggested we call in the morning to see if suites had sold, and if not, they could accommodate us.So I called at 7:30 after the kids were up, and spoke with Ertis, MOD, who suggested I speak with George, the rooms controller. I explained the situation to George, and he said he could not guarantee the club access, and that the platinum folks made an error. Well, this isn't really my fault, but he suggested I contact them. So on my daughter's birthday, the day of our arrival, I call the hotel, am directed back to the platinum line where they are trying to track down our agent, transferred back to the hotel, then back to customer service. I told George, look, just let us know if you can do it or not---we can come another time. he said no, you should just come up and we will do our best to accommodate you upon your arrival. I said, actually, I would just prefer to know so that we don't show up and get disappointed. We still could not get a straight answer.So I was directed by customer service to corporate, because the notes did reflect some information about club access, although they apparently did not leave clear enough notes. Again, not my issue, right?Then amazing Pam from corporate contacts the hotel to figure out what is going on. She said that they are now saying that no suites or club access are available. She then notes that, actually, they are selling club access and suites and rooms in almost every category. And by the way, we have a regional sales rep who can access their loads, so someone was not being truthful, and this really put me over the edge.It is your property. if you don't want to accommodate an upgrade, then fine---just say so. Don't tell me to go ahead and come and "we will see what we can do." I have small kids and it is everything to have club access, and there are plenty of choices in Manhattan. Second, don't LIE to me. manager Brian finally took the line, and said, well, there myst have been cancellations. Fine. still unlikely, and now they want to charge us $100 for club access after all of this. Fine. We were offered a high park view or a low, city view suite.When we arrived, we were greeted warmly and enthusiastically by the professional doormen, and walked into the unimpressive lobby, greeted genuinely and kindly by the front desk staff, who bestowed small, stuffed horses upon each of my kids, which made them both very happy. Interesting to note, Manager Brian was standing right at the desk and never made eye contact or greeted us. Awkward.We had arrived early, and our room was not available, which was fine. We were told that no suites were available (another change in Brian's story), but a park view room would be ready in an hour or so. Fine.We had a quick snack in the club and headed out shopping. When our room was ready, we walked into a closet of 812, which was a park view, but not a high floor, so we had the view of the street and a bunch of sidewalks and a row of trees, replete with the sounds of traffic---hazards of staying on lower floors.Not only did Brian fail to deliver on either of his promises, the room was tiny. We rearranged the furniture and our daughter slept in a crib in the bathroom, and our son on a roll away in the center of the room. It was almost comical. Except that it was slightly humiliating. The TV was broken, the phone was broken and one of the lamps was broken. Turn down skipped us somehow the first night, and all calls for requests went unanswered.Honestly, we just felt swindled. Look, I can appreciate that people are running a business. I would also appreciate that those businesses recognize that they rely on their dedicated customers to keep things moving. I would rather you be honest with me, so I can make alternate arrangements, than continually encouraging me to come, only to fail to meet any of the promises you've made to us.As far as the club, it was mediocre as far as most RC clubs go. The food was on target, but not spectacular. The service was uneven and unpredictable. You had servers working so hard, and other standing around or playing games on the computer. We had been in the club 5-6 times before the only club concierge, a lovely woman, who happened to be pregnant, carried over a high chair for our 12 month old. Why not one had thought to offer this before is beyond me, but what a lovely thought from this concierge. Coffee was hard to come by, and we had to ask for straws for the kids each time. part of the brand standard is to anticipate the needs of the guests, and since we were down there a few times a day, we still had to chase people down for a cup of coffee, milk for the kids, and a straw.Maybe this sounds picky, but I know what to expect, and this was not it. For 70,000 points a night ++, we just want what is expected, let alone standard.On another note, there were never enough doormen. I struggled with those double doors and the stroller+kids on a few occasions, and it was quite frustrating.Overall, here are my recommendations1) Pay. if you use points, you clearly are not valued2) Come alone. This is not an environment for kids. I don't think the staff really knew what to do with them, and I didn't see many of them. When i asked about their Ritz Kids offering, I received blank stares (or silence, via phone)3) Get a HIGH floor, park view. 4) Be prepared for the smell of horses in the lobby and in the low floors5) Actually, go downtown and stay at the Ritz Carlton Battery park. The service, food and ambiance is amazing. Yes, it is downtown, but it doesn't matter who you are---the doors will be opened for you, the food will be amazing, and people will be kind to you in the truest sense from the ladies and gentlemen at Battery park. If you must be at Central Park, Essex House is down the street and a good deal less expensive for similar perks and much better service.The pluses (because it wasn't ALL bad) were the amazing, hard working housekeeping team who always had a smile, warm greeting and were quick and efficient (and we tipped them well!) There was one particular doorman, a larger gentleman with a teddy bear quality and deep tenored voice, who was the picture of NY doormen, always with a genuine greeting and kind smile. The concierges were particularly outstanding, offering complete information, friendly smiles, and were easily accessible, especially the blonde concierge (can't remember her name!) I appreciate that they had multiple suggestions for theater tickets (from how to navigate the TKTS booth to the $400 pp tickets their broker could secure for us)Truth: We won't be back--at least, not as long as Brian and George are still at this location. I have too much respect for myself to be treated the way we were, and won't go through that again. If you can't or won't honor an upgrade (that is, remember, entitled to us), then just say so straight up and let us make decisions accordingly. Don't disrespect me by lying about it. Battery park is just too close to go through that again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: True luxury hotel with stunning views over Central Park! Do take the Park view luxury room - the views are worth every dollar you pay. The rooms are clean and big (in Manhattan terms), bathroom had a bath and a shower, beds are fantastic - very comfy! We were welcomed by a bowl of strawberries in chocolate sent by the Guest Relations manager, with whom we were in contact prior the trip. We also tried the spa, which was fantastic - do try it!The service around the hotel is flawless - very prompt, accurate and proactive.We definately recommend this hotel to all travelling to Manhattan.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Norman, who you will find at the Bar at the Ritz Carlton Hotel, on Central Park South. You sit at the bar, and everyone comes there for Norman, all the patrons are there for him. I feel badly when you walk in and you ask is Norman working tonight, they say no, and your face can't help but show the disappointment. He is a delight and pours a serious adult beverage! His other great attribute is his advise. I was buying an apartment on the upper east side and my interview was the next day with the co-op board, and I was nervous. He told me "when they ask you what your plans are for the apartment, tell them you love it just the way it is!" Which I did and redid the kitchen when I moved in. Priceless. I have followed Norman up and down 59th Street (he has been at 4 different locations) for the last 25 years. I am always getting a plate of something special, strawberries when I have a glass of champagne, cheese with my Malbec, killer chips with my vodka, always a gift. We all love Norman!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband took me for a Champaign Brunch at the Ritz, and we stayed there for the weekend. It was phenomenal!!!! The rooms are well groomed, the beds are extremely comfy, the service was fantastic, and the granite and gold trimmed bathrooms are very clean. Weather you are a shopping guru or just enjoy life while walking through the streets of the city,... you'll love your surroundings. You may even bump into someone famous at the hotel during 'High Tea' like we did! (there are tons of famous faces around these parts) One word describes my experience...Amazing!!! Sightseeing throughout the city takes a bit of walking, but don't bother bringing your comfy flats,...unless their designer made. Remember, this IS the fashion district of the world!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a fabulous stay at the Ritz Carlton celebrating my daughter's 16th birthday! We had a suite that had a partial view of Central Park. Everything from service, atmosphere, location, room service etc.. was perfect! This hotel is absolutely worth the splurge!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz to celebrate my daughter's 16th birthday. We were in a suite with a partial view of Central Park and it was perfection. The rooms were completely insulated from any street or other noises-which was wonderful! The service, the atmosphere, the location and the suite all were sublime. This hotel is worth the splurge!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the place to go in New York. Nice size and feel. Great food in the bar downstairs. Nice experience for a honeymoon. Go here for service. Great location next to the park. Close to everything. Great for couples. Great staff...went the extra mile.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights and enjoyed every bit of the Rtiz... I used MR points on this stay but paid a token fee for an upgrade, which gave me Club access, a spacious high-floor suite with a partial view of Central Park. The best thing was that RC also allowed me to do a late (6PM) check-out since my flight was at 10PM, and that made the last day very productive for last minute meetings and shopping. Staff courtesy was outstanding and they make everyone feel like family here.The property location is spectacular with minutes away from 5th, Madison etc.. Very pleasant ambience throughout the hotel and peaceful nights. Excellent room-service, fitness gym... what more can I say...?If you are a revenue guest, be prepared to pay $1000/night, but it's great value for NY visitors.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed a week amidst hurricane Sandy. Despite a planned earlier departure, they easily accompdated my necessary extra days due to the storm. The concierge desk is the BEST--always helpful and secured me reservations at hard-to-get-into restaurants. They made the most of my stay even in the face of the inclement weather. I felt safe, tended to, and well informed. A very worthwhile stay if headed to NYC. The location is stellar as well. Walking distance to fantastic shopping and Central Park is across the street. The staff overall is highly accommodating, and I plan to return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the Ritz for a work reward trip - my budget is usually more of the Marriott or Hilton variety. My husband was unable to accompany me on the trip so two girlfriends went with me - thus we requested a room with 2 double beds. Just beware - apparently they only have one room with double beds per floor and this does not come with a park or a city view, rather the view of the wall of another building 2 feet in front of you outside every window. Needless to say our room was not equipped with the fabled telescope so many others mentioned. The bathroom in the room was huge and very nice with a separate shower and tub and enough room for 3 "girls" to get ready in at the same time.This being New York , we were not in our room all that much and I will have to say that when it comes to Concierge services the Ritz is top notch. The Concierge assisted us with several reservations prior to our arrival. On the afternoon we checked in we mentioned that we wanted to stop by somewhere for a quick drink prior to dinner and before we even unpacked our bags an envelope was slipped under the door with spot on recommendations.The dinner reservation (Beauty & Essex) and lunch reservation (ABC Kitchen) that the Concierge recommended and made for us were exceptional and provided the exact tailored experience we had requested.Of course you can't beat the Central Park location and getting a cab is a breeze. Additionally, we were always greeted by name each morning down in the lobby by the endearing Enders (sp?).One thing we found peculiar was that when they do turn down service they place the pillows in the window behind the drapes. The first night we returned we had no idea where our pillows were and called housekeeping for more, only to discover the others the next morning.All in all we had a great experience, but had I been paying don't know if I could justify the additional $200+ per night it costs to stay there over other hotels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What an amazing hotel! We stayed here for two nights, and had a great experience! It was a very romantic weekend for us because we got engaged! This was the best hotel to stay in for this special weekend. We had a room with a park view and everytime we looked out the window, we were amazed. The room itself was classy and bright. It was an above average size room for a NYC hotel. The bathroom was clean and refreshing The staff was friendly and attentive. Great hotel for a special weekend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Sometimes I find myself waiting way to long to write a good review, not this time. Planned a girls shopping trip to NYC 6 months ago and booked Ritz over other considerations. Have stayed at Ritz- Central Park one other time many years ago with family and had a magical experience. So in the efforts to recreate the last experience I booked again. In my opinion the location can not be beat (I am shocked when folks say they don't like mid town, sooooo much to do within feet from hotel). From the second you arrive you are made to feel increadably special, amazing welcoming staff. We splurged and upgraded to club level (highly recommend for many reasons), so we checked in and headed to club level for a much needed cocktail. The Club lounge is beautiful and very welcoming. Equiped with heavy appetizers, wine, champagne, bottled water, etc it was a sight for sore eyes (We had been traveling for @ 9 hours). Within a minute of arriving, Lazar who was on duty asked if we would like a beverage we said yes 'Martini's please' (can't say enough about how much we enjoyed Lazar, great personality, great martini maker, great representative to the hotel). The room was very lovely, what you would expect of a Ritz. The location of this hotel is right accross the street of central park, blocks from the best shopping anywhere in the world and you can walk to Time Square & Theatre district. Sit in the lobby bar and it's people watching galore. Keep eyes pealed you just might see a celeb or two. I had very high expectations (based on last visit) and the Ritz effortlessly topped themselves. Will be back, and worth every penny.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I'm very late in writing this review, but remember it well. I had a cancelled flight due to weather while on a business trip and booked a last minute reservation at The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park. Located at Central Park South, you can't find a better location in Midtown to see the sights, walk around, find great restaurants, and easily get to other areas of Manhattan to enjoy during your stay.For the business or family traveler, you can't go wrong at this Ritz. Only one room per floor has double beds, but you can always ask for a rollaway if you need it. The property's rooms are the older English style, but very, very well appointed and manicured. The room was pristine and the bathrooms are very up to date and more modern than the rest of the room's style. The gym has no view, but is adequate for basic workouts. The lobby bar/cafe is beautifully done and has the feel of old world New York. Make sure you stop in. Also, ask for a room with a view of Central Park. While the Ritz commands a high price, you're paying for luxury and location. If you can splurge, do. You won't be disappointed!
user_name:
BlakeTraveler
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Significant other and I had a couples weekend away at Ritz Carlton on Central Park South in NYC. We opted for the club level room for about $150 more per night and were glad we did. Also opted for the more expensive park view regular room: nice with the view and a telescope in the window. Even though there is some scaffolding and work being done on the building's exterior, it was an elegant and totally relaxing stay. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel is a bit old-school and it would be nice if they did a refresh on the room decor, however, things were spotlessly clean and all the internet and flat panel tvs worked flawlessly. Everyone from doormen to check in desk personnel were extremely kind and professional. No wait for check in, and each time we left the room it seemed like it was cleaned immediately. Turn down service, newspapers in the AM, etc. The club lounge staff were a real highpoint: chatty and friendly and full of info. Free drinks, nice snacks, different tidbits being put out four or five times per day. One evening we missed the hors d'ourvres and arrived back around 9 PM a bit hungry: the staff gave us a nice little place with some cheeses, nuts, etc. Would definitely stay there again. Can't beat the location!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Old fashioned charm and elegance, rather than a modern feel, but I happen to like that quality in a hotel. The service was exceptional and the minute you check in, every staff member remembers your name. You feel valued. Central Park is right across the street. Taxis are easy to get, but you're walking distance to most everything in midtown. It's a great location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here in July and it was just as amazing as you would imagine the Ritz in Central Park to be! Cross the street to enjoy the park, and near wonderful restaurants! We enjoyed lunch in the hotel restaurant, gorgeous salads and fantastic wine. Luxury at its finest

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first visit to New York in several years and our first visit to this Ritz-Carlton property. It was such a wonderful stay and the staff couldn't have been nicer. This is definitely one of those properties that remains true to the values and traditions that The Ritz-Carlton Hotel Company has always been known for. The rooms were very spacious, clean and appointed as a Ritz-Carlton should be. Every detail was attended to. Room service was always on-time and housekeeping was always taken care of exactly when we would have wanted it. Meaning, we never came back to the room and found it not having been serviced or turned down.The lobby is exquisite and the bartenders more than accommodating to our occasional visit with friends needing a bit more space than just the two of us.Overall, I can't wait to go back and visit this hotel again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed in a single king room on the top floor which was small but quiet which is what I needed. Big bathroom, nice Asprey products. Bed and bedding fine. People working there were lovely. Very convenient to work so a home run for me. Only con : wifi not free and it took 3 calls to the front desk to get a new light bulb. Otherwise, the service was top notch.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz for three nights Easter weekend. We usually book the Surrey for our trips to NYC but the Ritz had a promotion with American Express Platinum that was hard to beat. Room upgrade, food credit and third night free. Everything about the hotel was charming. The room was lovely and the bathroom updated and sparkling. The service was impeccable and it has the feel of a boutique hotel rather than a large NYC hotel. Our only complaint (if you could even call it that) was the hords of crowds right outside on 59th street and the pedi-cabs and the horse carts with somewhat aggressive hawkers. Growing up in NYC it was interesting to see how tourists are mobbed with crazy offers to ride around Central Park. But I guess it's comparable to a Gondola ride in Venice! Special thanks to the doormen and bellmen who were just wonderful. A top rate hotel and I hope they run the special again so we can return!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is indeed one of the top properties in NYC. Location is the best, right across the street from Central Park and only steps away from Fifth Ave, Columbus circle and the Lincoln Center. We spent a weekend there for an opera at the Met, and had a great experience. I recommend eating elsewhere, since the food options on property can be limited and overpriced. The rooms are classy and well-appointed. I particularly enjoyed the high quality of the windows:double-paint/thermopane - made by an UK manufacturer, ensuring uttermost silence and respite from a noisy street. Since we were staying on a special occasion, strawberries and chocolate were offered complimentary. All in all, great service and location make this hotel one of the top ones in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Lovely hotel, we upgraded as I was proposing to my girlfriend and staff accommodated every whim we had but to be honest the room seemed a little dated, old bulky tv set, and the restaurant was closed at the time so we have to have room service. Bathroom in particular seemed old and dated, a real shame as you expect more from the chain of hotel at these prices.Spa staff were out of this world amazing and deserve lots of praise.
user_name:
blissfultranquility
Isle of Man, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Sometimes, reviews by consumers and top raters get it right and this is one of those rare times. This property is situated in the best possible location in the City, directly on the Park and near top restaurants and the world's finest clothing and jewelry stores. The condition of the public rooms and sleeping accommodations were absolutely pristine and comfortable. And, most importantly, every single staff member we came in contact with were friendly, authentic professionals who went out of their way to brighten our day and stay. Best Vesper martini I've ever had and the new Aldens restaurant is top in decor, food and, once again, service.We get around quite a bit and have rarely enjoyed the authentic experience we had there. We used to be Four Seasons devotees but in the last few years agree with various surveys that RitzC now has that top echelon.One of the best hotels we've ever experienced and we would eagerly recommend to family, friends and business associates. Can't wait to stay again. For what you get in personal service, the value is excellent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Prepare to be pampered!This is a truly superb hotel and deserves it's 5 star status. We stayed as a one off celebration so were very careful not to incur any incidentals.This is an extravagant hotel and worth every penny, the staff and decor reflect that, would I stop again? Absolutely, with a Lotto win in my back pocket.Breakfast was a memorable part of our day, thanks to the boys who served us on our five night stay.
user_name:
La G
Newcastle, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: How can you go wrong with a stay on Central Park South at a Ritz Carlton? You really can't!!!Awesome view of the park, I am sure the hotel could use a little face lift but it is not a modern hotel nor should it have to be. Beds are very comfortable and the showers work!Telescope was a cool addition! Minibar has some great items... Johnny Walker Blue!The lobby area is a great place to have a drink or conduct a meeting. If you can afford it go for it, you only live once. The ladies and gentleman will be glad to help in anyway possible.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently stayed at the Ritz in Central Park for my twin nieces 16th birthday and it was an amazing stay. Jo, the Special Events Manager, decorated the room with the material i had FedExed a couple days in advance and also with balloons that Balloon Saloon had delivered. They also gave the twins a beautiful cake that was personally decorated. The staff was so sweet with recognizing the twins and wishing them Happy Birthday for the rest of our stay. The Club Lounge is worth the extra money with the attentive waiters, (thanks, Lazarus!) and the yummy food at our convenience, all day long. We will always remember the special time at the Ritz and can't thank you enough for the lifetime memories !!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is superb, the fabric of the hotel is stylish and comfortable. We took a premium room overlooking Central Park, 7th floor. The room was tastefully and elegantly appointed, the antique telescope in one of the windows is a nice touch. All aspects of the stay were top notch, delivered by a professional and committed hotel staff team. People always make the business. This business clearly has and enjoys keeping excellent people. We will stay again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here for business. View of air shaft so in perpetual darkness all day. Room super dated and shabby. Service was snobby. Maybe I'm spoiled by the hotels in Asia, but I would've thought you should be able to do much better with $500 a night (even Paris is much better value). Anyway didn't have to pay myself, but still wouldnt choose this place if i had a chioce. No idea what anyone would stay here - I suppose if you pay more you might be able to get a better room with a view or something.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We did not have a chance to treat ourselves this holiday season so in January, after all the traveling and craziness we decided to treat ourselves.We had an amazing dinner with grilled veal chops, fine wine and the service level where you never ask for a thing and whatever you wished just appeared!Anticipated every imaginable need and want - a magical celebration!
user_name:
Timmyk40
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I hadn't stayed here for 5 years+ yet was welcomed as if I had only just left. Nothing was too much trouble and it felt exactly as if I had never left.What more can I say? The bar is fantastic, the new restaurant was very good.
user_name:
Rick S
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Simply cannot fault the service in this hotel. From the moment I arrived, the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful. Within a day they all seemed to know me by name, which was remarkable. I arrived at 7 in the morning having caught a red eye from California yet they managed to find me a room immediately so I could shower and change before my meetings. In the evening with half an hour's notice they were able to cancel a previously booked dinner reservation for five people in one restaurant and find space for that party somewhere more local. Umbrellas were provided when it rained and they manage to conjure a cab out of nowhere, no mean feat during a storm in NYC. Room was very nicely laid out. Bed was incredibly comfortable. One minor issue is that when it is very still one notices the subway trains moving under the building but I cannot say that it impacted on my stay. Pressing and shoe cleaning available overnight and coffee delivered complimentary with wake up call. Everything was really as a hotel should be.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We enjoy staying at Ritz Carltons whenever we are in a city where one is located, especially on the club floor or with club access. The last time we were in New York there was no club access availabilty left, but this trip we were able to have club access and really enjoyed the club at this location. We had a deluxe room on an upper level. The check-in was smooth, the room was lovely and clean, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. The staff in the club lounge were very friendly and the food presentations were very good. Some Ritz Carltons locations have had nicer presentations, others have been not as nice. Any help we needed, the staff was very willing to do all they could. The doormen were kind and went out of their way to be helpful.We did not eat at the restaurant or spend any time in the bar because we enjoyed the quiet of the club lounge and talking to some of the very friendly people we met there. The only complaint we have is no coffee maker in the room. We have gotten used to having a coffee service in the room and with the club lounge several floors below, it would be nice to have coffee in the rooms.We enjoy the Ritz-Carlton Central Park very much. We look forward to staying here and love the view of Central Park. The location is wonderful for walking to so many stores, restaurants, and enjoying the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Decided to splurge and got the package complete with ballet tickets, personal shopper and stunning central park views (love the telescope by the window). Wonderful friendly service. Probably would say it was overpriced, but it is the New York Ritz Carlton after all, expect nothing short of old world opulence.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay here every time we visit New York. The rooms are spacious and very well kept. The club lounge facilities are also great, with complimentary soft drinks and snacks available all day and alcoholic ones in the evening. The staff are so friendly and attentive, it makes for a really nice atmosphere. All this with the great added view over Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We often stay at this hotel when we visit New York, and it has been our favorite. The views of the park are amazing from the room and the service is great. I must say that our last visit surprisingly did not meet our expectations. They must have some new staff in the reception/ entrance area that they did not go out of their way to make us feel special, especially since we were celebrating my birthday. Unlike other reviewers, I happen to like the decor and I'll be disappointed if they renovate. We went to have a drink to the beautiful lounge before dinner and we were asked to move to another table because they had reserved our table for others. This would be fine if there was a "reserved" sign on the table but there was none. Then the waitress could not make eye contact, or a conversation. Too shy? The newly renovated restaurant lacks in service and food quality but not in prices. There some great restaurants close to the hotel (Marea, Benoit), so I would avoid the hotel restaurant. If this level of service and attitude continues, I'll start looking for other hotels with a view of the park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz in Central Park is not for the weak of wallet. The normal price ranges from $800 - $2,000 per night, depending on whether one books in advance and chooses a suite vs a normal king size room. Of the poor reviews I read, I was a bit worried about the hotel, but found none of these issues. The place smelled and looked lovely. Our afternoon tea was exceptional, including a variety of tea sandwiches, champagne and earl gray tea. No it was not cheap, but anyone concerned about price tags needs to skip this hotel altogether. Breakfast for two was $80;it's a 5 star hotel with a 5 star price tag. With the view of Central Park, and proximity to all in central and uptown Manhattan, I found it worth it. The only better woulld be the Pierre or the Carlyse, both of which will run up a $1,000 per night bill very quickly. The hotel staff and concierge arranged everything for us from transportation to theater. they were very kind to my daughter, and proactively sought to make us more comofrtable. I was able to host my friends in our roomy room, and catch up over room service drinks in leisure. The public spaces are understandably conservative, and largely cater to an international business class group. German bankers, Swiss businessmen, that kind of thing. We loved this hotel, and will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Booked two rooms for a four night visit to New York. Everything else was pretty goodTwo good rooms.The room itself was clean,Large windows give good light in the roomswonderfully comfortable bedsa great location

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We went to the afternoon tea at the ritz-Carlton.....boring! For 55 dollars you get a couple of dry sandwiches and one huge scones. Not the afternoon experience I was hoping! The hotel is in a great location, but definitely very old and would need a little revamp. The room smell like humidity due to the carpet. The view is amazing, don't pay the extra money for the club which is not worth!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a native New Yorker who moved to Chicago, I am very picky about staying in NYC hotels. For the past few years, my husband and I have stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park during the December holidays. I have to admit that it has become somewhat of a tradition for us and returning to this property is like coming home for the holidays! From our curbside greeting to the check-in, our stay and departure, we have found our experiences very satisfactory. During our 2011 visit, there were a few glitches and we mentioned them as we left the property. When we returned for our December 2012 visit, we were surprised at how wonderful everything was. Apparently they remembered our concerns and made several efforts to make up for them. We enjoy staying at this property because it is a central location for our visits with family and friends from all the boroughs. It is very convenient to anywhere we needed to go whether shopping, the theater, or restaurants. We enjoy chatting with the folks at the front desk, as well as the concierge staff, and we enjoy ending the evening with a drink in the lounge at the end of the day.Although I would like to keep this wonderful property a secret, I must admit that I whole heartedly recommend it to anyone who is destined to NYC. With the level of service that they offer, it will continue to be one of my NYC favorites!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I wrote a review a year ago where I was less than pleased with our experience at the Ritz. They lost our reservation and it just went downhill from there. However, the Manager offered us a complimentary night, to allow the Ritz to "get it right this time". So, we took them up on it and it really was a great experience this time. The room was fabulous with a great park view. We went to the bar where we had a wonderful experience - mostly because of Eric the bartender - who was friendly and served great drinks and fabulous snacks. I would definitely stay at the Ritz again. They did a great job this time and did absolutely "get it right". We'll be coming back.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The view of Central Park is the most unique I have ever seen. The service was impeccable. Norman- the bar tender- is an institution. Best stay I have ever had in NYC. I also learned that going after the holiday rush gives you great access to the best places, at a lesser cost/crowds, and you still can get the Christmas decor! The Ritz location and staff is the best in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What a wonderful stay! From the second we stepped out of our car until we left there was nothing less than the absolute highest standards of service. A beautiful hotel with all the trappings that one would expect from a luxury hotel.Amazing food in the restaurant, well maintained rooms and common areas. Service was beyond reproach.We will be back again

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: While walking Mid Town Manhattan, and Central Park, we found the best place to relax and enjoy a nice drink. Inside the Ritz sits a very nice, but small, intimate bar. We found service to be what you expect , outstanding! Simply put, they remember clients by your last names, and are very friendly as well. You feel like they are truly glad you stopped by. Norman has been there for 30+ years, and has the best Irish coffee recipe I have ever had. Drinks are generous, poured the old fashioned way, and served with a warm smile! The decor is classic, upscale,staff friendly and not at all stuffy. We came back the next evening for our last evening meal during our visit in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz really needs no explanation. It is the epitome of upscale standards. The rooms, service, food...all incredible and unsurpassed. I would always recommend this hotel and one of my favorite chain hotels around the world. Have stayed in many and have enjoyed each stay, each time. Their service never waivers and you can always expect the best.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed here several times, but this property is trending down. Nothing major but a whole list of miscues. We had room service for breakfast before we left for the day and came back at 6pm and the entire breakfast was still in the room. The lounge has excellent food but the service is woeful. Up to an hour for coffee and and a piece of pie. We tried the next day for lunch same waiter same result. The hostess came to our rescue and actually went into the kitchen and brought out or meals. The wait staff was ambivelent. I talked to the Asst Manager and got a list of excuses and have a nice day.Most disturbing was what was happeneing on our floor. As you excited the elevator the first guest room (bedroom) had card chairs lined up in the hallway. These chairs were occupied by some very seedy and unprofessional looking people. I can only imaginle what was taking place in the "guest" room. I talked to the Concierge and they asked if I felt uncomfortable. I said tell me what is going on in that room and I will tell you if I feel uncomfortable. I was never told,The BLT restaurant has closed and the new in house restaurant is smaller and attached to the lounge and same kitchen,same slow service.The attitude of most staff from housekeeping to front desk seems to be one of lethargy. The old Ritz of high energy friendly staff seems to have changed. So sad to see a great property suffer from such a quick decline in service and attitude.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We returned to the Ritz Carlton because we had really enjoyed our previous stay. We had a view of the park, which was nice, and we could see the ice skating rink from the room. The room had a telescope so you could get a better view of the park. The room was a noce size, as was the bathroom, which had both a tub and a shower. The hotel has a wonderful location, and is within walking distance of most neighborhoods. The Club Level is really nice, offering 5 presentations daily. The staff in the Club Level lounge are all amazing, and go out of their way to please their guests. If they don't have something you want out already, they will get it for you. The lounge offering of appetizers and wine kept us from visiting the bar area off the main lobby of the hotel, but it was busy every time we passed. The drawback to the hotel was that the fitness center was a little small. The weight area of the fitness center was nice, but the cardio area was pushed together with the machines on top of one another. The lighting over some of the cardio machines, such as the treadmills, was like a spotlight and emitted a tremendous amount of heat. Stay away from those machines. The hotel could work on improving this cardio area. We ate dinner at the new restaurant. We didn't have a reservation, but received a table right along the window. Most of the tables are banquette style, so if you do not like that kind of seating then ask for a separate table. The restaurant was not busy, the service was prompt, and the food was good. The hotel is very expensive, but most hotels in this area are expensive. I'm not sure if it's really worth the money being charged, but it is definitely worth visiting at least once.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a great hotel and a great Ritz Carlton. Location is really nice, of course, right on Central Park South. Service is outstanding and friendly. Very active and vibrant bar area (especially since the LA Lakers were staying there when we were there). My only complaint is that they need a new restaurant to fill the space that used to house BLT Market. The current restaurant in the hotel is really not up to par. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a weekend here on points (LOVE the Marriott points)Room was clean and well appointed - no park view but we have been told these rooms are quieter.Our only gripe was that we should have had access to the Club Lounge but it was "oversubscribed".We found a welcome gift in our room - were wished "happy anniversary" at the front desk and a "Happy anniversay" dessert was brought to us after dinner.In all a very plush place to stay if you want to feel spoiled - pricey if you are paying but well worth spending points on if you have them.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We checked in at 6 PM on a Sunday and the person at the front desk was completely clueless. Not a good beginning for such an upscale hotel. The room itself was okay. It was clean. The real positive of our room was the club level. There they went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The food presentations were fresh and tasty. The Spa is not really a spa. It did have a steam room that worked very very well but something truly was missing from the spa experience. The massage therapist was very good. The location could not be beat. Its a lot of money for what you really get, but its NYC after all.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We booked a Ritz Carlton Suite for 7 night with my wife and 2 children. For more then 800USD a night I have to admit it is very pricey but this is NYC. We booked the limosine service from Kennedy airport which came on time. Check-in took just a few minutes. Our Ritz Carlton Suite was very spacious and had perfect views of Central park. We were also upgraded to a Ritz Carlton suite Club Room. The club had nice food and beaultiful views. Food was very good with a choice of both local and international cuisine. I really liked the Bistro and Bar which serves very nice and tasty seafood. I would defitney recommend it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I could write ten pages about this experience but I will try to keep it as short as I can.We booked a room for the Macy's Parade View many, many months in advance. We stayed at this hotel about two years ago (I failed to write review) so we somewhat knew what to expect. We were contacted prior to our arrival to find out if there was anything that could be done in preparation for our arrival. One of the few things we requested was not to be given a handicap accessible room. When we arrived after a long messed up day of travel we were placed in a handicap accessible room on the sixth floor. No door on toilet room, no bathtub for our two year old, grab bars all over the place. Called the desk and was moved to another room on the third floor. This room overlooked the top of a scaffolding that had work stuff all over it and blocked the first lane of Sixth Avenue where the parade would be. It ruined the view and would have ruined any pictures I had hoped to take. I called the desk again, asked manager to come to room. It is now around 10pm and I have a two year old! She informs me the rooms I had been offered were all that was left for the parade view but that certain guests were not there for the parade and would be checking out of ideal rooms the next day. At this point I am baffled that I, the customer who paid $1500 per night many months in advance am given the leftover crummy rooms. But someone who is paying probably half that amount and isn't even there for the parade view is in the good parade view room? I got pretty upset-wanted to cry. After going back and forth with the night manager begging her to do something she called with "good news". She had a guest move out of an ideal parade view room on the sixth floor. We had to wait for the room to be cleaned and they comped us dinner at their restaurant while we waited. When we finally got in what should have been our room all along it was perfect. The room was very clean (maybe the cleanest I've ever stayed in) except the outside of the windows were quite dirty. After a couple of phone calls they came and were able to swing the window open from the inside and cleaned them really well. The two large windows were perfect for watching the parade. The have a huge ledge you can actually sit in, my toddler stood in, and you can crank them open at the top and hear the sounds.They really did not do anything special for the Thanksgiving Holiday or for the customers paying huge amounts for the view. Their "Parade View Package" turned out to be nothing beyond the room and hot chocolate on the morning of the parade. That seems pretty silly to me. I don't think someone paying $1500/night for a basic little room is really going to think hot chocolate is a great deal. Besides we aren't eight years old! Hot chocolate?! I would have much rather had a nice welcome note from management saying "Happy Thanksgiving, thanks for staying with us". A small fruit basket maybe? A couple drink vouchers? They often do things like that at Ritz Carlton even if you're NOT there for something special! Disappointing!I give the rating four stars because the room was very clean (big deal to me!) and all problems ended up fixed in the end. We had an unbelievable view of the parade! But I am still pretty shocked about our initial room assignments and their lack of attention to detail for the guests there for the very costly "Parade View Package".

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed at the Ritz the weekend of November 30. Very nice hotel, nice room, enjoyable restaurant and bar. Breakfast at the restaurant was very good. Room had no view but clean and nice size. Compared to our stay at the Pierre, I felt the attention to detail at this hotel was lacking.We didn't use the spa or gym (went for runs in central park). Can't best the location of this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Central Park Ritz is a nice, boutique like property which is well located. Rooms are smallish, but very well-appointed. The lobby is small and very understated. This is definitely a Ritz which flies under the radar and feels more like an apartment building than a hotel.I have stayed here many times on business. The service is good and it's hard to find fault. As a business traveler, the hotel is on the pricer side. Rates fluctuate, but it's not uncommon to pay close close to $1000 a night (or more) for a modest non-suite room, which is nearly double the price to stay of the neighboring Essex House (which happens to be a very nice property, at least while it was in the hands of Jumeriah...We will see what Marriot does with it).

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a native New Yorker who was displaced due to a flood in my apartment, my family and I had to stay at a few hotels in Manhattan for a total of five weeks before we could move back into our own place. When we travel for vacations ( which we don't usually do in our own city) we normally stay at the best hotels. Especially in capital or large cities. We have been very lucky to have stayed at some of the most luxurious properties but, clearly, i am a tourist in all the cities except in New York. It was a strange experience. And I tried to see this hotel from the perspective of knowing Manhattan inside out and as a tourist from out of town. (I often don't end reviewing on tripadvisor as often as I should so I do apologize to all of you who are so faithful about reporting back.)We needed a two bedroom suite. We wanted a Central Park-facing suite. They had no two Bedroom suites, per se: but we were offered a one bedroom Central Park suite with a deluxe room right next to it,although it did not connect. The room was for our 12 th grade daughter so she was okay on her own but I would have preferred an arrangement where we could have all been in one suite.The suite was large...that is the living room and the bedroom in the one Bedroom suite facing the park. Lots of windows. The connecting deluxe room was dark and faced Sixth Avenue. You could sneak a peak of the Park but it was a dreary room and not that large. For an expensive deluxe room I felt it was not nearly nice enough.Even for the suite: The decor was really not very stylish in my opinion. Ritz Carltons generally are very traditional in decor. Lots of gold and swagged draperies. Lots of brocade and fringe. It really seems very dated and not especially clean at all.. A number of their properties have become sleeker, and it's certainly not that I prefer minimalist style. But I feel if you are going with elegant and traditional it should be more authentic, with first class fabrics and well-planned decor: it should definitely not be cheesy and the Ritz Carlton felt cheesy and unfashionable. The suites we occupied at the St. Regis during this stint away from home were much more elegant in every way. Night and day....and service as well. This Ritz Carlton just seemed the right side of shabby....barely. And the Housekeeping was just uninspired. Finger marks on glass tops that serve as furniture protectors, grimy dust in corners people don't usually look in, dirt around switch plate covers, sheets tucked in very sloppily, wrinkled and rumpled. And dirty windows really hampered that amazing view that so many visitors come to see and enjoy.As a tourist, I could see loving the Ritz Carlton because the view is fabulous. However, one unfortunate drawback that is not the hotel's fault is the odor from the horses directly opposite the hotel. The carriages and horses line up in a long, long line and the smell wafts directly into the hotel. Please, do not open the windows under any circumstances because the smell from the horses across the way is unbelievable! New York really does not smell like horses and their own "waste". The city has been very vigilant that the carriage drivers keep things very sanitary, but the smell is just over the top no matter how scrupulously clean the streets are kept. We really loved the Club Lounge. Sadly, it seems that one must stay on a Club Floor to really be able to count on great service. Trying to jostle for a spot in the bar or a table in the casual eating area is really unpleasant. And the only place at the Ritz Carlton where the service is truly personalized is in the Club Lounge. And the complimentary food and drinks are just so nice to be able to enjoy.As a native of Manhattan, I would like to say that Central Park South is not, in and of itself, a great street. It seems as if it would be because of its proximity to the park, Carnegie Hall, the Plaza, breat stores and even Lincoln Center. But Central Park South is especially very touristy. Plus, because it is the last street before the Park, there are no buildings opposite the hotel to keep that side of the street spotless and really inviting. In New York each building is really in charge of maintaining the decorum and cleanliness of its own sidewalks. . A lot of nonsense and noise can just happen across the street, outside the Park, even if it's just scads of trinket stands and some really unruly, noisy groups of people now and then. I would hope the revelry or whatever would never affect the experience of those of us staying at the hotel. But I was bothered by loud crowds late at night, for example.That is definitely, without question, not the fault of the hotel, so I would never blame the hotel. I'm just saying there are better locations. And very close by. In fact the Ritz Carlton is in a very convenient location as a base for sightseeing and shopping but you dont need to stay on that slightly seedy street to have all the advantages of the location. But you pretty much do have to stay there if you want that amazing view. (there are a few other hotels with similarly great views but they may be more expensive for the premium of the full-on Central Park view.What the hotel is at fault for, in my experience, is very poor service Ina number of areas. Compared to other five star luxury, full service hotels in Manhattan, the front reception staff is rude and they do not even pretend to be happy to see you. They act neither elegant and poised or friendly and competent. They are easily exasperated for no reason. They do not extend themselves beyond whatever it is they must actually be doing in order to keep their jobs. I checked in and out twice during our five weeks (they couldn't accomodate us for one long stay, we had to keep switching). And only after a great deal of exasperation and bad attitude did I insist on speaking to a manager. She was very apologetic and sent us complimentary champagne, but I would rather have had good service. Housekeeping was definitely hit or miss, which is not acceptable in this level of hotel. Only after the aforementioned manager flagged us as "VIP" guests (for whatever reason) did we get personal attention from housekeeping, room service, and even the host at the bar started to acknowledged us by name and "found"seats for us, etc.All in all, there are so many excellent choices in Manhattan in the same price category and in the same type of luxury class that are better located, have much more professional and customer-centered service.I can understand that it has a special location because of its famous view into Central Park. But you are giving up a huge amount of service and quality of accommodations, food and all around decor and ambience as well as actual location for that view. I stayed at four other hotels of the same calibre and price during that time, all within the same basic area. This one, this Ritz Carlton, by far, had the least to offer in every aspect.A few "buts"....For example,....the Club Lounge was really, really nice, and a welcoming place to relax. Also, the gentleman from housekeeping who would make up the sofa bed for my son every evening worked very hard and was proud of his hard work and was extremely friendly.. We met nice people in the Club Lounge who were visiting New York and it was fun to have nice people to chat with. I just felt sorry for the out of town guests who were not getting treated as well as possible, especially if they were not on the Club Floor. In my opinion, they were not getting great advice from the concierge, etc.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This property is faultless. No request is ever too much and is always met with just a little bit extra and location is brilliant. The lobby through to the rooms are simply clean and relaxing. Impeccable service in all areas, very comfortable furnishings and a place you never want to check out and leave.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This Ritz-Carlton is exactly what a Ritz should be. The location is perfect...right off of Central Park...convenient to ABC Studios, Time Warner Center/Shops, The Plaza, Apple Store, Bergdorf's and other Fifth Avenue shopping. The bar and restaurant are fabulous- and the other guests are extremely friendly. One note, ask for a room that actually has a view (and isn't by the heating/cooling vents overlooking the rooftop). Those rooms definitely exist and that is the only thing that could possibly dampen your experience. Otherwise, it's perfect and- along with the Mandarin Oriental- one of the best hotel choices in the city.
user_name:
thenewyorker917
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central park many times. As always the staff is fantastic. It is a lovely hotel in a great location. We had a few minor complaints. For some reason they now store housekeeping itmes in the hallways. It is really weird to see a rack of towels etc. (there was a sheet thrown over top of the rack to "hide" it) in the hallway next to our guest room. The workout equipment is getting old. For a hotel of this caliber nothing should be showing its age. We will probably still stay there the next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is simply one of the top hotels in NYC. The service is phenomenal, the property striking, and the service fabulous. There aren't too many better locations to be in midtown, close to shopping, dining, and across the street from central park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The location is indeed fabulous, just within few steps from Central Park. The room is quite luxurious in a Ritz Carlton way. They don't come in a bargain either, but this is NYC! Staff are efficient although somehow I found that their politeness and friendliness are rather "plastic" - not genuinely coming from their heart. However, I have no complain about this hotel at all nor was I super impressed either. The breakfast room is rather uninspiring, however I quite like the bar/lounge area which is small and intimate in sort of English way.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from my second stay at The Ritz Central Park and it was better than before if that is possible. I took my mom there for her 80th birthday and they treated her royally. We had a small issue with the first room as they are doing repair work on the outside of the building and it was loud. They were very reponsive and changed our rooms. They treated us with a birthday cake and a bottle of wine. We love the club level lounge and find it a great place to relax and enjoy the food and beverage selection. The club staff are the best. They reconize you as a returning quest and every request is met with a yes. Best hotel in New York for service, staff and location. The view from 1710 was AMAZING!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Here's a quick story to illustrate the great service: Big surprise: my flight into JFK was delayed and then it took about an hour-and-a-half to get into the city during rush hour. That left me with about a half-hour to check in and to get ready for a big meeting. As I waited to get my keys, a friendly front desk employee offered me a bottle of water and warm welcome. Within a few quick minutes I was in my room, quickly unpacking. I phoned room service for what would be my first of three interactions with Denise, one of the best hotel employees I've ever had the pleasure of dealing with. I explained the situation and she and her team rushed a shrimp cocktail to my room in about 10 minutes! After my meeting, I ordered a Kobe beef burger with avocado - perfectly prepared and again, it was in my room in record time. The next night, I was debating a delicious cobbler because it came with lavendar ice cream. Denise offered to give me a dip of vanilla as well in case I wasn't crazy about the lavendar - turns out, they were both excellent. All three meals were delivered by incredibly friendly waiters as well. Everyone I encountered, from the maids to the doormen to the Spa employees were friendly and efficient. As for the rooms, they are bright and comfortable with an impressive marble bathroom and all the little extras the chain includes, like collar stays, mouthwash, Woolite, etc. The fitness center and locker area are top notch and the location, just down the street from The Plaza, makes it one of the best addresses in the City. I've been extremely blessed to stay in 5-star hotels on 6 continents. While I've always been partial to Four Seasons and Penninsula properties, the Ritz-Carlton Central Park is right up there... this stay put the hotel above even the Dorcester in London when it comes to service. There are plenty of great hotels in NYC... but know that if you pic the Ritz-Carlton Central Park, you will encounter the kind of service that will make you want to come back again soon.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We were treated by our daughter to an all expenses paid weekend at the Ritz, in celebration of her father's retirement and our upcoming anniversary. WHAT a delight! From the moment the valet (Adam) met us, it was the start of the best hotel stay we have ever had, bar none. The reception people were great, the service exemplary, and the accomodations unbelievable. Our room was a king, facing Central Park, incredible view, fabulous furnishings, spotlessly kept. We had drinks at the bar, and were treated like royalty by both Norman and Eric. They are the epitome of what bartenders should be, a true plus for the hotel. I hope everyone gets to enjoy the "Ritz" treatment at least once in their life. We can't wait for the next time!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just a short comment which I feel impelled to make regarding the Park Central where we stayed. We had been looking at cheaper accommodation but am so pleased we stayed at PC as the beds were so big and comfortable. I have never slept so well on holiday. The icing on the cake however was the wonderful assistance we received from Elizabeth of Customer Relations. After a long flight from UK and delays at airports and taxi rides, she was the perfect hostess on arrival in a strange city when we were both tired and worn out. We shall never forget her bright hospitality and she is a great ambassador for the hotel.Best Wishes.Maureen

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Went for a one night stay for a concert at Jazz at Lincoln Center; the hotel is within walking distance. Decided to take advantage of the park with the "summer in the park" package." The hotel arranged everything including bikes and a delightful picnic lunch. There was even a short gondola ride included which I thought was fun. The staff was especially welcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, very clean and comfortable. Slept well. Enjoyed the park view room even on a lower floor but a higher floor is better if you are not interested in the street scene. The food served in the club level lounge is delicious as is in-room dining. Expensive but no complaints.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: New York is an expensive place to visit. When you walk around the city, you realize that New York draws a cosmopolitan visitor, many with plenty of money to spend on lodging and shopping. The Ritz Carlton Central Park has a wonderful location at the southern edge of Central Park close to the highest end shopping the city has to offer. Nearly all of the top, expensive hotels are within a few blocks. So, if you plan to stay here, be prepared to spend a lot of money (more than $1000 per night). Are there other safe, clean hotels in NYC (sure). This was a splurge trip to NYC for me and my family. Our room was very nice (city view) and the bathroom is very good (separate tub and shower and water closet). Room service was impeccable for us and maid service was very professional. All of the other amenities (concierge, front desk, bar, doormen) were very attentive, professional and helpful. We would stay there again.....after I save up enough money!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What do you expect when you stay at The Ritz Carlton's flagship hotel? Everything! The great news is you get exactly that. The property is five-star and the staff is seven-star. I read some of the negative reviews and was surprised at what I read. The property was like a brochure. The room (King, Park View) was perfect. There was nothing out of place and certainly exceeded our expectations. In terms of service....every encounter was personalized and quick. How can you arrive and within 20 minutes, everyone knows your name? The "magic" of The Ritz is why most celebrities and travelers who want everything to be perfect stays here. There's not a better location for families or anyone who wants a magical NYC visit. Need dinner reservations? Call downstairs and you will have them done without any hassles (outside of the Hotel). I highly recommend this property for discerning guests with the highest standards.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with a buddy of mine for one night in late September 2012. We went to NYC for one night to attend a concert at Radio City Music Hall. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted and taken right to the front desk to check in. The room was booked on Marriott points, so we were only given the option of a standard room with 1 king bed. We called ahead to request a room with 2 queens and were told they would do their best because only 15 of the rooms have double beds. Without fail, our request was honored and we were even allowed to check in 3 hours early. Some reviews complain that the lobby was "nothing special". I find it to be just the opposite with all of the rich dark wood covering the walls. It was very opulent, warm and comforting. The common areas and the rooms smell so good in the hotel, it was one of the first things that I noted. We did not have a park view room, our view was of a brick wall. I didn't mind this too much as we were not in our room very much. I found the rooms to be very comfortable and the bathrooms to be very spacious with great amenities. Also, the beds were extremely comfortable. The location is great for exploring central park, an easy walk to radio city and 30 rock, and a so close to many great restaurants and shopping. I would highly recommend!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The price is steep but the servie is worth it. Comfy beds in the most hectic city on earth. Good for short stays but after that you may want a kitchen like myself and wind up in an apartment. The location is central to everything and the concierge is very competent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment the doormen open the front doors you know you are somewhere truly special. When we got to the front desk to check in there was already a card waiting on the counter with our name on it. How do they do it?! The doormen greeted us by name as we walked by. How do they do it? Our room was an interior view but we could still see sky so it felt okay. Bathroom was just beautiful with deep tub and separate shower stall and toilet room. Lovely bath products and amenities such as RC collar stays. At one point a bottle of champagne appeared. Comfortable bed, perfect location and friendly people. The ultimate in any hotel wish list.
user_name:
sksaledtan
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have been in residence at this property for YEARS and never once had an issue! Location perfect, close to and for days of sightseeing, shopping, eating and the best theater in the world BROADWAY. For the first time visitor(s) do the hop on hop off buss and spend an hour or so being driven around learning about areas you might not have time to visit real-time during your firsts stay. NOW Time Square is NOT the end all be all place to hang out, don't do it don't do it. I hear from friends and other travelers that they spent most of their time in Time Square and left thinking NYC was not all that great. Ok, from the time you drive up to the unassuming doors and the gentlemen meet and greet you with a sincere welcome, you know your in for nothing but the most humble gracious serves! And yes that's what happens. Walk through the doors smell that intoxicating sent in the air and turn left and greet the front desk staff, they will assure each guest they are welcome and at their beckon call for any need you might have!! As the staff guides you to the elevator look left and see the welcoming finely appointed gathering area, they also serve a perfect High Tea. Then into the elevators and up to your guest room, jr. suite or suite, and when booking I suggest a corner Ave/Park view suite and of course the higher you go the better the view, winter, summer, spring or fall the views of Central Park never fail to impress. I also suggest you book a club level suite, or a room/suite with club level access. The Club Room is on the 2nd floor oh shoot is it the 3rd floor? You'll find it. The many "presentations" daily are creative and just plain YUMMY! It's world class style all the way. I have in-laws that can't keep the NYC pace so this is the perfect place to plop them into and go see the city. The rooms will not disappoint the bathrooms will entice you to primp a little longer and a soak in the tub will ensure you made the right choice to stay here. I had the great pleasure of meeting Ms. Cynthia Chung while in residence one stay, if you ever get to meet this AMAZING woman, you will never forget it! She knows EVERYTHING about her property and it's guests. She is one of the most distinguish woman I have ever met. Room serves is superb and served with impeccable grace and style, the bath and pillow menus will temp you to try new products and ensure a pleasant slumber. If you want over the top morsels for dinner, your just an elevator ride away. Men will need a jacket and you women get away with whatever you wear. This is such an elegant dining experience and the flavors will open new taste buds in your mouth, and begging for more. Now for those of you who want to know the "score" just go next door and take that jacket off, order a beer and watch all the sports you want. I feel like I could go on and on about this property... They are extremely pet friendly and my Westies LOVE driving to the front doors and getting to check in and get to their park view suite and lounge on the window sills and watch out the windows at the park and horses down below. Gosh have I covered everything? If not let me know, always happy to assist. Travel smart/safe and enjoy. B
user_name:
TheTrvlGuy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: True Ritz doesn't disappoint. The staff are knowledgeable, helpful and kind. The location is close to all we wanted eg. Time Square, Central Park, subway etc. yes it is pricy but that is the Ritz way. Bed was comfortable, room had great view. Could not ask for anything more.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my second stay at the Ritz Carlton at Central Park and, I'm happy to say, it's still my preferred hotel in New York City. My wife and I were greeted at reception as old friends and this set the tone of the service for the remainder of our stay. I booked a city view room and was pleasantly surprised when our attendant pressed the elevator button for the 22nd floor. I was completely blown away when the door opened to a room with uninterrupted views of Central Park. We'd been upgraded and this was the PERFECT way for them to break the news! The surprises kept coming at breakfast when we were shown into the hotel's newly opened restaurant. I mean "newly opened" in that it was still "closed for renovations" the night before. Like the rest of the hotel, the restaurant is simple, low-key sophistication. As mentioned by many other reviewers, the rooms are elegant and the bedding is first rate. We felt like we were sleeping in a warm cloud. We quickly fell into a deep sleep and were only woken by the alarm we set the night before. The only hiccup was that our room was set-up for a guest of Islamic faith. Being an Atheist, I had no need for a Koran, didn't need to know the direction of Mecca and would have liked some booze in my mini bar. This said, I couldn't help but think how impressed I would be if I were indeed a Muslim.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my report of my visit to New York City, the best city of the world.I want to share my experience in New York with everybody, probably somebody can use it. We didn’t know what to do, if to flight Lan Chile or Tam. We decided for Tam.Everybody says Lan Chile, in my opinion the best is Tam. With a short time change of plane in Sao Paulo, it was the best flight I’ve ever experienced. It can only be compared to Swissair ( I went to Zurich years ago). Great plane, clean, immaculate service, delicious food…the best airline. I don’t understand why nobody talks about.AAs hotel we choose the Ritz Carlton Hotel. t arrival, we were at the hotel in less than 2 hours. We were not wrong, this hotel has the perfect location, right on Central Park close to the best shopping and elegance of New York.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My first time staying at the NY Ritz and I was not disappointed.
