The doormen and the front desk were very helpful (however, I was disappointed that we were not offered the check in glass of champagne that I am used to at the Ritz...it was there behind the counter, but not offered). The room was large and quiet with all of the extra ammenities expected of a luxury hotel. Had light dinner in the lobby bar, which was very nice, while the restaurant was being renovated.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Rock star views (outstanding), elegant , charming, great wines and concierge level treats at the lounge.Uptight & distant service, awful room service, awful attention on the phone.The concierge is kind if you go to him or her personally but not by phone, they are always busy.The suites need blackouts!The lounge needs an espresso coffee machine.. and a toaster...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed to celebrate my wife's birthday. Great location, extraordinary service. My wife loved her treatments at the la prairie spa. The rooms were beautiful; very comfortable Yes, it's very expensive but this is a unique place in that it is located in one of the most desirable locations in the world. It was a great stay. If you can afford it, we highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I recently completed a three-night stay at this property. First off, the location is terrific. So close to Central Park, great shopping and some great restaurants. Times Square and the Theater District are also fairly close by.The service we received from the staff was excellent. We interacted with the front desk staff, the concierge staff and, of course, the doormen. Everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and pampered. Joe, the lead doorman, is one of a kind.The rooms are nice overall. The bed and linens are top notch. My wife and I both slept very well all three nights, which is atypical for a hotel stay. The only downside to our room was our shower, which leaked water all over the bathroom floor each time we showered.We will definitely return to this property.One word of caution for those visiting NYC: stay away from the pedicabs. Many of them are scam artists and will charge you an EXORBITANT amount of money for a short trip. They can legally charge you anything they want to and something needs to be done about them. If you must use one, make sure you negotiate the fare before you get on board, and make sure you understand the fare is PER PERSON.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Enjoyed our long anniversary weekend at the ritz. Everyone was lovely and very accommodating. The club lounge was fantastic. Just didn't like the pillows....too soft. But I won't quibble...great place to stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Wow is all I can say, we went to New York to celebrate our 42nd anniversary and picked this hotel because we had stayed there once before. They really made our time with them special, always remembering our names and the fact that it was our anniversary. Room was spectacular with a great view of Central Park, concierge made great recommendations that contributed to a great memory. Would definitely go there again!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stay because a friend was celebrate her daughter birthday in Eloise at the Park. Great experience. Service, ambiance was amazing. Highly recommended because they trick you like a queen. If you wants to have dinner go to quality meat. They have fabulous steaks

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Spent four nights and enjoyed it a lot! I wouldn't mind going back, but I'd probably try somewhere else on my next visit to NYC, just to be fun. Some notes:- No digital clocks in the room... nice analog clocks for a change! - Workout facility in-house, reasonably good enough and clean. No pool onsite, but access is given to a nearby gym at reasonable rates apparently. - Small but beautiful elevators- Only hotel that I have been to that has Opus One and Johnny Blue bottles available for purchase in each room. - We had free wi-wi in room- We had Club access and that is our favorite way to go at the Ritz. Some pros and cons include: * Lots of food and coffee when needed * Some flies on cheese * Helpful and nice people / service * Great breakfast * Repeated menu EVERY single day... a bit boring. - Got free parking with one of my rooms, but not the other. Would have been $65/day (!) - Nice amount of pens, paper, soaps, and other useful items in room including currency power converter for international devices- Choice of AM newspapers- Extremely fair at checkout... anything we didn't agree with was immediately taken off our bill. Cons:- Horses hang out across the street and often lobby has horse-smell. - Cigarette smell in EACH of three hotel rooms that I was in during my stay. After about 5 minutes in the room you wont notice it any more. - Very few, if any, rooms with two beds in them... - The employee's two way radios do not work in every room, causing delays- In room safe is too small for laptop- Welcome water was offered by front desk, but could have been helpful in the room instead. - Requested to see if an upgrade was available at checkin -- maybe, but only for additional money. - Do not even think of getting a room not facing central park in this hotel. Not only does it not face central park, it faces NOTHING. We moved out of this smelly room immediately. - Draws are small in room- Only one luggage rack in our room- Relatively small rooms to other Ritz properties I've been to
user_name:
AlvinMonk
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Central Park for 5 nights in July.This was our second stay and we simply couldn’t find anywhere else in NYC that we’d rather be! We had 3 rooms in what I must describe as the best, most comfortable hotel we have ever stayed in. Everything was immaculately clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff were polite, friendly and helpful.The location is great, just step out of the front door and you’re in Central park, or around the corner to 5th Avenue, or a ten minute walk to Times Square.A special mention for the concierge George Domenick who for me is the model of the perfect concierge.Yes the hotel is expensive, but worth every penny. We’ll be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything perfect during our last trip. Club lounge excellent and have to give special mention to Laza- a real character and great fun.. But all were staff excellent, friendly and elcoming without being in any way over th top. I wouldnt stay anywhere else in NYC

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I LOVE this hotel. It is perfectly located, beautiful rooms, extremely clean, excellent staff and very quiet. I have stayed in many hotels in NYC and this is now my favorite hotel in the city. You can walk to many attractions from this location and there are a variety of subway stations within 1-3 blocks of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious. If you are going to NYC treat yourself to this wonderful hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel is absolutely fabulous in terms of location, staff and service but it appears to be deteriorating. There is no bar or hotel restaurant, although there is one that is currently being renovated. The general appearance of the common areas and the lackluster approach to details was truly unimpressive for a property of this stature and with this potential. The views over the park were truly incredible (request this and if available, take it), the rooms and bathrooms were spacious but it lacks refined service levels. Housekeeping services were mediocre. The concierge did not fulfill my preorder. At the same time the help from the doormen and the front desk were impeccable.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: we recently stayed at The Ritz Carlton new York, Central park and i personally couldn't think of a bad work to say about it. on arrival our bags were taken for us straight up to our rooms which meant we didn't have too struggle with out bags in the lifts. when checking in the reception staff saw we where all tired from a long flight and got us all a bottle of ice cold water to refresh us. when we went to our rooms they where all lovely! they where all really smart and couldn't fault out room at all. we only had one small problem in one of our rooms and as soon as we mentioned this to the staff they couldn't be more sorry, moved us to a better room and gave our whole family a complimentary meal in there lounge. most of the time there was someone on the door to great us and open the doors for us.we needed to get from the hotel to the airport to catch our domestic flight down to florida, we mentioned this to the concierge and they ordered us a taxi and made sure it was ready for us. when we where getting into the taxi the door man put all our bags in the boot for the journey and wished us well on our travels.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed in the Ritz Carlton for 5 nights for my son's wedding in Central Park. The staff were excellent and could not have done anymore for us. The room overlooking Central Park was fantastic and as someone else commented, the shower was fantastic. Extremely comfortable, clean and very spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would definitely stay there next time we are in NYC.On the downside, we booked the hotel through Virgin Holidays, who neglected to advise us that the bar and restaurant were undergoing refurbishment and were closed. Therefore, if you wanted a drink or breakfast outside your room, they were only available in the foyer lounge area, which whilst it was lovely for sitting and watching the world go by, was not the same as sitting in the bar after a long days sightseeing or having a quite breakfast. Don't get me wrong though, this was not the fault of the Ritz Carlton, but Virgin who should notify customers of renovations in the properties they offer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights in a connectIng two bedroom suite on the fourth floor overlooking Central Park with our two kids, ages 4 and 12. The rooms were very large and although a higher room would have afforded a more expansive view of the park, our kids loved watching the horse carriages, vendors, and tourists walking in and around the park. Pros:Phenomenal service, especially when dealing with the multiple problems with our tvs.Great location by Central Park, the Zoo, and a very cool water play structure inside the Park.Beds are beyond comfortable!Concierge floor lounge serves delicious light breakfast, light dinner, snacks and drinks. Cons:Not overtly kid-friendly. Tiny lobby restaurant.No pool. All in all, definitely a touch notch hotel in a very convenient location, but don't go expecting special family amenities.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: For the steep prices of the Ritz Carlton, the service would be acceptable at a low tier marriott, not when you're paying a thousand dollars a night. The Ritz Carlton Central Park used to be our favorite hotel in New York City. It was very disappointing to see how much the service had declined. The room was clean and the bathrooms were nice, but the overall service was below average, especially for a Ritz. Prior to checking in to our hotel, we had special requests that were unfulfilled when we arrived. In the past for special anniversaries/birthdays, the staff had always made the experience more special. We are hoping that these issues are resolved.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz, Central Park from 9 July 2012 to 15 July and again from 22 July to 24 July (I has travelled to Florida in the interim). I was on Honeymoon with my new wife and neither of us had stayed at a Ritz Carlton hotel before. I chose the hotel, because it had consistently high ratings on the Internet, both from experts and everyday guests. Firstly, the location of the hotel is a dream. It sits on the corner of 6th Ave and Central Park South. For those of you are unfamiliar with the layout of Manhattan, that means you will be a 10 minute walk from Times Square, 5 minutes from 5th Avenue (a shoppers paradise) and about 30 seconds from Central Park. It is a prime location and Central Park South is widely considered to be the street with the best hotels in NYC. I was offered 3 types of deluxe rooms: a standard; a city view and a park view. The prices go up in that order by about $50 per night. I chose the city view, as I was more keen to get a view of the streets of NYC. I asked to be high up, expecting a rooftop view and was given a room on the 16th floor. Unfortunately, only when I got to the room did I realize that hotel is surrounded by some pretty tall buildings and so the view that you get is simply the side surface of surrounding buildings. Nevertheless, you get amazing views of the streets below. My room was on 6th Ave and almost at the central park corner, so I also had a partial park view. The view of the park was lovely, and there was even a fireworks display from the park one night. In retrospect, if I was expecting to spend a lot of time in the room, I would definitely opt for the park view room. As for the room itself... All I can says it that it was true 5-star luxury. Modern cushioned wallpaper welcomes you, with vintage furniture pieces interspersed throughout the room. The deluxe room was very comfortably sized, with a work-desk, a coffee table and 2 single-seater vintage chairs to complement the king-size bed and flatscreen TV. Another hotel that I had previously stayed at while in NYC had an ultra-modern look, which made it feel quite cold and not welcoming. The Ritz was quite the opposite. Low lighting throughout the room and subtle colors make you feel like royalty. The room was very clean with extremely luxurious bedding. The bathroom was a masterpiece on its own. A modern marble look greets you and luxury doesn't begin to describe the impression it creates. As for the service staff, they were truly amazing. We received individual service and were always greeted with a smile. There's always complimentary fresh coffee and a range of teas in the lobby area for those who are getting an early start to the day. The hotel has a La Prairie brand spa which I went to with my wife, but I will discuss this in a separate review. Overall, I can say without a doubt that this is the grandest hotel I have ever stayed in. It's has the kind of luxury which is understated enough to let you know it's there without looking like it's been put there to grab attention. This hotel rivals the attractions of Manhattan by putting them at arms reach, but at the same time providing you with a reason to sleep in every now then.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After a disappointing last trip away I needed luxury and ritz definitely delivered! Food, service, everything to the highest standard, Fantastic!!! If there was a sixth star the ritz would be the first to have it as it flew past the 5 star mark with ease!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: For many years I have enjoyed the Ritz Carlton Central Park, and, in particular, the Club Room. This was not the case this last weekend. First of all, we had requested early check-in, which we fully realize is not guaranteed. What we were not prepared for, however, was that our room would not be ready until almost a full hour after check-in time. This seemed to be the fault of Housekeeping, which indeed is not what it used to be. Formerly, you never saw tacky housekeeping carts in the hall. This time, not only were they in the hall but left there overnight. We were disappointed to find that our bath towels were very threadbare -- shouldn't Housekeeping be taking these out of circulation? This is, after all, the Ritz, at very steep prices. But most of all, the Club Room disappointed. It appears that the hotel is overselling the Club Room, resulting in very crowded conditions -- similar to an airport lounge. And when would you have expected to see small children in the Club Room standing on chairs and jumping off them? Isn't the Club Room supposed to provide a serene experience? I felt sorry for the Club Room personnel who have been there for years -- you could tell they were embarrassed by the crowds. Hotel management needs to rethink their policies -- possibly limiting club access to older children. All in all, this was our first disappointing experience at the Ritz.
user_name:
newyorker905
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is the second stay at the Central Park south location. Have stayed downtown at Battery Park. The hotel and its facilities are first rate and accessible to mid-town. Stayed on in a park room on the 20th floor with club access. The shower was fantastic - high pressure, consistent temperature, roomy with Asprey shampoos- one of the best I have experienced! The club was very busy with many celebs . I heard this distinctive voice behind me during breakfast and it was the Ewing brothers (Bobby-Patrick Duffy and JR - Larry Hagman). Ran into Charlie Sheen and his bodyguard in the elevator. Staff from his show were everywhere. Club staff were very accommodating and helpful with broadway tickets, restaurant reservations, and access to 9/11 memorial.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Top shelf location with incredible view from suite overlooking Central Park. Check in/check out were a breeze, the hotel staff were accomodating. Price was incredibly steep (not an exceptual value) Only negative mark was the bartender in the bar at the hotel, older gentleman seemed like he has been there forever as was full of himself and aggitated.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have stayed at several Ritz-Carlton's including, but not limited to those in Grand Cayman, Jamaica, New Orleans and St. Thomas. This one is not as nice as the one in Grand Cayman or New Orleans or St. Thomas. The facilities in those locations are nicer and the staff, believe it or not, are better there, particularly in Grand Cayman which is truly beyond belief. This is not to say the staff at Central Park Ritz are not nice and helpful. They are, but I rank the Central Park Ritz about an 7.5 on a 10 scale. Examples of so-so service include the 4 calls it took just to reach someone at the front desk not at a busy time. It seems they just didn't want to answer their phone. And, in the club, it was clear that those who were regulars at this location rated better service as I was wholly ignored for long stretches while they conversed with them. The room was a king central park view which was nice, but small and nothing special in comparison to what you would see at other destinations, particularly for the $$$$ you spend for such a room. For example, in St. Thomas, you get more than twice the room quality and size for 2/3 the money. A glass of champagne in this facility will run you $35 and that is for a quality that you could buy a bottle for in a liquor store for $40. With all the foregoing said, it is a nice hotel, I just would not get club access next time as it is not worth it. The food and alcohol there are not that much or special. The highest floor my type of room could be obtained was the 9th floor which is okay, but if you really want a nice view, you have to pay much more to get higher. My room with club access and the view was $1K per night. If I was going to stay on Central Park, then I would consider the hotel again. If not, I would consider other locations as there are many options. I give it only 3/5 due to the value for what you get.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you want a view of central park, then this hotel is one of the few places that offer that.We stayed a night at a King Bed Central Park view room. The highest floor for this type of room was the 9th so although we had a view of the park, it was only 50ft or so above the tree line. So if you're expecting to be able to see the park in all its glory, you'll need to stump up for a more superior room.Park views aside, the room was an OK size. Decorated in the style that you would expect from the Ritz (not modern) but extremely comfortable...and a great bathroom.What makes this a 5 star review are all the nice touches that we were treated to, including chocolate covered strawberries in the room on arrival; a delicious birthday cake waiting for us after we returned from dinner; staff at our beck and call for whenever we needed the smallest thing; all the staff knowing you by name; the best spa treatment ever (according to wife), etc...Highly recommended for a special occasion.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We received such personalised service. The staff were so welcoming and genuinely pleasant. It was such an oasis to walk into after a busy day out. Our children were greeted with a lovely stuffed toy and our daughter was given a complimentary birthday cake even though her birthday was several days after we were due to leave. The view from our suite over Central Park was amazing and was just like the photos on the website. We also had club level and again were greeted by the same people each day who were so nice. The restaurant was being refurbished which was a shame but Club level definitely made up for it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I wanted to visit the Central Park Zoo so I decided to stay at the Ritz, within a five minute walk I was there. I only spent one night but it was an excellent one. The room was large and bright, highest quality. Little additions like the collar tabs make the difference. The staff was also top notch - kudos to Victor for the great service.Unfortunately the bar was closed for renovations - I was really looking forward to having a drink or three there but I'll make it a point to stop in next time I'm in Manhattan.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Although our room on the club floor had a lousy view of the windows of an abutting building, the room, hotel, amenities and the location are superb. The only negative is that the grout lines on the shower tiles had mold and someone left a insulin pen in the minibar refrigerator. Other than those minor issues this place is awesome. We will return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed here last week for a long weekend. As other reviewers have said, this hotel is an oasis in the middle of the hustle & bustle of the the city. Located directly on the south end of Central Park between 5th & 6th avenues, it is in a great location - walkable to Park Avenue shopping, Rockefeller Center & and even Times Square (although that might be a bit long for some). Easy subway access, too. We paid extra for club level access - thoroughly worth it when you consider all of the food and drink offerings. For example, my cocktail in the Hotel's lounge was $18 but was free when I ordered it in the Club. The hotel gym, though not large, is adequate. Only 4 treadmills;however, there was never any one else in the facility. The concierge desk was extremely helpful & friendly - they appeared very busy most of the time. No real complaints at all. We had friends staying in a hotel next door & they couldn't sleep one night because of a thunderstorm that went through. Not an issue at all at the Ritz. Very good insulation & the our cooling system ran almost constantly providing a white noise. We stayed 3 nights at the Peninsula (on 5th Avenue) 6 months ago. Their hotel & rooms seemed very comparable to the Ritz but my husband & I felt that the staff at the Rtitz just seemed a notch above the Peninsula.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect location right by Central Park (we had a view from our room) and also close to most of the other tourist attractions.The hotel itself is immaculate with probably the most service orientated and well-trained staff we have encountered.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz on Central Park is in a great location. The rooms are very nice, large and comfortable. Being across from Central Park and all the great shops of New York is convenient. We have also stayed there several times with our Yellow Lab and the hotel goes out of their way to accomodate our dog. They always bring her a dog bed, a bowl for food and water. The Club Lounge is also excellent. They have a great selection of food and the service is excellent. If you want to enjoy a great location, very nice hotel near all the shops and restaurants the Ritz is an excellent choice.
user_name:
baci2003
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have spent both a couples and a mom/daughter weekend here. Pure indulgence. Expensive, but very special for a special occasion. The staff and concierge level attendees were fantastic. The level of service is exactly what you would expect from a Ritz. Five stars.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Make sure you get a room with a view of the park. Pay extra to have access to the lounge where you have gourmet free food and drink. This includes breakfast, lunch and heavy appetizers in the evening. The beds and linens are fabulous and the service is excellent.
user_name:
Debbiewebbbbie
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Friendly and efficient reception staff, they are truly amazing. It's a great value of of money. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They were very willing to assist us in getting around New York City and even drew a map for us. Beautiful hotel and great location!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here for three nights and it is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The location is perfect but it is the staff that make this hotel. They are truly amazing. The rooms are magnificent and we were lucky enough to be given a view of Central Park. i cannot recommend this hotl highly enough!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We arrived here Tuesday for 3 days and have just extended, this is a true oasis and a stunning hotel, we have a city view suite and the space is very good and the service exceptional, the young lady that took us to the room picked up that my wife was not well, she then went out and got a "Get well card", exceptional (Thankyou so much Tuscany) what a nice thought. Room service and the greetings here all perfect. I have tried other NYC hotels W in Times Sq, Essex on Central Park and they are put in the shade by this place. A delighted client.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed 8 nights and were delighted with this hotel. Walk able to Central Park, Times Square, Empire State. Great value for money.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It's hard to beat the Ritz Carlton's location on 59th (Central Pk. South) but of course you pay for location. The rates are up there. We loved the ambiance, room decor and service. We were a little suprised at the limited capcity (small size) of the lobby bar because, given the (great) location, the place is always crowded not only with guests but with people just seeking a cool place to hang out. Still, if money is not a factor I would definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Visited in June for my wife's birthday and the hotel couldn't have been better. Amazing location and great Ritz rooms, but what makes the hotel fantastic are the amazing staff who just don't seem to be able to do enough for you. The concierge staff were outstanding but all of them from the doorman to the staff in the club louge just make you feel at home. A perfect hotel for a perfect New York stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A beautiful hotel in a fabulous location, across the road from Central Park. Although we did not get a Central Park view, the room we had was stunning. The bed was so comfortable and the bathroom was immense. The Staff were extremely helpful and made us feel very welcome. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again over Times Square hotels where I have previously stayed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Staff continually recognize their guests throughout their stay. They truly wish to accomodate your desires. The staff offered assistance before we asked for it. The concierge took great pleasure in making food recommendations, immediatly provided directions from off the top of their head without having to look up anything. One night we had a show to see and wanted a reservation following the show...the concierge looked up the show length and made a reservation at a time that followed the show end time and allowed time to travel to the restaurant. All recommendations were great. I went to run in Central Park on Friday and they offered water up my return without me asking for it. They inquired about the length of my run and two days later remembered me and asked if I was going to run again. We called for ice and they quickly fulfilled the request with no follow up. The spa was wonderful and staff were experts in their trade. Very knowledgeable and courteous, wish I had gone to the spa sooner, went on the last day as they have a steam room within the spa. They also have a relaxation area and a music menu to select the type of music you wish to experience for your treatment. Staff were very nice and welcoming without pressuring one to purchase their La Prairie products. They sent a complementary gift up to the room following the spa service. Look forward to my return to this hotel!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First time in this NYC hotel. Excellent location. We walked to many sites, but cabs are available or subways close. Room was located on the inside corridor. No views, but also no street noise. Room was bigger than I expected. Bathrooms clean and neatly organized.We appreciated the quiet of this hotel. Stayed over a weekend, which can be noisy. But not here. Got the sense you were in an isolated location. Very nice. Didn't eat at the hotel. Too many places which were close.Staff was probably the friendliest I have ever encountered. Anything we needed, they were there to help.Would definately stay again and recommend to others.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: but the prince sadly turned into a frog. I erred on the side of generosity but 3.5 stars would have been more accurate. This hotel has a lot going for it as far as the hardwiring is concerned- to start the location is perfection - around the corner from Fifth Avenue and right across from Central Park. You have the best of New York laid at your feet. The rooms are timelessly elegant and generous in size. The bed among the best I have ever experienced... BUT to quote Gertrude Stein "There is no there there". The staff and service, the soul of any great hotel, are wildly disparate and range from truly excellent to borderline disgruntled. Several times there was no one at the door including when I first arrived with luggage in the middle of the afternoon and after arriving back after the theatre late at night. Check in was somewhat perfunctory and it was the first time I was not upgraded as an Amex Plat card holder which is fair enough if they have no rooms available however upon check-in the guaranteed late checkout of 4pm was confirmed by the clerk at her initiative which I did appreciate. On my final day, at a little after the regular check out time I received a call thanking me for the stay and well, in short asking me to leave! Taken aback but thinking this was a misunderstanding, I assured the clerk that the guaranteed check out at 4pm was confirmed by one of his colleagues but instead of apologizing he just asked me when I would leave and said that my keycard (which is used for both the room and elevator and was faulty the entire time of my 3 night stay) would no long work and if I intended on staying I would have to come to the front desk. I was so disgusted I packed up and left with a very bitter taste in my mouth and astonished at the rudest treatment I have ever experienced at any hotel. I am the type of person who always checks out 5 minutes before the time and If they were pressured for rooms they could have handled this a lot better. To add insult to injury the bill contained several mischarges in the favor of the hotel including all three breakfasts (which were included in my rate) charged as lunch. It was quickly remedied but still this shouldn't happen at a hotel of this caliber. While I rather like this hotel doesn’t have a large impersonal lobby it is missing a great bar like Bemelmans at the Carlyle or the King Cole Bar at the St. Regis. Most importantly and sadly, however, I found the Ritz-Carlton Central Park lacking in any sort of graciousness or charm.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend in April. I was a little bit wary when we first checked in because the hotel seemed a little bit pretentious for us, but my concerns were quickly alleviated. The staff at this hotel are all extremely friendly and eager to help. But the best part of the hotel is the room. I spend 150+ nights/year in hotel rooms and this one was by far my favorite. The room was bright with a great view of the park, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom and bedroom were both large enough that my husband and I never felt like we were getting in each others way. Unfortunately, my husband and I both got food poisoning on this trip (not from eating at this hotel), but if it had to happen I am glad we were at this hotel. That may be the only downside - the room is so nice you don't want to leave it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed here during our holiday in New York, and part of the reason we enjoyed our holiday was the amazing service and professionalism displayed by the Ritz Carlton. The food was great, the decor classy, and the service was prompt, friendly and very pleasing. Our room was very good and worth the money we paid for!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I flew into Philadelphia, rented a car and drove to New York to stay at the Ritz-Carlton Battery Park where we had made reservations a couple months earlier. Our GPS took us to the Central Park location instead of Battery Park...we had unloaded our car and they had parked it before we realized the mistake. Instead of being treated like tourists who didn't have a clue (which we were) they quickly found us a room in this location. However, we wanted to stay in the Ritz where we made reservations. They graciously let us leave our car at their hotel, found us a cab and sent us on our way. When we arrived at the Battery Park location we were treated like royalty and they continued to pamper us for the remainder of our stay. The concierge was very helpful in helping us zone in on the best things the city has to offer for our short stay. The concierge ordered us a limo, after 6 hours of walking from lower Manhattan to mid town, to see the city at night and he was one of the drivers for the Apprentice contestants...he drove us all night to see the city that never sleeps...he was wonderful, informative and a great historian...We never met an unfriendly person in all of New York and the staff (and luscious rooms) made it a trip worth remembering!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Ender, the accomplished and passionate welcoming host who escorted my wife and I to our beautiful room, overlooking Central Park, gushed when he talked about the pride that he and the other employees of The Ritz Carlton Central park shared. 24 hours we checked out fully convinced that they had every rite to be proud. In the Ritz Carlton world, one that always demonstrates superior service, the Ritz Carlton stands tall. In the world of normal hotels.... they don't stand a chance. Awesome in every move. Not a single slip. Room was perfect and just what we had expected. Employees I had not even met greeted us by name (I've got to figure out how they do that? Do they have pictures of guests in the employee lounge?)... everyone greeted us with that warm "welcome home". It was a one night trip up to see a Barry Manilow concert at Radio City. We mentioned that to the staff when we checked in. After a great evening on the town and at the concert, we returned to our room to find Chocolate Covered Strawberries, the lights and bed turned down and a Barry Manilow romantic CD playing in the Bose sound system. My wife freaked... a note accompanied the CD indicating that it was a gift to help us remember our visit with them.... are you kidding me. New York, Central Park, Ritz Carlton... your going to pay, but who cares? This hotel and this staff have no rivals if it is an exceedingly memorable visit to New York you desire. If you're just looking for a cheap bed, this is not your place. Highlights are the Location, Central Park, Staff, The club lounge. Like all in New York, the rooms are relatively small, but better than most. The hotel is old, but fresh. One of the top properties in the US. Bar none.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great little hotel. Understated elegance right next to Central Park. Wonderful experience and service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotels lives and breathes customer service - any aspiring hotelier should stay here to learn how it is done!My wife and I were treated like royalty with nothing a problem.It was very welcome as we wound down having spent 10 days in NYC.The rooms are luxuries and the bed very comfortable - the lication is spectacular as you walk out onto central park.A wonderful Swedish massage was just the right tonic to end the trip off.The hotel is costly but worth it especially when considering other hotels are just as costly but don't offer half the service and amenitie.Stay here and you won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was our first visit to New York, and our first time at a Ritz Carlton.Check in was smooth, Concierge service very helpful and knowledgeable. A complimentary glass of champagne with check in definitely helped! The room was much more spacious than we expected, given its central location. Very well appointed, luxurious bathroom. We booked 2 of the deluxe rooms, each sleeping 4 persons, and we had plenty of room.Room service could be slow. We ordered tea and coffee making facilities for our room, and when room service messed up on our order, we were offered a complimentary breakfast in the hotel restaurant which more than made up for the mistake!This hotel is ideal, a family friendly central location for sight seeing.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Every time we go, we think things would change and not be as good. Not so--this is a great hotel with a great location. They are extremely helpful, especially after our long, long trip from Capetown. They even went to the drug store for me. We aways get the Hospitality Floor, so if we are too tired to go out, we have a home away from home. Great evening hors d'ouvres. Housekeeping is great. Staff are friendly. No glitches for us!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The price for the room was over $700 and it did not include breakfast. The staff is stif, and not friendly. The one good thing is the location; central park is beautiful.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Have stayed in this hotel numerous times in the past 10 years and come back for the location and beautiful rooms. It is a great night's sleep in the City that Never Sleeps. Still, for the price, glitches we encountered were unsettling. The front desk did not have a record of the room discount booked through American Express. Getting a check to sign at breakfast in the lounge was painfully slow all three days, music in the lounge was turned up to excruciating levels one morning and the 'renovation' of the restaurant was disappointing, there have been at least 3 restaurant concepts in the past 12 years. Still housekeeping staff is wonderful, the hotel's intimate size and polite fellow guests add to its attractiveness and I just wish they would pair a bit more efficiency and accuracy with their location and other merits.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is my favorite hotel in New York. The service is amazing, the views of central park breathtaking, the rooms beautiful, and the location fantastic. We have stayed there a few times and I always look forward to returning. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the bistro but they are renovating it to a more upscale restaurant. Meanwhile you can have breakfast at the beautiful lobby/bar area. The service is the best I have ever experienced. They remember your name, ask you about your family, and be happy to see you. You feel welcomed in this hotel and they will go out of their way to help you. Among the amazing people who work there I must single out Ender Ozmelek as a true gem! He is not only friendly and welcoming but will also make you feel at home. For example, he always arranges for a Greek newspaper to be delivered to our room along with NY Times, without us having to ask for it. For me this hotel approaches perfection!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My friends and I spent the weekend in New York City and chose to stay at the Ritz Carlton for a number of reasons. Who knew it would be the absolute best choice for us. We were treated with the utmost of care. Brain Drab and Jorge made sure we were not only in a magnificent room but every question we had was answered before we asked. We almost stayed at another hotel in the city and could not be more thankful that we instead stayed at this Ritz Carlton!! Can't wait to return to this wonderful property and people!! Thank you!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: this was a top hotel for quality, service, friendliness and location, would recommend to anyone and return myself in the future!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The service here is great. More incredible than the design is the service. Wish I could come here everyday..

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Loved this hotel, classy yet not brash. The service was spot on, as was the food.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had such a nice room facing the park, so the sunrises were so beatiful. I also recommend their club lounge level rooms as presentations were absolutely great! It was nice to go out and return to the hotel for one of their signature treats. Hotel's locations is great. Only minus was that some of the people working at front desk were not up for the job compared to other Ritz-Carlton location, but maybe it was just NY style service(?). Concierge however exceeded our expectations.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz on Central Park with our 2 children and my in-laws for a week April 7- 14. It was a wonderful experience and I would definitely stay here again.Our experience began a week before we arrived when the concierge desk helped me make arrangements for airport transportation, and some restaurant reservations. Everyone at the concierge desk was helpful and friendly, but Brian and Tim were especially wonderful! Their suggestions for restaurants and hints for sightseeing were perfect! In fact, our best meal of the trip was at Quality Meats (Tim's suggestion).Shortly after we checked in, treats were delivered to all of our rooms...lovely fruit bowls for the adults rooms and a bowl full of cookies and chocolate candies to my children's room. This was an unexpected treat and was a big hit, especially with my girls.We were in 2 connecting rooms on the 19th floor and a suite on the 18th floor. All the rooms were spacious and clean, with very large bathrooms. The suite was a city view suite, but even had incredible park views from the living room. Beds were very comfortable and linens were soft and luxurious.We ate breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant. The food was delicious and plentiful, and the service was outstanding. The French toast and the hot chocolate were especially delicious! The only negative experience we had at the hotel involved the lounge area. The lounge area itself is lovely and the seating is comfortable. Unfortunately, one of the lounge employees named Lisa is truly unpleasant. On 2 different occasions, she got our order wrong. Neither time did she offer to correct it, and seemed irritated when we pointed out the errors. Thankfully, she was the only negative in our week at the Ritz.The location of the hotel (on the south end of Central Park) made it perfect for walking to most destinations (museums, shopping and Times Square are all within easy walking distance). When we didn't feel like walking, the doormen were quick to arrange the house car or a taxi. The doormen are all wonderful! They always greet you with a smile and kind word, and most greeted us by name.This property is outstanding in so many ways, but the incredible customer service is what truly sets it apart from others. I can't wait to return!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: When The Ritz-Carlton opened in what was previously the St. Mortiz Hotel they had a celebrity chef in the restaurant at the corner of Central Park South and 6th Avenue. They have since dumbed-down this restaurant. Gone are the carpeting and tablecloths, replaced with an unpolished hardwood floor and plastic placemats. The decor includes antique farm implements (in the middle of Manhattan???). Two of the light fixtures had burned out bulbs, very unusual for a Ritz-Carlton. The breakfast menu is uninteresting, uninspired and un-New York. Your local Denny's has a better, more creative selection. Service OK; food very average but also very expensive. There are too many other choices in New York. Don't waste your money here.Postscript: The above was written on a Sunday. On Monday, this restaurant was closed permanently, apparently to be replaced by a retail shop and a smaller dining room with a "new" concept.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband surprised me for my birthday and we stayed here for one night. I wished we could have stayed longer but had to meet the moving van in CT the next day. Service was excellent and really made us feel welcomed. We had a larger room and loved the bath tub space! It was in a great location close to activities. We really didn't have too much time to explore the lobby and bar but they did seem nice. Parking is a bit expensive but it is NYC. Would love to return and stay longer.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I visited the Park Central Hotel, which is conveniently located across the street from Carnegie Hall and near Central Park. It is within walking distance to the theatre distance and many wonderful shops and restaurants. Hotel staff, especially Ellen, are very professional. The rooms are nicely sized. The bedding was luxurious and comfortable. I happened to watch a basketball game in the NCAA tournament. The flat screen tv was terrific. I have stayed here before and the experience was similar. I enjoyed the consistency, professionalism, and location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I can't say how much I just love this hotel. We stayed after returning from being abroad and it was so nice to come back to true service and luxury. Everything about the stay was fantastic and a big shout out to Under who was so lovely to both us and our children. I would definitely return...but not for those faint at heart once you get the bill...sometimes you just need to splurge!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Sometimes in NYC on business, this time I stayed as a tourist with my two young daughters who love NYC. We feel at home and very comfortable here and all the guests are well looked after and quickly known by name. A lady on the Concierge desk recommended Sarabeth's (just four doors....a 30 second wak away) where we had our worst ever breakfast experience not just in NYC but ever.....ending up with my Coeliac daughter being very ill. The management tell me they won't be recommending it without warning people with Gluten allergies and everyone against sitting in the rear rooms (so noisy you have to shout to talk). Room service at the hotel is first rate.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great location and we had a beautiful suite overlooking Central Park. The rooms were very quiet except outside the bedroom we could hear a low rumble, which was surprising simce we were on the 19th floor. Our room wasn't ready till 5 pm, so we had to wait two hours after regular check in time. The hotel (concierge and spa) did not respond to emails. Food was very expensive and room service did not get our order correct except once, though they gave us our breakfast for free as a result. I've had more help getting a cab at a Hyatt as well. The hotel itself is very nice, but it was very unlike other Ritzes where I've stayed.
user_name:
izolo
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: From the moment our car pulled up we were treated like royalty. It is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed and if you have kids traveling with you...they are treated the same! Cribs are wonderful & staff is loving! Our bed was comfortable & hotel was spotless! This should be the blueprint for anyone who says they are customer service oriented! Thank you Ritz

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Great Room, Great Service all around a great place. Location was perfect. Would highly recommend for the business traveler or leisure.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Let me just preface this that I have stayed at several Ritz Carltons around the country. I have also stayed at several other luxury brand hotels. Will this hotel have the best room in all of NYC? no...... Will this hotel have the best service?...without a doubt yes! Every single person in this hotel goes out of their way to make your stay memorable. We stayed on the club level. We pretty much didnt pay for breakfast or lunch our entire stay because were full from the lounge. The free cocktails were nice too and you can pretty much ask for any drink you can think of. The room was ok...big for NYC standards. The bathroom was extremely nice for NYC standards. Seperate shower from tub, huge area for 2 people to be getting ready at the same time. They do have a complimentary car that will take you short distances, but you have to ask and it really depends on traffic/demand, etc. I cannot mention all the times where this hotel has anticpated my needs and then exceeded them. I have been to NYC before, but never have I enjoyed my stay so much. My new home is at the Ritz Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Rooms are very nice but are not the stand out here - it's the service & location is excellent, right near the corner of 6th Ave & Central Park. The lounge serves some of the best scones in the world. You can happily skip the main afternoon tea & just do scones because they are sensational! The staff at the hotel are exemplary - soooo extremely friendly & helpful. The bellmen was happy to help us with the courtesy car, opening the doors for us & greeting us with a sense of humor & charm. Bathrooms downstairs are sooo clean & horse & carriage rides around Central Park are right across the street. You can't beat it in terms of location & friendliness.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There are a lot of hotels to stay in New York. I was very disappointed by this choice. The service is not what I have seen from the Ritz in the past. The service was what I would expect at a low budget hotel. The only exemplary service was from the Bellman and doormen...Jose was polite, gave us great recommendations, and made our trip super. I booked my trip with american express platinum which gives a 4pm checkout. I specifically told them when i checked in that I would be leaving at 2pm. I got a call at noon telling me I needed to checkout. I pointed out to them that I had a late checkout and they said fine. We walked over to central park, and when we returned at 1:30 they blocked our room, so our key didn't work. This was terrible treatment to give a guest. There was a weak apology for this. Please don't stay here unless you want to be treated like a motel 6. I am cutting up my Ritz Rewards program card, and will never stay at a Ritz again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The hotel was really worth the money. Our room wasn't ready immediately so they gave us a key to the lounge level which was so nice after the long cab ride from the airport. There was a light buffet breakfast that was full of fresh fruit. The head host offered any extras for us. We were barely through our breakfast sitting at a table overlooking the park when a nice woman came to escort us to our room. And the attention didn't stop there. We will be back. The lounge level is really a wonderful place to have for a quick trip also because you can pop in and there is always something there to pick you up, a cup of coffee, tea, and light food. We were going to the Big East Tournament and although the Ritz isn't very convenient to Madison Square Garden, it is worth the distance. When the doorman directed us to the closest subway, after we asked, and we found the card machine not functioning, they got a car for us to go down to the Garden. It was greatly appreciated as it was cab shift change. The people make the Ritz.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I've never stayed at a Ritz before, but was really pleased with how the staff makes you feel at home. Stayed in an avenue view room (room 1405) and thought it was great. In fact, we could see Central Park from our avenue view room, so even though we didn't get a park view room, we were very happy. Location is perfect for anybody frequenting the park or shopping in midtown. Ate at SaraBeths (restaurant two doors down) for Sunday breakfast - go before 10 AM or be prepared for a wait.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Last year we stayed in a lovely room looking across to Central Park. The whole experience was great- good location, great amenities, and a special ambiance in the Club lounge and the downstairs bar/lounge-they serve the best martinis! The staff were friendly, food presentation and service great which all added up to a wonderful time in NewYork.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I spent this past weekend at the Ritz for his birthday. We typically stay at the Four Seasons but we decided to give the Ritz a try since we could collect Marriott nights as my husband needs so many nights a year to maintain his platinum status. We were to have a city view room, but instead we faced another brick building with no view whatsoever. We typically receives upgrades due to his status, this did not happen and we did not receive the room we paid and requested with the city view. No apology or a discount on the room. The rooms are large and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. The housekeeping service was lacking. We only received one water bottle the entire weekend. We had to keep asking for towels as we were provided with only one bath towel for two people. The housekeeper cleaned the room and then left her dirty rag on the sink, and no toilet paper in the bathroom. It was nothing major that happened but little things like having to ask for toilet paper when you are paying $700/night for a room is a bit ridiculous. The concierge desk was always staffed with 3 people; however they were always on the phone for lengths at a time. Understandable, but after waiting for 10 minutes 4 different times we went to ask for help at the front desk for recommendations. They did acknowledge you but has to continue their conversations. We received wonderful recommendations from the front desk staff, so it wasn't a problem. My husbands joked that to get a hold of the concierge he should go up to the room and call them. We have stayed at the Four Seasons the last few years for my husband’s birthday, they always send up a small cake, card and sometimes a bottle of champagne. The Ritz Carlton- nothing. They did not even acknowledge we were here celebrating his birthday, after this was noted in the reservation and I had called several days before to confirm reservation and mention this. This was disappointing. We ate at the hotel for breakfast as we had a $100 credit to use. If you stuck to the menu the prices were not unreasonable, however if you ordered something that was not on the menu the price was steep. I ordered one egg on the side and it was $14, this was funny as my entire pancake breakfast with pancakes, fruit and a drink was only $20. The location is directly across from Central Park and in an ideal location for walking to various sites. We are returning for another weekend in NYC in 2 weeks. We will be staying at the Four Seasons the next time around.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We just returned from a long weekend in New York. After doing my research on Trip Advisor I selected the Ritz. From the moment we walked in till the time we left the experience was perfect. We have traveled to New York many times but this was our best. The lobby is lovely, very classic and warm. The desk staff were very helpful and the check in was a breeze. We asked for a quiet room and it truly was. The rooms are large and well appointed. We booked a room with club access and that is a must. The location is great, just far enough from the crowded time square, but a nice walk to shops and shows. We will stay at the Ritz again and again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In December, I stayed at The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park on a weekend trip with my daughter, her pal and their mom. The four of us planned to soak up as much New York at Christmas as possible in 48 hours. The location of this hotel is perfect for experiencing all New York City has to offer. We were so close to all the sites including 5th Avenue, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park and more. I really can't imagine staying anywhere else now when I go to New York City.Everyone there made us feel so welcomed. I felt like the doormen were swooping us in from the cold and the lobby was embracing us with a warm blanket. They also always helped us with navigating the city and what was our best way to travel to a location. All you have to do is taste the S'mores and Cocoa in the Star Lounge in the lobby to feel relaxed and at home. That is how I felt while I was there. It seemed like I had always stayed there and of course they knew my name (it was the Ritz wasn't it)! I felt so relaxed right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. It refreshed us, so we were ready to go out and tackle more sightseeing, shopping and more!Everyone there was at the top of their game. My packages from shopping never even had to go to the room. Ryan was amazing and had them shipped without a care for me. They showed up in perfect time for Christmas and were in much better shape than the ones I carried home myself. All the staff were amazing, whether they were at the door, in the lobby, a concierge or in the club lounge. I did not have a care in the world, because I knew that if I did they would handle it for me.Also the rooms are amazing. We needed double beds, so we had to forgo the view, but the Club Lounge substituted for a view of all the decked out holiday horse and carriages going down the street. Our bathroom was almost like a Spa Suite! Also the bed was the most comfortable that I can remember anywhere and I travel a good bit!I would love to make this an annual trip! Maybe next time for a Mother's Day Adventure or to experience Central Park in the spring or summer. The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park has to be the best place to experience New York. I can't imagine staying anywhere else! Also if you are going to Broadway or to see the Rockettes, this is your place to stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The concierges are really amazing, helpful and extremely dedicated, location of course is wonderful, but room service and the restaurant at the breakfast are sometimes slow and not so top for what you are paying... In general a very good hotel, but mostly for the location and the staff at the frontdesk, concierge and doormen, but should ameliorate room service and the restaurante and bar...

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have been so impressed with this hotel. The location is ideal and the quality of the room is great, especially for the price. Every time I go need a place to stay in the city, Park Central is my first choice. Literally just a 5 minute walk to times square and central park. The hotel itself is VERY clean and just nice enough to make you feel like you are actually on vacation. We tried staying in some cheaper hotels in the city a few times and it was miserable. Staff are also very pleasant and helpful! Oh and the beds are soooooo comfortable!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Imagine checking into the Ritz to celebrate your daughters 13 birthday with three friends in tow only to find that one of your adjoining reserved rooms had been "SOLD OFF".with my wife fuming, the birthday girl in tears and everyone looking to me to get tough and make it right, I placed all my faith in the competent hands of General Manager, Mr. David Salcfas who implored me to, TRUST HIM TO MAKE THINGS RIGHT!. Mr. Salcfas, Matt Gomberg and the rest of his superb staff shifted into high gear and within 40 minutes had the "birthday" party primping and prepping for a night on the town in a beautifully appointed suite.Within ten minutes a complimentary room service arrived with goodies for the girls and a bottle of fine champagne to calm mom and dad's nerves. That was extremely thoughtful and parr for the course for such an outstanding organization.What truly surprised me was the personal phone call for Mr. Salcfas to notify us that a stretch limo was awaiting our arrival curbside to take us anywhere we desired for the entire evening. After all our planning and preparations to give our terrific kid and her friends a birthday to remember, what really topped off the evening was the kindness, courtesy and professionalism of a consumate hotellier.Mr. Salcfas, I thank you for taking such great care of us and for making my little princess feel like a queen.We will not forget your thoughtfulness and concern for our total satisfaction by you and your entire team.SincerelyDavid Breitbarth

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Life is very dark and very bleak. That's why we all need to drink champagne and stay at the Ritz (c) Truman Capote.Legendary hotel on the 59 street aka Central Park South. It's the street full of luxury hotels including the Plaza, Essex House and Mandarin Oriental. You can have a carriage ride by the Central park. That's very pretty and very NYC but that's why the street smells like... you know...I used to live couple blocks away so often had lunch or drinks at the hotel. The bars and lounges are nice.I stayed there only once with my girlfriend after the New Year Eve party, and was pleasantly surprised the rooms were very clean and big, and very well decorated. If you're coming to NYC for a visit, I'd definitely recommend Ritz Calrton, just a great place to be in the very heart of the city!
user_name:
LazNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Just returned from a three night stay and am totally impressed with this hotel. The service is first class. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful, and acted as if they really enjoyed their job! We stayed in a king room which did not have a view, but the size of the room, the furnishings, the bath were comfortable, very clean and definitely adequate. We did pay extra for the club level amenities and this is well worth the extra expense. Could easily eat breakfast and lunch here and the evening cocktails were a real treat. Did not use the spa but used the workout room. My only complaint about the hotel is the size of the work and its lack of windows. However, Central Park is just across the street and provides a perfect setting for running and walking. One of my favorite things about this hotel is that it feels small and relaxed. Most NYC hotels I've stayed in feels huge and crowded.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My wife and I don't usually stay at the Ritz very often as generally speaking it's out of our price range. That said we have had occasion to do so twice this year. The Central Park South location is your typical Ritz experience. Attentive/Friendly staff, understated but warm lobby/common areas and opulent rooms with many small details. Our room was spotless, sizable (for New York) and very quite.The only issue we had was the absence of an iron in the room. This was noticed about an hour before my wife needed to leave for a meeting and it took the whole hour for them to bring one to us, thus she had to go out wrinkly. So if you need to touch up your clothes before going out call way ahead for an iron. The strange bit is that other Ritz locations have irons in the room.I should probably mention that the room was over $1200/night. While it was a great hotel, with famous Ritz service and a great location, our regular room was by no means worth that price. You can stay around the corner on 5th for half that price at a few other of New York's best (historic) hotels. We have stayed at other Ritz hotels for much much more reasonable prices.If your independently wealthy there is no need to stay elsewhere...for the rest of us you'd be just as happy elsewhere.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton during this, my first visit to NYC, and I would struggle to find a simple complaint. The hotel is elegant and charming, its staff incredibly attentive, and the rooms have 5 star down to the smallest detail. Every time I returned to the hotel, I was greeted by name, and treated with the service and courtesy that would make every visitor feel like a visiting royal, or diplomat. If you are planning a weekend never to forget, book the hotel that will match your memories. Ritz Carlton.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: In january 2001 I went for a 5 days shopping trip to New york and stayed at the Ritz hotel, I had heard so much about it ,so I was eager to give it a try. But I was disappointed ,the service was really bad! I don't appreciate if the staff judge me(Or anyone els) if I walk in with a pair of Loubutin or my snickers .Guess what I had on my feet this time? The breakfast is not included and not impressing in anyway. When it was time to leave the didn't bother to help us with our 2 oversize baggage at the lobby and out because they where to busy to ignore us. The did got a minor chock when the realized than the stretch limo who drove up in front of the hotel was ours to take us to the airport.No this is one place I never will go to again!Really bad service !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: On the advice of good friends I stayed here in January with very high expectations. These expectations were exceeded from the moment we checked in to the day we checked out, this hotel was absolutely fabulous. Having stayed at the Ritz in Moscow, Berlin and San Fran recently I knew what to expect but this was a step up. The staff , in all areas of the hotel, were genuine, friendly and helpfull. Charles in the club lounge was a great guy - always smiling and remembered all our favourtie drinks ! The massage was one of the best i've had and was able to get one almost on arrival which was great after a 30 hour journey from Perth Australia. The location , room qualtity (arghhh the beds !) lobby lounge were top class. Check-out was perfect and all our room additions etc through amex were catered and accounted for. My last stay in NYC was the the Peninsula which was great but the Ritz has something special in this very beautiful city. I've found my home away from home and can't wait to get back there.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I travel extensively to NYC, and consider The Ritz at Central Park our home in NYC. In the past we've stayed at the Mandarin, and at Trump SoHo, both great properties. But The Ritz, with its location, its boutique-y feel, the concierge lounge, and the superior service, we don't want to be any place else. Each time we return, staff knows us by name. It's nice to pull up after a long flight and the doormen know you, as if you are a resident. The concierge lounge is GREAT, the food, drink, and the staff...we just love it. And the La Prairie spa is one of the best in the city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Impeccably clean, and very comfortable. We had a great view of Lady Liberty from our room (515). Friends of ours stayed in a suite just above us (617) and had the same great view...alon with a spectacular room. They club lounge was comfortable and the food was delicious and plenty. I'm sure it must be less relaxing and pleasant in the club lounge during busier times at the Ritz, but we happened to be there at a quiet time of year and enjoyed it very much.Doormen were pleasant and polite. If you are looking to spend time in midtown, be prepared to cab it or take the subway a lot since this hotel is at the very bottom of Manhattan. We couldn't have asked for a nicer experience. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton on a business trip and look forward to returning with my family. I've stayed at a number of Ritz-Carlton properties, but the room at this hotel was probably nicer than any RC I've stayed at thus far. Very spacious room, especially for NY. It is also located directly across the street from the South end of Central Park, which made it easy to get up early and jog into the Park. With one exception, the service was exactly what you've come to expect from RC -- attentive, responsive and polite. My only complaint is that they failed to follow up on my wake-up call the first morning I was there, which could have caused me to miss an early morning (fortunately, I always set my cell phone alarm as a back-up). When I made the front desk aware of the oversight, they were extremely apologetic. I appreciated the professional way they handled the oversight after the fact, so I didn't ding them on my scoring for "Service".

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed with my husband and son over New Year's Eve in a Central Park View suite. Great room, 15th floor, fantastic views of Central Park. The room was very comfortable and spacious. Two large rooms, two very nice full baths. Great for a family stay.Everything outside the room itself was difficult to take. Upon check in (we arrived at 4:30pm) we were told our room was not ready. We waited in the Club Lounge while it was being readied. No communication from the front desk, we waited two and a half hours for our room to be ready. Unfortunately this was the second time in a week that we've checked into a Ritz Carlton property after our quoted check in time and had to wait over two hours for it to be ready. The front desk told up it would not be long, so we waited. Had we known it would be a few hours, we would have left and done something, it actually ruined our plans for that evening. The Club Lounge felt cold. It does not have the warm feel at the Battery Park and other Ritz properties. The staff while not unfriendly, were cold and abrupt. We are never hard to please and don't ever ask for special requests, but it just didn't have a very welcoming vibe. The Lounge always felt crowded and people descended like locusts. I drink tea, so it was easy to make it myself, but for coffee, people were putting in requests like this was your local Starbucks. It was definitely off-putting. Our only really good staff experience was with our Bellman. He sent up a nice cheese plate and wine personally because he felt bad about how long we had to wait for our room. He always remembered our names and referenced specific details we'd shared about our itinerary and home. All in all I wouldn't stay here again. As much as we loved the room, the hotel felt cold and impersonal (minus our wonderful bellman). We love Ritz Carlton's and generally it is one of our top choices of hotels to stay in. I'll look for another property next time we are in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My friends and I stayed at the Ritz from Jan 12-15 and we could not have been happier!! The room, the service, and the location could not have been better. Book the concierge level, it's worth the money!! We can't wait to stay there again next January.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You could not find a better hotel in a better location in Manhattan than the Ritz Carlton. Ritz is usually not my first choice in hotels, but in Manhattan, it's the best. It's location, across from the Central Park, and with views from its high floors looking directly across the park are phenomenal. I particularly loved it's elegant, old-world charm and feel. Rooms are beautifully appointed with telescopes to look out into the park itself. The comfortable cocktail lounge in the lobby is the perfect place to flop down after a full day of running around all over Manhattan. Prices are high, but to me, it was worth it. The lounge/club was also well worth it....it didn't have the kids running around like I've noticed at other hotels which offer the club level add-on. I've been back to this hotel twice and on my next trip to NY, that is where I will go again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Recently, I stayed at The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park on a weekend trip with my daughter, her pal and their mom. The four of us planned to soak up as much New York at Christmas as possible in 48 hours. The location of this hotel is perfect for experiencing all New York City has to offer. We were so close to all the sites including 5th Avenue, Times Square, Radio City Music Hall, Central Park and more. I really can't imagine staying anywhere else now when I go to New York City.Everyone there made us feel so welcomed. I felt like the doormen were swooping us in from the cold and the lobby was embracing us with a warm blanket. They also always helped us with navigating the city and what was our best way to travel to a location. All you have to do is taste the S'mores and Cocoa in the Star Lounge in the lobby to feel relaxed and at home. That is how I felt while I was there. It seemed like I had always stayed there and of course they knew my name (it was the Ritz wasn't it)! I felt so relaxed right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city. It refreshed us, so we were ready to go out and tackle more sightseeing, shopping and more!Everyone there was at the top of their game. My packages from shopping never even had to go to the room. Ryan was amazing and had them shipped without a care for me. They showed up in perfect time for Christmas and were in much better shape than the ones I carried home myself. All the staff were amazing, whether they were at the door, in the lobby, a concierge or in the club lounge. I did not have a care in the world, because I knew that if I did they would handle it for me.Also the rooms are amazing. We needed double beds, so we had to forgo the view, but the Club Lounge substituted for a view of all the decked out holiday horse and carriages going down the street. Our bathroom was almost like a Spa Suite! Also the bed was the most comfortable that I can remember anywhere and I travel a good bit!I would love to make this an annual trip! Maybe next time for a Mother's Day Adventure or to experience Central Park in the spring or summer. The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park has to be the best place to experience New York. I can't imagine staying anywhere else! Also if you are going to Broadway or to see the Rockettes, this is your place to stay!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We recently booked a few nights at the Ritz on Central Park (which we have done for a few years now) for the holidays. Normally our experiences at any Ritz hotel has been exceptional, but unfortunately this time was a major disappointment. We booked the hotel by phone, received a confirmation at the time and received an email confirmation a week before we were to arrive. When we arrived we were told that they didn't have our reservation. When they looked into it more they told us that "someone" had changed our reservation and then canceled it - which made no sense since we never booked the room on-line, and an outsider can't get into your reservation and change it. But, the woman at the front desk kept insisting that they didn't change the reservation - "someone else did it"?????But to make matters worse, she really didn't care that we were now stuck without a room. She essentially told us that no rooms were ready (at 4:00 in the afternoon - check in is at 3:00) and that any room that would be available would take at least 2 hours to clean. Again, no interest in accommodating us in the least. When we returned after 2 hours we were put in a tiny room (two adults and our 15 year old son).
