We could barely move in the room, but again, the woman at the front desk really couldn't be bothered, and since we needed a place to stay, we were in a bind.My husband did finally go down to complain and asked to see the manager (John Nomer), who was the only person who at least acted like he cared about our situation. He took us to see another available room, and was extremely apologetic.I understand that it's the holiday season and things get busy and hectic, but I expected more from the Ritz. I expected them to be more sympathetic to our situation, especially being return customers.My family and I will not be returning to the Ritz on Central Park next year or any year after. There are plenty of other great hotels in New York City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As always a great stay at a Ritz Carlton property. The location on Central Park is central to everything! Surrounded by great shopping. Everything was terrific except breakfast at the hotel....over priced and the food was not good. The service atbreakfast was, however, very good. My husband an I love staying here.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The people at this hotel were all fabulous and warm. We were traveling with our two sons and all the staff treated them like they were high profile guests. The hotel finish and design is very warm and cozy, feeling more like a home than a hotel......Some days a I felt more like staying in than exploring the city and shopping....this seldom occurs. The housekeeping here is some of the best I have ever experienced. The club level was very nice. Great service, selection of food and drinks and a gorgeous view of the park and carriages.Room service was fast, efficient and excellent quality and taste. George, delivered my shirts each morning and was so upbeat and pleasant instantly made each day better. Our room a city view suite was nicely appointed and very comfortable, I could stay for a few months. Two things to be aware of is while it is listed as a city view suite the living room is however the bedroom looks into a dark abyss with a weak attempt of a roof top garden. This is not listed on the net, nor was it mentioned when we contacted the hotel directly. Also our room was above the spa and we were awaked two mornings by a loud noise. The front desk did do their best to amend the situation. The only other issue which would not likely bother most was their packing/unpacking service. It was not bad but certainly was not English butler service, which while they do not market it as so I would have expected it at one of new Yorkshire best hotels.In summary our next stay will be right here at the Ritz Central Park.....we loved it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz-Carlton at Central Park is a very nice hotel but with so many comparable options in this neighborhood and beyond, I don't think we would go back. On the plus side, our suite was roomy & comfortable with great views. It was also very quiet, which was nice after dealing with the holiday crowds and chaos on Fifth Ave & Rockefeller Center. Unfortunately the service wasn't as personable as I'd hoped and there was very little attention to detail. As another reviewer said, you feel like you are "just another guest." And at these rates, I expect a little more. Also, this property is not nearly as kid-friendly as other Ritzs (and we were traveling with our 7-year old).Overall, we enjoyed our stay but it fell just a little short of my expectations. It's a very good hotel in an amazing location, but it's not going to "stay with me" as some other hotels have.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: So nice to treated so wonderfully. Jenny at the desk was very hospitable. Every employee we ran into whether it was housekeeping to any staff member in the elevator & the manager was ALWAYS very courteous & concerned about our stay. Staying @ The Ritz was a treat!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. From the moment you check in until you leave, the hotel staff do everything they can to help their guests. This hotel focuses on quality service and making guests feel like they are at home. It is an oasis in the heart of New York City. The Concierge team was great. Rooms are large and very well appointed. Bathroom amenities are above the norm. The Internet is good and a business centre is available 24 hours a day. The hotel's location is by Central Park and near everything you want. One problem was Breakfast at BLT. Food was very expensive. The eggs benedict and coffee were served cold. The Manager came over to apologize and removed these charges from the bill. I would go elsewhere for breakfast. Otherwise - this was a great hotel in every way.
user_name:
NAFTAflyer
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is an incredible property. From the location, to the staff, to the ways the rooms are appointed, everything was perfect. If you are not offended by the price, there is probably no better place to stay in NYC. Enjoy a drink at the lobby bar, where you are sure to see a celebrity, and for another $150 a night, you can enjoy the spectacular concierge level, serving incredible drinks and light food.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in a great location- across from central park and a few blocks from great shopping. It was a bit pricey when I stayed, but thankfully was able to use AMEX points to pay for entire stay. Online photos do not do it justice. I was slightly hesitant to book this hotel because it t looked "old- fashioned" and dated from the photos online. When I arrived, i was proved wrong. Its very elegant (just what youd expect from any ritz) yet still very fresh. The lobby/entrance way was smaller than i had expected, but that was great because it prevented tourists from walking in and just "hanging around". I stayed in one of the smaller suites with one bedroom, living room w pullout bed, 2baths, and a great view! The room was spacious- perfect for 1-4 people. I had clothes pressed and they did a great job w turn around time- needed it within a couple hours. Room service was great. The staff is wonderful. I arrived at 9am, check in is not until 3, but i called ahead and asked/ begged if I could have my room early since I had an event to attend at noon. They told me they would do their best but if I needed to shower and get ready and A room wasnt available when i arrived, they would give me access to they spa facility to use. That was very nice of them. When I arrive it was ready! If you are willing to splurge on your trip to NYC, this is a great hotel. I wouldnt even think twice.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Very convenient location, superior service and comfort. A relatively small lobby area, due to the constraints of the location. Right on Central Park. Hansom cabs within view, the Waldorf is right down the block.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My family and I spent two nights at this hotel in October - my daughter was 16 in September and so we booked Park View rooms as a treat.Clearly, this is a very good hotel. Everything was efficient, the hotel was spotless etc but I suppose these characteristics should be expected and a given.The rooms were very good indeed and I really can't imagine it's worth staying without the view of the Park.So why is it that I don't feel comfortable rating it a 5? I think because it probably didn't quite match our high expectations. Whilst staff were pleasant enough, they weren't overly friendly. It felt like we were just four of very many guests, which of course we were. However, I think that's what makes the key difference between a very good and an excellent hotel - the latter makes you feel special, even when you're not.Make no mistake, we have no regrets selecting this hotel, it really is very good. It just wasn't special enough to want to return when the competition is so great.We spent the next two nights in the Ritz-Carlton at Battery Park, where our expectations had perhaps (unfairly) been lower but where the experience truly was excellent.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz Carlton Central Park is a fabulous hotel. A little pricey, but well worth the cost. This was our 6th visit to the hotel, and it just keeps getting better. The staff sets them apart from every other hotel. They are all truly outstanding, and they set the bar high.We were there for over 2 weeks and every employee was top notch every day. There is nothing these guys won't do to make your day better. Particular stand outs... tamara in the star lounge is awesome, Matt, Bernhard, Johnnie, and Hassan. I would also recommend the Club Lounge. Ryan and the great waitstaff up there are all fantastic. I could go on. They will spoil you and you will never want to stay anywhere else. The rooms/suite are large, roomy, and very comfortable. The beds are so comfortable, you will want to buy the bedding. The location can't be beat. Right outside your door is Central Park. What a beautiful sight to walk out to every day. It is also close to all of the museums and shopping. Bergdorfs, Madison Ave, 5th Ave and Columbus Circle are all within walking distance. This hotel is the best hotel, bar none.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is a very beautiful Hotel, and yes. you pay for it. They were very nice from the second we put our foot outside(!!) the door. Very nice rooms with a good view over both a bit of cetral park and a apartment house which was a bit fun to look in to. The room was amazing and very elegant. comfortable beds, big bathrrom and good with space in the room.The service at the font desk was great, they were really helpful and happy to have tourist asking for their help and advices.We will always remember this Hotel! And my grandmother (86 years old from Sweden) always talks about it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This hotel delivers were other 5 Star NYC hotels fall flat. Great in every way. Clean and fresh rooms, amazing location, great Central Park views (Central Park View rooms only), 5 Star service at every turn. I love this hotel. Unlike The Four Seasons Central Park (57th St), this is a true 5 Star experience. You cannot go wrong here!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This lovely hotel is fantastic and in front of Apple Store and 5th avenue.The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The staff really friendly and couldn't be more helpful. The free Wi Fi actually works unlike other hotels we have been in and the comfortable lounge does a lovely breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese and snack in the evening. I'll be back again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband have stayed at this property several times, and each time the service just gets better. The staff is amazing and the bar tender a legend! The quality of the food and lodging is always outstanding! I am looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Everything you would expect from good quality business hotel with the advantage of being over the road from Central Park. Room was good size, with quality furnishings that we well maintained.Service from staff was friendly if on occasions they didn't do what was asked. But these were just minor irritations.The only gripe was the cost of food in the bar. I know New York is expensive and I expect to pay higher costs than in local restaurants, but when a burger, dessert and 2 glasses of wine come to over $100 it seems excessive.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Excellent location and good welcome received for a frequent returning guest. Noticed lower numbers and accessibility of Club Level staff on last visit - although staff when available were very good.More worrying was the refusal of staff to address or acknowledge recent well publicised shocking health reports on the hotel's hygiene. As a result of this we have a reluctance to return to the hotel or recommend it until this situation is sorted satisfactorily.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz sure know how to pamper. My wife and I stayed in early October. The room was outstanding though didn't have a view of the park. Clean, spacious (for Manhattan) and an excellent bathroom (including speakers for the TV). Also, very quiet for a midtown hotel both inside and outside. Only drawback was the smell when the doorman opened the door. This is due to the number of horse drawn carriages just outside by the park. While an awesome property and excellent service, not twice as good as lower ranked properties at half the price in my book. For a splurge or Marriott points, don't miss it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here as a family in April for a few days.First impressions. The lobby is very small indeed - it's definitely boutique style. I actually realised that I would have preferred to stay at a hotel with larger public space when I arrived there. It all feels very cramped and rather dark at the Ground Level.We all loved the Club Lounge: the service and the atmosphere was intimate and convivial - just like the best RC Club Lounges - and many of the guests were evident regulars.Our suite was a bit disappointing - the layout meant we hardly used the sitting room and the view was uninspiring (to be polite). I accept we didn't pay for the Park view but the scene from the sitting room windows was rather depressing.All-in all: the location is excellent but this was not a hotel that I was bowled over by and I would choose somewhere else next time I stay in New York.However as an aside, I did eat the best meal of my life (and we are foodies) at Per Se - well worth travelling over the Atlantic for!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz- Carlton Hotel New York, on Central Park South, is a grand hotel that lives up to the Ritz Carlton name and tradition. We stayed in a beautiful room overlooking Central Park. The Hotel is very beautiful, quiet and dignified. The service is quick and sure. The hotel makes you feel very comfortable because it runs so smoothly. We had access to the club level and I would recommend this extra. The food settings are lovely and it is fun to visit and have a drink with visitors from all over the world who stay at the Ritz Carlton. Or just relax by yourself and overlook the park.I am looking forward to my next visit to this Hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: What a way to spend a luxurious afternoon sipping tea and sherry along with an array of delighful petite fours that resemble jewels and taste incredibly delicious. The atmophere is simply beautiful and elegant and full of lovely ladies and gentlemen displaying the ultimate in class. The Ritz is truley the la grande dame of New York city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 10 nights recently.We enjoyed our time at the hotel.The staff were lovely.It is with great regret that I am posting this review however I feel it necessary.When we arrived home to Australia I needed to raise an issue with the hotel.I will not go into details as I do not want to cause discomfort for those involved.I wrote an email to the hotel regarding my concerns and did not receive a reply.Five emails later and three weeks since we have been home I have not heard back from the hotel.What a disappointment that the hotel will not address my concerns.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: As a former New Yorker, I am very choosy when selecting a hotel in the city. First and foremost, this is honestly a wonderful hotel and I think the Ritz staff here is second to none. While I've visited the hotel before many times (former restaurant that is no longer there, La Prairie Spa, tea in the hotel lobby), I stayed in the hotel for the first time this past weekend.A disclaimer: I was treated for the weekend (courtesy of my mother in law) and did not pay for the room. I have no idea what our room rate was (nor do I want to know!) and I am sure that if I was paying out of pocket I would stay elsewhere...for example, I think the Ritz Battery Park seems to be a much better deal.Our room: We had a very decently sized room with a king bed and partial Central Park views (upgrade courtesy of booking through American Express). Allow me to digress...I have complained about the Ritz Rewards system in prior reviews; we are Silver members (staying at least 10 nights a year in Ritz properties) and my in-laws are Gold members. All of our amenities during this stay were provided through Amex and we did not receive anything due to our Ritz Rewards status. Every time we've asked the front desk about this, their response is that it's a new system, they don't know who is what tier at check-in, etc. I have even been told at other properties that having Silver status "means nothing." Regardless, the room was lovely and I have no complaints.The location: If you want to shop, this is the place to stay. The hotel is a very easy walk from 57th and Fifth (aka Mecca), where you'll find Bergdorf Goodman and the other usual suspects. It's also an easy walk up Madison Avenue (better shopping than on 5th and much fewer tourists). It's also walking distance to the Time Warner building. Obviously, it's across from Central Park, which is a huge plus except for the carriage horses that line up directly across from the hotel (it is my personal belief that the carriage rides should be stopped for animal welfare reasons, so this might not bother others).The restaurant (BLT): We received complimentary daily breakfast at the hotel, which here is at the adjacent BLT Market. I generally like BLT restaurants, but I am not a huge fan of this one. Breakfast was fine, although I certainly would not eat there if it wasn't free, as there are typical Ritz prices for very average fare (think $40 for a continental breakfast). On the second morning we had one of the rudest servers I've ever had and it took an hour for our food to arrive, although the food services manager did step in to make things right. We also had dinner here one night (to use up daily hotel credit) and it was fine, but again probably would not have gone if we didn't have the $ to use up.The lobby lounge: I love it in here. We had drinks and appetizers after checking out and had a wonderful hostess. Gorgeous setting, great drinks, decent (not amazing, but it will do the job) food.The spa: "If you have the means, I highly suggest you [try the La Prairie spa]." Even if you don't book a service, hotel guests have access to the spa facilities, which includes a somewhat mediocre steam room BUT access to all the La Prairie products you could ever desire (face wash, body cream, etc.). Services themselves are quite pricey. I have had a couple of amazing facials here and a couple of very disappointing ones. Like anywhere else, it depends on who your esthetician is. But overall, it's worth it just to experience the facilities. The staff: Great. I felt very taken care of during our stay, and any issues (poor experience with server at breakfast) were resolved expediently, although (again) I wish they would fix their Ritz Rewards system.In sum: This is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic area, but you'll pay for the privilege and there are (in my opinion) much better deals at on-par hotels to be found.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The gracious staff at the Ritz-Carlton made my family vacation a dream. They delivered stuffed toys to the room during turn-down, along with milk and cookies. Our direct view of Central Park was fantastic for the kids, and adults, as they looked at birds, horses, buildings, etc, through the telescope provided in the room. The location was such that we walked almost everywhere, but when we needed a lift, the coutesy Lincoln Sedan was available, gratis. I will certainly stay at the Ritz, Central Park, again, even though New York has so many other good choices, this was the best for my family.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at this hotel on July 28-July30th 2011. I reserved this hotel with trepidation as it is very expensive and we spend little time actually in the room. Needless to say ,it just did not live up to the hype. The rooms are very nice and and beautiful, however they are small. The big problem i found was the hotel basically tolerates smoking in the rooms. We have allergies and the first night they had to move us to another room because of smoking in the adjacent room. The second room smelled from some horrible perfume that was sprayed to mask the smell of smoke. Low and behold our neighbor in the second room also smoked so basically our stay was miserable.The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating and explained to me that smoking is a big problem and that they fine smokers $500, but most smokers staying there don't mind paying the $500 . If you don't smoke,don't stay there ! I love the Ritz Brand and all it stands for, but for my money I think the Ritz Battery Park is better. Great service means nothing if you cannot breath in a $600 a night room. Seriously either your are non smoking or not ! They did comp one night only because I told the staff that if I were at the Hampton Inn ,They would comp my room because I was not satisfied !

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had Platinum Amex book this hotel for me because we flew to New York to see Andrea Bocelli. Why did I choose the Ritz? Because that is where Andrea Bocelli and his fiancee, Veronica Berti stayed. How did I know this? Because we got to personally meet them at the Ritz, and we wanted to be there for that. We had a beautiful room, but it was $1099 per night - and it is generally $699 per night. It just happened to be fashion week in New York; that with the Bocelli Concert in Central Park kept all the rates in New York around the Parksky high. But it was worth it to me. Not only did I get to meet my idol, the world's greatest tenor, but the service and room were impeccable (as they should be for that price!) We stayed three nights, and then drove to Connecticut to see friends. One night at a beautiful hotel in Farmington CT equaled the price of the taxes for one night in the hotel in New York City.......

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This is currently my favorite hotel in New York City. The location is superb, right across from Central Park, but also a short walk to Rockefeller Center and Times Square.Many of the room overlook the park, and have a wonderful view while also being very quiet, with no street sounds coming through the windows.The service is top notch, with very attentive staff from the doormen to the concierge. The lobby is quite small, but it still feels very good to come "home" to it after a busy day touring the city, and to feel the calm luxury of the lounge where it's nice to have a drink and relax.Rooms service is very efficient, but of course it's also ridiculously overpriced, but that's pretty standard at most luxury hotels these days.The rooms themselves are very nice, standard Ritz Carlton type rooms. Clean, nice bathrooms. The park view rooms are very nice for their view, but also for their larger size. The air conditioning works great, which was helpful in August in New York, when it was brutally hot and humid every day. Be aware, though, that if you get their cheapest rooms, they are much smaller and basically have a view of a wall or water tower.All in all, you really can't go wrong with this hotel when visiting New York City, as long as you can afford the room rates and expensive extras.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 12 nights in August 2011 with my sister and a friend. I chose this hotel based on reivews I read on trip advisor. We loved this hotel. The location is fantastic with central park opposite and 5th avenue nearby. The hotel is beautifully furnished with old world decor. Our room was spotless and the bathroom was lovely and spacious. The beds were like clouds. We had drinks at the hotel bar every day we loved it so much - we just felt so welcome and comfortable there. We found the service outstanding - from the concierge to the door men - nothing was too much trouble and all staff were genuinely friendly - especially Abdel, Johnny, Bernard and Nazier (sp). One minor issue was there was that there is a charge for internet use in the business centre and also for wifi. However, the concierge let me use their iPad whenever I wanted. Could not recommend this hotel more and it will always be my hotel of choice in NY. Judy, Sydney Australia

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at Ritz Central Park couple of years ago when we were just a young married couple! So we really enjoyed the great location where we were able to walk anywhere. Right accross the street there is the Central Park entrance where you can easily access. Hotel has a great concierge service with an excellent reservation and recommendation services. Rooms are luxurious as any room in Ritz Hotels. This hotel is a must stay because of its location.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After unpleasant stays at the other hotels that line Central Park South I was very happily surprised by the Ritz Carlton. The lobby bar was great, service was impeccable and friendly. It really felt like the best of New York. I took a star off because my room has a funny smell and the one time I preordered breakfast the order got messed up and was late. Minor annoyances.I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you are in the mood to splurge, and lucky enough in this economy to be able to splurge, then this is the place to stay. Everyone wants to help you, from the moment you check in, whether it is Orlando de Campo or anyone else, the Ritz creates the Gold standard for other high end hotels to meet. From the floors, the furniture, paneled elevators you can feel the upscale everywhere. People remember your name, which a challenge for me. The rooms are very well apportioned, the bath area seemed as large as our entire room in other locations. Lots of beautiful people everywhere, I felt out of place.  We had a very, very nice stay with several nice surprises, fruit delivered to the room, and a CD of the Musical that we attended. We would have loved to stay longer, but had to return to reality. Hope you have the disposible income to afford a visit here. I hope you feel it is worth it. They may not be from the south, but they are very,very hospitable, I was very pleased.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here on a girl's weekend with my mom just prior to Irene coming ashore. The location is a great jumping off point for Central Park and shopping.The hotel is classically decorated, with the lobby appointed in dark wood and decorated with large, oil paintings and soft lighting. The room itself was rather small and styled with striped fabric walls and nice wood furniture. The bed was extremely comfortable...the highlight of the stay I would say. The bathroom had nice marble finishes, a large tub and all the comforts you would expect of a nice hotel. The view from the room left a little to be desired...a view of the building interior walls. The service was pretty good overall...everything we asked for was taken care of. If you like the feeling of traditional luxury, you will like the Ritz Carlton. If you like a more contemporary, modern hotel experience, try the Mandarin Oriental on Columbus Circle.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We actually stayed in the Trump Soho Hotel this year and decided to return to the Ritz Carlton, just to see if the standards of the hotel had changed. We had afternoon tea with Champagne which was all very enjoyable.and during this time we had a chat with the duty manager and asked him if we could view the rooms we stayed in last time as we had friends with us who were keen to see what they were like. We were delighted to see that they are still as fabulous. The beds are still huge with luxurious bedding and cushions, with classy decor which is clean and in perfect condition. We had rooms with a lovely view over the park which was great as there is always something going on in Manhattan. A truely great hotel and we will certainly be returning there in the future.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: First trip to NYC and stayed at RC Central Park for 3 nights for my 40th birthday. Staff extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Room was very spacious with fabulous views overlooking Central Park. Room was spotless. Food was of a high standard. Lovely touch by management when I arrived a large vase of flowers and dessert to wish me happy birthday. Felix the doorman was very helpful and efficient in hailing the cabs!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Again, this place is fantastic. This was our 4th stay at the Central Park Ritz and of course it was as fabulous as always. But of course, I post a new review with each visit because there are always updates!Remember - this gorgeous hotel is not cheap. The lowest rates I have ever seen were for 595 per night. So if you count your pennies stay somewhere else. But keep in mind - I did not hear the word "no" even once. My husband, 3 kids, sitter and inlaws came and we all had a blast. There were some snafus at check in - not sure if this was the fault of the hotel or Amex but they worked it out. The locationnom central park is great. For families, hit the m and m store, the bike rides and victorian gardens in the Park, serendipity 3 (of course), Dylans candy shop, etc.Also, if you can afford it, purchase club lounge access. The food is top notch and the service can simply NOT be matches anywhere. Carmelinda the club concierge is wonderful. Lazar is the man with the most. He is an amazing server in the club lounge - he will anticipate and meet your needs. And I imagine he has stories we could not fathom.This trip I did find that housekeeping and room service were both not as responsive and speedy as usual. With summer, maybe they are short staffed?? Also the spa is good, small but with well done services. The La Prairie products are exorbitantly priced. Seriously - 495 for a moisturizer? That's ridiculous. But then again if they can get it why not??

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Older property, thus rooms are smaller. Stayed here several times in the past and has been renovated since, but hard to tell difference from older rooms. We waited 2 hours for room to be ready even though we had requested early checkin (we knew no guarantee), When we finally got into room at 3:30 PM our room had a very smokey smell although it was "non-smoking" and housekeeping kept spraying a pungent perfume that was so strong we could taste it. Housekeeper said she thoght last guest burned incense. I called and asked for another but none available. Smell increased after turn down (more perfume) so at midnight when we got back we were told "now we have rooms" and offered a move but kids already asleep, and all our stuff already unpacked. We also booked package that included Central Park Lake boatride. We made reservation with hotel and when we arrived at boathouse as instructed by hotel staff but we still had to pay as there was no record of hotel booking. To their credit, hotel did reimburse and gavve us an extra $70 off the bill for this inconvenience, but would have been better if got it right the first time. Very expnesive place - one plain iced tea (no alcohol) and Pellegrino in lounge was $27.00 with tip. Service in Lobby Lounge was overwhelmed. Hotel had a feeling of being understaffed, but staff was earnest and tried hard to correct deficiencies. Central park location very convenient, but our room had no view of park - only dingy back of another building and on other side sixth Avenue. To their credit, they waived at check out breakfast cost above package allowance.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed 4 nights with our 3 and 6 year old sons. Absolutely wonderful. We had a 1 bedroom suite, which was huge (bedroom, living area, and 2 full bathrooms). Nice to have enough room to spread out in. All of the staff was upbeat and helpful, and so sweet to the kids. Highly, highly recommend.We stayed Club level, and the food was great, but I would note it isn't particularly kid friendly (nary a Goldfish cracker or peanut butter sandwich in sight). Our kids were fine and there was plenty they would eat, but nothing they really got excited about. I'm not sure I would stay Club level with kids again, given how easy and cheap it is to grab a healthy breakfast and lunch on the go in NYC.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I had stayed at this hotel in 2009, so went back for around 10 days, occupying two park view rooms along with a friend. I was very disappointed and believe the hotel needs a renovation. Maintenance could not get my a/c/ heating system to work properly throughout my stay. I was cold while paying the sort of price they charge. Rooms looked as if they needed repair. At the lobby, one afternoon when my friend and I came back from shopping and were resting, a person told us they had to get the room ready for tea, implying we should leave unless we wanted to consume. All in all, it did not seem the same hotel I stayed in in 2009.Everyone tries to be nicely-spoken, but it really is not worthe it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: A beautiful hotel, fantastic location over looking Central Park.They made us feel very special, even upgraded us as it was my birthday, and sent up champagne! Little touches like always addressing you by name, add up. It's the Ritz-Carlton, you know how good it's going to be!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: After a few stay's at the Central park South Ritz, We fell in love with the service, Especially the Club Level access. A time gone by, Windows overlooking the park, The debateable, yet atmospheric hourse draw carriages. The astounding personal service, fortys music in the background. Everyone is greeted as if the had arrived at their private club. We are allway's amazed at people who do not TIP for all this service, but it does nothing to lessen the warm welcome to all. On our many stay's we did encounter a cliche which I will not go into. It was handled in a way to make us remain loyal. The entire staff is warm welcoming, Truly Ritz. Our dog really does enjoy 29.00 burgers with steamed carrot and peas, to which we have been ask on ordering is this for Sadie? Merci Beau Coup

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: You have high expectations when you book into a Ritz Carlton Hotel...even higher when you picked it as special treat for your sister and brother-in-law birthday and anniversary celebrations. Overall we were not disappointed! The start started a little rocky when our rooms where not ready at check-in...which was after 4pm in the afternoon. So we were invited for free drinks and to wait in the bar/ loune. It did take even longer than we expected (90 mins) and as we were jet - lagged....we were dsaapointed! The rooms though were large and sumptuous.The location was perfect ...wonderful launch pad to all the sights! We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel but to experience all the different options on offer very close to the hotel...having pancakes was quickly ticked of the list of must dos! The concierge was very helpful in solving a dilemma to find a restaurant that served fabulous steaks for my in-laws ( another must do for them!) AND served vgreat veggie food (for me and my husband). It also had to be within walking distance as we were tired from sight seeing (The Met, staten island etc.). So, very knowledgeable! With central park on your doorstep, no stay would be complete without a lovely evening stroll in the park to see all the activities going on there.On leaving the hotel, the hotel surprised us again. They realised that we were disappointed aboit the long wait at the start of our stay and decided to comp all our drinks over over the time of our 4 night stay.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at Ritz Carlton Central Park for the first time and it is a truly excellent property and location, location, location! Our stay was absolutely terrific for 4 days being the 4th free. We arrived at about 12 pm, but this was not a problem for the hotel at all, our room on the highest floor with spectacular view of Central Park was already ready and waiting for us. There were no problems at all, staff was happy to help at any moment. The stuff in the executive Lounge was absolutely amazing, pleasant, and so polite, which really made our stay very special. We stayed 4 days before US OPEN and even met a boy in executive lounge every day there that was later singing OUR NATIONAL ANTHEM during the opening ceremony which we watched on TV on the day we returned home.Our Deluxe room was well appointed, very spacious and luxuriously equipped. The interiors are designed in a very tasteful, classic fashion and, of course, impeccably clean. The Bathroom décor is outstanding and nice size with tons of marble.We have stayed at top properties and this one may be quit pricy for some, but my wife dreamed of staying in the hotel on the highest possible floor with the view of Central Park in its entirety and unobstructed view and she couldn’t have chosen a better property to have her dream come true. Seeing her happy means a world to me. Ritz’s reputation and experience makes this hotel one of a kind. We have nothing but great memories of our stay.There were no problems at all, staff was happy to help at any moment. During checkout we were asked about our stay, we were so attached to our life style at Ritz that we didn’t want to live and my wife shed a happy tear. Check out clerk went around the counter to give her a hug and we exchange sweet words which made us all happy.Would stay again!
user_name:
Tudorllc
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: If you can't splurge to stay the night, at least stay for drinks. The bars and restaurants are wonderful and a way to experience the glamour!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed here with my husband but wish I had stayed elsewhere. I did not like the room or the service. It is a nice location but it is one of the more dowdy ritz's I have ever stayedat. The lobby is small and crowded dark and depressing. The doormen unfriendly and the front desk too. So are the waiters and waitress. But the room service staff was wonderful. The room was comfortable but the hotel itself is a letdown. The location is okay right across from central park and close to shopping. Still this was one of the least impressive ritz carltons I have stayed at and next time in NYC I will chose a different place. I do have to compliment the spa. I had one of the best facials there and everyone was very nice. We had a very bad view from our room . Central park views are way more expensive. When we got upgraded due to problems with our room to a central park view it was nice but I would never had paid that amount for that room. Breakfast downstairs gives you a nice view of sidewalk life. But very expensive as well as having a drink in the lobby. I love to splurge but hate getting ripped and I felt this ritz let me down in surroundings and service.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Flawless service, beautifully appointed and immaculate rooms, sumptuous linens and heavenly beds overlooking Central Park. Is there a reason to even look at another place to stay in NYC?
user_name:
travelpro10000
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband, two daughters and I were lucky to stay at the New York Central Park Rirz Carlton for three nights. The hotel is private, intimate and luxurious. The employees know the guests by name and could not be more accommodating. Our suite was spacious, clean and in good condition. It overlooked Central Park and was absolutely beautiful. Nothing is overlooked at this property. We took our daughters to see Spiderman one evening and upon our return the soundtrack was playing on the DVD player in the suite with a note from guest services. Not only had an employee noted that we had gone to the theatre, they remembered which show, located the DVD, written a personal note, and left the music playing for us --and the DVD was complimentary. The food and service at the club level were excellent. Club level is well worth the cost and the extras such as a private concierge, full bar service and food presentations from 7am to 11pm pay for themselves. If you are considering this hotel do not hesitate. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Disappointingly, when we arrived at the Ritz-Carlton, our reservation could not be found. Given that we'd arrived off a flight from LA with a four year-old in tow and it was midnight, I was more than a little uptight to discover that wasn't the only problem, as I was also told there were no two-bed rooms left in the hotel. The front desk person called the other Ritz-Carlton at Battery Park to check they didn't have our reservation (despite my insistence that we had specifically booked Central Park South and we were there to celebrate the four year-olds birthday the next day because of its proximity to FAO Schwarz and the Park). Fortunately I was able to produce a copy of the reservation made online (detailing our request for two beds and that we'd be arriving around midnight) and a two bed room was found within 10 minutes. For the inconvenience we were kindly given 'club' access which gave us access to complimentary continental breakfast, light lunch, afternoon tea, evening drinks and canapes. We went to breakfast and an afternoon tea during our 2 night stay and both were very satisfactory. Room service was superb, the beds divine, and the space in the rooms more than adequate for a lengthier stay. Highly recommend despite our experience on check-in.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We spent a long weekend at the Ritz and were very pleased. The location was great, the service was excellent (with one exception -- couldn't get a bucket of ice), and the room was wonderful and very clean. We enjoyed the nice linens, toiletries, turn down service and newspaper service. Our room was very quiet and we had a great view of Central Park. It is unfortunate, however, for the price that the hotel does not include internet.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We arrived January 3rd 2011 and guest relations were fantastic. Our two-bed suite had wonderful views of Central Park, room service was astoundingly good. For a city hotel, many of the staff soon knew our names. The treatment we received was very good but the attention given to our young children was absolutely outstanding, from the moment we arrived to the moment we departed when guest relations presented our children with various gifts. I understand they went out shopping for them specially…..I think my children won them over as they were always perfectly behaved and very polite at all times….something appreciated by the staff.I had Blackberry problems on arrival and the hotel’s IT expert was determined to help me, spent two hours doing so and managed to get everything working for me. Fantastic assistance.One day my children asked for a DVD which was sent up to the room with, what I can only describe as the most enormous, vast bowl of popcorn I had ever seen. Such surprised happened quite often. Room service was terrific, as were the reception staff and security.I’ve stayed in many NYC hotels over the past 33 years and this is my only, perfect, NYC hotel experience. Don’t stay anywhere else in NYC, this hotel is fantastic. Also, try booking accommodation with executive lounge use as the service there is well worthwhile, great for breakfasts and ever changing snacks during the day. The location is terrific and the complimentary hotel car was often available for us. Finally, the late night bar was the stuff of legend, with a very chatty old guy serving who was simply terrific. Marvelous cocktails too! Altogether wonderful.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Location fantastic, room excellent, service and staff perfect. Could not fault it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: There are many luxury options in NYC.I continue to choose RC Central Park because they just get it right every time.The rooms here are classical Ritz Carlton. The lounge and bar have an old world NYC feel. Service is outstanding at this location from the bell staff to reservations to front desk.Suggest a room with a Park View.Central to everything, you can walk or arrange a vehicle for dinner. Also, direct access to central park for an afternoon or evening stroll.Very romantic for a getaway.Many options in NYC but you know what you'll get if you stay here.The restaurant at this property leaves alot to be desired.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Perfect location ... right across the street from the Park between 5th and 6th . The staff is amazing. Everyone genuinely seems to want to make your stay memorable. The rooms are beautiful and Norman the bartender is the best in North America.Concierge level is the best of any hotel I have ever stayed.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I visit NYC often and tend to hang out around midtown so I've stayed at many of the Central Park South hotels and generally find them to be adequate but not particularly impressive. For a change and having been pleased with Ritz Carlton elsewhere I decided to stay at the Central Park hotel this May for 6 nights. I booked a Deluxe Avenue Suite with Club Access and looked forward to a pleasant stay. Unfortunately I was more than a little disappointed.Check-in was fine and certainly the lobby is small but nicely maintained but on walking into the suite I was struck by the strongest carpet deodorizer imaginable. It was horrible and permeated the entire place. I told the desk clerk to please make sure this was not used again. Now maybe it wasn't but the smell never faded and really made the place quite unpleasant to relax in. The rooms were fine with a reasonable living room and bedroom and one small bath and one decent sized, but the furniture was a dated Federalist revival and the carpets were slightly worn. Not what I would expect of a five star hotel in Manhattan. Maid service continued to be a disappointment with wet towels being left in the bath on two occasions and a broken remote for the Bang and Olufsen not being repaired after 3 calls to the front desk. Service elsewhere was similiarly poor - a call to the concierge about a desired restaurant reservation was unsuccesful and yet when I called Eleven Madison myself they were able to get me in!! I'd flatter myself that my name carries more weight than the Clefs D'Or's concierges at the Ritz but I know thats not the case, leaving me to assume that they simply never called. The club lounge is fine with a pleasant assortment of food and drink available but to try and get a glass of champagne or even a cup of coffee in the morning seems tantamount to an insult and again there is always the expectation that to greet a server you need to have a 20 dollar bill in your outstretched hand. A dinner at BLT, the american bistro attached to the hotel was horrendous with an hour wait between appetizer and entree and the maitre'd finally admitting that the meal ticket had been misplaced, and for the piece de resistance upon checkout when a car to the airport was requested two hours in advance - no car showed up.All of these errors would be acceptable in a 3 or 4 four star hotel but at the Ritz where the expectation is that you'll give someone 20 dollars for opening a door it really is quite unpleasant. I'm not sure if staying in the Presidential Suite gives you some access to what really good service is supposed to look like but if you're really looking for a service-oriented hotel I can think of half a dozen that will do you better than the Ritz Carlton Central Park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I was amazed by how much I enjoyed staying here. A year ago, I stayed at the RITZ London and that was not even close to as good as I expected so when going to the RITZ in New York, you can imagine the shock I got when I started to really enjoy my self. I have very high standards when visiting hotels. I own Majopo Group, so I can afford to stay here and I understand that not alot of people can but if you are lucky like me and have very high standards, I would highly recommend it. I have to say that the thing that makes this hotel stand out for me along with the service (which was un-beatable) was the views of central park.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I have reviewed this hotel before, but I am doing it again because we just got back from New York. I just have to say that if you can stay here, you should. It is such a great way to enjoy being in New York. Our whole family loves staying here and, what I never expect, we are remembered every time we come back. Felix, Ender, Ryan, we love you all and we can't wait to come back.I have stayed in a lot of places in a lot of cities and I consider myself a fairly relaxed traveler but I love coming here because it is like coming home. To somebody's rich house who takes care of you and you don't have to clean up after yourself (yay!). The only possible thing I can think of that might be an improvement is maybe more attractive staff uniforms (Four Seasons has great uniforms for staff at most of their locations). But that's it.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Central Park with my family over the easter weekend.The location of the hotel is fantastic overlooking Central Park, and the standard of the hotel was what you would expect from a luxury hotel. The most striking thing about our time in the hotel was the exceptional attitude of every single member of staff that we came across. There is a general "can do" attitude of everyone we came across, and they were constantly striving to find some way of improving our visit, and at the end of the day these little touches just added to enjoyment of the visit. Without exception our service/ treatment in all areas of the hotel was exemplary and I would book the hotel again on a trip to New York in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We wanted a 5 star luxury hotel that catered for disabled travellers and that is exactly what we got! We arrived at about 9 pm but this was not a problem for the hotel at all, we were shown our room by a manager - Ender who over the week was absolutely amazing, pleasant, and so polite, which really made our week's holiday very special. Each member of staff were obviously informed that it was our 5th wedding anniversary and they each said to us "Happy Anniversary" again which made it very special.The room we had was a 1 room city view suite, which had a lounge with sofa, writing table and tv with honour bar. There was a separate toilet and shower area. I had ordered a shower chair which was provided, saving me the stree of having to request it again. The bedroom had a King size which was lovely and spacious and tv and chair, there was a bathroom off the bedroom which was spacious and had a bath, double sink and toilet. In the suite we had there was no roll-in shower it had a step the room you want is 301, which has a roll-in shower, even though I requested it back in January when I booked it , it was not available when we arrived, which did cause trouble for me as an amputee I had trouble going over the step and then closing the door, because the step was quite tall and there was not any room to close the door because we had to push the door into the shower instead of the usual way of outwards. However we worked it out, but it was difficult.The bar area (Star Lounge) was beautiful and the barman Norman was a character. The bar was marble and wood and you could sit at the bar or in the lounge area on leather couches, very relsxing.We paid for Club access which was great - a separate room for the Club where you could have drinks, food and use the internet up to 11pm which was good. I would recommend anyone paying for the Club Access, it was a great place to go and even though you pay for the privilege of using the club you don't pay for the food or drink, which does save you money if you use it all the time.We used the spa La Prairie, this was lovely, an area to change then sit with either herb drinks or champagne etc. We both had facials and I had a a pedicure and manicure, the range of colours weren't brilliant but I did find one that I liked, so that was ok. It was also very accessible for disabled people even in wheelchairs.I would also have to say that ALL the staff that we dealt with were fantastic, polite, informative, helpful and any requests that we had were dealt with pretty much straight away. The Club managed to get us into 2 very good Itlaian restaurants that are usually very full, so they are there for getting you into places with big lists!!It is situated perfectly on Central Park south and you are within easy reach to 5th Avenue and Broadway.I believe there is a house car but not useful for a person in a wheelchair as it is a very tall vehicle, but that is not a problem as they can organise a private car for you or they can order a limo or Sedan if you want something special!I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants luxury in New York!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: This was unquestionably the best hotel experience I have ever had (in my relatively short time on this planet). We stayed for an altogether far too brief visit in the heat of the summer, towards the end of our honeymoon.The arrival was smooth and note perfect - we were ushered to our room without delay and within a short time we were relaxing in the club lounge enjoying afternoon tea, overlooking Central Park. The room itself was stunning, beautifully presented and above all, sizeable.On one particular evening, we arranged with the hotel to go to a theatre show and dinner before-hand. The concierge arranged everything - including recommending a high quality and convenient option for our meal and arranging tickets for our chosen show, Jersey Boys. On our return to the hotel room, we entered to find the soundtrack playing in the bedroom with a personalised note explaining that they had given us a copy of the soundtrack to keep for the future. Great service!Although in reality an expensive option if you are a frequent traveller to NYC, the one-off weekend away or get-together is perfectly served by this stunning and welcoming hotel. There are few hotels that aim for a personal experience such as this, and even fewer that achieve it. Without question, the Ritz-Carlton meets and often exceeds those aims, and the cost feels justified; ulitimately that is what any guest wants.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have just returned from 6 fantastic nights at the Ritz.We booked with BA over 6 months ago a week before we were due to leave they called to say there was an issue with one of the rooms which would cost £2,000 to resolve.I emailed the Ritz and they sorted it out within an hour and no cost at all.When we arrived we were greeted at the door and made to feel very welcome taken to our rooms.We had 2 rooms next to each other accessed through a private corridor.The view was not great but we had not come for the view.The rooms were spotless through out the stay and a great turn down service.We had dinner in the restaurant and the best steak I have eaten yes its pricey but the quality of food made it worth every penny.Cocktails and drinks in the bar were just lovely and you are made to feel very special our two teenage boys felt the same.A great decor does not make a great hotel but staff do they were just Fantastic nothing was to much trouble the Con siege service spot on but best of all Felix the doorman was incredible very knowledgeable gave great tips on restaurant and what to do and what to avoid.We will defiantly stay there again

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband and I typically stay at The Lowell when in NY, but for a girl's weekend, I opted to try the RC Central Park. The location across from CP, and access to great shopping was perfect for us. We had four rooms on the 12th floor. The rooms were very nicely done, with all of the amenities you would expect for $750/night. The rooms were spacious by any standard. All of the rooms looked over a grungy water tower, but frankly we weren't there for the view. From check in with Robinson, to the bar where we ended most of our evenings, to room service, all was very well done. Look, the Ritz Carlton is a chain hotel, albeit a very nice one. You can expect a spacious, well-appointed room, beautiful public areas and great service. I will take that any day, and am returning in two weeks on a solo trip to the city.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Easy access to the center of the city, just next to central park so which makes it a great place especially in the mornings

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We have been here multiple times so I figured I should contribute a review. This hotel is fantastic. The size of the rooms, the lobby and lounge (amazing French martinis), the club floor, and even the spa services (although limited in menu and availability) are all superb. The proximity to shopping on 5th, the view of the Park, the linens, and most divine room service make this a favorite. We often stay on the club level - talk to Carmalinda - she is wonderful. We love her. If it is possible, she can make it happen. In addition, we have several young children - although they were not there this trip. On other visits they are always treated wonderfully and never seen as a nuisance - smething you often see in fine hotels. It was a pleasure, and we will be back again this summer!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Let's keep this brief - this was everything a top-end business hotel should be. Great room, supremely comfortable bed, outstandingly friendly staff. Nothing else to report (which for me is a BIG compliment). Well done, others should take note - there is a good manager here behind the scenes.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Granted the Ritz Carlton Central Park is a truly fine property and in a vaunted location, but service, maintenance, and cleanliness just weren't up to the mark of the $895 listed room tariff.I found the room to be of a good size and all the fittings in the room and bath to be of the quality one should expect, but thickly caked dust on airvents, a colony of dust balls under the bed, and water damage in the room weren't acceptable in my book and joined my disappointment in the quality of the gym and spa area.Upon check-out I was not asked about my stay, so it was left to me to volunteer my concerns, which is a small thing but it echoed a trend that the property isn't consistently getting the small things right and that is the name of the game in this league of property. Again, it is quite good, but certainly below the standard I've come to expect from properties that merit scores of 90 and above in Conde Nast.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: It has now become a tradition for our eldest daughter (11 years young) to ask for New York rather than a birthday party! Easily I booked the Ritz Carlton Central Park as our trip there last January was unbelievable. I knew i would not be dissapointed as we are return guests to many of their chains. Again, the Ritz did exactly what we expected. Check in with Daniel at the front desk was quick, pleasant and very accommodating. Its amazing the incredible "people skills" staff at this company have and it makes things that could sometimes be time consuming and slow quite enjoyable. Our suite that we had booked was not quite ready and immediatly Daniel arranged an alternative (and desirable) option. We once again opted to take Club Access and I cant encourage people enough to try it. The staff is always there for your every need (fresh coffee, hot chocolate, etc) as well as keeping the lounge spotless! The concierge in the lounge (Carmelinda) was phenominal at booking various events/activities you may be interested in or just giving you the answers to the slew of questions you may be wondering about while in NYC. Do not get discouraged with rumors of "unattainable" rooms prices etc...remember, you get what you pay for and the Ritz Carlton Central Park is worth every penny!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Stayed 3 nights with wife for our 20th wedding anniversary under a special offer I discovered on the web. I've stayed in many hotels in Manhattan since 1975 and most have had disappointingly small rooms, some were uncomfortable, most were rather noisy, and others had rather dull decor and dull bathrooms. This time, admittedly for a huge price (but a significantly reduced one at that), we had a very large room with fabulous, traditional English furnishings, in wood and silk, that was immensely comfortable. We had a very nice view of Central Park out of two sets of window from the 11th floor. Soundproofing was sublime and the busy world of Central Park South was reduced to less than a murmur from within our room and the hotel overall. The bathroom was generally very good, clad in lovely grey and white marble, and with a delightful separate toilet room with its own door, and would receive a grade A except that the bath was too short -- it was beautifully deep, but about 1 to 2 feet too short for me to be able to stretch out in it. This design was obviously in order to leave room for a nice large shower cabinet (which was just superb, I must say). Dining was generally very good although I didn't like the way they served us sprouts as a side dish with hidden bacon bits which neither of us eat. Service was generally outstanding throughout the hotel, and nothing required more than one phone call to get something which usually arrived pretty promptly thereafter. The concierge was extremely helpful and responsive, and obtained flowers for our arrival and also for presentation to my wife at our celebration dinner. The front desk upgraded us the instant we checked in. These were lovely bonuses that have great value. The final bill for the stay was moderately gigantic, but I'd been expecting it and had braced myself beforehand for the immense cost. But it was worth it and RC definitely helped make it memorable. If I have a few thousand spare dollars lying around in the future, I'll do another mini-honeymoon trip like this and stay at RC again!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: The Ritz is a nice hotel in New York with exceptional service and comfy beds.However, I have average income and stayed there as a gift from a lovely friend. Whoever the "normal" guest is there, it is one who has a lot of disposable income. For instance, I ordered a soup and beer from room service one night, at a jaw dropping $24. Then $6 was added as a "delivery charge". Then 18% service charge and tax. Then I tipped $2. So, I paid almost $40 for beer and soup!! There is no coffee available in the rooms (only bottled water is free) and continental breakfast with coffee tops $50. So, we went to the deli around the corner...$18 for 4 coffees and breakfast sandwiches, versus $200 at the Ritz. A small bag of Kettle Chips there was $7! Internet in the room was a whopping $14.95 a night.The hotel and rooms also didn't compare at all against the Ritz in Shenzhen, were I can afford to stay for special occasions since its just under $200 a night. So, you are really paying for the location and the "historical" quality. A standard room at the Ritz in Shenzhen looks out over the city, is 8 times the size, has Nespresso machines and lots of free snacks, nicer room accouterments, bigger bed, is quiet, and plenty of toiletries. In comparison, our room in New York faced other rooms and a water tower, is small, is bare bones without even toothbrushes (I'm sure they would bring them, but still), and has a lot of noise from other rooms and the hall. So, you are really paying 80% of the room cost for staying next to Central Park. Personally, I'm in my twenties, like to shop down in Soho and eat in the West or East village, so a room at one of the Tablet Hotels like Gild Hall or 60 Thompson is 1/4 to 1/3 the cost of the Ritz, the rooms and amenities are much nicer, and the location is "hip". Anyway, for certain people, the Ritz is going to be the perfect hotel for you (I think a lot of the guests must get discounts through their work or are just really, really wealthy). Its a great location to get to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and old school restaurants. If you are saving up your money for a once-in-a-lifetime luxury hotel stay, I think you would be gravely disappointed. If you're a techie, or want a modern or "young" experience, this hotel is definitely not for you (its like the W hotel's great-uncle). Finally, the TV didn't work well...some channels didn't appear, some didn't have sound, some had the sound out of synch. It would be cool if they put in rainforest showers as well.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed here Thanksgiving Weekend with two families with a bunch of teenagers . The location is great right on Central Park and so convenient to all the great stores . The rooms are very tastefully appointed and the beds were extremly comfortable . We had club level rooms and it was a great treat traveling with hungry kids . Club Level has a great view of the park and the bustling street and had some really nice appetizers and desserts available throughout the day /night . Service was great they treated our entire party like royalty . The spa looked great we plan on checking it out next time .

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I know it's expensive BUT it's worth it. The rooms are fantastic and the service is out of this world. If you can swing it I highly recommend that you get access to the club lounge.....a wonderful place to unwind other than your room. They have fabulous food and they go all out to make you feel special. I go in December every year....actually headed there Dec 6, 2010 and can't wait....there is usually a big xmas bazar by columbus circle. The rooms are great....tub is delightful......BLT Market is divine and located in the hotel. I LOVE IT THERE!!!!!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Beautiful rooms and beautiful service, the hotel is in a fantastic location and if you can get a room with a view of central park it is so worth it. We were on the 21st floor - amazing. Its just off 5th avenue which is perfect for shopping. We didn't actually eat at the hotel as we preferred to go exploring the many restauarants, ones to note are Mortons Steakhouse - best steak we've ever had and amazing service. Spice Market if you like oritenal/thai food. Don't both with Milos fish restaurant - an absolute rip off and appalling service. There's also a great italian on Madison avenue, Pazzo Motto I think, great food and great atmosphere. Absolutely loved New York and would definitely stay here again, nothing is too much trouble from finding particular shops, or booking restaurants. The Spa is Fab !! Had a wonderful silver rain pedicure - worth every dollar !! Highly recommend this hotel, and a special mention to Ender who is a credit to the hotel.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We loved our week a the Ritz Carlton. We had come to the Ritz Carlton after a disappointing week at the Dorchester. Everything about our experience at the Ritz Carlton was fantastic, from check in (they actually had our room.)to food (delicious, plentiful and warm), to help from the Concierge desk (They got me into a restaurant that I was unable to book.)I think that the best thing about the Ritz Carlson is that they really seem to care about the level of service that they provide. What a treat.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Really, this is a terrific hotel in a city full of not great hotels..... Stay here, you truly wont regret it, Go On treat yourself

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We chose Ritz New York because in Singapore we stayed in Ritz and we loved the hotel so much that even after several years we were perfectly remembering the good service, nice room and delicious food.So Ritz in New York wasn't that good but still was a nice hotel,in a good, quite location,with a big room.We had a small problem with the bathtub and they solved it immediately and we were told to choose, as a compensation, a free dessert or free internet. We chose one day free internet but we never got it.As it was a compensation we didn't insist about it but were disappointed not to get it.The service and food was not as remarkable as we would have hoped.Especially the service during breakfast didn't meet the hotel's level,it was hard to get an attention of waiters and the bell boys were expecting to be tipped each time when we ask for a cab.Overall,nice but not worth of the money there are better options.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: Try not to star gawk! Celebritiea everywhere we wanted to respect their privacy, but Brahman Kelleher is such a talented musician, artist, producer, songwriter, shall I go on. I just love "missing you" from the penthouse suite at the ritz and allni can say is Magic! This place is magic!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: I think this is my husband's favorite hotel! We loved our room and actually were on a club level which is worth every dime. The real plus here though is the service. Everyone is helpful and accomadating to your every need. We would definetly stay here again if we were ever in New York City.

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: My husband surprised me with a wonderful stay at the Ritz for my birthday! It was so luxurious and just the best place to stay to celebrate a special occasion. First, the service was AMAZING!!!! From the moment we drove up to the front of the hotel, located directly across from Central Park, we were treated like royalty. They asked our names and the reason for our stay and of course we told them we were celebrating a birthday. When we walked into the hotel and were approaching the front desk, the people at the front desk said, Hello Mr. and Mrs. Shuck and Happy Birthday Mrs. Shuck. It was really neat that they had transferred the info so quickly. The concierge arranged for us to travel to dinner in the hotel town car and got us the best Handsome Cab (Carriage Driver). When we returned from our outing the hotel had sent Godiva Chocolate covered strawberries to our room...Amazing. The room was beautiful from the linens, to the woodworking, to the view overlooking Central Park. No doubt, we will be back!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton as we got married in New York in august and we have to say we had the most fantastic stay we have ever experienced from any hotel! from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, the staff were so kind and helpful and everyone made us feel so special during our stay. we were treated to so many treats as we were getting married from strawberries and chocolate on arrival to champayne on our wedding night, the hotel even gave the bridal party one of their luxury mercs to take them to the wedding location all free of charge. The room was beautiful, absolutely spotless and really spacious, gorgeous comfy bed, just perfect! we honestly can't rate this hotel enough it's just magical we had the most perfect stay! Our only complaint would be that this hotel spoils you so much that no other hotel could ever compare! just amazing!

hotel_name: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
review_body: We had a wonderful time celebrating our recent wedding anniversary, something nice to do for a special day in our lives. The hotel is fabulous, as previous reviews have stated. What stood out for me during this visit was the hotel staff - we stayed during the week that the UN General Assembly was in session. The hotel was extremely busy, as the Nigerian delegation was staying here. The lobby was packed, people all over, limos double parked, yes, somewhat chaotic, but the hotel staff had their act together. Cool, calm and collected. Professional and discreet. The registration desk treated us like we were the only ones in the lobby. The concierge did a phenomenal job assisting me in securing dinner reservations at a fabulous restaurant where reservations are extremely hard to obtain. The staff was truly focused on ensuring that we have a pleasant stay and they definitely succeeded. We will be back!
